lines.speaker: Caravan Driver
lines.line: Agh!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hey, soldier! Are you alright in there? It looks like we've hit something.

lines.speaker: Caravan Driver
lines.line: Hm... I swear I hit this same darn boulder every time I make this trip. Sorry folks.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Ah. Does this mean we have to walk all the way to Ragni from here?

lines.speaker: Caravan Driver
lines.line: Unfortunately. Luckily, it's not that far from here. Just a straight path forward.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, nothing to do but keep moving! Tasim, soldier, I'll race you to the gate!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Wait, don't!-... He's already gone. We'll have to catch up to him. soldier, lead the way.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I don't suppose you know much about Wynn either, do you?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Of course, the King of Ragni's been recruiting Fruma soldiers, but...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: That war of theirs must be getting pretty bad if they need this much support.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, there's Aledar! And the gate, by the looks of it.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: There you two are! You'll have to be faster than that if you want to stand a chance against the undead.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Yes, yes, we'll be faster next time. So, is this the gate marking the border between Wynn and Fruma?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: It looks like it, yep! Are you two ready for the start of our new lives? Here we go!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, what are you waiting for?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: So this is the Wynn we've all been hearing about... It's beautiful.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: I guess the war hasn't made it this far. This is what we'll be fighting to protect.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Hey, recruits! Come over here, I have something to tell you.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: A soldier? What are you doing all the way out here?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: There's a bit of trouble up ahead. They sent me out here to intercept new recruits.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Do you see this cave over here? Caves such as these often contain useful loot that can help keep you alive. If you enter the cave, you can find armour to protect you.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, you heard the man! Let's go get geared up.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Don't leave yet! I'd love to keep going, but first we need to get protection.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Enter this cave and find yourself some armour.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You heard the soldier. Let's enter the cave and find some armour.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Hmph. The soldier didn't tell us the cave path was collapsed! We'll have to jump through.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Well, this is a problem... I don't think we can make this jump.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Hm. There's got to be some way to... Oh! What if we could break that rock on the ceiling?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...And then it would fall and open up a path for us! soldier, left-click the rock to attack and break it!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: It worked! Now we can reach that chest!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You can right-click a loot chest to open it.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Anything good in there? Come on, let's get back to that soldier.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh, you fell! Try doing it again.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Hm... Yes, that looks like it'll do.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Normally these outskirts are pretty safe, but we've had some corrupted forces slip through recently.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: We're not entirely sure how they got here... Either way, they've been causing chaos. They've even managed to destroy the bridge!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: ... In any case. You've noticed your loot is currently unidentified, yes? You'll be able to identify it at the Item Identifier further down the path, on your left.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright. Thanks for the warning! We'll be sure to stay safe. soldier, lead the way!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: soldier, you're going the wrong way!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hey, don't leave yet! We still need to check out the identifier and head on to the bridge!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, that must be the item identifier the soldier mentioned.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Right. soldier, you can right-click the identifier to identify your item! Let us know when you're done.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: You've got it identified? Great! Let's keep moving.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hm... The soldier said something about the bridge being destroyed. Maybe we should check it out.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Well, that soldier wasn't kidding. This is some serious damage...

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, how are we meant to get to the other side of this ravine now? Ugh. Another thing gone wrong, just like-...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ... Aledar? What's wrong?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: That's... weird. I was just thinking about something from before Wynn, but... it's gone. I can't remember.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hm. I can't remember anything from Fruma either... soldier, how about you?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Nothing. It can't be a coincidence we've all lost our memories at the same time, right?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: No, but... We can worry about that later. For now, we need to find a way past this ravine. Aledar, soldier, you should look around for a way across. I'll keep looking here.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Yeah... Alright. Let's go, soldier.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Be careful, soldier! Don't want you falling off the edge.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hey, don't leave yet! We still need to figure out a way across the gap.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Woah! That's one way of doing it, I guess! Hey, Tasim, over here!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Good work! You two, go on ahead, I'll be just behind you.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Looks like that's the underpass up ahead... We just need to get through there, and we'll be at the castle!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Ah, the new recruits. Wait there a moment. There's a spot of trouble up ahead.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: What? What's going on?

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: A group of the corrupted have sieged the underpass. It's not safe to go unarmed, so you'll need weapons.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a bow for you. There you are.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a wand for you. There you are.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a dagger for you. There you are.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a relik for you. There you are.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Let's see... A spear for you, a dagger for you, and... a spear for you. There you are.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Are we expected to fight already? I would have thought we'd need training first.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: In a perfect world, yes. But unfortunately, that trouble up ahead won't wait for you to train. Good luck, recruits.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: What's going on?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I think that's one of the corrupted... soldier, get ready. You never know when it could...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Strike! Kill it, quickly!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Phew... Good work, soldier. Let's keep going.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hm... Something's wrong. I think we're about to be...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...ambushed.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: soldier, take the one in the front! We'll handle the two in the back!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: I think I'm starting to get the hang of this! These corrupted don't stand a chance!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Likewise. Alright, let's keep going. It shouldn't be too far now...

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Finally, some backup! Help me out here, would you?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: What happened! Are you injured? Were you attacked by the corrupt?

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Injured, yes, but not by the undead. I'm well equipped for those. The issue is this here cave-in.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: This isn't seriously the only way through, is it? There's got to be something we can do!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: If only I wasn't injured, I could just use my weapon to cast a spell on these boulders to get rid of them...

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: ... You there, the quiet one with the bow. What's your name?

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're an Archer, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Hunter, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: You should be able to unlock your first ability... Just use your compass, and click on the ability tree on the left.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Now, cast your Arrow Bomb spell by clicking Left-Right-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: ... You there, the quiet one with the spear. What's your name?

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Knight, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Warrior, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Now, cast your Bash spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: ... You there, the quiet one with the wand. What's your name?

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Dark Wizard, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Mage, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Now, cast your Meteor spell by clicking Right-Left-Left!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: ... You there, the quiet one with the dagger. What's your name?

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're an Assassin, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Ninja, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Now, cast your Spin Attack spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: ... You there, the quiet one with the relik. What's your name?

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Shaman, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: soldier. You're a Skyseer, right? Walk up to the boulder for me.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Now, cast your Totem spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Stand in front of the boulder and cast your spell by clicking Left-Right-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Stand in front of the boulder and cast your spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Cast your spell by clicking Left-Right-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Cast your spell by clicking Right-Left-Right!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Well done, recruit! It's a straight path to the castle from here. You three, head on towards the castle.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: ... Wait. What is THAT?!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Aghh! Let me go!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Quickly, after that thing! We need to save the guard!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Hey, soldier! Castle's the other way!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: ... That was close. Thanks for the save!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: I think you three are going to make good recruits - not many can handle themselves like you just did.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: You should head on to the castle, now. I'll take care of any leftover corrupted.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: We... we made it! We really made it! Gods, that was a close one at the end.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ... Still think those corrupted don't stand a chance against you?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Ha ha. Very funny. Let's just head inside and talk to the king.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...oh, soldier! Over here. Aledar's gone on ahead, but I figured I'd stay back and wait for you to be done.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: So! Wynn, huh? It's pretty exciting to finally be here. I'm going to head off in the direction of Detlas soon, but I wanted to tell you about something first.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: There's this handy item we were all given on our way here- the Content Book. It displays most things you can do in this world- quests, caves, and more.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: It also lets you track any content you want, which will create a beacon you can follow. Here, why don't you try it out? Use your content book, and click on the highlighted quest.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Well, there you go! I'm going to head to the end of the Emerald Trail, to the entrance of Nivla Woods. You should meet me there once you've gotten a little stronger.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Where are you going? Don't leave us!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Come over here, we have a problem...

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: Ah, you must be the last recruit. Please come over here and speak to me.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: Hello! Your friends just left. They told me quite the story about what happened to you three on the way here.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: Welcome to the Wynn Province!

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: This is the noble fort of Ragni, one of the oldest and most influential cities in the province!

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: Your job as a soldier of Wynn is to stop the growth of the monsters that are ravaging the province.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: You might want to train a little more before hand, though. Many lives are lost everyday...

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: ... Anyway, good luck! If you are lost, use map.wynncraft.com as it is very useful if you don't know where to go.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: Take this [1 Ragni Teleportation Scroll] too! It will bring you back here if you use it.

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: I see you want to venture into the wilderness!

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: My name is Enzan, and I am now a retired knight. I've spent most of my life fighting for Ragni's army, just like you.

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: I know how hard it must be to be a recruit at this time, so I've got something that could help you! Well, I don't have it, but my brother does!

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: Follow this road, he's just past the item identifier, you can't miss him. Just head to the big set of stairs, past the item identifier.

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: Tell him I sent you! He can be such a jerk to strangers sometimes, especially when he's focused on his stairs...

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: What are you waiting for?

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: My brother shouldn't be hard to find, he's obsessed with stairs. He should be near the item identifier.

lines.speaker: Enzan
lines.line: Hey there! Still doing well after all this time?

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Excuse me? Can't you see I'm busy?

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Oh, my brother? Sorry, I didn't know.

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Why yes, I actually have something that could help you...

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: But before I give it to you, why don't you h elp me with something first?

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: You see, there's a special kind of mushroom that grows in this cave. I hear it has certain... energizing properties.

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: If you can bring me [1 Energy Mushroom], I'll help you out. Enter the cave down the stairs, and bring me that mushroom!

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Ah, you're back! Do you have the mushroom?

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Excellent... Now I might finally be able to climb these stairs!

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Who knows, maybe there's a treasure or something up there?

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Take this ring. It's an accessory item! You can identify it at the nearby Item Identifier.

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: It's a very good ring for someone starting out like you. There's just one small issue...

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: To wear it, you must help my friend back in Ragni. He's been pestering me for days about needing help.

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Open your [Quest Book] and Right-Click on Cook Assistant to see if you can help.

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Well? Have you brought me [1 Energy Mushroom]?

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: No? Then what are you waiting for, go back into that cave!

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: Go on, I don't have time for you. My brother keeps sending me people all the time.

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: They keep coming expecting free stuff! I don't have time for this, I still need to climb these stairs...

lines.speaker: Therck
lines.line: I don't have time to talk to you right now, move along!

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Ah, looks like a fresh recruit! Did you see my posting? Good, good.

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Recently, my dear step-father passed away and I buried him out back. Well, he's not there anymore... the corruption has got to his body.

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Yes, yes, I know, I should have buried him more responsibly... But I didn't, and now he's turned into an unstoppable beast!

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: We should use my fresh Corkian sprinklers to poison the pest! I have a spare [1 Crate of Rat Poison] here... But I'm too weak to get past the pest myself.

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: That's where you come in! If you poison the water reservoir on the other side of the farm field after you enter, I'll enable the sprinklers, and he'll be done for!

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: There we are! Water poisoned, sprinklers enabled... Now we can just watch as he-

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Oh, dear. It seems to have just made him angry. Recruit, he's weakened- you'll have to kill him yourself!

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: You've done it! Come back here now, so I can reward you for your work.

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Goodness, that was a little more exciting than I anticipated. Still, good work! I'm glad we were able to get rid of that monster...

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: I mean... poor step-dad. I don't know how I'll explain this to the wife... Might need to buy her something nice, heh.

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Anyhow, take this well-deserved reward for the risky actions you took today. I'll also give you access to my second farm in the back, take whatever you need there!

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: I thank you greatly for your actions. My crops should grow back soon!

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Hey! Get away from my farm, this is private property!

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: I could really use some help right now, but you are too weak. Come back when you are level 2.

lines.speaker: Farmer Cevalus
lines.line: Have you at least attempted to get rid of that pest yet? Remember, the water reservoir is on the other end of this here field.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: I can't believe what is happening to me!

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: The King ordered me to bake cakes for all those new recruits!

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: Unfortunately I don't have the ingredients to make them, and nobody sells those items in the fort!

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: You think you could get me [2 Eggs], [1 Bucket of Milk] and [3 Wheat Grains] really quickly?

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: Great! You got all the ingredients!

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: I can't thank you enough! Here, take these emeralds and armour for all your trouble.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: You should explore around to become stronger. I hear there might be work to do in Nivla Woods.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: I urgently need help! But you aren't experienced enough to help me, yet.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: Come back as soon as you reach level 3.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: I still need [2 Eggs], [1 Bucket of Milk] and [3 Wheat Grains].

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: You can get eggs at the ranch north of Ragni, by killing some chickens.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: You can get milk by buying it from a merchant there as well.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: You can get wheat grains by farming some from the fields close to Ragni's north entrance.

lines.speaker: The Cook
lines.line: You should practice your cooking, maybe one day you'll become a master chef like myself!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Oh, man... What am I going to do now...

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: O-oh! H-hello soldier! Wow, what a coincidence that we're both here... in Detlas... today...

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: What? Don't look at me like that! We had a perfectly fair interaction which we both benefited from. I got the plant, and you... well. You gained experience?

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Look, alright, I get it! But I can't pay you back either way. The mayor sent me here to pick up a crate of supplies for the village.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: The issue is... I've already run out of money on- uh, unrelated purchases. And even if I had the money, I couldn't buy the supply crate anyway...

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Those two over there who run the market banned me from ever using it after I tried to buy out the world's supplies of magical powders.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Look, it's not my fault I'm making big market moves. I'm just, you know- smarter than all these other folks!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: ... The point is. I could really use your help right now! I- I promise, I'll pay you back for it this time.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: All you need to do is go over to the Trade Market, and buy the supply crate for me. Please?

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: ... What? They also banned you from the market?! Well, great. What're we supposed to do now?

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Well, do you have any other friends we could get involved? There was... that other soldier guy, right? His name was... Tim. Or something.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Look- alright, I get it, I'm a jerk who doesn't remember peoples' names! Could you just ask him to buy the supplies for us? He's our last hope... probably.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Well? Did you buy the supply crate yet?

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: All you need to do is go over to the Trade Market, and buy the supply crate for me. It's not that hard!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Hey, good work! Now you'll need to pick up the supply crate.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Perfect! Now, quickly, come back over here, before those two realize you're working with me!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: You got the item? Good. Good, good good.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Okay! Now, we're onto step two. So, you see, this package still needs to make it to Alekin Village...

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: And. Well. You're the one holding the crate, not me! So... you know!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Well, you see. I really don't want to do it. And I'm not going to!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: So either you run the supplies to Alekin Village... or we both run away and start new lives, and we avoid the consequences of our actions!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: ...no? No. Okay. Worth a shot. Well, you know the way by now! No need for me to, uh, get in your way! Heh...

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Great! You know the way by now, surely! No need for me to, uh, get in your way!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Just take those supplies to Alekin Village, and. Well. Things will work out.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: ...probably.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, hey soldier! Are you just here to hang out? Or- that look on your face tells me you're here for something else.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Oh. Well, that explains that. Though- is there a reason you can't get it yourself?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I... guess so? Is there a reason you can't do it yourself?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...You're banned from the market? How did you even manage that? We haven't even been in Detlas for that long!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You- what!? Nevermind, I don't actually want to know. Come on, lead the way. I'll buy... whatever it is you need.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Tasim: You- what!? Nevermind, I don't actually want to know. Come on, lead the way. I'll buy whatever it is Ope needs.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright. So I'm just buying a supply crate...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Here it is. I wish you luck with... whatever it is you're up to.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: He bought you the item? Good. Good, good good. Okay! That was... harder than expected.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Now, we're onto step two. So, you see, this package still needs to make it to Alekin Village...

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Hey! I- uh, I can't help but notice that. You're still here. With the crate. You need to bring it to Alekin Village, remember?

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Ah... So you do. I thought I had sent Ope to pick that up...

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: More of his shenanigans, I suppose. I am sorry you have had to deal with him twice.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: When he returns to the village, I'm going to need to have a word with him... Ah, but of course, I should pay you for your troubles.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: I hope these emeralds will suffice. Additionally... we have recently fixed up one of our broken carts, which makes the trip to Detlas and back.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: You may feel free to use it whenever you like! As thanks for all you have done for us.

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Alekin Village? Sorry to say, but the wagon's broken down.

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Detlas? Sorry to say, but the wagon's broken down.

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: I reckon it won't be long 'till it's fixed up, but you'll have to make the journey yourself for now.

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Detlas? Well, lucky you! The wagon's been fixed up all nice and new!

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Just hop on aboard, and I'll get you to Detlas in a jiffy!

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Ain't far to Detlas from here! We'll be there in a jiffy, just you wait.

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Howdy! Lookin' to hitch a ride off to Alekin Village? Well, lucky you! The wagon's been fixed up all nice and new!

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Just hop on aboard, and I'll get you to Alekin Village in a jiffy!

lines.speaker: Wagon Driver
lines.line: Ain't far to Alekin Village from here! We'll be there in a jiffy, just you wait.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, soldier! There you are. It's good to see you. Are you ready to continue on towards Detlas?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: It seems we'll need to pass through the Nivla Woods first. I've heard the forest is crawling with spiders... But between you and me, we should be-
H-hey! You two! You're soldiers, right? I can tell from your weird fashion sense. You folk are supposed to help people! So. Help!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Huh? Oh- yes, of course! What's your name? What do you need help with?

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: I'm Ope! I was recently... uh... bit by a spider! And now I need your help to get a rare medicinal herb to heal me!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: It only grows in an infested cave filled with creepy crawlies. And I'm clearly in no condition to go get it myself!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Well, alright! We're here to help, after all, so... We'll get you that herb!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Perfect. I'll bring you to the cave, and you can do the rest from there. Follow me, soldiers!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Well, here we are! The only way you can reach the cave is up through this tree.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Hm... There's two of you. Good! One of you can climb up into that cave, and the other can protect me from the crawly spiders down here!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright! soldier, you can go up into the tree, and I can defend Ope here while you do that.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Good, good. Well, good luck up there! Try not to get bitten too much by the spiders!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: There you are! It feels like we've been waiting for hours.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: It... really hasn't been that long. Maybe ten minutes at most.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Well-... Anyway! Do you have the herb? It's very- uh, important! To cure me. Yep.

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: There it is! Eheh. Thank you kindly for your work, soldiers! Now, about your payment... Let's see, what do I have...

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Oh. I seem to be out of emeralds. Well- I can, uh, offer some advice! There's lots to find in this forest. Plenty of caves with valuables to explore! Might be worth your time.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Wait, are you seriously not going to-

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: It has been a time, soldiers, but I truly must be going! We're near Alekin Village, you should stop on by! Go and speak to the mayor! He can cover my expenses!

lines.speaker: Ope
lines.line: Well. Goodbye!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: That's... frustrating. He seemed shady from the start, I should have-... Well. What's done is done. Let's go speak to that mayor.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Ah, travelers... welcome to our humble forest town. Have you come to stay, or are you simply passing through?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Probably the latter. Though, we ran into a man named Ope, who directed us to speak with you.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Oh, Ope... I take it your meeting with him went poorly? I must apologize for him, he is... a tough man to deal with.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Here, I may offer you a small sum of emeralds as an apology. I hope he has not soured your opinion of our small town, here...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh... Thank you. That's very kind of you. We'll probably stay for a while, before we continue towards Detlas.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Then feel free to make yourselves at home! We welcome all travelers here, no matter how long their stay is.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I'm going to go rest up a little. I'll be ready for more adventure soon though, don't worry!

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Ah, hello! What can I do for you today?

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: He's... difficult. He's the son of my sister, who was unfortunately killed by spiders some time ago.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: With his father out of the picture, I had to take him in. He's a grown man now, yes, but... I fear the loss has taken its toll on us both.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: I truly hope he will cease with these ridiculous ploys sometime soon... but I can't bring myself to do more than give him a stern talking to.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: He's a good man, truly. I believe that with my whole heart. It's alright if you don't feel the same way, though. I will not force you to interact with him if you do not wish to.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Oh, dear... I suppose it must have been fifteen years ago that I took the position, when the old mayor stepped down.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: He was a kind man, always looking out for the townsfolk. Though, by the time he retired, it was clear he was growing restless in our little town.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Well, as soon as he passed down the position to me, he immediately traveled to Detlas and enlisted in their army! I hear he's in the business of training soldiers these days.

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Ah, but I've tried to live up to his legacy. I like to think I've done well in my time as mayor!

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: A fine day for passing through! I hope you enjoy your stay.
Oh, it seems I have a guest. You're just in time for dinner... hehe..

lines.speaker: Arakadicus
lines.line: Ah, the main course has arrived. You look so good, I think I'll have a taste of you myself!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Do you need to prepare? We'll wait here for you until you're ready.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, are you ready? When you are, let's head in and fight those spiders!
Oh, it seems I have some guests. You're just in time for dinner... hehe..
My poor babies are starving. But what shall they feast on? How about... you?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright, we're in. Keep your guards up, you two. Don't want to get picked off by the spiders!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Indeed. We'll proceed with caution.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: There's more spiders here than I expected... Nothing we can't handle, of course, but- still.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh, hey- watch your step! Don't want to fall and get stuck in those webs down there, yeah?
...s-stupid spiders, n-n-no good... I-if I get-... get out of here, I'll- b-burn them all down, all those c-creepy c-crawlies... Then it'll j-just be me a-and my- mushrooms. Mushrooms...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ..Wait, that voice... Yahya, is that you?

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: H-huh?! O-oh! Soldiers, good n-not too strong s-soldiers, here to r-r-rescue good old... Yahya! G-g-get me down f-from here!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: You know this guy?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Yeah, we do... He's the civilian who was taken by spiders, just before we came to Detlas. I'm surprised he's- well, you know.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Huh. Well, lucky him, I guess! Alright, let's get him down. soldier, just cast a spell at him to break the webs!

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: H-hah! F-freedom! No m-more c-creepy crawlies... Just me a-and my... mushrooms.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You should probably get out of here, quickly. We've cleared the path from the entrance to some extent, but more spiders could arrive soon.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: ...O-okay!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...and there he goes. Huh. Weird guy.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You don't know the least of it. Alright, let's keep moving.

lines.speaker: Arakadicus
lines.line: So you freed the Mushroom Man... no matter. My babies think you three look just as delicious... You will make a fine replacement, hehehe...

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: These spiders just keep coming! There has to be a limit to their numbers, we just need to keep fighting!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I can't imagine it's much further from here. Just a few more jumps to make, a few more spiders to fight through, and we'll be there.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Here we are, then. The spider queen must be through here.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright. Let's rest a moment, then head on in and take her out. If we work together, these spiders won't stand a chance!

lines.speaker: Arakadicus
lines.line: Ah, the main course has arrived. You look so good, I think I'll have a taste of you myself!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, we're not going to make it easy for you! We'll take you down!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: The people living in the forest are more than just food for you spiders! We won't let you attack them anymore!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: We did it! We killed the spider queen! Nivla Woods is safe from that threat now!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: We- we did! That was... intense. But we succeeded in the end!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...So, what now? We completed the mission, so we should report back to the Admiral, but... what's after that?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I guess we'll have to figure that out. I know I still want to help defend the province, but beyond that... I don't know.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...Yeah, alright. Well, hey, let's all meet back at Detlas and celebrate! We deserve it after that whole ordeal.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: That sounds good, yeah. soldier, we'll rest up here a little, but we'll meet you back at the barracks soon.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: There's a lot I want to do... but where should I start? Maybe I'll talk to the Admiral about it...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I'm not sure what the future holds, but at least we're doing the best we can. That's what counts.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, here we are! Back at the barracks, after a successful mission. It feels a little... unreal, you know?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I know what you mean. But, well, we did good! We managed to make the woods safer for the people living there.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: We did! And now, we celebrate! Here, let's all have some Nemract Whiskey for the occasion.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...So, what're you two planning to do next? I think I'll speak to the Admiral about finding an assignment somewhere.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Hm. I've been thinking a little about... looking into more advanced powder techniques. Something about their magic sticks out to me.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, really? I thought you would be more into basic fighting, what with our journey to Ragni.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Yeah... well, I guess I found something a little more interesting along the way. I'll let you know how it all goes.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Keep us updated, Aledar. So, soldier, what are you thinking of doing next?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Not a bad idea! I might join you with that later, once I've decide on things more.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Helping people is a good goal. There's bound to be lots of people around who need it.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Exploring, huh? That's a good idea. There's plenty to see around here!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...And- well, we all came here for a reason. Might as well see the province while we're here, right?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Well, if you're staying in the area, maybe we'll cross paths! I'll likely be defending Detlas in the short-term.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: And, well, I'll probably be around as well! There's plenty of experts in the area.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, hey, there's no shame in that. There's lots to do around here. I'm sure you'll figure it out!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: If you need a goal, the next place you might want to visit is Nemract Swamp, to the north. Maybe pay it a visit when you reach level 20.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...Well, I'm glad we were all able to be here together. Here's to a long and fulfilling friendship!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I'll drink to that! To all our future adventures.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, hello soldier. I'm probably not going to be here for long- I've been assigned to help defend Elkurn to the south.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You should come visit, if you have the chance!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...Oh, soldier! Good to see you. Anything interesting going on with you?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Me? Well, I've been making a little progress... but, nothing too big yet. I'm keeping at it, though!

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Soldier! Good timing. We've been requesting help for ages.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Looks like we have a blocked pipe in the sewers. No wonder no one wanted the job.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: I'm going to need you to get your hands dirty. I'll need some assistance with the blockage.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Meet me up the hill at the sewer entrance, just right of this big drain here.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Ah you're already here. Coming up behind you soldier!

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Here's the brief. We get in, deploy small explosives to dislodge the blockage and get out.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: I forgot to mention this won't be without danger. There's all sorts of nasty things in this sewer. Keep your wits about you. Right, let's go!

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Do you feel like there's something lurking that doesn't want us here?

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Anyway, I've found the blockage. It's right up ahead.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Here's a small explosive. I placed one at the blockage already, if that alone doesn't work, use this.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Ah, you’re alive! Looks like we underestimated the amount of sewage.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Let's get out of here. Do you still have the explosive I gave you?

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Good, let's use it on this wall, it looks like we can break right through...

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Oh no, oh no no no! Did you just open that? Come here immediately.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Oh no...

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Dungeons are sealed for a reason. This one used to be the old Ragni prison.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: It has a horrible history. People used to hide here during raids.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Rumour has it that Bob, the hero of Wynn, was born in this very prison.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Now only proven parties of soldiers may enter if one has slain a key guardian.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: You must go in and defeat the dungeon.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: The sewer entrance is just right of the big gate. I'll meet you there.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: I fear we face a much worse enemy than a blocked drain..

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Hello, I am a lieutenant in the Ragni army. I have a job for you soldier.

lines.speaker: Jenprest
lines.line: Wait, you aren't level 5 yet! Come back to me when you get stronger.

lines.speaker: Captain Fenor
lines.line: Ah! You must be a new recruit! Well, I've got a mission for you.

lines.speaker: Captain Fenor
lines.line: There's an old cave behind me. It was used in the Corruption Wars...

lines.speaker: Captain Fenor
lines.line: We used it for quick and easy travel between Detlas and Ragni. It’s been abandoned for years.

lines.speaker: Captain Fenor
lines.line: This cave could prove to be very useful for future recruits who need to travel between Detlas and Ragni.

lines.speaker: Captain Fenor
lines.line: Now, here's where you come in- I need you to clear out that cave route so we can use it once more! Good luck, soldier!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Ah, recruit! You must be the one Cap'n Fenor sent!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Well, let’s get started then!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Help me clear this debris. Just walk up to it and give it a good shove for me!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Nice job! Let's move cautiously, We don't really know what's down here...

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Wait... Do you hear that? Ah, monsters! Do your job soldier!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Wha?!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Ah, that cave-in just blocked the path! Defend me while I try and make a hole!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Keep it up! I think I'm half way there!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Aha! I can see the other side! Just a little more...

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Got it, I made a hole! Quickly, let's go before we're overrun!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: This cave barely seems worth the trouble to me...

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: This wall of debris is much too big for us to be able to move. What do we do now?

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: hmm... Maybe if we- wait, what's happening to the wall to the right?
Oh, uh... Hi... Well, this is a little awkward... I'll just... Go.

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: ...Who in the world was that? You can go check that hole out if you want, but I'll stay here and try to think of a solution to this debris.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh... Didn't expect you to follow me... Well, um... Hi! This will sound mad but...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I'm Drale, and I'm on a mission to free these cows from the enslavement of Katoa Ranch.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Those farmers stole those cows. They are sacred animals. Now they're about to turn them into steak! If you were to help me, maybe I could help you...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Go free those innocent cows from enslavement! Qu-quickly! Before that farmer gets back...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Where are you going? Come here and talk to me first.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Go free those cows from the farmers before they're taken to the slaughterhouse! Oh man, the slaughterhouse...

lines.speaker: Bylvis
lines.line: Ah, good to see my cows are all in tip-top shape! Welp, time to- gah!

lines.speaker: Bylvis
lines.line: An intruder! What are you doing with my cows!? Guard golem! Attack!

lines.speaker: Bylvis
lines.line: Golem! No! That cost me thousands of emeralds!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Thank you so much, but we're not done yet. We need to get these cows out the province.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: There's a small opening behind me. Go through it and help me get these cows on a raft to Gavel!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: There's the raft! Help me push it for the cows!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: And, that should do it! Be free, my friends! A new life awaits!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Again, thank you so much for what you have done this day. These cows deserve a better life than being farm animals.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Oh! Right! You were busy with something before you came to help me, weren't you? Hm... I think I might be able to help you with that as well! Let's go back to the tunnel!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Recruit, what took you so long? I've been waiting for an hour! What were you doing?

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: ...You helped some crazy cow-obsessed lunatic steal cows from the local farm? Recruit, that's against the law you know...

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Oh, what do I care? Silly Bovemists.

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Either way, we still don't have any means to get rid of this giant pile of rubble...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Hello again, friend! I'm here with the help! Cows, to me!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: What in the world?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Since you helped me with my problem, I thought I should repay that favor by helping you!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Welp, see ya! Oh, and nice to meet you, miner! Now, let's get going my cows!

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: ...What just happened? Am I seeing things? You know what, I don't want to know.

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: Anyway, why don't you go on ahead? I'll be here guarding this passage so nothing else bad happens to it.

lines.speaker: Miner Linton
lines.line: It was an honor to adventure with you, recruit!

lines.speaker: Sergeant Klafson
lines.line: Recruit, Captain Fenor told me to meet you here, said if you came out on this side of that tunnel then you completed your mission!

lines.speaker: Sergeant Klafson
lines.line: You did a great deed today, soldier! We can now use this cave to travel easily between Ragni and Detlas! Great job!

lines.speaker: Sergeant Klafson
lines.line: Halt! You cannot go down this cave, it is blocked.

lines.speaker: Sergeant Klafson
lines.line: Hello again, soldier! Doing great things around the province, I presume?

lines.speaker: Sergeant Klafson
lines.line: I'm sorry, recruit, but that passage is blocked. We used to use it, but not anymore...

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: Go through the cave and talk with my friend Sayrr, he can give you the helmet. After that, explore the ship and bring me [4 Ancient Treasure].

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: Glad to see you again!

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: You are too low level to help me, yet. Come back when you are level 8.

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: It would be madness to explore this hole without a breathing helmet!

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: Hi, my name is Omango. I am a resident of the Maltic village, on top of the hill.

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: As you may know, our people came to your land years ago, and this is the ship they used.

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: They brought lots of luxurious goods with them. Most of them got lost in the wreck.

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: But recently, a small hole has opened in the shipwreck here. It is believed that our fortune is hidden within it.

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: Unfortunately, nobody has been able to explore it. It is too deep, no creature can survive underwater that long!

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: However, my old friend Sayrr is a fisherman, and I know that he has a very special helmet...

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: If you convince him to give you this helmet, and find the treasure, I'll give you a part of it!

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: Sayrr is out on his boat, but the cave next to me is a quick way over to where he does his fishing. Be careful on the way, though.

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: When you finally have the helmet, explore the ship and bring me back [4 Ancient Treasure]. Good luck.

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: Why ya looking at me like that? Is it cause I'm small, eh? I'll have you know that I caught fish that were twice your size!

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: ...or, well, I used to be able to. Nothing's biting recently- wait a sec, why'd you hop on my boat anyways, stranger?

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: Ahah! Yes, I still have that old breathing helmet. You want it? You'll have to do something for me first.

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: I'm sure you heard me, but the fish just aren't biting around here anymore! I need to make a living somehow! There's some fish in that cave, but...

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: ...it's a bit dangerous. Tell ya what, I'll give you my fishing rod, and you can go catch me, say, [10 Gudgeon Meat] down there.

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: The helmet will be all yours after that.

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: Ah! Welcome back! Any luck with the fish?

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: Great, and I'll thank you kindly. Here's your helmet, have fun with that.

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: I will need those [10 Gudgeon Meat] from the cave if you want that helmet!

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: You have lost the helmet already?

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: Let me help you then! Bring me back [10 Gudgeon Meat] from the cave just like last time and i will give you one back! Deal?

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: You are back already?

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: It seems you got everything i needed, here is your brand new helmet!

lines.speaker: Sayrr
lines.line: You should go see Omango back near the crashed ship!

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: You got it! You found the treasure!

lines.speaker: Omango
lines.line: As promised, here's your part of the loot.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: Hello, soldier. Making your way to Detlas, are you?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: Just carry on in the direction you're headed. You'll make it there in no time.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh, soldier! Hey! It's good to see you again- I didn't notice you arrived. Is Tasim with you?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh, shoot, I have something I need to get to. We'll have to talk later!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh, soldier! Hey! It's good to see you and Tasim again. Hope you didn't have too many adventures without me!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Tasim told me all about the corrupted force you took out. I wish I could have been here to help!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...Oh! Since you're here- I was about to head out to join Lieutenant Van's squad to take back a tower overtaken by corrupteds. You should come with us, too!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well? What do you think? Want to get some real combat experience? It shouldn't take long.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh. Alright.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, I'll still be here for a while. If you change your mind, let me know!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Perfect. Well, no time better than the present! Let's get going.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh, wait. There's a stop we've got to make first. Follow me to the Powder Master!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Tasim's gone off to the training room, if you were looking for him. He's really jumping straight into it, which... is good! We all need to get stronger so we can defend the province.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Hey, you're back! Have you changed your mind? Want to join a raid on a corrupted tower?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright, so. There's something I've been told about the tower we're going to be attacking which we can prepare for!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Apparently, the big bad at the top of the tower is weak to ❉ Water damage! And so, here we are at the Powder Master.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: You can apply various elemental powders to your weapons here, which lets them deal types of damage they might not have been able to before.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: In this case, you can apply a ❉ Water powder, so that your weapon will be more effective against the corrupted enemies at the tower!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: I, uh... don't remember the whole elemental speech off the top of my head. If you want to know more about those, you'll have to talk to Captain Ragon in the barracks. He has a whole course about it!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...The point is- here. Take this elemental powder and talk to the Powder Master to apply it. Let me know when you're done!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Got the powder on your weapon? Good, that means we're ready.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Lieutenant Van and the others are by that bunch of houses in the Detlas Suburbs- you probably saw it on your way in.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Lead the way! I'll be right behind you.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Let's keep going! Lieutenant Van and the others are by that bunch of houses in the Detlas Suburbs, remember?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: Ah, Aledar! Good to see you here. Who's this with you?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: This is soldier, sir. They're here to join our assault, if you'll allow it.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: Hm... Well, I don't see why not. The more the merrier, that's what I say.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: If everyone's here, we can begin. Here's the plan! We'll need to fight off some of the forces near the base of the tower, so that someone can climb to the top.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: It doesn't much matter who does the job, so long as it gets done. If you see an opportunity- go for it!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: If you need to retreat, or the corrupteds are slain, regroup here! Understood?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Yes, sir!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: Good. Alright soldiers, let's take back that tower!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: Go on, head for the tower! If we're lucky, we'll be able to clear out the corrupteds who have taken over it.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright. It's time to take on the tower! We've got this, soldier.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Hey, soldier, there you are! Come on, let's climb that tower!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: We did it, we killed the corrupted! Come on, let's get back to Lieutenant Van with the news!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: We did it! Let's get back to Lieutenant Van and tell him the news.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: It seems everyone has returned. Well? Have the corrupted forces been vanquished?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: They have, lieutenant! soldier and I reached the top and defeated the corrupted.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: Fine work, soldiers! Another great victory for the Detlas army. With the leader killed, it shouldn't be too difficult to clear out the rest of them.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: I'll let the Admiral know of your victory today, soldiers. And- here, some payment for your work.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: The two of you have a promising future. I look forward to serving with you in the future!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: That was good fighting out there, soldier! I'm going to head back to Detlas for now, see if there's anything else I can do around there.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Van
lines.line: We'll take care of the remaining stragglers, don't you worry. Thank you for your work today, soldier.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Good to see you, soldier! I haven't been up to much since we took back the Raging Tower.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: I've been waiting for Tasim to finish up whatever he's been doing. He's been nonstop training since he got here, you know.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Hey, maybe it'd be worth your time to join him! If you talk to Captain Ragon over there, he'll probably teach you some things.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Perfect! Well, no time better than the present! Let's get going.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh, wait. There's a stop we've got to make first. Follow me to the Powder Master!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh. Alright.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, I'll still be here for a while. If you change your mind, let me know!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: soldier, hello! This place really is nice, isn't it? I'd like to stay a while longer before moving on towards Detlas, but I'll be ready soon.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: In the meantime, I've been thinking about what we could do to help this place... I've maybe got something.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Take a look at that villager over there. He's acting a little off, like he's got something going on. I wonder...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright, I've decided. I'm feeling a little restless, so let's go over there and see if there's anything we can help with!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Maybe we can leave this place better off than it was when we got here!

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: G-... Hi! H-how can I help you on this... this p-perfectly fine and n-n-normal day!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Sorry to interrupt- we're soldiers traveling through this town, and you looked like the sort of person who might need the kind of help soldiers can provide. Anything we can help with?

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: O-oh! No, t-there's nothing going on. Not a th-thing. My m-m-mushrooms are... they're fine. Why are you a-asking? Ev-... everything is g-great. W-why wouldn't it b-be?

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: ...O-okay, fine, y-you caught me! My mushrooms... my m-mushrooms aren't fine! T-they're bad, even! A-are you hap-... happy now?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Ehm- no, but that's why we're here! Is there anything we can do to help your... uh. Your mushrooms?

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: Hm. One soldier, two s-soldier... Y-you look weak. I've s-seen str-... stronger. B-but- eheh, the- the s-stronger soldiers are... not here. Y-you'll be good enough. Maybe.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: I- my favorite mushroom spot. I c-can't use it any-... anymore. Spiders. L-lots of spiders. They've t-t-taken over it... I can't get... mushrooms. Can y-you kill the s-s-spiders? Mushrooms.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: We can kill spiders! Right, soldier? Come on, this is what we're here to do! We became soldiers to help the people of Wynn, didn't we? We'll help you get your mushrooms back, sir.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: H-hm. Good. I can't m-make my soup without... mushrooms. F-follow me, I'll take you to the-... the spiders. B-bad spiders.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: H-here we are. I- I can f-feel the m-m-mushrooms... from here. And the s-spiders! No-... no good.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: S-so! Mushrooms. Those-... those bad c-creepy c-crawly s-s-spiders... Kill them. P-please?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: We wouldn't have come here if we weren't planning to. Alright, soldier, let's clear out some spiders!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You know... I'm starting to wonder what I've gotten us into.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I'm just hoping this all works out in the end.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: C-come on! Keep up!

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: Soon... s-soon I will have my m-mushrooms again...

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: G-gah! D-don't you know it's rude to-... to e-eavesdrop?

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: I-is it done? S-s-spiders... No m-more spiders? Is my m-m-mushroom patch cl-... cleared?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Looks cleared to me. These are... uh... some fine mushrooms!

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: Th-thank you soldiers! Th-that was-... I mean. I-it was f-fine, I g-... guess.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: ...O-oh. Do I n-need to pay you... now? Heh. Is- is [2 Emeralds] fine with y-you..?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Come on.

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: Oho okay, ok-... okay! It was a joke, don't get all ex-... ex-... excited. Here, just take-

lines.speaker: Yahya
lines.line: G-gah! C-creepy! C-c-crawly! S-s-s-spiders!!!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Yahya! No!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I-... this is bad. This is really bad. We need to tell the Mayor, now.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Come on, we need to tell the mayor what happened!

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Ah, hello travelers. You seem to be in a rush- has something happened?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Yes! Yes, something- something has happened. We went with Yahya to help him with a problem he was having with spiders-

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: Yes, yes, I know of Yahya's antics... He doesn't seem to be with you. Has he ran off on you, just as Ope did?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: No- no. When we finished clearing out the spiders, we were swarmed- and they took him!

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: ...Oh. Oh, dear. That isn't good at all. If they're making moves such as this, unprovoked...

lines.speaker: Mayor Alvin
lines.line: You two are soldiers, yes? I would ask you to continue your travels to Detlas. Find an Admiral Aegis- tell him our little village needs aid.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I-... of course. We'll set out immediately. Come on, soldier.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: So we're finally going to Detlas... Not the circumstances I would have liked to be traveling under, though.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Detlas' military will be able to sort this out. Surely...

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...and that's how we managed to defeat that undead swarm, sir!

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: That's good to hear. Thank you for your work, Aledar. I'll speak to Lieutenant Van and see if he'd be willing to take you into his squad.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Thank you for the opportunity, sir. I won't let you down-... Wait, is that- Tasim and soldier?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Aledar! We've finally made it to Detlas. We've had... something of an adventure, getting here.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Ah, you two must be the the recruits Aledar has been telling us all about. It's good to finally meet you, though I can't help but notice you seem to have arrived in a rush.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Right! Right. We've arrived from Alekin Village, with bad news and a request for aid. The spiders of the forest have grown hostile, and threaten the town.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: One of their townsfolk was captured and taken away in front of our eyes. Mayor Alvin sent us here to request the aid of Detlas' army.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Bad news, indeed. Very well, we will make preparations. For the time being, the two of you should rest and hone your skills. Captain Ragon here in the barracks would gladly offer some training.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Thank you, sir. But is there anything we could do to actually help?

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Enthusiastic, aren't you! Let me think... I believe Captain Fenor out by the west gate was looking for aid. If you're willing, I'd suggest you speak with him.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: And Lieutenant Van is planning a raid on a corrupt stronghold! I'm sure he'd be glad to have more forces with him.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Yes, yes. Well, I must be off. If the threat of Nivla's spiders is growing... we must prepare accordingly. I hope to hear of your future endeavors, all three of you.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Heeh...stranger. I...may need your assistance...

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: My master...wishes to create a very dangerous potion...a transformative elixir of invincibility...

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: I was...in support of this... but then, he accrued essence of... the corruption. I had to run away...

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: I fear... that he may be going... too far. I need your help...

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Get me... [8 Red Mushroom], they can be found outside the east gate behind me.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Good...good. You have the mushrooms.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: You must...ensure that it has worked. You...are much stronger than I, stranger...

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Did you see the orange witch hat roofed hut when you were gathering the mushrooms?

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: That is my master's house, you must go back out the east gate and enter the hut.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Bring me his...coat as proof...of his death...

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: I...must thank you, stranger...

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: I only hope...that my master will not be...angry with me about this. It...was for the better.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Now. I...do not want you saying anything about...these events. Take these, and...never speak of this again.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Heeh...stranger. I...may need your assistance...return when you are...Level 12.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Never speak of this again...stranger.

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: You...you can't go down...there!

lines.speaker: The Assistant
lines.line: Quickly, get me...[8 Red Mushroom]do as I asked... go through the Black Road outside the east gate from here.

lines.speaker: Dr. Essren
lines.line: Ah, you must be the one my assistant told me about.

lines.speaker: Dr. Essren
lines.line: If you are trying to stop me, it's too late. I already drank the pot-...

lines.speaker: Dr. Essren
lines.line: What is this taste? Mushrooms? This can't b-

lines.speaker: Dr Essren
lines.line: Aaaaaarrrggg!

lines.speaker: Transformed Essren
lines.line: What have you done to this potion, human? You will pay for it!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Ah, hello. Welcome to the Detlas Barracks! Feel free to look around, but do try not to distract the soldiers.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Ah! You must be one of the new recruits the Admiral told me to look out for! What was it... soldier, yes?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: You've done well to reach this city as quickly as you have, which must have required a great deal of fighting the undead.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: But the fact still stands that you lack experience. You can certainly fight, yes, but can you fight well?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Lucky for you, that's where I come in. You're just in time for today's training session! Come here, follow me.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Now, I've heard from Sergeant Van of your aid in his assault on our overtaken fort- which, good work, very well done...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, hello soldier. Are you here for training as well? I've been honing my skills against these dummies, so that when we face corrupteds, I'll be ready!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Oh! soldier, hello. Are you here for training as well?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Ahem. Now, in front of you, you'll see five special training dummies. Each one finely imbued with elemental magic. You are aware of the elements, yes? There's five of them in total.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I am! The elements are... ✹ Fire, ❋ Air, ✤ Earth, ✦ Thunder, and... ❉ Water?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: That's right. And generally speaking, they're strong against each other in that order- ✹ Fire beats ❋ Air, ❋ Air beats ✤ Earth, and so on.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Elemental weaknesses may vary based on the enemy, but that order holds true in most cases.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Enemies will take more damage from elements they're weak to, and take less damage from elements they resist. This change to your damage is always a flat value, and it varies from enemy to enemy.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Now. For training purposes, you'll be given an elemental weapon to try out on these training dummies. Take note of how each elemental defense and weakness affects your damage dealt. Speak to me once you feel you understand the concept.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Well? Have you noted the effect of elemental defenses and weaknesses on your damage?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Go on, then. Just speak to me when you're ready to move on.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hm... So if I attack this one, I'll deal more ❋ Air and less ✤ Earth...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, hello. Don't mind me, I'm just trying to wrap my head around this all.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Excellent. I'll take those training weapons back from the two of you. Any questions?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I do have one. If our enemies are susceptible to the elements in this way, would that also apply to us?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Ah, yes. A fine observation. Indeed, you are also bound to the rules of the elements. Elemental defenses and weaknesses from your equipment will affect you in the very same way.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: One final note before we move on from the elements- your weapon may not always be as effective against an enemy as you would like.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: However, you have another tool at your disposal in the form of your spells! Different spells will deal different elemental damage, even if your weapon does not use that element by default.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Oh! So my Bash spell will still deal ✤ Earth damage even if my weapon only uses ❉ Water, right?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Correct! Now, let's see... We have the two of you here. Why don't we have a friendly duel? A chance to test your battle skills in a safe environment.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: That sounds good to me! soldier, we've been traveling together for some time now... I can't say I haven't been curious to see how you fight. Let's see who comes out on top, shall we?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright. I'll be waiting here when you're ready!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright! Let's do this!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: There you are! Are you ready for our duel?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright. I'll be waiting!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright! Let's see which of us is the better fighter!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Phew! That was a good fight. You did well, soldier. We'll have to do this again- and maybe we can get Aledar to join!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Yes, yes, fine work, the two of you. Now-

lines.speaker: Scout Evelyn
lines.line: Captain! Captain Ragon! There's- there's corrupted forces! Advancing from Ancient Nemract!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Hm. And the Admiral is away... Very well. Mobilize the troops! We meet the forces at the north gate!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Captain- we're capable fighters too. Let us come along and help fight off these undead!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Hm... As I see it, this is a fine opportunity for you to gain some firsthand experience! Very well. Prepare yourselves, and come to Detlas' north gate when you're ready.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: This is exciting! But... I'm a little bit nervous, still.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ... We'll be alright. Come on, let's go follow the Captain.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Come on, let's get going towards the north gate.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Do you need to prepare more? That's fine- I'll be waiting for you at the north gate!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: There you are! Ready for battle?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: I understand. We have time until the corrupted forces arrive, so go prepare. Don't take too long, though.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I'm prepared as well. These corrupted won't stand a chance against us!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Yes, yes, very good. Now, it shouldn't be long until-

lines.speaker: Scout Evelyn
lines.line: Captain! They're here!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: That's right. And generally speaking, they're strong against each other in that order- ✹ Fire beats ❋ Air, ❋ Air beats ✤ Earth, and so on.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Stronger foes such as this one will cast spells one after the other, in a specific order. These spell combos can be dangerous, so make sure to take note of them.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: We'll be fighting all around you, so shout if you're in need of aid. Alright, soldiers, let's defend our city!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright soldier, let's do this!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Ah, so this leader is a summoner as well! You'll need to take out its forces for it to return to the fight!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: That's nothing we can't handle! Let's keep at it, soldier!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: There's more of them on the way! Keep fighting!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I think this'll be the last of them. Then we just need to take out the captain!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: You're doing great, both of you! Keep your focus on the enemy- sometimes, you'll encounter foes which change their tactics mid-battle!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Some may even have very powerful spell combos they rarely bring out! I expect this one will be no exception. The battle is nearly won, keep fighting!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: The leader has been slain! Take out the stragglers, soldiers! The battle has been won!

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: We've been seeing more attacks from Ancient Nemract recently... good grief, when will that Graken do his job and sort it out?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Hmph. Well, regardless, the two of you fought well! The training seems to have paid off.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Thank you, sir! That captain was a tough foe, but it was nothing we couldn't handle... right, soldier?

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Hm... Let us return to the barracks. I'll have to speak to the Admiral when he returns, and I'd like for the two of you to be present.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: He wants us to be there for a meeting with the Admiral...? Huh. What do you think that could be about?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ... Hopefully it's not anything bad. He did seem to approve of our combat prowess, but-... Nevermind. We should get going.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Ah, there you two are. Come here.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Oh, Admiral! You're back already?

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Yes, my absence was never meant to take long. I was paying a visit to the desert city of Almuj, for a meeting with an Admiral Amerigo...

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: But I digress. I've been told the two of you were essential in the defense of our city! Excellent work.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Our preparations for the assault on Nivla Woods' spider den are nearing completion. I'd like the two of you to join that mission.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Sir- are you certain? I mean, we'd be happy to join, but surely there are many others more worthy of such a task.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Nonsense! Captain Ragon has assessed your skills, and has deemed them sufficient. And I trust the Captain's judgement.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Now, I must be off. I'll see the two of you when it's time for the mission.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: A big mission to take out the spiders, huh... You know, even though I'm a little worried, I think I'm excited.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Ahem. Before you return to your business, I have something for the two of you. Payment for your work today, and a special piece of equipment. Make good use of it.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: Hm. Come looking for more training, have you? I'm afraid the next training session isn't for some time.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: If you'd like some more advice for combat, though, you could always speak to the soldiers down in the training room.

lines.speaker: Captain Ragon
lines.line: They're honing their skills, and they'll gladly share some tips if you ask them.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: soldier, hello! Don't mind me, I'm just... waiting.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Aledar said he'd come do some training with me, but it turns out he has a whole mission he needs to take care of first.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Maybe you could help him? You should speak to Aledar if you're interested.

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Looking for able-bodied adventurers! Preferably with no friends or family, but I'm not picky!

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: You see, I'm a horse merchant. Make my living selling these beauties to adventurers like you.
