lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: I work at this barn, selling the horses I raise in Ternaves out here to rich Detlas folk.

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Until these rabble-rousing troublemakers blew a tunnel through my barn and smuggled MY horses out.

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Usually, I'd be charging a high price for these horses- Not to be rude, but one you couldn't afford.

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: So, let's cut a deal- They stole my stable key. If you can go to my barn in Ternaves...

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: And return that key to me, I'll so charitably bestow upon you one of my horses. This deal is sweeter than you realize, too...

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Betty'll be there to help! Strong as she is, don't you DARE let them touch her!

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Now, best be on your way. Ternaves is a fair bit down the Black Road from here, off to the east.

lines.speaker: Etus The Blind
lines.line: MOO! ALBERT! SOMEONE IS HERE... I CAN SMELL IT. MOO.

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Looking for able-bodied adventurers, preferably with no friends or-

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Hey, it's you! Got my barn key?

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Ah, god bless. And I presume Betty did all the work while you just- lounged around.

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: I kid! I kid. But as the great bovine above as my witness if I see the smallest bruise I will-

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Eh, nevermind all that. A horse I promised, and a horse you shall have. Much thanks to you.

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Hey! Look who's here! So, how's the horse doing?

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Aaah dang! I had some work for you, but I can't ask such a low level. Come back when you are level 13!

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Hey, where do you think you're going? You can't just buy a horse like that! Talk to me if you want access... dang tourists...

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: I wouldn't enter that if I were you...

lines.speaker: Enkser
lines.line: Hey, have you found my [1 Stable Key] yet? It should be somewhere in this tunnel right there.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Hm... ah, soldier! There you are. I was just about to send someone to fetch you.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Follow me- we have a conversation to have in my office. It's on the top floor of the barracks.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: ...ahem. Now that we're here, we can discuss the matter of Nivla Woods.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Our preparations are complete, and it's time for the assault on the spider den! With you here, we'll just need to wait for-...

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Admiral- we're here! Sorry we're late, we were sparring in the training room and lost track of time...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: If soldier is here, I take it that means today is the day we strike at the spiders?

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: Indeed it is. Now, you three are to be the force which will fight through their den and clear out as many of those spiders as you can. For that, you'll need support.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: We've sent out several soldiers ahead of time to make preparations on site. You'll want to first speak to Private Cob on the Black Road, who will have supplies for you.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: I expect this mission will hold some danger, but I trust the three of you will be able to deal with anything you come across. Good luck, soldiers!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Yes, sir. We'll do our best.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: These spiders won't stand a chance! Let's get going.

lines.speaker: Admiral Aegis
lines.line: You'll want to start by speaking to Private Cob on the Black Road. He'll have supplies for you to bring along with you.

lines.speaker: Private Cob
lines.line: 'ey there, chaps! You lot must be the spider killin' force, eh?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: That's us! The Admiral told us you had supplies to give us?

lines.speaker: Private Cob
lines.line: That I do! Now, 'fore I send ya off, there's some'n I gotta warn ya 'bout.

lines.speaker: Private Cob
lines.line: Y'see, the entryway to all them creepy crawlies- it's been sealed by some big ol' sticky web! Ain't no way through, y'hear?

lines.speaker: Private Cob
lines.line: No fire, no magic... nothin' has broken through. The cap'n decided- 'ey, why not try some lava? 's hotter than fire, anyway.

lines.speaker: Private Cob
lines.line: Point is. Along with all your supplies 'n whatnot, ya've gotta bring along some lava for the cap'n. Magically contained, o' course!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Sure, that sounds easy enough. A bit of extra work, but we were heading in that direction anyway.

lines.speaker: Private Cob
lines.line: That's the spirit! If ya want the best route to the den, follow that road with the burn marks. It'll send ya straight to the cap'n!

lines.speaker: Private Cob
lines.line: Best route to the den's through that road with the burn marks. 'sends ya straight to the cap'n!

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: At ease, soldiers! You're the three Aegis told me to look out for, aren't you? Have you spoken to Cob yet?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: We have, and we've brought supplies. As well as... lava, I think?

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Ah, good! Just what I've been waiting for. Cob filled you in on my reasoning, yes? We need to get through these webs somehow... and, well, this seemed simpler than the other option.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Now, let's see here... If I cast a spell on it like this, then...

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: ...Hm. That's not good.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: So, what do we do now? You mentioned another option- what was that about? What about it made it difficult?

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Right. You may have noticed on your way here, but the nest is at the base of Mt. Wynn, a dormant volcano.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Legends speak of incredible magic granted by the mountain- that of protection, incinerating any who dare go against it.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: These are only stories, of course. It's very unlikely the mountain actually could grant such magic. However... there may be some truth in the legend.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: So what's the catch? You would have tried this first if it were that simple.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: The mountain is infested with spiders, even more so than Nivla Woods. Our few attempts of scouting it out have shown that they're incredibly hostile towards intruders.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: As though they're protecting something, I assume?

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Indeed. So, here's the plan... If you enter the mountain, the spiders will quickly try to move inside to stop you. I'll need one of you to stay here with me to fight them off.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: So two of us take on the volcano, and two stay behind. Got it! soldier, you should be part of the Mount Wynn group. But then, Tasim, which of us should go with them?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Why don't we let soldier decide? Which of us do you want to join you in the volcano?

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Then take more time. But don't take too long- we don't want the spiders to realize we're planning something.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright. We'll fight through the spiders in the mountain, then. Captain, Aledar, good luck!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright! We'll handle the volcano then. Captain, Tasim, don't die out here!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: So, who do you want to join you to fight through Mount Wynn?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Let's get going, soldier! We'll want to get to the summit as quickly as we can.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: We should get moving, soldier. I don't want to make those two fight more spiders than they need to.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: We're counting on you, soldier! Go climb that volcano! The cave entrance is not far from here.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...Wow, it's hot in here! That makes sense, I guess, given what we're here for. Let's reach the top as quickly as we can.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: W-woah! You felt that too, right? What's going-

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: That... that was a close one. Phew! Can't believe we made it out in one piece. I think we're near the top, too.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, here we are! ...The heat's gotten more intense up here. Come on, let's find what we're looking for, before I over-

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: We've got to run for it! Come on, jump!
...intruders....come to take....sacred protection....
.....must not......allow.....will kill.....for queen!....

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Ack! We should have known it wouldn't be that easy. Alright, let's take down this spider and get what we came for!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, there it is. We have what we need to burn through those webs!... I hope.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: The spider mentioned a queen... I guess that's what we'll be facing in their nest, then.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright, let's get back to Tasim and the captain!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...I can hear the spiders already. We'll need to fight through them if we want to reach the top. Let's get going, we don't want to take too long.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: H-huh? That shaking, it's almost like-

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: What are those spiders doing!? soldier, come on, we need to move!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...That was closer than it should have been. The spiders must be real desperate to protect whatever it is they have up here, huh? Let's keep going.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: It was a tough climb, but we made it... It's, uh, very hot up here. So- what was it we were looking for-

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Of course it wouldn't be that easy... Alright, soldier, let's do what we came here for. Let's claim that magic, and burn through the webs!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I guess that's that taken care of. We'll be able to burn through the webs protecting the spiders' nest, now.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: You heard the spider mention a queen, right? We'll probably have to defeat it in its nest to stop the spiders, once and for all.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: We should get going back down the mountain. We don't want to keep Aledar and the Captain waiting.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: You've returned! I trust you found something that can help us pass through these webs?

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: We did! We fought off a spider at the summit, and claimed a magical flame.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Excellent! Now, give it here. I take it the three of you intend to storm the nest?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: That's why we're here, yes. We'll deal with this spider problem once and for all.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: If that's the case, I'll leave it to you. I'll continue dealing with the spiders in this area of the forest in the meantime.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: ...Anyway, stand clear for a moment! I'm about to burn the webs. Good luck in there!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: We did, yes. There was a powerful spider at the peak, which was making use of this magical flame.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Yep, we do! The Admiral sent us here with that mission, and we'll do our best to complete it.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Here we go!

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: Now head on in and finish off these pests!

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Alright! We'll handle the volcano then. Captain, Tasim, don't die out here!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Alright. We'll fight through the spiders in the mountain, then. Captain, Aledar, good luck!

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: At ease, soldier! Not much to see here, I'm afraid.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: I've been stationed here to keep an eye on the spiders' nest, but... Well, they've put up a massive web to block entry! There's no way through, from what I can tell.

lines.speaker: Captain Enduyn
lines.line: If you'd like to help, I'd suggest speaking to Admiral Aegis in Detlas. He'll be able to give you an assignment.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Oh, finally, someone has come to this hidden village!

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I am Thomas, and I help manage the supplies for this ravine village.  Though, I have  a bit of a problem...

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: We're running low on ravine grains, which is our main staple we use for our food.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: We usually get it ourselves, but recently an angry group of pigmen took over the tunnel to the top of the ravine, where the grain grows.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: The last time we entered, I heard an explosion from the top. I fear the pigmen are blowing up our g rain supply with TNT...

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: You appear to be much stronger than I am, so maybe you can get past the tunnel pigmen and eliminate the explosions at the top.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Just keep to the right wall of the ravine and climb up the stairs to reach the entrance. Also, be careful in the tunnel, as the pigmen throw rocks as a weapon.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I didn't expect you to fall out of the sky like that. Are you okay, or should I go get the potion mer chant to heal you?

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: You're fine? Oh, good  to hear.  Did you manage to get rid of the pigmen and their explosives?

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: A green creature? A "creeper"?  No such thing exists in this world, especially with the pigmen all around!

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Oh, you brought a piece of skin back. How odd, I've seen this skin before...

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: There's a large cave over to the south. I tried to enter it, but I got ambushed by green creatures...

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I thought I was just dreaming, but these "creepers" you talk about...they might live in that cave.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I have an idea.  I need to know for sure that they live there. A merchant can make you a mask with the skin and another material.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: There's a Pigman Overlord that sometimes hangs in a cave nearby. If you can kill it, you can get a pigman hide strong enough to make the mask.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: If you continue on the western path past the tunnel entrance, you should find a camp where the Overlord is located.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Go get the pigman hide, and then come back to me so I can tell you what to do next.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I see you have the hide. This skin will work perfectly for my plan.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: There is a Mask Merchant in this village. He can make you a mask with the two materials I have.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: With the mask, you can put it on and go undetected into the cave with these "creepers". Only then will we know the truth.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: To get to the creeper cave, follow the western path and turn left at the pigman camps.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Also, if you somehow lose the mask, the merchant can make you another one if you bring him another piece of skin and hide.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Here are the materials. Be careful out there. Who knows what those green monsters could do to you...

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: So, what was in the cave? Were there really creepers in there?

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: What's this? It smells like gunpowder...but more earthy. And this came from the cave?

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: This powder is definitely not native to this area. It has to have come from those creepers.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I guess for now we'll leave them at peace. If they do exist, they don't need to be hunted down to extinction.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Besides, if they are composed of gunpowder, they could easily blow this ravine to pieces.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Thank you for your help. I guess you deserve some sort of reward, considering you helped solve the ravine's big mystery.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Feel free to come back to our village any time. By then our food supply should be stable.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Our village needs a bit of help, but you look a bit weak for the job. Come back once you're level 15, and then you might be able to help.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I see you've come back, but you don't have what I asked for. I can't do anything until you fulfill your task.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Thanks again for your help. Now we can truly say creepers exist here in the ravines.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Anyone! Can anyone- oh, hello. You look strong enough to be able to help me.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I am Thomas, and I help manage the supplies for a village in the Pigman Ravine. Though, I have a bit of a problem...

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I came here to Tempo Town to see if I could find help here, but I've had no luck. Until now, that is. Would you be willing to help?

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: You would? You're a life saver. I'll meet you at the village, just follow the path out of town and take the northern-most entrance to the ravines.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Once you get there, keep to the right wall of the ravine and climb up the stairs to reach the entrance. Also, be careful in the tunnel, as the pigmen throw rocks as a weapon.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: I'll meet you at the village! Just follow the path out of town and take the northern-most entrance to the ravines.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Once you get there, keep to the right wall of the ravine and climb up the stairs to reach the entrance. Also, be careful in the tunnel, as the pigmen throw rocks as a weapon.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Do you need a reminder about the location of the Pigman Overlord? Just continue on the western path past the tunnel entrance, and you should find a camp where the Overlord is located.

lines.speaker: Thomas
lines.line: Have you been to the creeper cave? Just follow the western path and turn left at the pigman camps.

lines.speaker: Rynend
lines.line: Please help us! We called for a Ragni guard days ago, but Humans tend to forget this little village.

lines.speaker: Child
lines.line: Help me! Someone! The witch is being mean!!

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: I wondered when they'd send the famous Ragni guards. You'll never get me!

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: I don't know why they call me a witch. Magic is everywhere, you know. This one's father made fun of my looks, so I'll turn his son into a Grook!

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: Oh...drat. I never could get that spell right. Well, now you'll have to guess the way, um, you fool! Turn back now, for, uh...

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: Oh...didn't think that'd fool you. You know, I'm really not all that good at magic. I just like wearing pointy hats, and have warts.

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: Maybe if the people of this village weren't so mean to me, I wouldn't have been forced to live here.

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: I know it's a crime, but his father and the rest of the villagers here hunt me like I'm a rabid dog!

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: I wasn't really going to turn this boy into a Grook. I doubt I could even make him grow one feather. I mean, watch...

lines.speaker: Child
lines.line: Thank you for saving me from the witch... She was nice at first and made me cookies, but I want to go home now.

lines.speaker: Rynend
lines.line: Oh my son! What happened down there? Erh, not a witch, you say?

lines.speaker: Rynend
lines.line: Come back to me when you're level 16, we need a strong hero to help our town!

lines.speaker: Rynend
lines.line: Please save my son! Bring me proof of the dead witch too.

lines.speaker: Rynend
lines.line: I cannot thank you enough for your help!

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Oh, good, good! I bet'cha you're a Ragni soldier, aren't ya? Listen up, soldier! I've got a task here that 'ye can help out with

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Ya see that lava spring right there? It just went and popped up out of nowhere! The brass is real concerned about it, mhm?

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: They've been yappin' about it bein' related to the Corruption, and 'ye can bet that that means trouble. BAD trouble.

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Now, this here Savannah has always had some Corruption lurkin' about, but not to the point where it can do this! It won't be safe around here if we don't do somethin' about it!

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Anyways, high command ain't gonna provide support for this until they know there's actual Corruption, so we've gotta find some evidence around the springs, understand?

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Take a look around the springs, soldier! Find me some damn evidence around here! [3 Pieces of Evidence] should be enough! Now, get movin'!

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Alright, good! Ya found some evidence, let me take a look at that!

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Oh... This is bad... very, VERY bad...

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: This here is some physical corruption. If it's gettin' onto the surface, then 'ye can bet one of those weeds is spreadin' underground, right beneath the springs...

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: If ya could get underneath the spring, 'ye could probably sever whatever damn root is causing this, but... the heat would be sure to fry your skin off...

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Wait... I've got an idea... Alright, listen up soldier! There's a lil' town North of here named Bremminglar, yeah? There's a healer person there that can help us out.

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: They're holed up inside of some important well in the center of the town. There's a password ya need to hop into that place, though...

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Don't have much to go on, but I'm pretty damn sure the password is Bob, or something. After the hero himself.

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Right, ye're headin' there to find a potion that can keep ya weak little hide safe from the heat, understand? Here, let me write down the location in that book of yours.

lines.speaker: Gregor
lines.line: Hey, hey hey hey! Darling, what do you think you're doing? You can't just waltz in here without telling me the password!

lines.speaker: Gregor
lines.line: Hmm... Your face... confidence... it gleans with confidence... yet... you still haven't spoken to me since you arrived...

lines.speaker: Gregor
lines.line: Could it be... you know that the password is penguin eggs, but you're just too shy to talk? Yeah... yeah, that's gotta be it!

lines.speaker: Gregor
lines.line: You've convinced me, little mute darling... You can enter the well. Go on, now!

lines.speaker: Gregor
lines.line: Right, listen here darling... There's a secret to this well... it's that... there's a guy doing his job down there... spooky, right??

lines.speaker: Gregor
lines.line: So... be a nice, respectful person, and don't go goofing off around here, yes?

lines.speaker: Gregor
lines.line: Hey! Stay out of there, nosey guy! I don't remember you giving me a password, darling!

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: G'day to you, friend. How can I help you?

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: Hm? The Colonel sent you? what for?

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: ...Corrupted... lava springs...? You realize how stupid that sounds, yeah? Well, I completely believe you.

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: Right, you said lava, sooo... You need a heat resistance potion, yes?

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: Welp, you're in luck, kinda... I have a potion that can resist the heat of lava, but the brew will not let you swim in lava.

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: Oh that works, you just need to enter a borehole that goes through the lava? Perfect

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: Anyways, if you ever need any more special brews, my assistant will be happy to sell some at a very affordable price.

lines.speaker: Nami The Healer
lines.line: Now, you have somewhere to be, right? Right. Go and report back to the Colonel, soldier. Tell him I said hi, by the way.

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Report! Ya got the potion yet, soldier? Good, drink it if ya haven't already!

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Right, that's what I like to hear! Now, LOOK TO THE LEFT SOLDIER! There is a borehole out there we dug to try and hit the source of this weed.

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: We found a pretty damn hot cave lying underneath the surface! If ya jumped into the borehole, 'ye could probably find the source of the Corruption and stop it.

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Now, the roots and spikes of Corruption are very sturdy, but we ain't never seen something like lava burstin' out of the ground.

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Had a small chat with the brass, earlier. They got a hunch that there's a heart to the Corruption that's pumpin' out all the lava!

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: That's gotta be our ticket, yeah? If 'ye destroy that, ya should be able to stop the spread of the lava! Now, get movin'! Head into the borehole, soldier!

lines.speaker: Colonel Gailard
lines.line: Hah! I knew ya'd give me results! Ye're pretty damn reliable, soldier! Here, take this for your trouble!

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: You sure look like a strong adventurer who could help me!

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: My name is Sayleros. I spent most of my life in Nemract, but decided to come live in Detlas with my family a few weeks ago.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: However, we got attacked by thieves on our way here, and I had to leave my family behind. Most of them died, unfortunately.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: I know that my brother had his will on him during the attack. Knowing he was a rich fellow, I expect to be receving a large part of his fortune.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: His body is buried somewhere in Nemract. I own a large graveyard there, and can grant you access to it if you can bring me back his will.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: One of my other brothers also survived the attack. He isn't... um... somebody I'd trust greatly, but I'm sure he has some useful informations for you.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: His name is Drucksh. He usually likes to talk a lot when he is drunk, see if you can do anything with that.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: I'll be waiting for your return! Follow this path, it leads directly to Nemract. Good Luck!

lines.speaker: Drucksh
lines.line: Mmh. g... uh! oh, why hello there.

lines.speaker: Drucksh
lines.line: My brother? Oh yes, I do know where he is "buried", but do I want to tell you? No, It's none of your business.

lines.speaker: Drucksh
lines.line: Ohh mmhhhgg... g-g-good old Nemract whiskey!

lines.speaker: Drucksh
lines.line: F-fine! I guess it wouldn't h-h-hurt to tell...*burp*..you where it-it- he is...

lines.speaker: Drucksh
lines.line: It's in the old c-c-cathedral, at the end of the town. Walk east, it should be right after the b-b-bridge.

lines.speaker: Drucksh
lines.line: Though, the p-p-priest might not let you go in that easily...

lines.speaker: The Priest
lines.line: Are you trying to go down into the crypt? Oh, that is a very bad idea.

lines.speaker: The Priest
lines.line: This place has been corrupted, and the dead came back to life. We had to break the stairs to protect this cathedral.

lines.speaker: The Priest
lines.line: If you really want to enter it, I'd have to purify it so it doesn't corrupt you.

lines.speaker: The Priest
lines.line: Bring me [12 Rotten Flesh], that should do it. Ancient Nemract is filled with zombies, it's toward the south-west.

lines.speaker: The Priest
lines.line: You got the flesh. Good.

lines.speaker: The Priest
lines.line: It should be... "safe", now. Be very careful, you are entering at your own risk.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: You look like you desperately need an adventure, Come back when you're level 20, I might need you.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: Thank you so much for your help!

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: soldier, there you are! You were taking so long, so I came over here as quickly as I could, in case you needed my help.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: What? You got his will already? That- that's brilliant! Here, let me take a look.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: Well, it's a little dusty, but I think it'll do the trick! Thank you greatly for the help.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: Here, here, take these as proof of my gratitude. And, also- Priest, since you're here, I'd like to grant soldier here access to the graveyard.

lines.speaker: Priest
lines.line: Very well. It shall be done.

lines.speaker: Sayleros
lines.line: Excellent. Well, I'll be off to Detlas now. Feel free to visit if you'd like!

lines.speaker: The Priest
lines.line: Thank the gods you are still alive! Hopefully you are still doing fine in this dangerous world?

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: Hmm... Let's see, wha- Ah! Oh, pardon me, I was distracted. Luckily you're here, because I require some assistance.

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: You see, I was just on my way back from that large mansion near Nesaak, where I went to acquire some antiques from an old business partner.

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: However, along the way, a valuable cursed mask escaped from my caravan and somehow made its way into the dark mine over there!

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: I would've gone after it, but the things I have in this caravan are too important to leave by themselves. Not to mention that the cave seemed to corrupt from the inside out...

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: You must help me retrieve the mask, for I must depart in 3 days! Could you brave the shadowy cave and bring it back?

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: You've met a terrible fate, haven't you? I was just about to run the whole way to Nemract to get help.

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: I would really like to hear what you encountered in that cave, but I must prepare to leave, for I have many masks to sell on a far away continent.

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: Maybe you can visit me at some point, if our paths were to ever cross again. Then we could talk about your journey.

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: To thank you for your help, I wanted to give you a special mask, but I'm out of it. Maybe next year?

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: If you ever need something in the future, you should visit me in my homeland.

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: I can't talk right now. I've lost something rather valuable, and I need to get it back quickly, because I'm only staying here for a couple of weeks. Please come back when you're level 21.

lines.speaker: Mask Salesman
lines.line: Please help me find that mask! It's very valuable.

lines.speaker: Viraex
lines.line: Garoth? Sorry that name doesn't ring a bell. He could have lived here, but...

lines.speaker: Viraex
lines.line: The buildings here have been destroyed and rebuilt so many times.

lines.speaker: Viraex
lines.line: If you say he lived here many years ago, the oldest building is the church.

lines.speaker: Viraex
lines.line: Now that you mention it, there were odd stories about the basement of the church.

lines.speaker: Viraex
lines.line: My grandfather told me about it. I still have a key to the place, you are welcome to check it out for yourself.

lines.speaker: Viraex
lines.line: I heard they found some weird rooms down there so they just left the place alone. Wise move, if you ask me.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: Day 4: The year is 623 AP. My base of operations has been completed, along with a safety bunker.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: Day 18: It's become extremely dangerous to continue my studies. With the Twains gone, the corrupt run wild.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: Day 53: My studies have yielded poor results. I know only what we already knew.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: That simple creatures become enraged and corrupt, the fallen both old and new will rise near corruption.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: Day 91: My studies have hit a wall. I know from my extended stay that humans will not corrupt through proximity or touch.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: The corruption seems to affect everything differently. Land, animal, human, mind. It's incomprehensible.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: Day 147: I fear there is nothing else to do but study the portal entrance for myself.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: If there is a "cure" I'm sure it will have something to do with understanding the portal.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: I leave this journal in the hopes that it will be found and help those understand this plight better than I. Though I admit, my information is not helpful.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Journal
lines.line: The corruption acts independently and without intelligence. It does not think, it simply does. It's like an idea, a concept. An idea is something that can not be destroyed.

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: What business does a Ragni soldier have here? These are restricted grounds!

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: Finding Garoth's old camp? Yes, it's been said to be around here, but it's old, and the entrance has probably fallen apart.

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: How about you look around here, it should be very near, and when you have found it, I'll help you open it!

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: *Mumbling* ... Hey what are you doing here! This is off limits!

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: Right, finding Garoth's old camp...

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: You say the blocked off entrance is over there?

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: I doubt you'd be able to move it with any spell you know.

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: Well, allow me to assist.

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: The spells around here have to be a bit stronger to deal with the... Well, you know.

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: Wait for it...

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: And there you go. I hope you find what you’re looking for. Get out of here as soon as you’re done.

lines.speaker: Adventuring Mage
lines.line: Walk inside then, soldier! What are you standing around here for?

lines.speaker: Garoth's Note
lines.line: This... was a mistake. Beyond the portal holds no answers.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Note
lines.line: I can feel my mind slipping through my very mindscape, I fear this may be my very last entry.

lines.speaker: Garoth's Note
lines.line: As I studied the portal closely, I found myself staring for hours, longing to enter. Just as I forced myself to leave.. I was pushed.

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Stop, Stop, Stop!

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: This isn't working. Great, now a Ragni soldier is here for a progress report.

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Soldier, we haven't made any progress getting to Garoth.

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Truth is, we simply don't know enough about him to know how to deal with this.

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Maybe if you could help us find out more we could figure this out.

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Garoth, many years ago lived and studied in Elkurn. It might be a good place to start.

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Welcome back soldier. Still no luck here I'm afraid. Did you find out anything about Garoth's past?

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: ... I see. We had no idea he was corrupted. We didn't even consider that for a second!

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Well if that's the case it might just be a simple case of...

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: Success!

lines.speaker: Pottur
lines.line: I can't believe it was that simple. Magic can be like forcing a square into a circle, you just got to change your tact. Thanks for your help soldier.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Ah yes, hello! I don't think you want to hear what I have to say. It's a bit out of your league, come back when you are level 23.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Would you like to hear the tale of the pit of the dead?

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: It is the pit where the corpses of the poor miners who discovered what is now named the Nether Portal are buried.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Those that had not already died had to be executed due to the insanity brought on from the corruption.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Their spirits still haunt the grave and infect the minds of people who disturb them. It isn't pretty.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: However, I heard rumours of those who were able to bathe in their waters and be accepted by them, to show no fear of the dead is to be admired.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Maybe this shrine that I keep hearing about has something to do with it? It's apparently hidden deep inside the pit.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Soldier, the pit is located south east of Nemract, across the bridge behind us. I will write down the coordinates inside your content book.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Enter the pit. Learn it's mysteries, then come back to me.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: If you are too scared to go down there, I understand. Dealing with the souls of the dead isn't for everyone.

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Very impressive! Here's your reward. I found it a while ago while walking around Nemract. It probably fell off a skeleton!

lines.speaker: Merloni
lines.line: Glad to see you again!

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: Hey, you aren't a chicken! Wait, you're a human! You can help me! Maybe you are the guy who helped my brother Yahya, but who knows, you humans all look the same to me.

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: I really love my chickens, but there is one that I just cannot control...

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: His name is Cluckles, he was given to me by a man named Bob before he went to war, but when Bob never came back, Cluckles got angry...

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: He's really dangerous to keep on my lovely island, so I keep him in my basement...

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: I want to take care of him, but my wife says it's too dangerous. Where's my wife you say? Oh, I think she's around here eating some grain.

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: Anyway, I need you to go down there and... take care of him for me. I would really appreciate it.

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: What is this?! His feather? What did you do to Cluckles?!  I wanted you to take care of him, not kill him!

lines.speaker: Nohno
lines.line: You monster! Leave this place now, and keep that feather to remind you of your hideous crime!

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: Let's see here... mother's old vase… check!

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: Dining room table... got it here, check!

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: Finally, the journal. It's out here somewhere, I assume. I'll look around.

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: Hold on, what? The journal! I must have forgotten it inside the mansion!

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: You there! Would you mind doing me a deed?

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: I left a very precious journal inside of this mansion, a hell within walls. It was my great grandfather's!

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: The mansion was designed by a Corkian architect, and I was scammed into buying it.

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: If you step inside the mansion just for a few moments, you'll understand why the sellers had to trick someone into investing in their god forsaken real estate!

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: Navigating from room to room is nearly impossible, the rooms move around. I've only been in the mansion for a week and I'm already packing my bags and moving to Detlas.

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: The journal! You outsmarted the mansion!

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: I must thank you, that journal was priceless to my family.

lines.speaker: Leucsaa
lines.line: Let this be a life lesson to you. Never buy a house from a Corkian architect.
Keheh... Come further, little human... Step into the shadows...
Welcome...
Ah, but if you had only said so sooner! They have already left this mortal coil...oh, what a shame.
Hush now. I will ensure that you and your family are reunited. You will even be able to partake in...keheh...family outings, under my watchful eye...
Aha, naive girl. How cute, you believe you have a choice in the matter. What you want, is not what I need.
Heheh...do you see now?
Do you see how easily this place fell? How quickly I became its master? And how I could simply dispose of you without a second thought?
Such fragile beings, humans. So very easily influenced. Heartbroken, made hopeless. Your ties only serve to weaken you.
So I invite you to continue. I encourage it, even. For if you should foray into my domain...
There would be simply no chance for you to survive. And then, I will be free to string you up like a lifeless little puppet.
So take the gem, my little soldier. I eagerly await our next meeting, keheheh...
I will allow you to return now... and I will ensure you remember what you have seen here.
Good luck on your little quest...keheheh...

lines.speaker: Lost Soul
lines.line: Please, stop this! Whoever you are, leave me and my family in peace! What did we ever do to deserve this?!

lines.speaker: Lost Soul
lines.line: Y-you...I thought they...oh, god, no...

lines.speaker: Lost Soul
lines.line: Wha...you mean... N-no, please! I don't want to hurt anyone! I don't want to die!!

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: I...there...too many...th-thousands, at...at least...

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: No point...we're...doomed...

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Scout! Report your findings, immediately! How many corrupteds are coming?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Thousands...? This is far worse than I expected. Men! Prepare for-

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Wait, w-what's going on? What's happening to you?!

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Ah, hello there chap! I must say, I didn't expect to see a part of the old Ragni regiment over 'ere.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Oh, sod it, I knew I was forgetting something! Steady there, chum! I'm on my way!

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Drat! Too late, it seems. Yes, I forgot to mention the floor was in poor condition. Up here! You took quite the tumble, are you alright?

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Well, there's some good news, I suppose. Still though, seems I sent you a ticket to a bit of a sticky wicket! Do you see a way out anywhere down there?

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: There's a tunnel? Aha, spiffing! I suggest you take it immediately. I'll have to return to my post now, post-haste!

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Good luck, chum! Now, back, you cads! Back I say!

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Hey! Come on, come over here! Quit milling about with the zombies, chap!

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Oi! Hallo?! Chum? Why're you wandering round all bog-eyed? Come back to me now!

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Aha, chap! Wonderful, the Ragni regiment's gotten its representative down 'ere. All rested up, I suppose, so let me give you an earful

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Simply marvellous work, chap! You've made it this far, so no time to fill your boots. Be prepared, we are about to fight Charon's undead army

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Ah, hello chap! Might I inquire as to whether you've found that blasted little ruby yet?

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: I'll do a spot of scouting ahead, and then meet you in there! I must admit this place does give me the habdabs though, wot wot?

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Well, I would ask for a spot of help, but that'd be a bit barmy of me, considering you aren't even Level 24 yet! You've bog all chance of being able to help 'til then, though I mean no offense.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Old chap, I can only hope you find this scribble in my absence. Of course I hope that you did not have to return at all.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Ah, hello. Don't mind me, I'm just preparing for an oncoming corrupted attack.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: ...nothing you need to worry about, of course. I can handle it.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Stupid- ship! Get out of there! How did I even- manage to do this!?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Huh? Oh! I- ah, nothing to see here! Just... just taking a look at my good old ship! Yup!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Success! Success, success, SUCCESS! I'm a genius, the smartest man alive!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: You there, random bystander! You have witnessed a magical marvel! I have just successfully restored my memories from years ago!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: You look to be from Fruma, yes? So you know just as well as I that your memories of your life before have vanished. Poof. Gone!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: But with this device... we can change that! Restore what has been lost! Recover the- you get the point.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Now, I'm in great need of test subjects... You would do well as one, yes, but I need more to be certain this thing works.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Listen here! I have a proposition to make. You'd like your memories back, yes? Bring me enough test subjects, and I can show you what you've lost!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Let's see, let's see... We need individuals originally from Fruma. There are a few of those around here.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: You can start with the would-be sailor, Caid. You'll find him just past Elkurn- follow the path until you reach the river.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: In the meantime, I'll be making adjustments here... It's not perfect just yet. I'm still missing large portions of my memory... Hm? You're still here? Get going!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Well? I've given you an assignment, what are you still doing here? Go find the Sailor Caid. You'll find him just past Elkurn- follow the path until you reach the river.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Stupid- ship! Get out of there! How did I even- manage to do this!?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Huh? Oh! I- ah, nothing to see here! Just... just taking a look at my good old ship!

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Picard sent you? The guy cooped up in that tower? Huh. Good to know he's finally finished his work. What did he want me for?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: ...Look at my memories from Fruma, huh? I'm not so sure 'bout that. If they're missing, they must be missing for a reason. And I'm- I'm happy here! Don't need to know nothin' about-...

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: ...Yeah, alright. I'll come with you to get my memory checked out. Just, do me a solid first, alright?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: I'm something of a builder. Figured I'd try my hand at makin' a ship, and, here it is! Pretty good, right?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Issue is, I've built it somewhere I can't really move it out from. And, trust me, I've tried. A lot.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: I have a friend out in Elkurn- an alchemist. I'll write down his location in your content book. Could you go ask him if he has anything to help?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Thank you greatly. I'll keep trying here, maybe I'll be able to get it out myself...

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Come- on! You've got to get out- eventually! Stupid- ship!

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Phew... this isn't working. Have you been to the alchemist yet? He lives in town. He'll know how to help.

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Hello! Looking for potions? This is the best potion shop in Elkurn!

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Oh, Caid asked you to speak with me? What does he need this time?

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: He built his ship in the wrong place... and needs help getting it out... Good grief, I could have told him that'd be a problem if he'd have just-

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: ...Ehm. Well, luckily for him, I know just the thing to help! I can brew him up a shrinking potion, and he'll be all good to go...

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Golden apples, check... Got the water over there... Hm. I appear to be out of an ingredient. You can fetch it for me, right?

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Good, good. The item I'm looking for is known as a [Bloom of Death]. You can likely find some growing near the Elkurn church.

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Do be careful, though! They're rather agressive towards those they deem as a threat. Nothing you can't handle, I'm sure!

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Well, I'll get to brewing. Fetch me [1 Bloom of Death] and I'll be able to finish the potion!

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Hm hm... I'll have to leave it at this temperature for... and then I have to...

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Ah! You're back! Do you need a reminder? You can find [1 Bloom of Death] if you look near the Elkurn Church!

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: There you are! And you have the bloom! Excellent, excellent, give it here.

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Just a touch of this, and a touch of that, and...

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: All done! One shrinking potion, ready for use!

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: My work here is done. Bring that to Caid, and it should sort out his situation!

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Well? Go take the potion to Caid!

lines.speaker: Alchemist
lines.line: Hello! Looking for potions? This is the best potion shop in Elkurn!

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Come- on! You've got to get out- eventually! Stupid- ship!

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: ... You're back! Did my friend know what to do?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: A shrinking potion... Weird choice, but I guess it'll work. So, what, do I just pour it on...

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Huh. Well, it's certainly... smaller. I don't know if I can even fit in there anymore! The potion will wear off... right?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Well. Whatever, I can get it out of there now! Guess that means we should go to the doctor. Lead the way.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Aha! You've returned! Good, good, this'll be a good test of my changes...

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: ...Right. And this is the doctor we're trusting with my memories?

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Now, now, don't underestimate my genius. You'll be fine! Probably. I'd give it a 95% chance. Now, step up here.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: And now, all I need to do is... Activate the spell here, hit the switch there, and...

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: G-gah! What's happening?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Right, let's see what we've got here... Edwin, can you check that other crate over there?

lines.speaker: Edwin
lines.line: Sure thing. Say- Caid. How do you keep getting ahold of these things? There's expensive parts in these, and that seems a bit out of your price range.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Well... Let's just say the latest resupply package for the guards is slightly lighter than it might otherwise be.

lines.speaker: Edwin
lines.line: Wait- what? Caid, please tell me you haven't been stealing from the guards. You know they won't-

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Edwin, relax. I'm barely skimming off the top of their supplies. They won't notice one or two missing packages out of thirty.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: 'sides, I'm not scared of them. They're here to protect us, aren't they? I figure they'll just let me off with a warning, like they have all those other times.

lines.speaker: Edwin
lines.line: If... if you say so. I guess you're right. They don't need all those supplies, really. And we can make much better use of these than they would!

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Exactly! I'm glad you agree. So, have you found anything goo-
You two! Hold still, you're under arrest!

lines.speaker: Edwin
lines.line: G-g-g-guards! Run!!

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: E-Edwin! Get back here, you cowa-

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: That's enough out of you. You two, track down the accomplice.

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Caid, you are being placed under arrest for repeated counts of theft of imperial property.

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Your record shows you have received multiple warnings for previous acts. This was your final chance, and you have thoroughly wasted it.

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Take him to the prison for further questioning, and to decide what shall be done with him.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Hey! Hello? Bystander-turned-assistant! Get yourself out of that trance, we need to talk.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Hm. Hm hm hm. The memory cut off there... I wonder what we'd see if we could-

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Ah! Bystander-turned-assis- you know what, I'll just call you my assistant. Finally out of your trance, I see.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Hm? Where'd the sailor go? Oh, I don't know, I wasn't keeping track- I believe he returned to his ship. That's not important.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: What is important is what we've just seen! Memories relived in vivid detail! Truly, this device will change the world!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: ...Though, I will say. I am a little lost as to the timeline of events. Caid was arrested- so how did he find himself here in Wynn, as a soldier?

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: It's puzzling, to be sure... If only we could see further. I'll get to work immediately- we must know more!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: In the meantime, I'll have you fetch another test subject for me. There's a Scout Reynauld on duty today- he's also from Fruma originally.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: You'll find him near a bridge to the Roots of Corruption. I'm counting on you to convince him to join our experiment. In the name of science!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Hm... Where does this barrier lie? Is this magic not strong enough to break through it? Maybe if I increase the power, then...

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Gah! Assistant! What are you doing here? Have you spoken to Scout Reynauld yet? You'll find him near a bridge to the Roots of Corruption.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: ...and so, we expect them to attempt to seize control of this bridge any minute now.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I see. Well, you'll have me to help defend the town, at the very least. I guess all we can do now is w-

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: soldier? What're you doing all the way out here? The Admiral sent me to bolster Elkurn's defenses, what with the incoming threat.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Hm? The strange doctor wants to see me? To restore my memories? I can't say I really trust the man... but I am curious if it'll really work.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Recovering memories from Fruma... That's definitely something I'd be interested in. I've had a strange feeling about it, ever since we first realized we lost them.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Then it's settled. We'll go with you to meet the doctor. However, the town takes priority. We'll need to fight off the incoming corrupted force.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: soldier, you should join us! Three is better than two, after all. We have a bit more time, so you should go prepare, then come back here.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: So, have you had any interesting adventures since we split up?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Oh, right! You and General Graken dealt with the undead in Ancient Nemract, didn't you? Captain Ragon was glad to hear that, I'll tell you.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Me? Eh, nothing really to talk about. Aledar's gone off to research the corruption on his own, so I've been- I don't know. Helping wherever I can.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I have the skill and the magic to fight off corrupteds, so I might as well help wherever I'm needed.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Are you ready to defend Elkurn?

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: We don't have much of it left, I'm afraid. Go, then, but come back quickly.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Then let's do this. Shouldn't be much longer now...

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: I have eyes on the target! Corrupted forces incoming!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Ah. This might be a little tougher than expected. Well, let's give it our all!

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Finally, I've got a good shot! Just have to aim...

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Damn it, the summoner's shielded! How do we take it down?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: The spikes look weaker than the shield! If we can kill enough of its minions, we'll break its concentration and you can destroy the spike!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Now that's a brute if I've ever seen one... Alright, if we take this one out, Reynauld should be able to take the shot!

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Alright! That should do it. Fire a powerful shot here, and...

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Got it! You two- chip away at the summoner, it can't have long left!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: It's out of reach again- but we know how to deal with it now! Come on, we just need to kill more of its minions!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Another brute to take out, then Reynauld can take the shot!

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: The summoner's weak... now I just need to hit the right... spot!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: There's nowhere for it to run now! Let's finish this.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: We've done it! Elkurn stands another day.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: That was-... that was definitely tough. But, hey, we did it!

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: That we did. Thank you both for your help- I'm not sure I could have handled that alone.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hey, it was nothing. That's what I'm here for. So, soldier. You said there was a doctor restoring peoples' memories?

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: We did come to an agreement before this combat, yes. I'll follow you to the doctor.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Same here! I'm definitely curious to see what I've forgotten. Let's go, then.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Ah, assistant! I see you've done better than expected and brought with you two whole test subjects instead of one!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Now, now, come on. Which of you will be viewing your memories first?

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: I suppose that would be me.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Excellent. Now, just step right up over here! Look directly into the orb, and concentrate on remembering.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Alright... Very quickly, I just need to activate this... cast a spell here... and...

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: ...I don't feel anythi-

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: H-huh? Hey, who's there? Why are you knocking at this hour-

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: ...Oh. It's you.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: Yes, it's me. Mind if I step inside?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: N-no, of course not- Uh. It would have been nice if, you know, you warned me you would be coming!

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: You know that isn't how this works. Now, where are the goods?

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Right... always straight to business with you. Never, "oh, how was your week?" Always just-...

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: Fine. It's up and over here.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: I salvaged some parts from... uh, one of the nearby factories. I hope it's-... it's probably what you need.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: ...Hm. One of the factories, you say? And you're sure you weren't spotted doing it? If I were caught speaking to a known criminal, you know the consequences for both of us.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: N-no. I wasn't spotted. I, uh... I took precautions. Went in at night. You know.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: Hmph.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: S-so... is that enough? I've gotten you what you asked for.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: Well... it is that, yes. But, Caid, you know the risk I take every time I come out here to speak with you. I'll need more than just the bare minimum to guarantee your safety.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: I- hmph. Okay, okay, fine, I'll- I'll add in some emeralds. To sweeten the deal.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: Excellent. A pleasure doing business, as always. I'll be back in a few weeks.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: Sir- you requested my presence?

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Ah, Reynauld. Good to see you. Come in, come in, take a seat.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: Might I ask what this meeting is for, sir?

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Oh, nothing too special. I just wanted to have a quick chat about your performance.

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: You understand that those of us who serve Her Majesty in such well regarded positions have a certain... strict code of honor we must follow, yes?

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Otherwise, how could we be certain our ranks are pure of any misdeeds? We must set an example for the people of our great province.

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: I- yes, sir, I do.

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Now, what do you think might happen if one of our own happened to... bend, or break that code of honor? What sort of a precedent would that set?

lines.speaker: Reynauld
lines.line: Captain, I-

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: It is with no great pleasure that I inform you that you, Reynauld, are to be stripped of your rank and arrested under charges of dishonor and conspiracy against the Queen.

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Your accomplice, the supplier, was caught the other day. I'm told he spent very little time grappling with the thought before choosing to spill your secrets.

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: There is no place for your sort in our ranks, Reynauld. A shame it had to come to this.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Assistant! Snap out of it! There's more to discuss.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...so, what, you haven't tested any of this before now? What if this magic is dangerous? With how Reynauld reacted, I'm convinced it even might-

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Now, now, calm yourself. Just because I didn't do any proper tests before this doesn't mean it isn't safe! I've done the calculations! They all work out fine!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Oh, soldier, you're back. That was a little intense, wasn't it?

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Yes, yes, very intense, whatever- we still weren't able to see what comes next! I swear, I was able to see more when I looked at my own memories! It's ridiculous!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Hmph. Maybe it just needs more power... If I increase the amount of mana I put into the spell, then-

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Hold on. You want to put more magic into this, when it's already unstable?

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Yes, fine, I understand you've taken issue with my methodology. But it works! This has worked thrice now!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Don't you want to know what your life was like before? Even if it's not what you want to see, isn't it better to know?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Fine. We can look at my memories. I don't know that I necessarily agree... but alright.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Excellent, I'm glad to hear that! Now. Activating in three... two... one... go!

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: All hands on deck! Arrest that insurgent!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Huh?! What's going-

lines.speaker: Royal Captain
lines.line: Grr... He couldn't have gotten far. All of you, search the city! Leave no corner unturned! Don't let him get away!

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I- oh, this is bad... What can I-...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Damn it. Damn it all. I can't just let the man bleed out, even if he's-...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: It's fine, you'll be fine... I know what to do, even if I really shouldn't...
G-gah! Wh-where am I? Who are you? I need to get-

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Oh. You're- you're cursed.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I-

lines.speaker: Royal Soldier
lines.line: He's in here! And he has an accomplice! Arrest them both!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: My magic is struggling to keep hold... but it's clear there's more to see! Increasing power...

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: ...You shouldn't have gotten involved, you know.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: So, what? I should have just let you bleed out in my home? Don't be ridiculous.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Yes! You should have! Because now, not only have I been arrested for crimes against the crown, but you've also been outed as one of the cursed. Wouldn't have happened if you had just... stood by.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...It was the right thing to do. I couldn't just stand by when there was something I could do to help.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Well, a lot of good that's done us. You know no one gets out of here, right? When they take you, you're never heard from again! So. That's where we're at.

lines.speaker: Royal Soldier
lines.line: Tasim. It's your time. Follow me.

lines.speaker: Aledar
lines.line: Good luck out there, Tasim. You'll need it.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Ahem. We're ready for the process. Prepare the Adjustor.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: The- the what? What are you going to do to-

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Silence. Before we begin, I want to make one thing clear. We do not need your ilk in Fruma. We do not want your ilk in Fruma.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: What we will do with you today is a kindness, a mercy. If the world were to have its way, you would be far worse off. Remember that as we continue.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Now. Let us begin.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: You are a new recruit, being sent to the Wynn Province to fight in their war. You enlisted because you thought your unique... talents... would be useful.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Fruma is nothing but a speck in your history. A fact set in stone, with details lost to the hypothetical past. You think of it fondly, but remember nothing.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: You will fight in their war. You will live for it, you will die for it. You will be of Wynn forever, and Fruma will be glad to be rid of you.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Understood?

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Must I repeat myself? Do you understand?

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: I will ask once more. Is your directive understood?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...it is understood.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Wonderful. Take this one to the caravan. It looks like we'll be able to fit two more for today's batch.

lines.speaker: Royal Inquisitor
lines.line: Now what might you be...?
......assistant!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Assistant! Snap out of it! You've gone in too deep, the memory is sucking you in!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Find an exit, now, or you'll be trapped forever with no chance of escape! Quickly! GO!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Good grief- there you are! Do you understand how dangerous that was?!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: What do you think happens to me if one of my assistants gets trapped in their memories forever! Nothing good!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: ...Fine, fine. It did give us more information. Don't do it again, though! Come on, come over here, we have much to discuss.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: ...Hmph. I'll admit, I'm-... I'm not sure what to do with this information.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: The memory restorification orb worked about as well as I could expect for a single use... but, good grief, that was upsetting to watch.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: It stands to reason both Caid and Reynauld also experienced this... and my magic couldn't break through that wall...

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Is this what they're doing to their criminals out there, in Fruma? Casting them out to fight in Wynn's war?

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: ...I'll have to think on how much I want to delve into memories. In any case! At the very start of this, I promised you we could view your memories.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: The offer still stands, if you'd like to take it. Just step up to the orb, like the others did.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Didn't the doctor want to talk to you? You should talk to him first.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Well? The offer still stands, if you'd like to take it. Just step up to the orb, like the others did.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: H-huh?! The orb! My beautiful memory restorification orb! It's ruined!

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: ...Oh, whatever. I have the blueprints stored somewhere around here. I can always make another... but still.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Oh! Oh, right! My apologies, I completely forgot to check in with you! Are you alright?

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: None of the other test subjects experienced this powerful a reaction... strange. It's almost like we were accessing memories that didn't exist...

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: ...Well. Ehm. In any case- I'll need to continue my research. There's more to learn, I'm sure...

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: As thanks for your help- here, a reward. Ah, also- I believe your friend is just outside the tower. You might want to check in on him.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: There's much more we don't know about Fruma... and, given what we've seen recently, I suspect not all is well within those walls.

lines.speaker: Dr. Picard
lines.line: Might there even be... a war within the Fruman walls? No, no, that's ridiculous. Those memories didn't seem to show the signs of one...

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: Cursed. He called me cursed. What does that mean for me..?

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: And the Inquisitor... I don't know what to think. All of us- what we thought we knew when we arrived in Wynn... None of it was true.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...Did the two of us really meet through sheer random luck? He was running from something, and... fell straight into my life.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I- I need some space to think. To... reflect. Can you-... please don't tell Aledar about any of this.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: He doesn't need to know about all of this. He's- he's better off not knowing.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...I'm going to head for the Gavel Province, I think. It's across the ocean, far enough from- from all of this.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: When you get stronger, you should go there too. Maybe we'll even run into each other, eventually.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: I guess this is goodbye for now, then. Not forever- but for now. I'll see you around, soldier.

lines.speaker: Tasim
lines.line: ...I'm just resting here, a little. I'll be on my way soon.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: ...Oh. Hello. My boat's back to normal, if you haven't noticed.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: I... can't really bring myself to care, though. Maybe I should just stay here, a while.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: You know, even though watching my memories was unpleasant, I can't say it wasn't worth it. I've started recovering bits and pieces.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: I had a sister, back there. We drifted apart a bit, before the end. She didn't really approve of what I was doing.

lines.speaker: Caid
lines.line: ...She must still be there, come to think of it. I hope she's doing well.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: Ah. You again.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: ...I certainly regret following you to that doctor and his damned contraption. Those were things I didn't need to know about myself.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: The more I think about it, the more certain I am that I don't wish to remember anymore.

lines.speaker: Scout Reynauld
lines.line: ...It does make me appreciate my new life in Wynn more, though. I'd like to do my best to not fall back into those habits.

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Hey, a little help here? I need to ask a favor real fast! Anyone?

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Oh, hey! Maybe- Mmm, wait. I don't wanna get you killed, this could be dangerous. Maybe come back when you're Level 25?

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Hey, excuse me! I'm in need of- ...yeah, just walk right by me. Maybe I shoulda gone to Detlas for help, these people here have enough problems...

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Don't suppose you'd be willing to help, huh? Bet you're busy- Wait, you've got spare time? Criminy, only took a week of asking! Good to meet ya.

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Alright, My name is Tyko, and I got asked to find a capable soldier for- well, lemme explain. So, I’m from a place called Tempo Town, by Time Valley. It's a recent establishment.

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: I'm buddies with the mayor- he set up Tempo Town as kind of a homeless shelter for people whose homes got ruined by corrupted attacks, since Time Valley doesn't seem corrupted.

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Some old guy with jaundice or something swings by, some kind of keeper- Says to set up on a ridge overlooking a lake. So, we did! Everything was going well for a bit.

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: And then some freaky time monster starts showing up in the middle of the night and tries to bust down our doors! We were told that ridge was safe, but that was clearly a lie.

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: So, that's why I'm here. No one at Tempo Town is tough enough to kill that thing, so I ran over here to ask for some backup. Glad I ran into ya!

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Lemme write down the coordinates for ya in your book. I'm gonna stick around and see if anyone else feels like helping.

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: The coordinates to where you need to go should be in your book. Help us out, yeah?

lines.speaker: Tyko
lines.line: Heya! Heard from the mayor that you helped out the town! Can't thank you enough for that.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Hello- Welcome to Tempo Town, friend! Established only two months ago, I'm proud to provide aid to those displaced by corrupted raids.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Come to think of it, you look like a Ragni representative... Can I bother you to deliver some paperwork to the castle about getting officially established here?

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Oh, not that kind of soldier? That's too bad... But- oh, this is a shot in the dark, but... maybe you'd be the type of soldier to take out a monster for us?

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: You- you would!? Oh, thank goodness you arrived when you did! You see- we were told by that old man Martyn to settle on this ridge because there apparently weren't any dangerous creatures here!

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: But every night, the same monster emerges from one of the ruins, and tries to smash the buildings down! Every single night, at the same time!

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: The guards are getting run ragged, and I refuse to be responsible for any deaths when I'm trying to save these folks!

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: We found the ruin it came out of, too- Er, one of the folks here, Doug, did! Here, let me write down the location for you- no, no, I insist, let me do it!

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: There's the coordinates in case you forget, but it's in the temple just up the hill! Please, please hurry and take care of that horrible monster!

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: The coordinates are in your book, but it's in the temple just up the hill! Please, please hurry and take care of that horrible monster!

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: Grr... I KNOW I saw that beast go in here, where the heck is it?!

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: Hey soldier, does that disk look like some type of door to you?

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: I saw some creature that I've been tracking for a few days disappear around here, and I think it's somewhere behind this disk...

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: But... There's probably some kind of wacky magic keeping it shut, since I can't get it open at all!

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: Hey, you're able to use magic, right? Maybe using one of your fancy spells on the disk will get it open?

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: Stand on the disk and cast any spell. That should probably get it open, then we can finally kill that freak of nature lurking inside of there!

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: Let's see... What kind of secrets do these odd temples house?

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: What was going through your noggin, soldier?

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Do you have any idea what you were doing? Bashing around that room I just sealed off for good?

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: You need to be careful, soldier! This Valley's secrets are NOT to be meddled with.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: I assume the mayor of that place called Tempo Town sent you here. You are going to have to tell that lad that his problems just got worse.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
