lines.line: The monster you just killed was known as a Time Trouble. They're odd creatures that were forced into a day-long temporal loop by some fools long ago.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: The only way to keep them at bay effectively is to seal them, like I just did here. But now, that stunt you just pulled sent ripples across the entire Valley. Now, every single Time Trouble is responding to this one's termination!

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Now, one Time Trouble I can handle, but this? I can't keep them all at bay... and now, you went and awakened every single one of those critters.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: I can fix this seal, so you'll have one less to deal with, but the rest of the Troubles will have to be taken down daily with brute force.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: You're going to have to deal with those, soldier. I have far too much to take care of in this valley.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: They'll have to be exterminated every single day. Now, I'm sure the wo rk won't be thankless, perhaps you'll be rewarded by the townsfolk of Tempo Town for taking care of them.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Now please, be careful in the Valley. I already have to look after one person, nevermind the mess of time that the Olm were so-

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: ...I digress, I'm just rambling again. Now, let me bring us back outside this temple, and you should head back to that shanty town.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Oh hey, it's you! I hope you've been keeping those Time Troubles at bay.

lines.speaker: Scout
lines.line: Oh, hey! I hope that monster wasn't too difficult for you to defeat.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Hello- Welcome to Tempo Town, friend! Established only two months ago, I'm proud to provide aid to those displaced by corrupted raids.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Come to think of it, you look like a Ragni representative... Can I bother you to deliver some paperwork to the castle about getting officially established here?

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Oh, not that kind of soldier? That's too bad... I hope you find your visit pleasant anyways.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: You're back! I heard some kind of weird chime coming from the temple on the hill- is that a good sign?

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: You did?! Oh, thank goodness... Honestly, Martyn told us he would deal with it, but then he just disappeared off into nowhere!

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Oh, he actually showed his face after you took care of the thing? What, did you beat him to the punch or something?

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Wait... What? He was...trying to seal the thing away, instead of killing it, and...you destroying it broke the seal?

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: And now there's more of them? Why didn't he just tell us?! Now they'll need to be stopped every day to keep them in check!!

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Gah, this is a disaster... It isn't your fault, you didn't know- Wait, what's that boxy thing you have? A [Time Fragment]? ...oh, so the monster dropped it.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Interesting... One of the townsfolk likes to collect those sorts of things! He's that Mysterious Merchant just behind me.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: Go talk with him about those! He might give you something worth your while if you trade them with him.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: ...also, while you were away, that strange magic stone up on the hill started glowing. We're not sure what to do with it, really! Might be worth your attention.

lines.speaker: Homeless Mayor
lines.line: ...hm. Well, this is a bit awkward- I don't have a reward ready for you. Making this place took a lot of money... Hopefully gratitude is enough- thank you, sincerely!

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: Hey, adventurer! Would you mind helping me for a second? I have a bit of a problem on my hands.

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: A long time ago, before Ancient Nemract was destroyed, my family used to own quite an interesting book, that held knowledge of places and beings of great power.

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: Unfortunately, a creature stole it from them during the attack that led to the destruction of Ancient Nemract, and no one has seen it since.

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: If you are willing to help, bring me [1 Book of the Bones], I believe this book is now between the hands of skeletons, in an old tower in Ancient Nemract.

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: See if you can find this tower, one of the skeletons probably has the book somewhere in there.

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: Great! This will be very interesting to read, thank you!

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: I have a task for you, but you are...perhaps a bit ill-equipped? Come back when you are level 26.

lines.speaker: Laen
lines.line: Thank you for your help!

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Go away! I know you're angry but there's nothing to gain her-

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Oh, you seem calm. What are you doing here? Bit close to the portal for a soldier isn't it?

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: I see, you were sent to aid the public. Perfect.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: I am Orikal, I'm trying to stop everyone here from killing each other.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Do you see all these spikes? I believe they are the thing spreading corruption.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Corruption does not affect humans like other beings. It's much much slower, more like an infection of the mind to us.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Could you inspect the peak of the spike in the village for me? It might give me valuable insight. Thanks!

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: That was quick... did you find anything?

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Really, nothing? You didn't even feel anything?

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: How can it be just a spike? It must be spreading corruption somehow.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Then perhaps my second theory was correct. I will have to send you underground.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: There are old cave systems around here from the mining days. I sent two men down to excavate the spike, can you go down and help?

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: The entrance is a little to the northeast. In fact, you should have passed it on your way to the spike.

lines.speaker: Alfonse
lines.line: This is insane, why are we here?! We're looking for corruption you know that right?

lines.speaker: Roy
lines.line: Calm down. All we have to do is keep digging. Besides, he did say he'd pay us a lot, so stop being mad.

lines.speaker: Alfonse
lines.line: Forget it, I don't care anymore, just prime the explosive and get clear of the blast!

lines.speaker: Roy
lines.line: Well, that did the trick. Let’s take a look.

lines.speaker: Alfonse
lines.line: Oh my... What... is this?

lines.speaker: Roy
lines.line: It almost looks like a giant spike...Woah. How deep does this thing go?

lines.speaker: Alfonse
lines.line: Well, you know what? We did our job, so honestly I don't care. Let's get out of he-

lines.speaker: Alfonse
lines.line: Orikal? We're done! Pay up! I want out. This place is getting to me.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: I came when I heard the explosion. I thought you’d hurt yourselves.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Well, I'll be darned. The spike goes this far down? And it looks like it goes even deeper than this!

lines.speaker: Roy
lines.line: Well, I don't know about you, but I say we blow it to shreds! That oughta get rid of this spike!

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: For once, I agree. I'll do it, you guys just get clear.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: ...Wow, that did nothing. We're going to need something MUCH more powerful than TNT...

lines.speaker: Alfonse
lines.line: Oh yeah? And just what would you have in mind?

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Well, it's sorta complicated. That's why I've decided to give our new friend here the job of acquiring this explosive.

lines.speaker: Roy
lines.line: Oh yeah, we were so busy with this spike, we forgot to address you! Sorry about that.

lines.speaker: Alfonse
lines.line: Well if you don't need us anymore then we'll just be on our way... WITH our money! So hand it over please.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Alright, fine. Here's your pay. Thank you for your help.

lines.speaker: Roy
lines.line: Gah! That's hardly anything! I'm not even surprised. Let's just go.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Anyway, come meet me back at my tent, friend. We will discuss what to do then.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Okay. I happen to know a recipe for creating an extremely lethal magical explosive.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: There are 3 main ingredients you will need to get me: [Stabilized Corrupted Ore], [Incendiary Fluid], and a [Switch Fuse] to activate it.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: There used to be a small mining camp a little east of this town. It's abandoned now, but you should still be able to find what you need there.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: It's not the big ol' abandoned mines, mind you. It's a smaller camp, in fact you should be able to see it from this village.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Best of luck! Oh, and also, try not to die please. These ingredients do indeed promote environmental hazards.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: You got 'em all! Excellent, this is exactly what we need.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Alright, stand back. I have actually never made this before, so let's hope I don't cause a disaster.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Phew, glad nothing tragic happened there. This should be it, now go take it back down to the spike and destroy it once and for all!

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Oh, do you feel that? It's like a buzzing in my ears I never knew about has just vanished.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: I think that worked you know. It seems the power of the spike comes from the root...

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: But what is it connected to? That's for another day. The main thing is the village is safe.

lines.speaker: Orikal
lines.line: Here, take this for your help. I found this potato in one of the houses around here, and I sure as heck don't want it!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Well well well, look who decided to come back with their tail between their legs.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Two weeks now and you still haven't found it? Ugh, I can't believe I ever trusted you with such a simple task.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Who am I? WHAT DO YOU MEAN WHO AM I? You offered to help find my shovel, and I've been waiting two weeks!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Forget about your payment. Unless you either pay me back or get my shovel right now!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: My shovel? That's why I sent you out in the first place! It's somewhere in Time Valley. I lost it while following a trail of flowers.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I think it was south west of the large ruined gate. Now go get it!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Well hello there, stranger! Welcome to Time Valley! Always nice to see a new face around here.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Mad at you? Why would I be mad at you? We've never met.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I know this a bit forward, but I need to ask for your help with-

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Wait, is that-? It is! You've found my shovel! I recognize those markings anywhere.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: But why is it so rusty? Ah, no matter. Give that to me and I'll head inside to get you a nice reward.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Thank you. Now, about that reward-

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Wha- What's happening?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Huh? Where is everyone?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Usually this place is filled with workers.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: But no one's here. And this place is clearly not done.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Whatever the case, I should probably find my shovel.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: If I were a shovel, where would I be?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Hmmm. Not around here.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Wait, what's that-?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: This place... There's so much going on but no one here.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: What I don't understand, though, is why this place looks brand new.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: This place looks like it's just being built!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: This must be something to do with the valley's magic. Wouldn't be the first time.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Heh, time.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Woah! Where did-?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: In fact, whenever I hold that shovel, this kind of stuff seems to happen.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Maybe it's sent me way back. Back to the construction of this place.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Then why is no one here?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Woah, that tree looks like it might fall over!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: That was a close one!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Uhf! How do they have a cannon? These guys must be super advanced.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I think I'm close now. I can just feel that shovel close by.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Oh there it is! My shovel!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I'm surprised it took me back this far this time.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Well, time to head on back-

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Wait, Martyn?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Ow! What was that for?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I... Might recall it.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Oh... So that's where I am. I am so sorry Martyn. Please don't kick me out of the valley.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Holy Bovine!

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: How did you get these powers? Are you even human?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I probably could have gotten myself out...

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I did?

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Uh, you're still here.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I don't understand Martyn. He seems to know everything about the past. Here, come closer, I want to whisper something.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: I think he might have known Bob. I saw some letters in his house.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Weird, right? Bob was a hard guy to know.

lines.speaker: Asher
lines.line: Anyway, take this. It's the least I can do to pay you for saving me.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Oh dear, there he goes again. Poor fool ignored my warnings and touched that shovel.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: He's gone and got himself stuck in a loop.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Head inside, soldier, and I'll explain what's happening here.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Let me explain why Asher disappeared...

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Time Valley was built many years ago by a long-lost civilization.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: They had odd powers. They ended up distorting time itself.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: The tools they used to make these structures are imbued with their power.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Asher found one of these tools: the shovel.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: The shovel is tethering its time of influence to today. It keeps sending Asher back.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: The issue is, Asher died in the past. This creates a paradox.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: We can save him if I send you back to prevent his death. Go through this rift to join him in the past.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Asher, you remember when I allowed you to live in the valley, I told you not to touch any odd objects.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: You got yourself stuck hundreds of years ago. If it wasn't for this guard, you'd be removed from existence.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: I know time travel can be tempting. But it's far more dangerous than you can ever understand.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: The valley is banned for most citizens. I watch over this timeline because of poor souls like Asher.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Ah, we're back.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Oh you know. I've read a book or two in my time.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Soldier, I'm sorry I got you dragged into this. I wish I could have done it myself.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: You died in the past. Multiple times.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Yes. In some surprising ways too.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Soldier, I'm sure we will meet again... in time.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: See you around.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Am I?

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Without Asher, his house has vanished from time.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: My my, a crushing defeat to be sure. You'll have to find a way to stop that.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Go back through the rift and make sure Asher doesn't become a pancake this time.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Well that was quite the explosive end to our friend there. There must be a way to prevent that.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Head back in there. This time with less explosions.

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: Oh, so close on that try. Who could've guessed that was how our friend met his end?

lines.speaker: Old Man Martyn
lines.line: I'm sure you'll nail it this time. Not sure how you will stop a cosmic event, though.

lines.speaker: Barman
lines.line: Hello there soldier! What can I get you?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I'll take 2 Nemract Whiskeys. One for me, one for this chap.

lines.speaker: Barman
lines.line: You got it.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So, I've seen ya around town. Ya even went to the ocean to help that chicken guy!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So... I've seen ya around town. I saw how happy that guy was when you brought him some journal.

lines.speaker: Barman
lines.line: 2 Nemract Whiskeys, coming up!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So... Soldier. Are ya up for sailin' the ocean with me? I got a fancier boat than that seaskipper!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I figured you'd be interested in explorin' the waters!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I'll wait for ya on the docks. Don't worry, ya can't miss the boat!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: There you are! Ready? Follow me, the boat's over here!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Look at this.. Magnificent! Much better than whatever the Seaskipper is using!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Well, what are you waiting for? Hop aboard!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Then it's settled, we're goin' on an adventure!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Buckle up, we got waves to catch.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So... I should warn ya', this is actually my first time sailing...

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: It doesn't seem too difficult though, a little to the left...

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Hmm, looks like we're not the only ones out on the water today.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: They're a bit too head on, don't you think?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I'm tryin' to steer the ship but it's not budging...

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: That's unfortunate...

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Unfortunate... For YOU!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Hey, you're finally awake.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So, there's quite a few bodies in there, and we never bothered throwin' em out!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Hey! The boat's lookin' real nice now!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I'll probably let you rest so- hold on.

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.line: Ho-Honip! One of the guys said he saw something really weird coming right for us!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Wait... What? Soldier, come!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: What's happening?!

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.line: We-we don't know! We can't exactly see it, but it seems huge!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I- Let me see.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Uh... Where am I supposed to be looking at, exactly?

lines.speaker: Pirate
lines.line: I swear, it felt like the whole ocean was getting crazy a second ago!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: If this is another one of your jokes...

lines.speaker: Seth
lines.line: LOOK OUT!

lines.speaker: Seth
lines.line: What the hell is that??

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I don't know, this wasn't planned!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: It's starting to panic!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: That's right, get back!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I knew you had it in ya, haha!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: What a show! Come, I've got some things to tell ya!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I don't know where that creature came from, but thanks to you it's gone.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I've got somethin' else for you to tackle. It's about... the rats.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Come to the hold, I'll explain on the way.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I think we have quite a hellish problem on our hands.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I'm not sure what ya'll find there, but these are NOT normal rats.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So please, get in there... and kill everything, alright?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I've got faith in ya. Here goes nothin'!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Hey there! Ya bringin' me good news?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: You took care of these damn thieving rodents? A... colossal rat you say?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Nicely done, I knew I could count on ya! C'mere, take these!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Anyway, for now, you can go rest and do whatever you want!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: What.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Well... That's a twist.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I expected you to do somethin', soldier, not him!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Anyways, come talk to me

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I have another task for you. It's about... the rats.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: See, I really don't think we have your usual type of problem.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: We sometimes hear unusually loud footsteps, along with some really eerie squeaking...

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: That's why we're not too fond of goin' in... But our gunpowder there! We need it, as pirates!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So, I need you to get in... and kill everything, alright?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Here goes nothing. Snoo, ya stay there!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: That sounds absolutely terrifying! And ya did that alone! You know what, her', take these.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Just cast one of your fancy spells!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: That was... Phew... That was something.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Now, for an even bigger surprise...

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: What the hell soldier?? What don't you get in the ""soldier"" part of your job?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Come, let's figure some things out.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: You've been a massive disappointment, y'know?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: But you can still redeem yourself.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Follow me, I'll explain on the way.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: I mentioned a rat problem earlier... It's, uh, not a small one.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: We've got gunpowder to retrieve, so you're the one who's gonna clear the hold.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: So get in there... and try to kill everything, alright?

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Don't be as bad as earlier. You're a soldier.

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Well, shiver me timbers! You did redeem yourself soldier!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: ...Seth? Have ya seen the soldier?

lines.speaker: Seth
lines.line: No, but they did a great job in the hold! Some gunpowder went missing though.

lines.speaker: Seth
lines.line: Wait a minute.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: 'ey there soldier! Looks like ya're in a bit of a pickle! How 'bout ya hop on?'

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Well... We're headed for Selchar, the heart of the ocean! Which is safer than wherever you were, heh!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Soldier, now's your time to shine! Scare it off with one of your spells or somethin'!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: It's working! Do that again!

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: One more...

lines.speaker: Honip
lines.line: Anyway, come talk to me.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: Finally, you have arrived! I have been waiting for you.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: It's so good to see you again! Wait, we haven't met yet, of course!

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: Sorry, where are my manners? My name is Tom, I have been living here in Selchar for 30 years.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: I can't really explain why or how I know, but you are destined to help us, so I implore you to hear my tale. Santa is a real man who delivers presents all over the three provinces. However, he hasn't been seen in Selchar ever since it was founded.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: There's a reason for it too, it's not because the children were naughty or anything like that.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: This is a lot to ask, but will you investigate this crisis? People of Selchar will be very thankful.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: You can start by searching for Santa, I believe he relocated to the top of an isolated icy island village after an incident the other year.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: I am not sure where, but some travelling merchants had mentioned about an island with candycanes east from here.

lines.speaker: Tom
lines.line: Good luck! The people of Selchar will be counting on you, I- I'm sure we will see each other soon. Or rather, you'll be seeing me at any rate.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Ho ho ho! Merry Craftmas! Well not exactly, but its only a couple of days left!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: So what can I help you with, young traveller? You have to wait until Craftmas for your presents, ho ho ho!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Ho? Selchar? Oh yes indeed, Selchar, that poor little island. I wonder if those people there are alright.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: You see, I was never able to enter that city because of the corrupted magic surrounding the island.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: My reindeer are very sensitive to evil auras, they will not fly anywhere nearby anything that seems... dark, or twisted.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Hey, I have an idea! Why don't you use my portal to go to the past and investigate for me? I feel terrible for an entire city missing 30 years worth of presents.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: I wish I could accompany you, but its only a couple of days left to Craftmas and I still have a lot of presents to manage, ho ho!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Don't worry! The portal might be a chimney, but I have been doing this before you were even born! Ho ho ho!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Ho ho ho! That's the craftmas spirit I want to see! Simply walk into the fire and off you go! Good luck and be careful in the past, changing things can be very dangerous!

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: Wendy, where are you? Heheheheh! Oh, hi! You seem new to this place.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: The name is Tommy and I'm ten! I am always excited to meet new people that come to town! Someday this town will be very lively and fun!

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: So what are you doing here? Want to join me play hide and seek with Wendy?

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: Magical barrier? I don't think anybody here will know what you are looking for. Nobody here really knows magic sadly.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: I did see a group of shady guys who arrived here last week.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: They always wear these black scary robes and talk about crystals and stuff. I think they might be bad people.

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: I followed them once before, they seem to hide in the abandoned cave underneath this island my daddy calls "the heart of Selchar".

lines.speaker: Tommy
lines.line: They could be the ones you are looking for. The cave's entrance is just below the stairs nearby. Bye for now, I gotta find Wendy!

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.line: So a little rat finally finds out about our secret, huh. Doesn't matter, with this relicstone, I am going to kill you right here and right now!

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.line: Uaaaggh! How dare you do this to me!

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.line: I can't believe my relic stone can be shattered by some random peasant like you!

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.line: Ugh! Stop it! Alright, you win. We only had the one crystal anyway.

lines.speaker: Summoner
lines.line: What? You want to escape this cave? Use the exit portal behind me then, heh heh.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Oh no, please! Don't kill me! Wait a minute, it's you! I can't believe it, it's you!

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Don't you remember me? It's me, Tom! We met when I was 10! That was 60 years ago! Why, you haven't aged a day!

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: You might have already noticed, but Selchar is basically nothing but ashes now. You might not believe me, but the culprit is my old idol, Santa.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: He just appeared with red eyes and turned the whole island into what you see now.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: He destroyed building after building, and his elves started to appear from the sky and killed every citizen in sight.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Their bodies were full of crimson crystals and their eyes were empty, as if they were possessed by something.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: I refuse to leave because Selchar is my home. It always has been!

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Despite what Santa has done, I know he is not like this. The Santa that I knew was kind and always tried bring a smile to everybody's face.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: That crystal, the one we talked about 60 years ago, I think it did this. But I don't know how Santa got a hold of it. I saw you remove it all those years ago!

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Santa would never want any of this to happen. This is why, I want you to do something for me, and for him.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Please, end Santa's misery from the corruption that cursed him. He must be suffering inside his twisted body right now.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Santa made a hideout in the heart of Selchar. I'm sure you can find it by looking for the one with the most crystals.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Good luck, hero! I know its hard to do this, but please stop Santa and bring me back [Ragged Santa Cloth] as proof!

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Did you do it? Santa is dead? Oh no, I can't believe it. He is gone, just like that. After nearly 20 or so years of torment...

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Sorry, it's just very sad for me to hear the news, despite my being the one who asked for it.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Thank you very much, my hero. I will spread the news that Selchar is safe from corruption for now. Maybe once the grass starts to return...

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: You really remind me of the hero in the tales, who journeys through time and the entire province to bring peace.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Oh, yes! I am not sure why, but I heard some magical sound from the hourglass tower. It probably happened when you defeated Santa.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: I reckon it's your way home. Go on now, you wouldn't want to be stuck in this miserable city, would you?

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: I hope you will live a very wonderful life, you deserve it. I hope we can meet again someday.

lines.speaker: Old Tom
lines.line: Oh, and keep this crystal shard from the rag you gave me. I definitely don't want it.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Ho ho ho! Well If it isn't my friend who just took a journey through time!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: But of course, I already know you were successful, Selchar has had presents for the last 30 years thanks to you!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Although, I would have expected you sooner! I saw something strange and dark in the fire when I expected you to return.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Of course, no one in Selchar will know you saved Craftmas, because for them, no one has missed one! Of course I remember what you did, power of Christmas and all, ho.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: So, what took you? Oh, 60 years you say? I wonder how that happened. Well, not even I can claim to know the future. My guess is having that dark crystal with you while travelling in time caused you to over shoot.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Don't tell anyone what you saw though, knowing the future can be dangerous. Ho ho! If this journey has taught us anything, it's that time is a confusing thing, and nothing is set in stone. I don't like to mess around with it too much.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Anyway, I wouldn't want you to keep the crystal with you forever if its truly as powerful as it seems, give it to me, and I'll store it safely.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: That is some seriously dark magic we've encountered on this journey, and I'm sure it won't be the last encounter in your adventure.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Here, take this early Craftmas present from me. Good luck with your journey!

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: These are dark times, weary traveler! Too dark for you. Come back when you are at least level 30.

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: Your deeds bring me great relief! Thank you, my friend.

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: These are dark times, weary traveler! Nemract is at its weakest!

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: Our warriors have been massacred! We are completely defenceless!

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: We once had a brave commander who lead us to victory, but I fear he has turned!

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: He is the reason our warriors are dead! He led them into a trap, I'm sure of it!

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: His name is Takan. He's been acting strange ever since his brother was sentenced to death by Admiral Amerigo.

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: Sadly, I can't prove of his treachery. I desperately need your help! You must investigate further!

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: Go talk to Admiral Amerigo in Almuj. Ask him about Takan, then ask him for reinforcements immediately!

lines.speaker: Mylo
lines.line: What!? You don't know how to reach Almuj? Just venture past Saint's Row and through the savannah!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: I have no time for you, stranger! Almuj's army is in panic!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: You are here for Takan? In Bob's name, of course he's a traitor!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: You came too late, he has already caused us much trouble!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: After leaving Nemract, he came to Almuj's barracks and led a surprise attack of bandits! The carnage!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: I was just about to lead the rest of my army to retaliate, but perhaps there is a better way.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: Since it would seem that Nemract needs my army, I need you to take care of Takan. Who knows what he could be up to!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: However, the bandits that have taken over the barracks will be too strong for you! You must use stealth instead of force.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: Go to the barracks in the corner of the desert and assassinate Commander Takan. Bring me his badge!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: There should be a way to sneak in from a hole blasted on the far west side of the barracks that I escaped from.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: In fact, the trail of blood I left behind might lead you to him! You should be able to find him in the command room.

lines.speaker: Takan
lines.line: The commanding officers are aristocrats, all of them! They deserve to suffer for their selfishness!

lines.speaker: Takan
lines.line: Now that we have taken over their barracks, we can take over all of Wynn and make them suffer!

lines.speaker: Takan
lines.line: Today is the dawn of a new era... GAAHHH!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: Stranger, report!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: You... You did it?! That was rather fast, I must say!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: You have done this city proud, stranger. Almuj stands for another day then.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: Please take this small reward as a token of the city's appreciation... Hm...

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: No, not a small reward. I will give you something that one such as yourself more than deserves.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: This is not any mere piece of gear. This is spoken of in fantasies, in fables.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: Such items have special abilities that are far beyond any of the normal magic powers you find on most things.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: This one, in particular is only awarded in very certain cases, and can be considered a medal of honour. Be proud!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: Now run along, I have to collect my own honorary badge for taking out Ex-Commander Takan.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: I have no time for you, stranger! Run along.

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: I need you to assassinate Commander Takan! Hurry stranger!

lines.speaker: Amerigo
lines.line: Keep that bracelet around! I am certain you will find it useful.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: Oh, hey! You, adventurer over there! Would you mind helping me?

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: You see, this cave behind me has been troubling me for the past while now.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: There are special slimes that live in there, and they drop a certain goo that is quite a delicacy when brewed into a drink!

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: They are called Gooey Slimes, and should be at the very back. A friend of mine drinks the stuff like water, and he refuses to work without it.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: However, the slimes have gotten stronger about a month ago. I'm unable to retrieve it any more, I've come close to getting killed a few times!

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: You, however, seem much better equipped than I. Hopefully you can do it.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: If you decide to help me, you'll need to obtain a special device for retrieving it, as the slime will dry up quickly in the air.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: A... less fickle glassblower, Yodbon, can make it for you. He should be living in a house in front of the Almuj bank.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: I'll need [8 Slimey Goo] since we'll need a big batch of drinks. If you help, I'll be sure to tell him, and he'll probably let you into his shop.

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: Welcome to Yodbon's Glass Blowery, what can I do f-

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: Oh, another stinkin' adventurer, eh...

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: So many've been coming up to me recently, askin' for a bloody Slime Scooper...

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: Izzat brother o' mine stopped workin' again? I swear, he's addicted to that slop...

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: Anyways, for me to make you a scooper you'll need to get [5 Soft Sand].

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: Come back to me once you've gotten ahold of it. You can dig it up from those sand piles 'round the desert.

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: You've returned, I see.

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: A'ight, fork 'em over and I'll make you the scooper.

lines.speaker: Yodbon
lines.line: ...There you go. No idea why he wants that stuff though. Maybe it's an acquired taste...

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: Oh, you're back! Good to see you were able to get through there. Have you got a full Slime Scooper?

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: Hmm, yes, everything seems to be in order. Perfect!

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: Thank you very much. Finally, I'll be able to get him in gear again...  Why are all Villagers so fickle like that?

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: Well, I suppose that's beside the point. I'll be sure to let him know you got him his most recent fix.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: He hangs around in a little black stall in the bazaar, there's a basement to it. He should let you inside now.

lines.speaker: Eluzterp
lines.line: And, for your troubles, a little something from me as well.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: You look like a hardy one, Ragni army is it? Would you be willing to help Almuj a bit?

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Us guards have been trying to root out desert bandits trying to rob the bank.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: We're using reports from witnesses to try to gain information.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: If I give you some of the witness reports, will you help get clues from them?

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Great! The store from the first witness report is straight down the stairs, just past this building here, just behind me.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: The store that you should read the report in is named “Gibbs' Mining Supply Store,” and it's the store that was robbed.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: I will write the coordinates to the store so you can read the report just in case you can't find it.
Business was slow that day, until two rugged, oddly-dressed men stormed into my shop, with a lot of nerve.

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper Gibbs
lines.line: Hello gentlemen! What can I interest you in today? Some industrial torches? Pickaxes?
Before I could close any deal with them, the man with a dagger started threatening me!

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: Shut yer' trap, old man. We came for a different kind of business.
I tried to make peace with the crooks.

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper Gibbs
lines.line: Wha-? Look, fellows. Just step out of my store, and nobody gets hurt. I don't want any trouble.
The bandit put the knife closer to me and started demanding the code to the TNT vault downstairs!

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: Listen up old man, tell us the code to the TNT vault in the basement, or I decorate my necklace with your fingers!

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper Gibbs
lines.line: Certainly not! That TNT is for licensed mining companies only, not your average amateur miner.
The bandits grew agitated and resorted to violence to obtain the combination.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: Well then! I guess you'll still be able to grasp a pick with four fingers, eh?
They swiped their knife at me, leaving a sizeable wound on my arm.

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper Gibbs
lines.line: Gaaah! Alright, alright! No more violence, please!
I had no choice but to give up the combination, which was 7812.

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper Gibbs
lines.line: The code is 7-8-1-2... please don't hurt me!
After I gave up the combination, they knocked me out!

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: 7-8-1-2... thanks! We won’t be needing you anymore... now go to sleep!
I had no idea what the criminals did after that, I never went back into my shop after the incident.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: You're back, having read the report I assume. Did you find anything in particular?

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Missing TNT in the shop's vault? The report was truthful and trustworthy.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: We need to catch these criminals quickly if they have access to this dangerous amount of TNT, capable of putting a hole in the bank's wall.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Luckily, we recently had another witness report come in.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: This report takes place on the roof of the Scroll Merchant's residence, a garden roof.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: I've written the coordinates to the shop in your content book in case you don't know where the Scroll Merchant is.
I was having a fine time tending to my rooftop garden after a lengthy day of selling scrolls.
While looking down on the street, I saw two unsavory men, one with TNT in hand, marching down the path.
I was suspicious, so I tried to get their attention, but they ignored me.

lines.speaker: Scroll Merchant
lines.line: Ey', what do you two blighters think you're doing with those dangerous explosives in the city?
I then realized that had no innocent itinerary, they were heading straight for my wealthy neighbor's house!
I tried to yell for the attention of a guard or official, but nobody could hear me.

lines.speaker: Scroll Merchant
lines.line: Guards! Guards! Robber! Come quick! Urgently!
Before anybody could hear me, a large explosion occurred inside of the house the bandits intruded.

lines.speaker: Scroll Merchant
lines.line: Gaaah!
The bandits came sprinting out of my wealthy neighbor's house with two of his most prized possessions: two of his weapons.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Were you able to uncover any new information regarding the status of the criminals?

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Oh dear, this isn't good. The criminals plundered two very powerful weapons.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: It won't be easy facing those criminals if they decide to raid the bank with those weapons.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: I'm not certain how to proceed from here, we didn't receive any more witness reports, and-

lines.speaker: Almuj Sentry
lines.line: Boss, I just received urgent reports of a robbery underway in the left residential area of Almuj!

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Oh my... you! Soldier! Urgently! The robbery is taking place across the bridge, next to the first house you visited today!

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: There will be somebody waiting for you outside of the house once you get to the residential area!

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: If you still can't find it, I've written the coordinates in your content book. Now quickly, get to the house!

lines.speaker: Almuj Citizen
lines.line: Hello? Are you with the guards? Good! Hurry! Some bandits just ransacked my house, and left with lots of emeralds!

lines.speaker: Almuj Citizen
lines.line: Follow me to my house, hopefully you can find the bandits! They stole lots of my precious gold!

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: Here-- maybe you'll help us pull the heist if I give you some of this gold we just stole.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: Ahah. I had a feeling we had a guard on our tail.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: I wouldn’t want to wear out my new-stolen weapons killing you... I'll just trap you in here with all of this TNT!

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: This'll blow up in a few seconds. Good luck getting out of here!

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: It's too late to stop us now! We’re already about to bust out of here with a grand prize sure to gain us province-wide respect!

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: Look here, the soldier decided they wanted to follow us. Dumb move.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: I guess we can kill two birds with one stone: escaping the bank, and killing this pest.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: Block the entrance, bandits!

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: Oh no... we've run out of TNT! We were in over our heads... We can't defeat them, just run for your life! Forget the emeralds, let’s get outta’ here!

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: What happened down there underneath the bank? I heard the rumble.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: You stopped the crooks? Amazing!

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: The Almuj bank is typically reserved for trusted members only; however, you have proven yourself today to be one of them.

lines.speaker: Almuj Bank Guard
lines.line: Thank you for your service!

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: Hello, dear. My name is Haily. Nice to meet you.

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: This is the Almuj charity center. We're looking for volunteers to help the homeless this year.

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: If you want to help someone else this year, our boss Nick is already out in the thick of it.

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: He's a really special man. I'll write his location down for you in your book. Oh, remember this is charity work, so hopefully gratitude is a good enough reward for you.

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: The world needs more people like you, so selfless.

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: We're looking for volunteers for the holiday season.

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: Come back when you're level 33.

lines.speaker: Haily
lines.line: So, how is it going? Did you find Nick in the slum?

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Oh. Oh... Oh dear. There's more people here than ever.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Hm, are you just passing through? Oh! A volunteer!

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: You're the only one this year. Things have really changed. We used to have hundreds of volunteers this time of year.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: The people here are starving. There's no two ways about it.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I don't know how we're going to feed everyone this year.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: The man who runs the budget store used to be homeless... He knows the struggles they face.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I'll look after things here. Can you go to the budget store? It's really close. Any food is gratefully received.

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: 'ello young soldier.

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: What can I do fer ye?

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: A food donation fer the 'omless?

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: I'm sorry but everyfin is sold out, everyone is preparing for Craftmas.

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: I might have something on the attic, if you find anyfin, you can 'ave it. I know how difficult it gets.

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: Hm... This apple has seen betta days...

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: Looks like I'm fresh outta food. Barely got enough to feed meself.

lines.speaker: Flodur
lines.line: I wish I had something to give this year. I guess people are having a feast in the city.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Any news?

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I see. I was counting on him.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I can't be too upset. He donates so much the rest of the year.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: We may have to ask the farmers directly...

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I know someone in Ternaves with a kind heart.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: We've fallen out before, seems he didn't understand what a donation was.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: There is a shortcut south from here, in a cave. Go through there.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Oh, also, can you give this blanket to Margaret while you're down in the tunnel? Just follow the road behind me.

lines.speaker: Margaret
lines.line: Oh, please don't move me along. I have no where else to go!

lines.speaker: Margaret
lines.line: Oh, a blanket for me? How sweet... From Nick, you say? He's always so kind... Thank you, as well.

lines.speaker: Margaret
lines.line: If you want to get to Ternaves quickly, just keep going through this tunnel. Some unfriendly homeless folks live around here too, so be careful. It's so sad, their state.

lines.speaker: Reshad
lines.line: Welcome to my farm! Looking to buy some of my fresh crops?

lines.speaker: Reshad
lines.line: Well, it seems you're out of luck. I've just sold the last of them from this harvest.

lines.speaker: Reshad
lines.line: It was all for that big Craftmas feast happening in Detlas. Wish I could help you out, but I'm fresh out of food to sell you.

lines.speaker: Reshad
lines.line: Wait, I bet Nick sent you, didn't he? Well, he's coming up on your left. Remind him that this isn't a charity.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Hey, soldier! Any luck?

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: We can't get any food? We're running out of options here...

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Well, there's only one person left that we can appeal to at this time of year.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Follow me.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Nick... You know the deal.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: The council all have their areas to care for. Yours is Almuj. How you care for it is your responsibility.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: There's five times more homeless and hungry than last year!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Nick, I know times are tough there, but-

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Tough?! It's impossible! What happened to people's good will? I had one volunteer this year! ONE!

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: I'm sorry Nick. You could go to Detlas and ask there, they have a feast big enough to feed an army!

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Hmmm... Oh, sorry. I miscalculated your journey here. Good to see you.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I suppose you heard Santa and I. Our next location is Detlas.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Alright, that's settled then. Leave through the fireplace behind me, it will bring you directly to Detlas. Good luck, Nick.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Wow. The people here live in such grandure. I wonder if they know people are starving to the east.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Let's ask around for some donations.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: More importantly, let's hope they'll share a trifle of food.

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: This event is invite-only.

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: You aren't even in a formal dress.

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: What do you want?!

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: Food? You want food? Does this look like a charity to you?

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: Of course not! We have an obligation to feed our partygoers, not some poor scraps of men in the desert!

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: Now get out of here before I call the security golems. And don't even think of stealing from the kitchen!

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: Hey! Don't you dare go stealing from the kitchen!

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: Get out before I call the guards!

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: Are you back here again?

lines.speaker: Server
lines.line: Nick really changed people's minds. Sorry about what I said.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Were you able to get any food?

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: You do?! I didn't expect them to be so generous, a whole crate?

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Oh...

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Stealing is not in the Craftmas spirit... But I think I can make this work.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Go on ahead. I have a plan. Don't worry, I'll return all this food.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Listen up everyone!

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I know you are hungry. Because I am too.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: But your dinner will not be served tonight.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: There will be no Craftmas feast this year!

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: This one night, this one missed meal.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: This is how thousands of people live every day.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Hungry, wondering when the food will be available.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: And while you sit there with empty stomachs be thankful for what you have. Spare a thought for those who have not.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Hundreds of men, women and children, just like you, will not eat tonight, at all.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: All because this enormous feast was not enough. Detlas bought all the food, cheap or expensive.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I'm here to remind you the real meaning of this day. To think of others..

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: I will return your meal tonight, but while you eat it... I want you to remember every empty mouth it could have fed.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Share what you have, be thankful for what you are given.

lines.speaker: Guest
lines.line: You can't do that!

lines.speaker: Guest
lines.line: The food on the table isn't enough to feed everyone here!
Well, looks like you came through yet again Nick.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: I came to see if I could help out. But it looks like you've done it.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Well, I guess there is only one thing left to do to complete this scene.

lines.speaker: Santa
lines.line: Hope you all have a merry craftmas. Ho-ho!

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: It looks like my little speech brought the rich back down to earth.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: They gave us half of their feast. Can you believe they still had leftovers?

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: All of that food, going straight to waste.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: They have no idea what they have, compared to these poor folks.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: You might be wondering why I know Santa. Well, he's my brother.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: My siblings and I take care of people at Craftmas. My area is the Almuj desert. I guess you could call me Sanda Claus, heh.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: It's people like you that keep the real meaning of this holiday alive. It gets harder every year as the meaning is distorted. Here is a personal gift from me. Thank you.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Have you found any food?

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Sigh... This isn't looking good...

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Thank you so much! I couldn't have done it without you.

lines.speaker: Nick
lines.line: Hey! Don't go down there, it's dangerous!
Hmm.. No dice. Let me try another.
Ugh. I guess the legend is true about the sceptre.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Ah, a Ragni Soldier. I didn’t think you had much to do out here in the desert?

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: I'm out here trying to get into the emperor's tomb. Although I'm realising I can't without his sceptre.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Way before the portal came about, there was a massive empire laid across this land.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: A powerful emperor ruled with a mystical weapon. When he died, the empire fell beneath the sand.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Untold treasures are inside the emperor's tomb. But without his weapon, there is no hope of entering.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: It's long been rumoured that bandits have the sceptre. They probably have no idea what it is.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: If you could get it, we could enter the dungeon and seek out the emperor for ourselves. The bandit's base is at the start of the mesa, up the hill.

lines.speaker: Vault Guard
lines.line: What, wanna enter the hideout?

lines.speaker: Vault Guard
lines.line: Even if yer a crooked soldier, we can't jus let yer in.

lines.speaker: Vault Guard
lines.line: That is, unless yer got the password?

lines.speaker: Vault Guard
lines.line: Didn’t think so. Now get lost, wasted enough of my t-

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: Now would you look at that... Even soldiers think they can waltz in ere.

lines.speaker: Geo
lines.line: Having fun thinking of a password? Sorry to spoil your lunch, but there isn’t one!

lines.speaker: Geo
lines.line: We could use a few more officials on the roster.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: If yer are on the liberal side of the law, talk to us outside.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: Looks like yer in. Look, there ain't a password cause we're meant to be the best thieves in the land, right?

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: So what good are words? Yer gotta give the guard somethin' stolen, aintcha!

lines.speaker: Geo
lines.line: And we just so happen to have the opportunity of a lifetime for you. Rymek has gone soft see, a new Mayor is cleaning things up.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: Well, we can't have government not under our control. Rymek will always be bandit capital.

lines.speaker: Geo
lines.line: So how about we give him a taste of his own medicine, and get hold of that journal he keeps? I’m sure that’ll dig up some dirt on him.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: And by "we", we mean you. You'll have to sneak through the mansion and avoid guards.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: He keeps his journal in the highest room. Might need to distract some guards too. It's the biggest mansion in Rymek, can't miss it.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: Yer know you could get kicked out of the army fer this.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: Heh, guess yer the real thing. Hop in, lets get out of ‘ere.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: That journal is more valuable than any gem, you'll be able to get in fer sure.

lines.speaker: Tarek
lines.line: Off we go!

lines.speaker: Vault Guard
lines.line: Password?

lines.speaker: Vault Guard
lines.line: Oh, this is quite the password, Ragni man. I think this will do nicely, on you go.

lines.speaker: Bandit Boss
lines.line: There was another mage at the ancient tomb today boys.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: Well she ain’t got the sceptre does she? She can’t do much harm. Wait why dun we use the sceptre boss?

lines.speaker: Bandit Boss
lines.line: Because the Creden Tibus is more than just a group of criminals. We are honour bound to protect these sands.

lines.speaker: Bandit Boss
lines.line: The empire that fell beneath these sands could be revived if that sceptre made it back to the emperor.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: Good job no one will think of searching that broken cart near the river ey boss?

lines.speaker: Bandit Boss
lines.line: Silence you fool. Didn’t I just say it was imperative no one found the sceptre?

lines.speaker: Bandit Boss
lines.line: Right, go steal some things or something, I have real work to do.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: I knew someone was listening.

lines.speaker: Bandit Leader
lines.line: We might be bandits, but we’re not stupid. That sceptre is left better off alone.

lines.speaker: Desert Raider
lines.line: Seize ‘em!

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: You actually got it! I knew I could count on you. Lets try this!

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Huh? We got no time for superstition, we need to break that seal.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Seems like something's happening!

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: We did it! Who would've thought that it was that ea-

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: What the hell was that...!

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: That shouldn't have happened, I... I don't understand.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: The legend says that the emperor was immortal. I thought this would work.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Unless.. He cursed himself. There has to be more to this story.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Perhaps we will never know the full story.. well not unless we unearth the desert itself.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: I'm sure the tale will be discovered in time.

lines.speaker: Lanu
lines.line: Well, maybe we'll see each other again, but I must go now. Here, take this as a token of my gratitude.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: My tribe worries our own business, stranger.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: Oh, my apologies, I did not realize you are a warrior of the province! We would be grateful of your help.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: Our sacred owl totem that we worship was stolen by the cunning Eagle Tribe many years ago. Its magical properties used to bring prosperity to our camp.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: However, the Eagle tribe are not victorious, we possess their mystic eagle totem, but alas, I do not know who was the original thief.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: We have been at war for years now, despite being neighbors. Without our totem, our rivalry will continue for ages and peace will never again be felt in our hearts.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: Retrieve our totem, and the blessing of the Owl spirit will be with you.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: Now, enter the Eagle Camp across the river, you may have to search the camp, I'm sure they have hidden our totem!

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Greetings, what brings you to the noble Eagle tribe?

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: You seek the Owl totem? The cursed Owl tribe trying to retain their lost dignity again.

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Why should we give you their totem back? They stole our source of enlightenment all those years ago.

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Tell you what, if you can retrieve our Eagle Totem, I will allow you to go return the Owl totem.

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: I'm sure they hid the totem, but if you are able to find it, I await your return!

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Wonderful! You may now enter the cave to retrieve the blasted Owl totem.

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Be careful, there are Eagle guardians in the cave, be prepared traveller.

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Once you get the totem, you may return it to its original tribe.

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Hopefully, we two camps will never set foot on another's land in an attempt to steal back the totems, and live in peace.

lines.speaker: Favian
lines.line: Anyways, hurry up, even the thought of the two totems sharing the same space makes me sick.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: I-Is that, the totem? My, it has been a long time since the owl has been with me. Though I wonder if the Eagle and Owl totem possess the same mystic powers.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: To think, such a long war could end so quickly and by the help of a single person.

lines.speaker: Caras
lines.line: Many thanks to you! I shall keep my promise, please accept this reward, and may the Owl be forever with you.

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Oh, hey kid. Wanna make some money?

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: I need you to translate this ancient text.

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Just run it down to the lab assistant, Tesha.

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: I'd take it myself, but I'm far too important for grunt work! The lab is up there in the tent, and don't you dare damage the translation!

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: Hello, welcome to WynnExcavation Labs!

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: Oh, Vade sent you?

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: Oh yes, the tablet I was waiting for!

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: Oh my! This is quite interesting..

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: Here, let me finish this up...

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: ..and there you are!

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: One tablet complete! Return it to Vade. Oh, and don't read it!

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: Take that to Vade, and don't read it!

lines.speaker: Tesha
lines.line: Oh hey it's you! Wynn Excavation has its eye on you.

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Who are you?

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Oh right, you're that kid I sent out!

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Well do you have the translated text or not?

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: You do! Brilliant! Let's take a look at that...

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: "Throw tribute an item to the wood that stands out, the right angle will open the way"

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: I wonder if it is talking about inside the temple... Oh, uh, I forgot you were here. Stay out of this kid, it's grown up business!

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Hey kid, did you just come from the tomb?

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: I knew I shouldn't have been so lazy and got someone else to do the leg work!

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Gosh, I can't tell my boss about this, he'll have my head! Literally! WynnExcavation is not a group you want to betray, they are more powerful than you will ever know.

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: YOU'D BETTER NOT HAVE TAKEN ANYTHING! THAT IS OFFICIAL WYNN EXCAVATION PROPERTY!

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Hey kid, can't you see I'm busy here? Come back when you're level 35.

lines.speaker: Vade
lines.line: Well, I figured it out soon after you got back. We possess the crystal, don't go looking for Wynn Excavation again, all is not what it seems. Take that as a friendly warning.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Good day! You're the person that helped us out in the desert aren't you? Excellent! Just the person I need! Can you help me out with a problem I have?

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Perfect! You see, we are supposed to be searching for some of the... uhhh... long lost ruins of ancient Wynn, just like in the desert!

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: However, it seems no progress has been made recently; my workers have stopped working!

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: The problem is, there are strange creatures down at the bottom of the cave disturbing them.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: I need you to go and kill them, but first you should go talk to one of my colleagues, he has more information for you.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: He is located directly at the bottom of this cave, go speak to him, go on now! Off you go!

lines.speaker: Flendar
lines.line: We know what you stole from us in the desert! Take THIS! You won't be escaping this dead end any time soon!

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Archaeologist
lines.line: Baffling... What a puzzling situation I am in...

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Archaeologist
lines.line: I cannot open this door for some reason...

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Archaeologist
lines.line: We suspect the purple crystal is behind this door, but the descriptions in the scriptures don't match this door.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Archaeologist
lines.line: They seem to describe another door, but all our evidence says otherwise.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Archaeologist
lines.line: The scriptures also say something about hidden within the rocks... But we removed them all!

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Archaeologist
lines.line: Well, the writing isn't actually all that clear. It could mean virtually anything, I think one of these words means hippo! Guess we'll have to find out!

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Archaeologist
lines.line: Anyway, back to figuring out what needs to be done here... Wait, who are you, you're not an employee of Wynn Excavation!

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: I have to admit, I'm impressed. I genuinely thought our plan would be successful. Who knew that dead end had a secret exit.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Not me apparently. We know what you took in the desert, you were just some kid expected to do a delivery job, who knew you'd take a shard of the crystal.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Don't pretend like you don't know what it is, you know as well as I do combining the four crystal shards is told to bring unlimited power!

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: You will not interfere any longer. The location of the remaining crystals are known only to us; the fire and leaf crystals are safe.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: I see that tricking you isn't the way to defeating you. If we ever meet again, we'll be using force and upping our security. Now I never want to see you again. Our socie- I mean company, will not tolerate your interference again.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: And don't come back!

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Hello there! We are working very hard here at this excavation site! We have one in Almuj as well, I think you should check it out!

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Good day! Can you help me out with a problem I have?

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Hmm, it seems you will be unable to help us. We need someone at least level 46.

lines.speaker: Excavator Lykron
lines.line: Go on now! Off you go! Remember to speak to my colleague at the bottom of the cave!

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Guard
lines.line: What are you doing here?!

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Guard
lines.line: This door is closed; the mine entrance behind it isn't open at this time.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Guard
lines.line: I'm here to make sure no one uses the passage while the archaeologist works.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Guard
lines.line: You will have to find another exit if you want to get out!

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: All operations functional... Transportation on schedule... Oh. It's you. We've been looking for you.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: Locating you was far harder than we thought, but here you are, having come right to us.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: Now you're here, I'm not sure what to say. But I feel I must explain, we at WynnExcavation apologise for all our previous encounters.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: We completely got off on the wrong foot. We are a company from Gavel which specialises in historic artifacts of great mystical importance.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: After our encounter in Almuj, we naturally thought you were a black market salesperson trying to steal pieces of the artifact for monetary gain.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: So we instructed all of our employees in all of our sites to thwart you at any cost. Historical loss is a very important issue, especially with something so powerful.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: But after hearing the stories of your travels in the province, we realised what had happened, and you mistook us for the enemy. This is obviously not the case.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: I hope this clears everything up between us and we can both move our separate ways, now if you'll excuse me, I have a meeting to attend.

lines.speaker: Guard Klerodor
lines.line: I'm sorry. This is a private meeting.

lines.speaker: Guard Klerodor
lines.line: It is only my first day on the job, so I can't let you in without a pass. Sorry.

lines.speaker: Guard Klerodor
lines.line: The door will be locked shortly.

lines.speaker: Chief Excavator Dranfor
lines.line: Hello and welcome, senior members of Wynn Excavation Site C. May the dark^s gaze forever watch over us. I want to update you on our progress thus far. The fire relic crystal has been largely intact in the heart of the volcano for many years.

lines.speaker: Chief Excavator Dranfor
lines.line: Removing it will most likely cause a chain reaction and make things difficult. Fortunately, a mage from the other side of the ocean is here to counter that. We can expect to have it moved and be shipped over to the undisclosed location any day now.

lines.speaker: Chief Excavator Dranfor
lines.line: I would also like to inform you that the crystals removed from our possession from sites B and A have not been retrieved. However, the culprit should no longer be interested in our operations. The lost crystals did not harness any raw magic, thus are not essential to the overall scheme.

lines.speaker: Chief Excavator Dranfor
lines.line: Now, our short term goals are to move our equipment out of the heart of the volcano and start moving the fire stone for assimilation at the concealed location. All senior officers are responsible for their quadrants. Let's get this done efficiently and discreetly.

lines.speaker: Chief Excavator Dranfor
lines.line: The alarm has been set off! There is an unauthorized guest! Guards, seize them!
You. You are the one they are worried about.
I am Amadel, leader of the rebellion.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: I know this is all a bit sudden, but I have some information you must hear.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: Everything you have been told is a lie. The WynnExcavation "company" is not what they appear to be.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: They are using that as a front and their reach stretches further than I even know.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: There is no higher authority than them, not even the kings. And their intentions are not good.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: For the last few years, they have been seeking a quartet of cosmic crystals that have been prominent across Wynn's history.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: Many different empires and societies in the province have held at least one of them since they were uncovered 2000 years ago deep within Wynn's southern border, though none have ever combined all four.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: The ancient desert empire, the Twain brothers, and an unknown party that cast this volcano's crystal into the ocean are among those who have guarded even one of these Crystals over the years. Their value is nothing short of immeasurable.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: WynnExcavation heard about it, and of course, set out to gather these artifacts in their attempt to claim absolute power over the entire world. Do you understand? We CANNOT let them have those crystals.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: You couldn't just take my polite word and leave it at that, could you?

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: You had to go snooping around, meddle in things that are far beyond your comprehension. No matter. Something did come out of this, it would appear.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: You were caught, conversing with Amadel, who we now know to be a traitor, thanks to you. There are eyes everywhere, young hero.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: I'm willing to bet he's already been... taken care of by senior staff.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: We also now know you are operating in the dark. You know nothing of the crystals or their power, and you know not that even the crystals you possess are inconsequential to our plans.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: You're lucky you aren't dead. How you infiltrated us this far has shown nothing but beginner's luck for the province's new hero.

lines.speaker: Excavator Placardus
lines.line: I suggest you leave, before the guards get here and you meet the same fate as Amadel. Our power is limitless; armies, resources, even royalty are on our side. Our gaze is everpresent. Now, get out of my sight!

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: Help, the king is... wait. No you're not strong enough yet, come back when you reached Level 70.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: His majesty Lord King of Troms is indisposed at this moment.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: He received a message and made his way frantically down to the panic room, which is somewhere inside of this throne room.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
