lines.line: He hasn't been seen since. Only the King knows how to get into the panic room, but I've had my suspicions about it for a while now.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: He seemed to be expecting someone, but I'm fed up of waiting.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: I managed to hear a few things he was muttering to himself just before he disappeared, though.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: He mentioned something about a fourth crystal... a green one.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: And then he said "The order of the crystals will open the way".Maybe it's a clue as to how to find him?

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: Please, we need to find him, I'm sick of telling everyone he's indisposed!

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: The panic room is hidden somewhere in here, we just need to figure out how to open it...

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: Last I heard from His Majesty, he was muttering something about a fourth crystal... a green one.

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: And then he said "The order of the crystals will open the way". Maybe it's a clue as to how to find him?

lines.speaker: Royal Advisor Carlos
lines.line: Oh my, a secret passage has opened up beneath the throne! Quickly, head inside!

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: I am impressed you managed to find me. Someone of my intellect is not normally found when he hasn't the intention of being so.

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: I suppose I at least owe you the truth for getting this far, not that it matters.

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: WynnExcavation, the Gavel company is a fake, a facade. It's not real....

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: It's actually a secret society run by the high and mighty of Gavel.

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: They have one goal, complete control.

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: You can't compete with them, kid. I tried to at first, but they had turned my inner circle before getting to me.

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: Though I cannot admit I fought hard, their ideals are admirable.

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: So I hope you will forgive me, I act only for the greater good of the world.

lines.speaker: King of Troms
lines.line: As you will not be leaving the city, I wish you a fond farewell. When you leave, you will be accused of treason and will be hunted. It is the only way...

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: Time is short, so I'll have to spare you the details, but let's just say I'm on your side.

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: The King just placed you under arrest for treason. They've locked down the entire city.

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: Both the front gate and the Passage are closed down. So we've created another exit for you.

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: Just follow the path to your left around the city. Keep going until you see a villager next to a tunnel . We'll clear your name once you've escaped.

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: You'll pass through the army headquarters on your way, so be prepared for a fight. I'm the only guard here to help you.

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: Now run! We don't have another moment to waste!
Hey, psst. Come here!
Take this, and run! You need to get out!
Head to those coordinates, there is no time to explain, now go! I'll close the tunnel behind you.
I'VE FOUND THE TRAITOR! THEY'RE OVER HERE!

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: I'm sorry, I can't let you in there.

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: I can't let you in there, not until you have proven you are truly on our side.

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: We never know who to believe anymore. Unfortunately there is no way for you to prove your loyalty.

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: Now if you would excuse me, I have to hunt for the lost map fragments of Dernel. I'm sure these eyes have something to do with it...

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: I'm sorry, I can't let you in there until you prove yourself!

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: I can't let you in, we're busy looking for an important document, I'm sure these eyes have something to do with it...

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: Is that...  The map fragments? You found them!

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: Oh my, you better come in.

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: There's not enough time! We need to combine those fragments with ours!

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: Hurry, get in the hideout!

lines.speaker: Traitor Thomas
lines.line: Thanks for helping with that long task...

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: Welcome, friend. I knew you would figure it all out.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: You must be surprised to see me. The excavation crew at site C tried very hard to kill me.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: They didn't succeed though. I got away, and I swiped a fragment of a map, and I found out what it's for.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: If you made it this far, you know Wynn Excavation are not what they seem. They want to harness Wynn's ancient power.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: They control our governments, authorities and seem to be 3 steps ahead of any of us that oppose them.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: That is, unless we're able to beat the excavationists to the last crystal.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: They cannot use a single shard of power without combining them all.

lines.speaker: Traitor Amadel
lines.line: Here, I've combined the map fragments behind me. It looks like it's deep in the jungle, I wonder where...

lines.speaker: Traitor Buice
lines.line: WynnExcavation have done really horrible things, and I used to help...

lines.speaker: Traitor Jaynar
lines.line: WynnExcavation will be destroyed, no matter what!

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: Oh my. It's you. I can't say I'm surprised to see you, we thought you might be stupid enough to come here.

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: Stupid enough to come here, yet, smart enough to make it.

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: You were at every site, taking shards and attempting to thwart us.

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: This time we won, and you lost.

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: What do your shards mean to us when we have all four crystals?

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: Nothing, that's what.

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: The boss wants to speak to you, I don't recommend keeping him waiting, he's not a patient man.

lines.speaker: Excavator Admin Uci
lines.line: He'll be waiting for you, head through that door.

lines.speaker: Excavator Sean
lines.line: My boss Uci is a bit of a mean guy, but hey the perks of minionship aren't bad!

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Scientist Azure
lines.line: This leads deeper into this dungeon, but it seems like it has to be activated from the other side.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: Well, well. Looks like you've finally made it.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: You might be a little shocked to see me here...

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: Everything was planned you see...

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: You finding that old fool in the desert, you surviving that fall.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: You finding that notebook, and eventually meeting me.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: Everything that you have done has been planned by the mastermind behind this organisation, me.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: You don't get it, do you? We needed you from the start. These otherworldly crystals are a powerful magic, but a dangerous one at that.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: We needed you, an unaware human with some form of pure intent to bring empowered shards here. Anyone else would have ran off with the shards, and turned against us. It's just how it all works. I don't expect you to understand.. Now. Enough talking.

lines.speaker: WynnExcavation Leader Amadel
lines.line: Step into this hole, and accept your fate. It's over, you've lost!

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: I see you have finally shown up.

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: There is no chance someone as weak as you can beat Amadel!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Amadel
lines.line: The crystals combine the power of the stars themselves.. an ultimate power... the power to reign over the entire WORLD!

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: That was a mere fluke..

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: Amadel is unbeatable!

lines.speaker: Shadow Amadel
lines.line: I- I- I feel... unstopable.. this power... will not allow me to lose..!!!

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: He's simply warming up..

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: THIS ISN'T EVEN HIS FINAL FORM!

lines.speaker: Amadel
lines.line: DID YOU REALLY THINK YOU COULD WIN?!?! YOU ARE NOTHING COMPARED TO ME! NOTHING!! I WILL EXTERMINATE ALL LIFE, STARTING WITH YOU!! NOW, PERISH!!!

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: I, I can't believe you beat him...

lines.speaker: Amadel's Assistant
lines.line: Amadel was a god...He was going to save the province...

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: You... hmm... Ahh yes! I remember you. You're one of the recruits I accepted long ago..

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: I'm no mage, but what you have there may just be one of the most destructive forces in the entire world.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: I remember being told something by my adoptive father, and he was a king of Ragni himself!

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: He told me that the Wynn province will never find solace. I never truly understood why, until now.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: You see, many  forces are at work on our lands that we cannot physically see, but the outcome of the influences cannot be ignored.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: Creatures that you can find in Wynn may not exist in Gavel. In Gavel, there are many magical beings. Creatures influenced by forces other than the Corruption. Not all of them are friendly, mind.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: But rarely do you see the undead in such numbers. You know, there is a fundamental law of our land, when two forces collide, there is war.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: This could be people, species, or anything, really. And I think the same thing can be said for the energy that resonate in those crystals you have there.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: I think those crystals represent a force far beyond what we can grasp, and if that power can turn one man into what you fought back there,  I shudder to think what else it could do.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: The Olm in the jungle clearly knew of this, too, as they met their eventual demise. Their desperation most likely led to them attempting to harness that power, as well.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: These are things that the mages of the ocean have studied in secret for centuries. We may never know, and rather, I think we never should know.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: If Amadel taught us anything, it's that we can never be trusted with power. Here, put that crystal into the lava. Let it burn and never be used. The king places the crystals in the lava, and watches them sink.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: Though it contains some of the most concentrated magical power ever, it is still limited to its container. Let it burn.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: I do not know the severity of the Excavation's integration into the powers of Gavel, but I bet we haven't seen the last of them.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: You have done this province an unspeakable service. I believe that even Bob is smiling down on you, today. I'm sure that if he were here with us, he would crown you worthy.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: As a token of our city's eternal gratitude, I wish for you to take this. It has no value to anyone except you.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: You might want to hold onto it, a merchant in Cinfras has arrived and you will be able to trade it for the item that I wish I could bestow upon you now.

lines.speaker: Ragni's King
lines.line: You truly are one of the greatest warriors to ever step foot in these lands. I hereby knight you as Wynn's true protector for your deeds today. I hope we meet again, young master.

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: Uh, you shouldn't have come here!

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: I am cursed. Everywhere I go, trouble starts. I decided to stay away from civilization, where I can't cause any more trouble.

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: It all started when I discovered an old tomb... upon entering it, the ground started shaking and I heard some inhuman screams coming from the tomb.

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: I ran as far as I could. I learnt after that this was the tomb of a mummy... that I accidentally have awoken.

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: If you could get rid of this mummy, maybe the curse would go away.

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: Achper knows a lot about mummies, you should go talk to him. He lives somewhere in Almuj.

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: If I know about mummies? Of course! I've spent my entire life studying them!

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: They usually are very hard to reach, hidden in their tomb.

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: I know what happened to Ormrod, and the only way to remove the powerful curse would be to kill the mummy.

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: The tomb is north from here, but be very careful!

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: Mummies aren't known to be weak... especially that one. It's demonic...pure evil, I have never seen such strength in a being.

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: On top of that, the Creden Tibus bandit clan have been ransacking the tomb. They might not let you inside without some negotiating.

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: Glad to hear you came back alive! Those mummies aren't always easy, eh?

lines.speaker: Achper
lines.line: Hi! If you are looking for some information about mummies, I can help you!

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: Hey, what are you doing? If you're trying to loot the tomb, me and the other Creden Tibus already beat you to it.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: But if you can bring me [1 Block of Pink Wool], I'll look the other way and let you into the tomb. I know it sounds ridiculous, but it's valuable.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: You can get it from Rymek in the southern canyon. Only other way if from a rare sheep or something, so Rymek's the better option.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: Well, whaddya know?  You got some Pink Wool! Okay, hand it here and I'll look the other way and let you into the tomb.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: But I feel like it's only fair that I warn you that it's dangerous in there.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: It took our entire clan just to make it out alive.

lines.speaker: Bandit
lines.line: I'll still let you inside if you want. Just remember, if anyone asks, this conversation never happened.

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: Uh, hello again... What are those bandages?

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: Those are the mummy's bandages?! You did it! My curse is finally lifted!

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: I can't thank you enough! As a reward, take this rag I got from the mummy when I entered the tomb.

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: I am not strong enough to wear it, but I'm sure you are! Take these emeralds too, that's the least I can do!

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: Thank you so much for removing the curse!

lines.speaker: Ormrod
lines.line: Don't stand close to me, I am cursed! Come back when you're level 36, you might be able to help me.

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: I am one of the Keepers in the great Temple of Legends. There we hoard secrets about the world.

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: I am here to investigate an old tale of the canyon. Does that interest you? I'm sure it does!

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: Legend has it that a ferocious beast lives among these cliffs. A dangerous bird that has survived for many years.

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: I would love to seek the beast out, but it seems the natives here are too busy thieving each other to inform me of it.

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: I have heard of an old prospector nearby who has ventured throughout this mesa. He may have some information.

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: His name is Jankan and he lives east from Rymek. Could you perhaps seek him out and ask him about this foul beast?

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: If you help me, I'll let you use the elevators spread in the canyon. Well...

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: A strange hermit decided to take control of them, but I'm sure we can reason with him.

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: I hope you are able to find the beast, and if you do, could you bring me back [1 Beast Egg] as evidence?

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: Hello there, youngster! Ye must be the stranger folks 'been talkin' 'bout.

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: If yer lookin fer gold, I can promise ye that there ain' any for you in this here mineshaft!

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: Oh.. Yer lookin fer a winged wilder beast? Are ye out of yer mind?

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: The devil of a bird is complete chaos! It can move mountains with a single screech! Men twice yer size 'ave weeped from the sight of it!

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: As it turns out, I did me back in trying to transport me earnin's from that there cave, left them right at the back did' I.

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: Go fetch me my [5 Gold Chunks] from the end of the shaft and I'll tell ye where ye need to go next.

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: Finally! It took ye long enough, hand it over! Oh right.. yer want'n somethin'.

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: I ain' got any intention of help'n ye with yer demise, but I can send ye along to a young fellow who might help.

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: There's this Hermit feller ye wanna talk to, he is a right nutter, that one. Feeds the bird'n all.

lines.speaker: Jankan
lines.line: I think ye can find him up the mountain and across the canyon abyss, he ain' a friendly fella, I can tell yer that much.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: What do you think you're doing here, kid? Think you can waltz in my humble abode and get across my bridge?

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: Oh, you want to know about the bird of the mountain? Hah, a little weed like you wouldn't stand a chance against it.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: It doesn't take kindly to strangers you know. I once saw it turn a group of poachers to ash!

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: If you want to go through here, you'll need to pay. Oh, I don't want your money, why would I need money, I have everything!

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: If you want access to these plateaus then you will have to find me a rare flower for my little cave here.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: It is found on top of one of the stacks in the mesa, it shouldn't be too hard to find.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: Bring me [1 Rare Rose] and I shall let you pass on to the creature of the mesa.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: A ha! This will do perfectly. My chickling will love it! I suppose you can cross the bridge now.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: The beast dwells on top of one of these plateaus. With a little searching, you should be able to find it.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: I'll let you use my elevators too. After all, it's not like you will last long...

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: Only one traveler I have heard of could stand against the beast. I believe he took an egg from it for a pet, hah!

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: He is long gone now, just like you will be in a few moments. It was nice not knowing you, kid.

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: What's taken you so long, kid? I just want [1 Rare Rose]!

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: What are you here for, eh kid? Get out. Get!

lines.speaker: Hermit
lines.line: Think you can waltz in my humble abode and get across my bridge? Get out!

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: Traveler! You have returned! Tell me, what have you learned?

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: You found it?! This is wonderful news! You collected an egg from it's nest as well? You are very brave indeed!

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: So the legend of the Cockatrice is true! You've seen it and battled it with your own courage!

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: If only you could enter the Temple of Legends, brave soul! But it would seem our paths are to part now.

lines.speaker: Svin
lines.line: Do not worry, I shall keep the egg safe. One day your legend shall be as greatly told!

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: Lo, adventurer! Welcome to the great province of Gavel, home of the villager race, and yours truly. You'll be headed into the grand citadel of Llevigar soon!

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: But enough with the pleasantries. Tell me... Ever heard the tale of the great pirate, Captain Hastor? Sailed the seas a long time ago.

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: Legend says that when Llevigar was rebuilt all those years ago, he hid his fortune within the walls someplace!

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: I'm a retired sailor now, but I could still do with a few extra emeralds from that treasure. Perhaps, if you're up to it... we could come to an agreement?

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: I have a riddle, the first of a number of clues that are supposed to lead to where Hastor hid his fortune, but I can't for the life of me figure it out.

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: Maybe you'll be able to solve it. If you can, I'll make sure to split the treasure with you!

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: This first riddle goes like so: “Toward the sunset, among northern flowers shaded by quartz”.

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: I do wish you good luck, adventurer! Remember, everything you need to solve the clues should be found somewhere inside Llevigar.

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: Aha! I'd come to ask how it was coming when I saw you jump over here!

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: Phenomenal work, my compatriot. Though, do remember our deal?

lines.speaker: Damiral
lines.line: You find the treasure, I give you a cut. I'll just take my part and be on my way!

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Welcome traveler, to our humble island...

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: My people and I landed here many years ago. Unfortunately, our ship didn't make it...

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: We tried to build a nation on these islands but became divided through the years.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Because of this, we are fighting a useless war with our neighbours.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: I believe we should try to pass a peace treaty, but I am afraid of getting killed if I leave the island...

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Would you mind helping us? Talk to Hallfred about this treaty. He lives on another ice island nearby.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Have you made any progress?

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: Welcome traveler! What brings you to our island?

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: Oh, I see that Adigard now sends strangers through his cowardice! Worried he'll get killed?

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: This is the last time I'll repeat it: We will sign the peace treaty the day Adigard and his nation will return to us... the treasure.

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: The one that they kept and hid from us after the shipwreck.

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: Pure gold, very valuable and rare! Tell him I'll be waiting for it. And none of that silly story again.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: I should have expected that. Hallfred was always very greedy...

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: We tried to make him understand that we do not have the treasure, without much success.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: ...You see, the reason why we became shipwrecked wasn't natural cause. We were attacked...

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: By whom? The undead. Ghosts and demons navigating a monstrous ship. They got us by surprise.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: I believe they also stole our treasure during the attack.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Would you help our nation come back together? Find this ship, and bring the treasure back to Hallfred so we can finally live in peace.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Sail north. That is where they attacked us many years ago. It should be easy to find, I'm sure they are anchored there in glory... Thank you.

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: Incredible! He actually delivered the treasure!

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: I suppose that means the end of the war between our nations!

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: This is a great day! Here, take this as a reward for helping our nation.

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: I'm sure you'll find a use for this helmet one day!

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: Hey, we don't just let strangers use our people like that!

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: I am glad everything is back to normal.

lines.speaker: Hallfred
lines.line: It's useless to come back to me if you do not have the treasure.

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Thank you so much for bringing peace between our nations!

lines.speaker: Adigard
lines.line: Our nation greatly needs help, but I'm afraid you aren't strong enough. Come back to me when you are level 40.

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: Hehehe... Hello there.

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: Welcome to the Tower of Ascension!

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: I challenge you to reach the final floor!

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: Have you got what it takes to conquer it?

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: Perhaps you would like to know the layout of the tower first? Hehehehe...

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: There are 7 floors in this tower, each with ten levels.

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: Each floor has nine regular levels and one boss level.

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: To pass a regular level, you must collect five tokens from the challenge on that level, and one token from boss levels.

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: After you beat a whole floor, you will return here and you can begin the next one...

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: So, what do you say? Hehehe...

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: Turn left and head to the first floor...if you dare...

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: You have completed my tower, I see...

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: Did you enjoy Death? Many challengers certainly did. Her power is... unmatched, hehehe...

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: And you... You are unlike them all, yes? Few have managed to ascend these floors.

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: A tower of madness, fueled by Death herself... Quite a challenge, yes?

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: You have joined us now, champion... Few can claim this victory as their own. Fewer still have held their mind.

lines.speaker: Ankou
lines.line: For this honor... A reward, for you. You have truly earned it... Hehehehe...

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: Aaah, no no no! This doesn't make any sense, what in the world is going on?! Nothing's working!

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: Gweh, a visitor? Get out of here! The plant is shut down for maintenance- wait, are you the electromagic expert we're paying for?

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: You are, right? Right?! Cause we can't wait any longer! This system was supposed to be unbreakable, a flawless design!

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: We didn't even need to get Corkian consultation on this, we had this system all figured out ourselves, but now nothing's working right!

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: You're seeing all these sparks and hearing all this crackling? We have no idea what could possibly be going wrong with this! That's why you're needed here!

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: We don't have much time until full meltdown! There is an entrance to the power plant opposite the bank, go there and meet with the Head Engineer!

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: Whew, finally Zeman found a guy for the job. I told him weeks ago this was a two-person task...

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: Wait, it's Zenam? Eh, what does it matter? You knew who I was talkin' about. Lemme give you the lowdown real fast.

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: About a month ago, there was a big blackout, and the generator here started acting up. Power surges, appliances overloading...heck, some of our lights turned purple!

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: My grandfather and his engineers jury-rigged this whole system. A reset should fix all this, but as a security measure, I need to be here to oversee the reset.

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: So that's your job- get through the system and find the reset button. These holes'll lead you around the generator rooms. Better get going!

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: Alright, that should do it- Ah, you're back. The system reset just fine, like I said. Everything should be winding down now.

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: It's purging the excess energy now- might have a few more power surges and crackles for a while, but it'll go back to normal soon enough.

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: Hm? What, there was a bug in the system? ...what, are you asleep or something? Of course there was a bug, we just fixed it!

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: Well, anyways, Zebra should have our payment all settled. You go on ahead- I still need to stay down here to make sure everything stays smooth.

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: ...oh, it's Zenam? D'you really care about getting his name right, or what? Anyways, the exit's through the water cooling system, it hooks up to the sewer exit.

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: I have to stay put, so get through the system and find the reset button for me. These holes are teleporters that'll lead you around the generator rooms.

lines.speaker: Head Engineer
lines.line: Were you bein' literal when you said there was a bug in the system? I swear I hear something crawling around down here all of the sudden.

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: Whew...welcome back. The power is back online- Everything is running at full capacity again. I think the system is just running excess through right now.

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: Glad you got here when you did though- some phony came through saying he was the expert. Clearly he was just here to take your contract money...

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: Though, I was panicking so much I probably would've believed him... Speaking of which, here's your cut of the pay, and something extra for the trouble.

lines.speaker: Zenam
lines.line: Here's to hoping that the system won't run into any more trouble in the future. I don't want to be faced with an impending cataclysm like that again...

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: Aha, another Ragni soldier, eh? Well, a warm welcome to you.

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: Did you hear about the requests from the Villagers we've gotten? They say these “Orcs” and "Goblins" are threatening their towns and cities.

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: Primitive, brutal things, apparently little better than the zombies we're used to, at least according to the Llevigar military.

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: So, we figure if might makes right with them, then defeating their leaders should scare them into submission.

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: Our scouts have identified three “chief” orcs in the area- Elisu, Ceifko, and Veltu. Though, strangely Veltu is always surrounded by goblins...

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: Well whatever the case, we're needed to defend Llevigar here. Can you handle the chiefs? They seem to hide in the camps with green flags- search the plains, return once they're dealt with!

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: Ah, the soldier from earlier! You're back, I see. Any luck defeating those- ...yeesh. Are those their heads?

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: That's...harsher than I intended, but it works... Not like the Villagers care if they're dead or alive, as long as they're dealt with. I have your share of the reward here.

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: This kind of surgical strike should help prevent an all-out war with the Orcs. Not sure we'd want a full-scale war to deal with in each province, hah!

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: You saw that the creatures in Gavel aren't akin to Wynnic fare while you were out, yes? They're a bit, ah...livelier than usual. Better get used to it.

lines.speaker: Captain Kymer
lines.line: The next major settlement is Olux, in the swamp up north, but I hear the swamp ogres are a lot tougher than the plains' fare. I'd stick around here and train up, first.

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: Hey you! Human. What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: Under Villager law any extra terrestrial or extra voidal entities are prohibited and owned by the state.

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: Seeing as you are new to the land, I can't see you being prosecuted, especially a Ragni Guard.

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: This meteor is different to what we've seen before. We suspect that direct contact with the meteor is dangerous.

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: The magical radiation doesn't seem to be affecting you at all though. Do you not feel anything? Perhaps you could help me locate it.
It's... mine.

lines.speaker: Thief
lines.line: .... I can't control myself...fjfjfj This rock...

lines.speaker: Thief
lines.line: What is... this feeling... No I won't listen..

lines.speaker: Thief
lines.line: I can't... control... my mind... end me.

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: Hello again. Did you find the meteor down there? Why on earth are you holding some?!

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: I see. This material is incredibly rare and magically powerful. Meteors fall all over Gavel and come in a variety of colours and potency.

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: We don't fully understand them, but we know they are dangerous. Every scientist who has studied them has lost their minds.

lines.speaker: Agent
lines.line: The meteors hold many secrets and powers, maybe the ones we need to end your war. Thank you, here's a small reward for helping us.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Ah, a member of the Ragni army. We're trying to gain entry to this frozen barrow. We could use your aid.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Are you familiar with the story of Theorick and Nesaak?

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Probably not. Well, you see, Nesaak was not always frozen.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: During Theorick's time, this place was like the Wynn plains, warm and arable.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: For some reason, Theorick Twain used his immense power to freeze the land before exiling himself here.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: We need to find out why so we can reverse this spell. Presumably, the source of that spell's magic would be within here.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: As such...have you heard of a place called Time Valley? We could use it to go back in time, to try to learn more about this barrier.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Well...in a way, at least. There are laws to this sort of magic. For one, you need an item from the specific time we want to see. Second, you can witness the past, not change it.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: One of Theorick's staves is on display in the Nesaak bank. Presumably, it should work for what we need. Could you retrieve it somehow?

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Aha, quick job. I see you've got the wand. Must've needed a sharp tongue to get the bankers to give it up.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Now, it is a long walk to Time Valley. Needn't take that walk, though, as I can teleport you there. Hopefully.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Once you're there, enter the Temple of Time. You should know what to do once you are there. Careful dealing with time travel, friend... No idea what you might find.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Should anything go wrong, I'll stay here to teleport you back to the temple.

lines.speaker: Psern
lines.line: What the...

lines.speaker: Psern
lines.line: Woah, your weaponry and armour is so advanced!

lines.speaker: Psern
lines.line: Are you another Twain? Only the Twains know magic like that.

lines.speaker: Psern
lines.line: Oh, you're looking for Theorick.

lines.speaker: Psern
lines.line: He's busy fighting in the war, shouldn't you be doing the same?

lines.speaker: Psern
lines.line: He went west. There was some kind of emergency.

lines.speaker: Psern
lines.line: We've been fighting the corruption for years, it seems like it might finally engulf Nesaak.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: I could've sworn she had gone this way... Oh, what now, more imbeciles? This forest isn't safe to travel!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: If you need help, lodge a complaint with the guards. I'm busy and I can't exactly break away from saving this god-blessed province to chill your milk!!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Are your ears full of wax?! I said-

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Urgh, the things followed you! See what happens?! STAND ASIDE.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: As though I needed TWO people to save! Now get out of here, I have to find that woman who went missing!
HEEEELP! I can't outrun them!!! Guards! Someone!!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Whuh! That's her voice! Where is she?! I just cleared this area!

lines.speaker: Girl
lines.line: Th-Theorick!! There's corrupteds!!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Ugh, is she dragging them over from the west?! You there, If you don't want to end up frozen, GET BEHIND ME, NOW!!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Phew... You're out of danger now. If you hadn't left town, though, you wouldn't have been IN any danger at all!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Don't bother apologizing to me, just get back to town. Now.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Next time you feel like picking flowers in the forest or whatever you were doing, remember you have a life to live, hm?!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Every day, more corrupteds, more deaths... There is only one thing for it. I have to tackle it myself. Cut the roots...and kill this hellish weed.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Still here? Well, listen up. Myself and a few others are planning something risky. Damned be it if our minds are lost, I need to go through that portal.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: You look heavily geared, so I'm conscripting you. Meet us at our base, immediately. Follow the river south and you'll see a house on the right side.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Well, I'll give you this. You're prompt to listen to orders, at least. We're headed to the Roots of Corruption.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: The last man that entered the portal and returned became Bak’al... But if there is even a fraction of a chance this could work, we must take it at this point.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Let's get moving. We'll be taking no breaks on the trip, so I hope you were prepared.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Now. The sheer cold I command can stave off corruption itself. Somehow I doubt any of you can say the same. I'll go in alone.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: When I enter... If I had to make an assumption, corrupteds will swarm the portal after me. Your job? Slay them. I can't have distractions in there.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: You will not be leaving your post here until I exit that portal. Understood?

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: ...no, no, no no no NO!! DAMN IT ALL!!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: You know what happened?! I lost!! I will destroy the province if I turn completely! GET AWAY, NOW! DO YOU HEAR ME?! RUN!!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: I... C-calm yourself, Theorick...don't...don't lose yourself to it...there's...yet a solution...one way...

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Oh...you again...the others...dead? Run off? Cowards...urgh...

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: You live...so...eyes up. Listen to me. If I turn...w-when...when I turn...n-no, can't...gaaah, I'll destr- Nggh...

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: I won't last, you can tell... Right now...killing me is an impossibility, you idiotic weakl- Agh, GET OUT OF MY MIND!!

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Gaaah... Tell...everyone. I will freeze this place. I...t-too fargone. It needs time to heal...and my powers m-must be dampened...frozen...

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: All worthless... Urgh, no...they yet deserve life...and this spell...it will surely claim some. Please, let them know why...

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: If I have learned anything from that insufferable f- ...from Mael...deaths without reason lets spirits linger. I would...prefer against giving him a harder time.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: K-keep advancing. Your things, if everyone was as strong as you...we may stand a chance. This could end me, in time, once I am weaker.

lines.speaker: Theorick
lines.line: Let it be known...Theorick Twain is not dead. He cannot be killed...all will burn...until future days. Here, in this accursed place. Find me...and end it all.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: You must have succeeded, or you would be yet in the memory of the past. I can feel some potent magic on you.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: So, you met Theorick? He was always said to have fallen from heroism after the great freezing.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Hm...wait, this flame...did you receive it from the Temple of Time? How did...what is...this is impossible, given what we know!

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: It unfreezes the entrance, you say...and...Th-Theorick...gave...he...what...? This raises so many more questions! Unless there was some other force at play...

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Well, ruminating on that will not help. Were you able to figure out why it was Theorick froze this place, at least?

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Wha...so many revelations...ice magic staves off corruption...? It is true that this place has seen less corrupted threats than other places in the province...

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Dear gods... We've had it all wrong this whole time... This was to protect everyone...but surely he would have told someone his intentions if he was of that sound a mind!

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: All this time, spent buried alive, wrestling with the corruption. The thought horrifies you, as well, judging by your face. Killing him would be a mercy.

lines.speaker: Telvu
lines.line: Here. Use this. It may help protect you within the Ice Barrows... Please, soldier. Be Theorick's guardian angel. Free him from this torment.

lines.speaker: Fredris
lines.line: I’m having trouble with the fish in our lake recently and I am sure the problem lies within the lake itself.

lines.speaker: Fredris
lines.line: I would like to commission you to investigate, but since it's freezing cold in our lake you need something to protect you. I heard the people in Maltic on the coast of Wynn have something that can help you.

lines.speaker: Fredris
lines.line: Would you mind coming back with a [Breathing Helmet I]? I think that should be everything you need.

lines.speaker: Calamaro
lines.line: Who are you? You don't look like one of those villagers we stole the fi... Wait, they didn't send you to retrieve "their" fish, did they?

lines.speaker: Calamaro
lines.line: For years we let them share the lake with us, the actual inhabitants of it, we were modest and took what we needed, we let them catch the rest. But then they went too far, they caught too much.

lines.speaker: Calamaro
lines.line: We didn't have enough to eat, we were forced to steal their fish, we would have starved otherwise. And now they want their fish, our fish back? We can't do that, I hope you understand.

lines.speaker: Calamaro
lines.line: However we don't have to fight over the fish in the lake, we just need a [Mythic Everlasting Pufferfish], that would be enough, nothing else. We never wanted to steal the fish.

lines.speaker: Calamaro
lines.line: If you want to help us and the villagers, just follow the stream that flows into this lake to the south, you will find the best fishing ground there. The pufferfish should be around there too.

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: Oh you look a bit lost, let me help you, I've lived here for a long time, I know every corner and every snowflake.

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: You're searching a [Mythic Everlasting Pufferfish]? Hmm I heard that name before, my friend, Strato, told me about it years ago. If I remember correctly it is infinite, you can feed every single person in all the provinces from this single fish.

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: Sadly Strato is no longer alive. He used to work and live at the woodcutting camp northwest of Nesaak. We always met here, caught fish and told each other stories. I really miss those times...

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: Maybe you can find some sort of bait there, he had some of the best bait I have ever seen. You should be able to acquire some and throw it in the water, maybe that will attract the pufferfish.

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: Can I ask you something? As you might see I'm not the richest guy, or the youngest. If you manage to catch that fish, could you hand it over? I know we just met but you seem like somebody who would help an old man.

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: Just look at those fish, I told you they love this bait.

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: There it comes, the [Mythic Everlasting Pufferfish], I can't believe it!

lines.speaker: Gernald
lines.line: You decided to give me the fish? I wish Strato was still around, he would be so amazed. I can't show you how much this means to me, but take this little gift please, promise me to never change.

lines.speaker: Calamaro
lines.line: You found a pufferfish! Who would have thought such a small thing could solve our problem. I will start bringing back the fish immediately, but first we will have a nice hot soup. Please take this as payback for your services.

lines.speaker: Calamaro
lines.line: You can trade it at the shop right over there, it's hard to miss. I will give you a last advise, you don't want to eat that slimy fish.

lines.speaker: Fredris
lines.line: Oh you are done with whatever you were doing? I heard you ran around the whole place, I don't know if you were the right person to ask for help...

lines.speaker: Fredris
lines.line: I will just ask the next one who comes around, no need to have you run around all day. Take this, I appreciate your effort.

lines.speaker: Fredris
lines.line: What is this thing supposed to be? You know, I would really appreciate your help, but this [Breathing Helmet I] does not look like it's going to keep you protected.

lines.speaker: Fredris
lines.line: Would you mind heading to our local armour merchant and buying one of our [Breathing Helmet II]? I don't want you to drown. Just come back with the helmet and I will tell you about my problem.

lines.speaker: Piere
lines.line: Oh sweet baby bovine, my house, what am I going to do? Wait, who are you?

lines.speaker: Piere
lines.line: Oh, a Human. Did the Llevigar authorities send you?

lines.speaker: Piere
lines.line: Detective Jackson has already been here. Not that he's doing anything useful.

lines.speaker: Piere
lines.line: An Orc managed to find some fire-imbued magical axe and burned down my house! Jackson didn't even call a firefighter!!

lines.speaker: Piere
lines.line: I don't know what to do, but maybe if you find Detective Jackson, you can kick his sorry rear into gear...

lines.speaker: Piere
lines.line: The Orcs are already savage brutes. If they really have their hands on magical weapons, we're all in trouble!

lines.speaker: Piere
lines.line: I believe Detective Jackson is by his cart "planning his next move." He's not far from here. Just continue past my farm!

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: How can I go about this...? I can't get involved myself, and they won't let me near... Wait, a human?

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: ...what do you MEAN "what am I doing?" This is a delicate situation! I need to- wait...actually, you might just be the help I need.

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: I'll give you the lowdown- we believe the orcs stole magical weaponry from within Llevigar, particularly a flaming axe.

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: However, there's a loophole in the ceasefire we had enacted with the Orcs. Theft isn't considered an act of aggression...

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: And that means my hands are tied. Humans, however, were not mentioned in the notes, so you'll need to retrieve it.

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Our only saving grace is that it'll be impossible for them to replicate its power- Orcs are hilariously inept at magic.

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: But, to the primary problem- You've probably seen how many orc camps are around here. Searching will take a long while...

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: My only leads are that the "Sablestone" and "Loamsprout" camps seem to be celebrating recently. Best to start there, yes?

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Just to review- You need to search those two camps for the Axe of Llevigar, and then return it to me if you find it.

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Sablestone is to the north, and Loamsprout to the south. They will be guarded, so don't be afraid to knock some heads.

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: I see no axe in your hands, so I should assume neither Sablestone or Loamsprout had it.

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Wait, really? A stick was the most powerful weapon they had? And Loamsprout...threw their dinner at you...?

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: I can't believe this! How are those... those THINGS outsmarting us?! Are they shuffling the axe between camps?

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: There are over a dozen camps between the Orcs and Goblins that they could be swapping it between!

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: What if the GOBLINS get a hold of it?! They're the cleverest by half of all of them, so that could actually be a threat!

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Searching the camps one by one will be far too slow, gah!! How am I going to fix this?!

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: There's Earthpit, and Cliffhearth, Shineridge and Stonecave, Sunspark, Mudspring, Holehold, I-
Fire! Stop!! I hold magic cutter! LISTEN TO POXPER!!

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: I- I can't believe it, that has to be the one! AFTER THAT ORC, NOW!!
GRRRH!! What 'Uthniiazek' mean?!

lines.speaker: Poxper
lines.line: Uthniiazek! Uthniiazek!! WHY NO LISTEN TO POXPER?

lines.speaker: Poxper
lines.line: Stupid Villager magic thing! Why fire no listen?

lines.speaker: Poxper
lines.line: Poxper say thing and make fire...what else axe say? 'Azektoluth?'

lines.speaker: Poxper
lines.line: Hraahah! Poxper control fire! Fire- kill human with Poxper! Uthniiazek! Azektoluth!

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: That looks like the axe of Llevigar to me! Blue finish, hot to the touch- well done! What Orc boss had stolen it?

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Poxper? That...hm. This could be bad. I've heard that name, and he's a fairly prolific Orc chief. You killed him, right?

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Mmm... Hopefully that Veretel won't catch wind of it. Regardless, you've done a great service for Villager-kind!

lines.speaker: Detective Jackson
lines.line: Here's your compensation for that. Thank you for the aid!

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: You're one of those soldier types, right?  My name is Tarod, and I could really use your assistance here.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: Years ago, I met a very powerful and legendary warrior by the name of Bob. Yes, that Bob.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: It's safe to say he was a very, well, admirable man. Him and I slowly became close friends over the years.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: That is, until one night, he vanished without a trace. The accepted story is that he was murdered by a pack of ravenous wolves...

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: Now, I don't buy that story, but... look, the point here is that he's gone now, and I want to find out where the hell he ended up. That depressing zombie lumbering around Ragni clearly isn't him.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: I believe he died in this area, and I have been looking for his body for quite a while now, with... less than success.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: Rumors have spread that a tomb lies somewhere east of Nesaak, but I've never been able to find it. This is where I need you to help me out, yeah?

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: Do you think you could help me out here? Search around that area, and report back to me if you see anything noteworthy.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: I'd be eternally grateful if you could help me uncover my old friend's true story.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: Welcome back. Did you find anything worthwhile?

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: Oh? Yeah, that definitely sounds like the tomb! Were you able to see what's inside?

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: No? There's... a magical barrier? Great... just GREAT...

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: I have a feeling whoever made that tomb didn't want anyone attempting to get to him, but... Forget it, we have no other options. This is the only way we can place Bob's soul to rest for good.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: Listen, I have a guy who can help us out. His name is Wedyf, a sorcerer type. If anyone could get rid of that barrier, it would be him.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: He lives in Bremminglar, a small town close to Almuj. Go meet him, I'll wait for your return.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Welcome traveler. Are you looking for something?

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Ooh, it has been a long time since I've released an undead...

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: The spirit of your dead friend must still be somewhere in this world. This is why we are unable to get close to his body. Soul magic works in mysterious ways.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Don't worry, I can do it. I've heard a little bit of Bob's story before. What a tragedy. His own infallible protection used against him...

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: ...Anyways, there's no need to lament on the past. Now, we need two items. The first is something from Bob himself. The other is the last thing that made his blood drop.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Out past the other side of Detlas, near Nesaak, there are some arches in the mountains. An old florist lives in a house close by. She has a rose that Bob had once cut himself on.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: I will warn you, though; she was corrupted some time ago. It may not be that easy to take the rose, so do be prepared.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Secondly... something of Bob's. I've heard rumors of a visage of him wandering around Ragni, perhaps you can find something of use from it? Killing enemies in the Nesaak region may be worth your time, as well.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Bring me [1 Rose] and [1 Bob's Tear].

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Great, you got everything.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Although... I might have forgot to tell you about something else too...

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: We also need a part of the soul of your dead friend.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: This is something I unfortunately cannot do myself. There is a blacksmith close to Ternaves who does this kind of stuff.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: He can extract the soul from someone's weapon. Very useful in those situations. Go talk to him.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Bring me the soul, and I'll be able to remove the spell preventing you from entering the tomb.

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: What can I do for ya?

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Oh yes! I can extract the soul from weapons!

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Bring me the weapons of your friend, and I'll see if I can do something with it!

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Oh it's... those weapons. Well, if you know what you're doing...

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: [1 Depressing Stick], [1 Depressing Spear], [1 Depressing Bow] and [1 Depressing Shears] will do the trick.

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Be careful with the weapons, you will only get [ONE] of each. If you lose one, you will have to ask around if anyone has a spare.

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Maybe someone will be selling one on the Trade Market in Detlas, who knows.

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Anyway, my apprentice over there has traveled around a lot, they might know where you can find the items for yourself, but I warn you, they are a little bit quirky.

lines.speaker: Apprentice
lines.line: Weapons of the depressed kind? Oh, of course, of course, I know of the set! Around Nesaak, I hear they are kept.

lines.speaker: Apprentice
lines.line: An army of Linx you must clear, in a cave you shall find this spear!

lines.speaker: Apprentice
lines.line: To a skilled archer you must go, best her in a lumberyard and you will have her bow!

lines.speaker: Apprentice
lines.line: On an altar, effervescence leers, complete the sacrifice and you will gain your shears...

lines.speaker: Apprentice
lines.line: In the forest, a house frozen in spikes thick, outsmart the contraption and be gifted a stick!

lines.speaker: Apprentice
lines.line: But beware, beware! Danger lies ahead, and will try to halt you in your stead!

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: ... Hi again. I see you got the weapons.

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: These weapons emanate so much sadness... I'm sure you heard about Bob's story...

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Here is the soul. It's a little bit crushed, but it can do the trick.

lines.speaker: The Blacksmith
lines.line: Good luck on your quest. Bob was a great hero, anything to help him is good in my book.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: I'm glad to see you again.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: I only need a part of the soul, you can keep the rest.

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: Give me a minute, I need to concentrate...

lines.speaker: Wedyf
lines.line: It is done. You should be able to enter the tomb now. Be careful.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: You're back... Has he... has he finally been put to rest?

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: It's... hard to hear, knowing that my old friend is really gone, this time, but... I'm happy he won't have to suffer on this war-torn world for another second.

lines.speaker: Tarod
lines.line: ...I want you to have something. This is his old battle chesplate; he gave it to me a few days before he vanished. I think if he were still here, he'd want you to have this. Please, take good care of it for me...

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Let's give it another try!

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Ready the drill, men!

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Darn. The drill just won't start.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Hey, Guard! Do you know anything about Electromagic? Come up here to the drill, maybe you can take a look?

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Oh! Never mind, it lit up, back up!

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: For the love of Bob... Why won't you just break?

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: This ice was created by Theorick, a Twain who defended this area many many years ago.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: When the corruption got too much... He froze everything, including the people. Do you see them in there?

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: We've tried desperately to get them out, but we've tried all the equipment we had, including this Corkian drill.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Maybe we should get more destructive... The demolition expert, Rhudya, is further down the cave.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: It's a long shot, but worth a try. Would you be able to get it while I clear this space?

lines.speaker: Rhudya
lines.line: Whup! You're on private property, y'know! Oh, Eppo sent ya? That's fair enough.

lines.speaker: Rhudya
lines.line: You'll be needing this TNT then, make sure not to drop it though, whup!

lines.speaker: Rhudya
lines.line: Just travel through this cave and you'll be returned to Eppo easy-peasy!

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Very nice, this might do the trick.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Back up, I'll ignite the explosive.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: NOTHING? Not even a scratch. I don't understand Theoricks ice.. It's not real.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: I'm not sure what else we can do then....

lines.speaker: Rhudya
lines.line: HEY. Eppo, over here! Near the cave!

lines.speaker: Rhudya
lines.line: Did the explosive not work? I found this old mineshaft on the way back from the cave, it leads to an old lava cavern.

lines.speaker: Rhudya
lines.line: Might be a long shot, but this lava looks different. Why not give it a try?

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: I don't understand how you can hold lava in a bucket.. But here we are.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Look for the corpse with a key, it might be above you. Good luck!

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Is that the right one? You got it? Brilliant! Now come back down.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Lets travel to the mansion together. Here, I have a carriage for it.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: While we ride, let me explain a little more about what we're doing. Let's go.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: As I mentioned before, there is a reason this land is frozen, and it's not natural.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Many years before Bob was around, Wynn was in ruins due to the corruption war.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: In those times there used to be a group of naturally gifted individuals called the Twains. They defended us all with elemental magic.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Theorick was one of those Twains. He harnessed unnaturally powerful ice based magic. He used it to protect the land surrounding the mansion.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Theorick.. Wasn't like the other Twains. He wanted the people he protected to pay and feed him as way of thanks.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: After years, Theorick was rich while the people he protected lived in poverty and fear - not only of the monsters, but in fear of Theorick himself.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: He punished those who disobeyed his curfews and would get angry if anyone tried to move away. The people felt trapped.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Eventually, just like the other Twains - Theorick fell to the corruption. Not before he had the last word.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: He froze the land entirely, killing almost everything and everyone left outside in it. Hundreds of lives were lost.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: It turns out the ice slowed the spread of corruption across the land to almost a standstill. It's been this way ever since.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Now that we can get in his mansion we hope to uncover the secrets of his ice magic so we may undo it, and share the wealth he hoarded from the people. Ah, we're here.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: This place looks frozen in time.. The grandure.. Well he did just take and take from everyone around him.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: So, I'm not sure where to start, but I'm guessing he has some protection in place.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: This is unbeliveable.. He was such a greedy-  AAAAH.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: ... I don't think we should insult him..

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Oof! Wasn't expecting that. That just proves everything I said about him. Punishing people who insult him.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Anyway, we should look around for some kind of secret entrance.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Trust Theorick to booby trap his own house the paranoid frozen gro-

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: That really isn't fun at all. I can't see a thing. Where are we now, a dead end?

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Well we know that insults result in punishment. Maybe a compliment will make him happy?

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Oh Theorick, strongest of all the Twains, you really are a hero.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Maybe n-

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: Looks like we finally found his private quarters, look at that vault door.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: There must be some way to open it. Look around and see what you can find.

lines.speaker: Eppo
lines.line: You did it! We have access to the vault.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Shipment 3A and 4B, fully accounted for... shipments 5C and 6A...missing 50% of quartz content?!

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Agh, this is getting worse! There's never been so much loss...whoever this is, they're getting bold...

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Ugh, go AWAY! Quit hovering over my shoulder like that- wait, a Human? Since when did you get here?

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: What, you like listening to the melodious sound of my voice or something? Or do you intend to help out?

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Well, I'm flattered either way, and I could certainly use the help. Quartz is going missing from my shipments.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Obviously one of the laborers is siphoning it to someplace, and I can't have that happening. So, be a private eye, humie.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: This is actually pretty dire- quartz has some magicality to it, see. It likes to soak up magic power, which means it can be weaponized.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: We tend not to use it for weapons since it can overcharge, but that's neither here nor there, is it?

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Every siphoned shipment has gone through Dado. Interrogate him! He hangs out past the big red tent, near the house with red flags.

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: Okay, these go to division P, and...look, I'm busy allocating these deliveries to Llevigar. Go pester someone else, okay?

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: ...what. You...think I... Pfff... Pffhahaaaah! Ohhh, that's RICH coming from a human of all things!

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: "Oh, me, the hired gun species that kills for money, will accuse you, a storied worker of seven years, of illegal activity!" Wow, you HYPOCRITE!

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: I'm hardly even angry about this! But, yeah, you freak. You got the wrong guy, surprise! Your brain workin' right in there?

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: I bet you got some wires crossed in there, huh? Go scuttle on back to town and kill someone's Wybel for pocket change or something.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: I'm just going to take a wild guess and say that asking him nicely whether he committed theft didn't bring up any answers.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: What, he brushed you off like THAT? Jeez, I knew he was a jerk, but really? That's just uncalled for.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: We have to make him talk...if shipments keep going missing, my contractors are going to look elsewhere!

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: We need to prove that he's guilty...wait, you came to ME for ideas? This is why I asked you for help! Am I really back to square one?
Aah, Nasea!

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: I...what are you doing here, uh...Larry? Were you missing quartz too??

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Ah, it's...Lari. No, the quartz shipment found its way fine...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: But, there was hardly an effect. Your idea was, unfortunately, a dead end.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Well, I did warn you that it was only an idea. I manage the mine, I don't practice purification magic. Don't pin anything on me for that.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I did not intend to imply that. Your help was appreciated, fate simply had opposing plans...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...is this human a part of your operations, miss?

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Well, in a sense. Someone's siphoning quartz, but our suspect wasn't intimidated by the ten tons of armor, so we're at a loss. Any ideas?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...as a matter of fact, I do have a solution. Elven botany describes a flower that grows decently close by, the "Tattytale" flower.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It weakens the will of those who catch a whiff of its petals, making them pliable to questions. It's...unpleasant, but if it is needed, I suppose.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: There is a cave infested with spiders, and covered with webs in the western mountain. It is the only place it grows outside of Aldorei, unfortunately.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Nasea, since it didn't help, I've returned the quartz. I thank you for your help...and I shall bid you both adieu.

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: Hey, everyone's least-favorite attack dog! Here boy! You want the emerald? Go kill all the flies in my house! Come on boy!

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: Aw, flowers. How sweet of you! Sorry, but I don't cave to psychopaths or flattery, hehehee!

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: I...huff... What was THAT for?! Are you offended that I don't like your flo- What? What am I doing with the quartz?

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: Uh, isn't it obvious? I'm working overtime and sending it up to Popo, duh. Where else would I be sending it?

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: What- Where's Popo sending it? Um...no clue. Whoever it is, they're super rich though. They pay me more than my house is worth every shipment!

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: Not sure why you need to- What? Where's Popo? Uh, he said he'd meet me at the cart track overpass, near the teal flags.

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: This was going to be our first meeting, so I don't know what he looks like, and likewise he's never seen me.

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: ...uh. Okay, I have no clue why I told you all of that...um, have you got any more of those flowers though? It was actually really good...

lines.speaker: Popo
lines.line: Ah, you must- Wait, never mind. I was expecting a visit from someone else.

lines.speaker: Popo
lines.line: Wait, you're Dado? I guess humans have more brain capacity than orcs after all, hehah!

lines.speaker: Popo
lines.line: Okay, down to business. I'm gonna look busy to cover for you while you get to the base for briefing. You'll get the details there.

lines.speaker: Popo
lines.line: You stick out like a sore thumb, but thankfully humans like to get into lots of weird spots, so it won't look too out of place.

lines.speaker: Popo
lines.line: Use the small rail here, flick the lever. It'll look like you're just...doing what humans do, instead of drawing suspicion.

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: Interesting, a human's been swept up in our plans. Hadn't expected the work force to diversify so fast.

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: Time for the rundown, oh I love explaining this! I think you'll find what I have to say quite interesting, yes yes!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: You see, quartz is a powerful magical material- moreso than many know! It can absorb and harness magical energy, but what more? I had to find out!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: The rubes in my research department got me kicked out for suggesting we further our research. What kind of scientist is scared to make advancements?!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: But without a board of directors breathing down my neck, my research has led me exactly where I'd hoped, and even more, yes yes!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Oi. Got a guest taking the secret passage.

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: Harnort! I'M Dado! This sicko mugged me for info! They're gonna ruin us both!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: Guards!! GUARDS!! Capture them! Stop them! Tie them up, do something!! Our research can't go to waste, not at this vital point!!

lines.speaker: Dado
lines.line: HA! That's what you get for showing me that amazi- HORRIBLE flower! Outta here!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Knock 'em down, boys!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Aah, they're really tough!! Don't let them take down more of my buddies!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Why are we fighting face-to-face?! They're destroying us!!

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: What the hell are humans made of?! Overwhelm them!! We hardly have any guys left!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: ...so it's come to this then. I knew the names of all those guards. I didn't hurt anyone to meet my goal.

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: You...I won't let their sacrifices be in vain! Llevigar needs to see what quartz is truly capable of! I MUST show them.

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: My Quartrons are the future! They need to see it! It will have been worth the scheming, and the thieving, and the burnt bridges!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: But you- you couldn't leave well enough alone. You stepped in, and callously threw away a hundred lives to stop the inevitable!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: One life for a hundred is a fair trade!!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: N-no! NO! NO, NO! You idiot, you blundering HUMAN! A hundred lives lost in vain to your destructiveness!!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: Why did they ever open the doors?! You all deserve to burn apart! You've ruined everything!!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: The Quartron's energy spike is overloading the lab's quartz! This entire room is going to explode and kill everyone in it! ARE YOU PROUD?!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: Aaah! Not responding?! You- You...YOU! You've destroyed the future! MY future! GAVEL'S future!!!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: The futures of a hundred men or more!! You humans deserve to burn in hell for your careless destruction!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: The energy output by the detonations is overcharging the quartz in the walls... This entire lab is a deathtrap now! Do us all a favor- SIT STILL AND DIE ALREADY!!

lines.speaker: Harnort
lines.line: How did you get back into my lair?!

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: ...you've got some serious explaining to do. First you disappear to go get that Tattle flower, or whatever it was.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Then Dado ran through here screaming that he was drugged or mugged, and ran off to the east ridge.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Then, he came back, asking me if I'd found any more of those flowers, and while he was blabbering the ENTIRE MOUNTAIN SHOOK.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: So, spill it. I wanted you to figure out where my quartz was going, and you made one of my workers an addict and caused a freaking landslide!!

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: ...uh huh. Mhm. ... ...yeah, go on. Uh, okay, I can buy that... ...I'd never believe you if you hadn't given me the proof.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: A militarized quartz mech...yeesh. That guy sounds like a piece of work. Guess that wasn't really your fault after all.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: I'll round up the police to get all those guards and them. ...what's with that look? Almost looks like you don't think anyone'll be there. Anyways...

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Okay, so I'll cut you a quick deal. I'll pay you now for figuring this out, and if you do just one more thing for me then you'll get something extra.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Take the elevator past the yellow flags and go into the private site, you have my permission. I'll meet you up there.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Coming up behind you.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: This is the newest mining annex, but we've hit a bit of a brick wall. Well...a gravel wall.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: So, if you can open up this area, you'll get access to the mine and whatever you find in it.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: You see the gravel wall? See if you can't dig through this for us.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Hm! Clean work there. Pretty impressive, I'd say. So, as promised, you have your mine access, and...

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: ...the core you showed me folded up into a ring. Really high-tech stuff, but I can't use it, so you can take it. Just head inside now.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: I wonder if that huge detonation is going to interfere with any more of our projects...it's annoying, but nothing for it.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Oh no, these shipments don't add up at all.. Huh? Who are you? Go away, you won't be able to help me until you are combat level 49 and mining level 15.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Come back when you have a solid lead on the missing quartz.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: I have to be off though, lots of work to get to. Hm. It looks like the core you showed me folded up into a ring. Really high-tech stuff, but I can't use it, so you can take it.

lines.speaker: Nasea
lines.line: Suppose that's all, then! Here's your payment. I'll see you around.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: Oh, hey you there! Are you heading down this road? You know it's a dead end, right?

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: It leads to an old mansion, that has fallen into decay.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: That mansion is the house of my ancestor; Dwendle Twain. It was a house of incredible heritage and magical powers, Dwendle himself was adopted into it.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: Marius Twain was the leader of the mansion; they fought against evil spirits, I think. The history of the house is not well-known, outside of a novel.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: I want to know the history of the mansion and uncover its secrets, but every time I get close, dark beings prevent me from entering.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: I am no soldier, and I don't think I will ever uncover the truth without your help. I can greatly reward you for your help.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: My ancestor left our family a large amount of emeralds. Beware though, traveller, the mansion's secrets are incredibly difficult to uncover and the monsters are powerful.

lines.speaker: Twendle
