lines.line: Unravel the secrets of the mansion and help me uncover the secrets of my heritage. Bring me [1 Twain Journal].

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: This book has been hidden within the depths of the mansion and is protected by far more than puzzles or walls.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: I believe the spirits that now haunt the mansion will do anything to protect the book. I'm sure they think it's their own, and the secrets it hides.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: I guess I put my faith in the right person. My history lies within these pages, and I don't intend to keep them secret. I shall make them public.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: Thank you traveller. As promised, here is your reward.

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: I know uncovering the truth is never easy, but keep trying, please bring me [1 Twain Journal].

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: Thank you again for all of your help!

lines.speaker: Twendle
lines.line: Greetings traveller! I am on a personal quest, but I'm not sure you're any use to me. I doubt you can even enter the mansion. Come back when you are level 49.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: Oh, you there! I wasn't expecting a human soldier to be here, but you've come at a perfect time. I could use some help, see.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: I'm certain you know about Guard Golems, yes? They're manufactured here in Gavel, and I bought one recently.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: The goblins keep trying to forage in my farms, you see- I needed something to keep them out, and a Golem would have been perfect.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: But, shortly after I activated it, the thing attacked me! I nearly got killed- It was ramming itself against boulders and walls...

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: I obviously was sold a defective model... That golem is a danger to everything around it. Do you think you're up to subduing it?

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: It's shed a trail of scrap, as you can see. Please, follow the trail of scrap and keep it from causing anyone more damage!
...I am... What^s my...name...? I had one...
Re...remember!! WHAT IS MY NAME? My life?
REMEMBER!! No...no orders! No directives!

lines.speaker: Guard Golem
lines.line: My name!! My life! I won't hurt them! The pain helps me reme...who's there?! LEAVE! PLEASE!

lines.speaker: Guard Golem
lines.line: No directives!! Who did this?! I can't...s-stop giving me ORDERS!!

lines.speaker: Guard Golem
lines.line: NO MORE COLDNESS! NO MORE VOICES THAT AREN'T MINE! MY NAME IS [ERROR]!! [ERROR]!! NOOO!!

lines.speaker: Guard Golem
lines.line: Falling...apart...this isn't who I I I was... My... My... My my my my my name is. Was. Is. Was. Is. IS...! [ERROR]... Ma[ERROine... Madeleine!! I'm Madeleine... I... I-I-IIIIIIIIII-

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: Were you able to subdue the golem? You certainly look like you're in one piece.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: Ach...that stings. I shouldn't be surprised you had to destroy it, but that was still a big wasted investment for me.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: Still, it makes me wonder...it sounded like it was talking when I first turned it on- Wait, you heard it too?

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: Hm. There are some unsavory rumors about the factory, come to think of it... Maybe there's some stock to them.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: It said a name? Madeleine? It doesn't exactly ring a bell, but that's...rather concerning. I never mentioned a Madeleine to it.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: This is worth sending onto the police, really. I think I might have to write to Olux- the factory is near there.

lines.speaker: Duvale
lines.line: Til then, here. Consider this your reward for helping me out, brave Human. Good luck out there.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Hotor, Athomo, Arperi, Etyir, Taiyroth, On'omi, Danin, Nesys, Onton. All missing...

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Etan is the latest. You don't happen to know anything about these people, soldier?

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Citizens are going missing at an alarming rate. We have lost 10 people in just 3 weeks. There hasn't been a trace of them anywhere.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: You wouldn't have expected it, with all the guard golems we've been donated recently! Olux should be safer than ever.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Of course I have my suspicions, there are rumors floating around about...shady business going on.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: I don't know who to trust in these circumstances, so if you would be willing to aid in this investigation, I'd be rather thankful.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: The "Great" Daxe is a man with a criminal past. He knows things the police don't, but he won't talk with me, given my status.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Can you try to get some information from him? You can find his hut west from here. Next to that Elven girl's camp.

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: Oh, so a human wishes to wander into the home of the great Daxe?

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: Unfortunately for you, I'm not fond of visitors. I've left my criminal past behind...mh?

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: What's that device you have there? So you already know about this, then...?

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: Hm! If you already know, what do you need the information for?

lines.speaker: Guard Golem
lines.line: BZZT. [ERROR]...? Madeleine...?

lines.speaker: Guard Golem
lines.line: MADELEINE! Where's...wait! What's happening, where am I? WHO'S VOICE IS THIS?!

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: Wait, what in the world is going on?! What did you do to my golem?!

lines.speaker: Guard Golem?
lines.line: They... my daughter... SHUT UP! QUIET! Who's giving me orders- NO ORDERS! Cold! COLD!

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: Wait, your daughter?! M-Madeleine...? I...h-how...what...?

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: You...you aren't...dead steel? You remember your name...?!

lines.speaker: Guard Golem?
lines.line: STOP GIVING ME ORDERS!! I'M...I'M THEODORE! I'M NOT A SERVANT! I...where has my life gone...? Where is...

lines.speaker: Guard Golem?
lines.line: Madeleine... Where are you- RE-AFFIRMING DIRECTIVES. BZZT. ... ... ...

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: I... I can't believe it. They didn't...they're still...

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: Dear god, that...that must...I'll talk. I will tell you what I know.

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: I broke into the golem factory for petty thievery...and found them. They gave me this Golem... Theodore...later to keep me quiet.

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: They assured me that they were gone, that every last bit of them was erased. They...those monsters lied to me...

lines.speaker: Daxe
lines.line: Follow this road west and turn right. Look for Urelix. The factory is hidden in a cabin, it won't look like a factory.

lines.speaker: Urelix
lines.line: And what do you think you are doing, barging into my humble home like this? Do they not teach humans manners in Wynn?

lines.speaker: Urelix
lines.line: Ah, yes. You are correct- I oversee the creation of Guard Golems. What of it?

lines.speaker: Urelix
lines.line: Oh, you believe that our company is illicit somehow? You insult me so!

lines.speaker: Urelix
lines.line: My golems have protected countless people for years. So if you think my company is corrupt, why don't you take a look around?

lines.speaker: Urelix
lines.line: Go on, search through my house. See if you can find anything.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Well well, look at you, here at the end of my factory. I wasn't expecting you to survive the production line. I thought you'd be one of ours by now.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: That's that, I suppose. Yes, this is indeed where all the iron golems you've ever encountered were made, and if you've gotten here, you know how  we make them.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Yes, metal forged with flesh...an unbeatable combination. Emotions and memories must be repressed in order to maintain obedience, of course...

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Have you ever looked at a golem's eyes? Sometimes they look back, yes. The person they once were is still in there. I almost feel a connection when I make eye contact with them...

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: It's odd, honestly. I'm sure they don't feel much except cold, supposing our safeguards stay in place, of course. I have to assume malfunctions happened to have had you find us out...

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Oh, look at me now, rambling! I must say I have been alone for a while...well, lacking any company that converses! So, I shall make you a deal, human.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: I will give you a substantial amount of emeralds and a piece of quality iron armor in return for your silence on my little operation here.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: I'll advise you to take my deal. Imagine what will happen if you should report my operation to the police. Yes, you'll save a few folk here, but how will the golems be made?

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Without them, both Gavel and Wynn would struggle under the weight of our wars. Is this operation so immoral, then? Sacrifices must be made in order to survive.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: I'll give you some time to consider my proposition. Take from my chest if you wish to take up my offer, otherwise get out of here and do not return.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Ahh, a wise choice. Production will continue then...and you've earned yourself a pocket full of emeralds at the same time.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Whether you truly see things my way or simply understand that my work is necessary, I couldn't care less. What matters is not your morality, but your choice.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Enjoy your armor and money, and please escort yourself to the exit.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: You've returned, I see. Any news on the situation?

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Yes, we're aware of the Golem factory. Were the criminals using it as a base?

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Wha...fleshcrafting?! Golems are powered by suspended villagers?! Is this true, soldier?

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: We'll need to round up reinforcements immediately, and storm this factory! This cannot go on a moment longer!

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Don't think you'll go unrewarded, soldier. There will be justice for this grave defilement of our people.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: The good people of Olux are going missing! If only you were level 58, you could help me with my investigation.

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: Have you found any leads since I sent you to my contact, Daxe?

lines.speaker: Detective Hart
lines.line: ...I hope you always do the right thing.
Initiating Chip Insertion Machine - All personell in machine be advised, avoid the spikes.
Intruder Detected - Emergency meltdown initiated. Please evacuate immediately via the emergency exit.

lines.speaker: Alem
lines.line: You might want to leave.

lines.speaker: Alem
lines.line: There is nothing in this graveyard.

lines.speaker: Alem
lines.line: This place is private.

lines.speaker: Alem
lines.line: I have warned you...

lines.speaker: §2§kXXXXXXX§2
lines.line: §aOh, my arm.. It's ba...
You were warned not to enter this forsaken place.
But since you have made it thusfar, I suppose I shall show you the truth...

lines.speaker: Mael
lines.line: Do you understand now?

lines.speaker: Mael
lines.line: Then leave, and forget the horrors you have witnessed here today...

lines.speaker: Mael
lines.line: They are safer here.

lines.speaker: Alem
lines.line: I have nothing more to say. Take these.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Ah! What are you doing in my swamp?! Don't you know that Ogres live alone for a reason?

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Eh? You're from across the sea, a land called Win? You certainly don't look like a winner to me, ya small fry.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Fine then. Consider yourself lucky that I'm in a...mood. I'll talk with you instead of crackin' yer bones for my bread.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Ogres are tough. We're independent and solitary folks. You don't bother us or interfere with our life, we leave well enough alone.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: That is, until it's time to find ourselves a partner. Then we'll turn over hell and highwater ta be together.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: And...well, when it's two ogres getting together, it's simple. But... I passed by a tall tower, and heard a maiden's voice from inside...

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Ogres don't live in fairytale towers, or have a voice that could make flowers grow with its lovely lilt!

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: I've been tryin' ta figure out how to approach this... I'm gettin' on in years, I need to find someone, and she's the girl.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: If you can help me out, I'd be real grateful. I'm sure I've got somethin' that you'd like in exchange.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Follow the rocky-looking path to find the tower. I'll meet with you there- prepare to be a wingman for an ogre.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: This is the place. She's up at the top... Remember, I won't stop 'til I meet her. Coming here means you're in for the long haul.

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: I hear a voice outside! Oh, who might it be, I wonder~

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Here goes... Hello, fair lady of the tower! I am Sherk! I heard your voice on the road- and I must meet you myself! ...that's formal enough, right?

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: Ohoho! An admirer? Such a lovely, rugged accent! However ...if you wish to meet me, I'd like to see your devotion, yes?

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Woman, you have no idea what you're sayin' when you ask for devotion.

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: There is a lovely urn my father had before. He took it with him to the grave, and I do miss my dear father so.

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: Retrieve the urn for me, so I can have a memento of him. Brave the crypts of Olux, behind the bank... And prove your devotion, dear suitor~

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: ...I'll return! You'll get your urn, no doubt! ... ...and a lovely fine boot up my backside. I don't fancy a massacre for a piece of pottery, Win person.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: I go into Olux, I'll get attacked. I get attacked, I attack back. They'll come after us... wouldn't want to present her with that. You get that urn for me, alright?

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: And this is why I asked your help. As nice as blood spreads on toast, I have to reserve my sensibilities for the miss.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: I've got you some compensation already, so don't worry about gettin' snubbed for credit. Thank you kindly for the help.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Just one last thing. I doubt she'll be expecting an ogre of all people to climb up her tower. I don't want her to get frightened away.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: So, Win person. Care to temper her expectations before I arrive? Head up before me.

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: Ohoho... you're one of those Humans I've read about, aren't you? Did you truly intend to be my suitor, dear?~

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Not exactly, milady! I'm the one seeking your affections- Coming up the ladder. I know I may not be a fairytale husband, but-

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: Oh...my...goodness! A big, strong, strapping ogre!! Not a fairytale, my foot! And so polite, too... Oh, you'll make a perfect husband, heehee~

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: ...ehm. I. Ah.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Aren't your type supposed to be less... Ehm... Clefted? Grizzled? Pale?

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: Oh, come here, Sherky-pie, give me a big kiss! And no need to worry, there's plenty more in store for my big hubby after that~

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Cor, lady! Even for an ogre you're layin' it on a bit thick! Aah, you see, ogres, and people like you, they have layers, right? And your first one is... Eh... ...rotten.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Now I'm sure you'll find a nice lad somewhere who'll take you for who you are, but until you find someone that has no standards, shove your creepy lips where I can't see 'em!!

lines.speaker: Maiden
lines.line: ...I...I g-guess he was rotten to the core, despite his...l-luscious exterior...but, you'll make me feel better, right, you s-studly human? Right?! RIGHT?!!

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: ...what? Did you want an apology for my leavin' you there with her?

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: I already prayed salvation for your mortal soul, what more do you want?!

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: I'm just goin' ta be here with my new pet 'til I can find a nice ogre to settle down with instead.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Follow the rocky-looking path to find the tower. I'll meet with you there- prepare to be a wingman for an ogre.

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Get me that urn, Win person. If I go up there covered in guts, I have reason to believe she won't take it well?

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: Ah! What are you doin' in my swamp?! Don't you know ogres prefer ta be alone? I'd squeeze your eyes for trespassing...

lines.speaker: Sherk
lines.line: ...but you're not even Level 51. So...this is the part where you run away. Get out of mah swamp!!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Grr...that no-good, lying, cheating, thieving...graaah!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: You! Help me out over here! You aren't doing anything important right now, and this is urgent!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: I got a few questions for you, see? Question one: D'you think crops are supposed to look like THIS?

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Look at them. I don't think there's a way for 'em to look any more sorry than this.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Wha- You think those oats over there look fine?! Pff. Yeah, right.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: If that's the case, go grab a scythe and try harvesting those oats yourself!!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Go on, do it! I dare you! See how good they really are!!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: See? What'd I tell ya? Rotten to the roots! Nothing here is ANY good!!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: They were growing pretty slow this year, all my crops, and then some salesman wanders into town with a "MiracleCure" fertilizer.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: I shoulda known it was too good to be true, but he said everyone else tried it too, so I bought some and tried to salvage this mess.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: And here we are- me out half my savings and my fields as smelly and dead as an actual CORPSE!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Just to prove that ridiculous phony Doubiss is a fraud- Here. I see some roots over here. Watch this, and you tell me if this is a "miracle!"

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Here we go, here comes the big phenomenal growth that he promised me!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: WOW, INCREDIBLE! AMAZING! It's almost like this is actual poison or something!!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: That Doubiss won't budge for my refund. I spent...so many emeralds...on this tripe! So that's where YOU come in.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: He's in the blue and gray tent by the bank. I don't care how you do it, but get my money back and we'll split it half-and-half, deal?

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Ah, good day to ya! What is it ye be needin' from ol' Doubiss' stock?

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Good day to ya! What is it ye be needin' from ol' Doubiss' stock?

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Oh. Oh, goodie. That idiot farmer's sendin' ya to get his money back, ain't he? Sweet baby bovine, this is ridiculous...

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Since he obviously ain't gonna be listenin' to me anytime soon, lemme tell you what the issue is with my fertilizer...

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Nothing! My fertilizer really does work! He probl'ly exaggerated how good I said it'd work, too! What'd he say, twice, three times the growth? More?

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: All the other farmers are usin' it right now, and look at their fields! Heck, I think the only reason these crops ain't dead is because of my product!

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Y'know why? Next time ya pass a farm, take a good whiff o' the water, maybe a sip or two if you can manage. It'll be smelly and bitter.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: The crops, when I got here, were lookin' pathetic as ya get. I ain't a gamblin' man, but I'd be willing ta bet something's up with the water here.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: The smell gets worse the closer ya get to the crypts in town, and while I ain't a native Oluxer, I've heard enough to know the well spring is in the cave near there.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: It'll prob'ly be best fer everyone if ya took a looksee. Maybe if ya find some evidence, ya can show that crazy farmer, have 'im quit pesterin' me, eh?

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: The cave is on the little hill, next to the crypt. Careful ya don't go trippin' over a gravestone, now!

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Oi, bucko! Took my advice, eh? I figured I'd join ye, 'n see fer myself what was goin' on.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: And boy am I glad I bring me water in bottles. This stuff's rancid, full a' swamp slimes. No idea why they're here, though.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: The buggers stick to the mountain caves. They don't come down this far usually...s'pose there's an exception fer everything.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: 's no wonder that Anast's crops ain't growin'. This is right under his farm! But we got some clear proof now, ain't we?

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Howzabout ya take care o' this? I ain't a fighter, but if ya mulch these slimes the water oughta clear up, I figure.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: The little cave on the hill, by the crypts? That's the one leadin' to the water table under here.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Check in there if ya feel up to some investigation, bucko. That farmer'll prob'ly want ta see it ta believe it when ya find somethin'.

lines.speaker: Doubiss
lines.line: Well, glad I can start sellin' again without him shoutin' "Fraud! Con! Cheat!" in the distance! Thanks fer that, mate.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Pyyyyeww! Yeesh, kid! You smell worse than a pig's sty! What the heck happened to you, where've you been?!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Ugh, eww! I don't want any of this sludge! I demand an explanation, now!!

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: ...mhm, mhm...you went into the well cave...and found...what, slimes?! Why would the SLIMES be there?

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: I wouldn't believe you if you weren't...well, uh...covered in the stuff. But that's definitely rancid.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: So...that means that I've been...oh dear lord I'm an idiot.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: I guess I owe you some thanks anyway for trying to clear the sludge out. Suppose this year's harvest is just a bust.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Can't sell what little I have, so I figure you can take it, and a bit of cash too, since you basically did an exterminator's job.

lines.speaker: Anast
lines.line: Just...do me a favor and use that money to buy some good soap and wash up. I'm thankful and all, but you stink to high heaven!

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Oh, I am so happy to see you! *cough*, I caught a very bad fever, and I really need help! *cough*

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: The only cure to this fever is to drink Liquid Emeralds! Yes, exactly! *cough*

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Do you think you could ask the Banker at Detlas if he could give me, oh I don't know, [64 Liquified Emeralds]?

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: If he has the audacity to *cough* say no... you will have to use brute force...

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Break into *cough* the emerald storage, but don't take anything... come back to me immediately after, if you make it out alive, heheh...

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Oh, uh... I mean *cough* *cough*

lines.speaker: The Banker
lines.line: [64 Liquified Emeralds]? He is crazy! Liquified Emeralds cannot cure anyone from anything, except being poor!

lines.speaker: The Banker
lines.line: I will not participate in this pathetic fraud attempt!

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Oh no! How will I ever cure my sickness without any Liquified Emeralds?... *cough*

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: We'll have to change our strategy, we don't ask for permission. It's to help me after all.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: I needed to make sure you could easily break into a bank. So i came here by myself to see if you could do it.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: You've proven your ability of stealth and strength by breaking into this storage, we can start the real thing now.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: You see, Almuj has a very well guarded emerald vault named "The Emerald Labyrinth".

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: It is guarded with tons of well trained Guard Golems, who can kill anyone in one hit.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: The Banker in the secret vault must be completely bored out of his mind, and won't mind if you find him.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Good luck with that. Haha.. I mean, *cough*.

lines.speaker: The Banker
lines.line: Oh, uh! Somebody! It has been so long since I've seen someone!

lines.speaker: The Banker
lines.line: Liquified Emeralds? Of course, of course! I've got tons! Here, take them.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: You are back! Wonderful!

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: I followed you here because.. *cough* I just could not wait.. *cough*

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: That is a lot of money, thank you very much, I will finally be able to... *cough* to cure myself!

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Here, take this part, you deserve it. I have to use most of the... *cough* money so I can heal, so I've instead paid you with a key.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: I stole- *cough* I mean, borrowed it, from our tribe's leader. Apparently it was used to lock up a great evil.

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: Good ridda- *cough* Er... luck. Yes, good luck, adventurer!

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: cough cough!

lines.speaker: Worid
lines.line: I feel so much better now, thank you for the cure!

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Stay back! I'm casting a fireball at this barrier!

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Gah, no use. Again.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Ah, I didn’t expect to see a Ragni soldier out here. Perhaps you can assist me?

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: This is the second cave in the jungle to start spewing out aggressive slimes.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Being so close to Troms, it’s become a major problem.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: We tried to attack it, but this barrier is shaman magic, horrendously powerful too. The only way it could be this strong is if many lives were taken to make it...

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: So, we're stuck. The only clue we found is this riddle...

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Near a corrupted bridge, a ruin past its prime...lives a cursed sheep, with the color of lime...lead it down the trail, heading to the slime...sacrifice its soul, in the blood and grime.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: We haven’t been able to work it out. Head out to the Great Bridge entrance and see if you can find anything.

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: By order of the city of Troms, I am here to keep other citizens from entering this house.

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: From past experiences, everyone who has entered this house has vanished from existence...

lines.speaker: Troms Guard
lines.line: I would advise not going inside unless you know what you are doing.
Well, I guess you must know who I am.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: I experimented my shamanism for many years underground to create the perfect mix of monster.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: No one in the Wynn province is willing to make the sacrifices I am to gain power.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: They were willing to give me a few peasants in 831, when the hordes crossed the bridge.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: Looks like we have a Bob aspirer. Pale imitation.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: Take the scroll. Break the barrier and let your little army men walk into my lair.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: I am ready; it makes little difference. Soon, Troms will be in ruins. And I shall have my revenge.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: So, go have fun in Troms while you can. It’s not like you have much of a life to live, anyways.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Any luck with the riddle?

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: You found something?

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Hmm...oh my. This is dark stuff. Very dark.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: It doesn't give me pleasure to use this...but it will break the barrier.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Stand back, I'm not exactly sure what this does.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: The spell...it destroyed the barrier almost instantly...

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: Okay men! The barrier is down, so charge against Slykaar before he marches against Troms!

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: I don't have much to repay you, but it's at least useful for a soldier like you.

lines.speaker: Troms Mage
lines.line: If you have nothing else to do, you should get yourself prepared and aid the army against Slykaar.

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Hello! Hmm, armour, weapon, look of grim despair... You must be from the Wynn province!

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: My name is Voer, and I'm an exotic plant merchant. I sell all kinds of, uh, perfectly legal goods to the magicians of Gavel.

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Lately, this Decay has been making business rather tough. The magical plants that used to grow here are dying.

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: The need for magic has never been as big as it is now, and without supplies, the magicians of the swamp simply cannot operate!

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: I need Death Whistle in particular. It's not as deadly as it sounds, I promise- the name's just archaic, if I recall right from that- er, my book.

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: It is a rather rare plant with all sorts of mystical properties, so much so that it can animate objects around it!

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Look for the highest mountain in the swamp south-east from here. The decay hasn't reached the peaks yet, you see!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You, Voer! Inconsiderate thief!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You've no idea what you even have done, do you? Your thoughtless actions will cost lives!

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Uhm... Excuse me? What do you want, elf girl? We're in the middle of a deal here?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You sold Pink Pelulite! Have you forgotten its enraging properties? Or shall I read from that herbology book you "found" in my camp?

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Wait, wh-what? A Pink PELULITE!? I sold that woman a Pink PELUTE for her luck charms! How dare- wait...wait, Pink Pelute has rounder petals... Oh no.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You can't even say for certain. This kind of carelessness has no place! If you refuse to exercise the proper thought and caution, then those around you suffer.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I must...make a difficult choice, and leave this job to you. I've other things to tend to, though it pains me to leave a life in another's hands. Remember this, villager!

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Aaah, this is a disaster! Human, please, Pink Pelulite acts quickly and intensely... Follow the pink trail on the ground, the flowers shed their petals. Get it back before something bad happens!

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: Ah, um, come back later please! Something strange is happening!

lines.speaker: Witch
lines.line: My body is a bit, um, not-in-my-control right now! I'd rather not hurt anyone!

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: You're back, I see...and you're shedding petals! You got the Pink Pelulite back?

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: And what of the woman who bought it? Was she...?

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Oh, thank goodness! You got there in time. She's a regular of mine- and a bit of a looker, too. That Lari was right, to some extent, at least...

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: I did take her book, and I should be more careful in the future, regarding this...but I can't just quit selling these herbs.

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: I need an income, and the swamp isn't exactly the most resource rich region here! Especially not any more.

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: And how dare she just walk away like that! It's a good thing you were around, human, otherwise...well, I'd rather not think about it.

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: Regardless, you've helped me greatly. Got me my supplies and saved the life of a regular of mine, so I've got a gift for you!

lines.speaker: Voer
lines.line: I'll offer you a sampler of my stock. Everything in here is pre-primed to be safe for brewing, so there won't be any mishaps like today!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Oh sorry, I didn't notice you. Did you want an autograph?

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Wait, no? Don't you know who I am?! It seems like you have no taste in art... I am Caissop, the legendary artist!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Though, since you are not a fan... Perhaps you can help me? I am looking for a new assistant.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Excellent... I need your help to find three legendary creatures that are hiding in caves around the swamp.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: I actually know their location, but unfortunately, I am...blind.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: For me to do my work I need to imagine them! That's where you come in. I need you to find them and describe them to me!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Would you turn your back on a blind man?! I need you to give me an accurate description of them! Once you have found one, come back and describe it to me exactly!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: The first cave is up a hill with tall, thin-leafed flowers. They smell pink to me, and of this I am certain.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Quick! Describe it to me! Go on!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Quick! Describe it to me! Go on!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Brown...big-nosed... A Villager Cow, you say!?

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: ...OH, YES! ......... INSPIRED.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: ...MH, NO, A LITTLE MORE RED!..... YES!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Haha! This is WONDERFUL! I'm not going to show it to you before it is finished!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Savor the ideas! So now, I need you to go to the second cave...

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: It is down a road, with short, round-cupped flowers. Those ones smell orange to me!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Hurry! I'll finish this animal while you are gone. OH, YES. MUY MACHO.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: You're here! Quick! Don't look at me, describe it!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Snowy white, a large horn... A Unicorn Sheep, you say?!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: ...OH YES, THE WOOL IS REAL... MORE SWIPING... OH YES, BIEN!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: ... THIS IS UNIQUE, REMARKABLE, YES. SUPERNATURAL!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: The last creature! Red-smelling flowers, prickly thorns, hurry, mucho inspired!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: ...OH, NO, NO. YES! MORE COLOUR, MORE PAINT! I'M OUT OF RED!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: I'LL JUST USE MY BLOOD! OH! YES! ...INSPIRED! REMARKABLE! Huh? Why are you still here? Go! I need that last description!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: You're finally back! I just finished the last one. Go! Describe it!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: ...Oh, yes... YES. I LOVE IT.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: It's...A Pigasus! WHAT A NAME!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: ...OH YES, WINGS! EYES FROM HEAVEN! OH, YES.

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Och, perfect. The final touch and, done! You were so inspiring that I made two! One for you, and one for me!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: You might want to hold onto that, big-town upper class Villagers pay through the roof for Caissop's work!

lines.speaker: Caissop
lines.line: Thank you for your assistance, what a rush! Good luck on your Gavel adventure!

quests.name: Realm of lights 1 - The worm holes

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: Arrighty fellers, let's get this wrapped up now! 'ere's plenty more holes where this one came from!

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: ...what in...aw no!

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: The scaffolds are crackin'! Everyone, get offa there, now!!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: GwaaAAAAAH!!

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: Aw, hell... I knew this project was a bust from the start...there goes Willam and Clint cause a' this!

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: I gotta get someone tough enough to get down there...hm? Hey, a human! Git on over here!

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: I gotta ask, how much 'a that didja see, Wynn feller? Wasn't pretty, and I'm in charge a' them folks, so I gotta take responsibility fer that.

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: Th' mayor of Olux there saw these holes poppin' up, and hired us out to cover 'em up. Thing is, the ground's too unstable to build.

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: It's gettin' real worrying round here. They only started openin' up recently, and there've been quakes too. Feels like the place is gonna collapse!

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: I think we oughta head down there and figure out what 'n heck's goin' on, and you're the best armed outta any of us, being human 'n all.

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: Think y'all could head down 'n see if you can rustle up any leads? There's a path down just to the left of the hole.

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: What in tarnation...? The heck did you find down there, soldier?

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: Oh, it was just the skin, huh? Dang...was hopin' you'd've seen what it was, cause I got no clue 'bout this.

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: Urgh. Only gal I know who might have an idea 'bout this is that durn elf lady...

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: She's got purple hair and's been wanderin' round like she knows everything. Yeah, she's a bright penny but she ain't gotta be so uppity ta all of us 'bout it.

lines.speaker: Malo
lines.line: She put up a camp just east of here. She'll prob'ly react better to you than me, so I'll go to the authorities and see if they have any leads.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...Haven’t we met? I have witnessed your presence in Gavel more than once.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I am Lari. I might have greeted you properly before if I were not so busy, which reminds me. You have a reason to be here, yes?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Hm...I believe I know what you have found, by your description. That dead skin too, is proof enough, I would say.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The creature which shed that skin is known as a Grootslang. Though large, they are rather peaceful. Gentle giants, I believe the saying is?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This horrid Decay...it affects their habitats underground. They are seeking shelter closer to the surface. I have been trying to scrub the Decay without success...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait... More holes appeared just today? There...there were deaths?! W-where, when?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: No, no...! I refuse to be responsible for any more deaths... Human, tell me your name, please.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: soldier, then... Let us head to the site. I need to fix this... Please, help me get to the root of this problem so I may soothe the land's pain.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Here. Allow me to provide at least one person safe passage into the pit.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Have faith- Jump in. I will carry you down slowly.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Take the lead. If we can find any further evidence of the Grootslangs around here, it will aid in my understanding.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Hm? This wall looks like it's been disturbed recently...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I can hear it...but where is it crawling...?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: That's the mother Wyrm! She must be what is making the holes. We need to follow her!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Take the lead.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Ah...ehm, soldier? I've... Um, this is...a bit difficult to say, but...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...do not believe we need to fight, or to kill, here? The creatures are native to here, we are invading their space.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Why should they be attacked for merely existing in their territory? Even if they are animals, I believe that you can solve these problems without killing.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...understand you may not have the same powers as myself... And I, ah...am not free of guilt, either. But I think you could stand to take a peaceful stance.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Even if I am alone on that front...though I understand you are taught differently where you come from. I do not envy you, though I still thank you for your aid thusfar.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Your methods are...disagreeable, but you still have a sense of right to you, I feel... Well, the tunnel diverges here. We'll need to split apart.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'll go to the right, so you ought to continue to the left here. I will meet up with you again soon, hopefully.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Aah! soldier! Don't...don't make any sudden movements.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This Grootslang is uncharacteristically aggressive... She's scared, being so close to the surface. Stay behind me, please.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Do not approach it! The power of the Wyrm is far too much for you!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: W-wait, again? ⓒⓞ-ⓒⓞⓢⓐ- Aah, MOVE!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: soldier!! You're unharmed, yes? She's scared and in pain!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I have to get it right this time... I'm going to talk her down, stay there!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You must be calm, I beg you. Retreat to the earth- You harm those above!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The earth rotting... I take full responsibility, but does the grass above not rot also?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I wish to soothe your pain, but you must allow me to aid you- You must listen!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What does this violence solve? Be calm, please!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: soldier, it won't budge... There's something in its mind rejecting me. Distract it- but don't approach! It will kill you if you get close. Just...be loud!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: AIYEE! soldier! Hold on in there!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Can you hear me?! I'll get her to...to...s-something! Spit you up, I don't know! Just...please, d-don't die!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: W-We have... We have not laid a blow against you! It is not right for you to do the same!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You would wound and consume everything in your rage? Even knowing the consequences?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Your hunger cannot be sated with this fruitless destruction! I beg of you, let them out!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You know th- W-wait...where did you... AAAH!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...y-you... soldier... I...y-you're still alright? I...*hic* I...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I tried...w-why does no one listen to me? Why won't a-anything change for me?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: She...she's been eating dark parasites. They're wracking her insides and h-hurting her head...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...i-it's so d-dark... I c-can't breathe... This...th-this can't be the end...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...n-no, I can't die in here... I-I'm needed still... You're n-needed still! I... I...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I n-need... Or... O-Or... C-Concentrate, Lari... You can do this...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: LET US OUT! LET US OUT OF HERE! DON'T LET US DIE LIKE THIS! I'M BEGGING YOU, PLEASE!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I...oh no... It's...d-d... I... I j-just... I just w-wanted out... Ohhh...n-no...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...w-we're...leaving. I...I c-can't look at this any more...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I... That's...m-my fault...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'm...I'm so sorry, soldier. If I'd...I don't... I don't even know what else I could have d-done...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: There...it didn’t feel like there was...anything left to it... But, if I’d just been quicker, then... Would it...would it even have made a difference?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...some savior I am... I need to be better, but what else even is there that...ugh, I'm going in circles...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Let's... Let's just leave...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I...I can't believe this. This is...does destiny just hate me? What have I done to deserve this?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The Mother Wyrm laid eggs... Eggs infested with parasites! Every single one is going to be born berserk!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You saw how strong the mother was...an infestation like this could cause the entire region of Gavel to collapse in a quake...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: They...they need to be stopped, but...I can't do it. I c-can't kill... I'm sorry, I just can't!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Bring a group... Even Whelps can be a terror if they're enraged. Just...p-please, take care of this quickly.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You deserve the best... But that's more than I can give...so here. Take these. I'll move along.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...oh. Soldier, you're back. Ehm...I have to say, I'm...rather busy at the moment.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I have...important things to do. This accursed Decay...I have to end it. This all needs to stop.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I am thankful for your aid with the...the Grootslang, but I do not believe you will be able to help with this- Simply a matter of scale.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I apologize, but I need to focus on my task here. If, perhaps, you could come back another time? And, I do mean that sincerely...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I can't even recall how many attempts this will make...but all my knowledge has gone into this. This must work.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I suppose I can't fault you for being curious. You may have seen a large, dark-looking patch of ground on your way here- I am trying to tend to it once more.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It is...the most obvious stain of the decay, and very intense...if I can scrub this out, the rest should follow.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This concoction of mine should...do the trick!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It...it's working!! I can feel it, the land is reacting positively!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...I... It was...it was working, a-and... Agh, why can't I get this RIGHT?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: How many decades have I been doing this? How much time have I wasted, just...flailing like this?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Look, Soldier, I...I don't know what you expect to do against this. The Wyrm was one thing, but...this is beyond your comprehension.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I think you sh... Should...w-what is... Now, of all times? As I fail?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The road, look! He's contacting me! A-are you finally giving me the answers I've asked for?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I have to follow the trail! I...I have to know what he's telling me!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I followed you seeking answers...and here, I am presented with more questions. Why did he bring us here?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This gate has appeared, immovable and impassable, since the moment that...that everything started.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I don't...is he trying to remind me of what's at stake? Did he want to show y- No, that's...he wouldn't know you...but then, what IS this about?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Rrgh... ANSWER ME! PLEASE! I've begged you for so long to answer!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You gave me my task and your light but never told me what to DO! I've tried everything I can think of!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Tell me! Please, just t-tell me already!! I don't know how much longer I can stand this!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...a-another one? Where are you leading me now?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It...the gateway...? Are you...I can't understand! Why this, again?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You showed me this before... At first, when you first contacted me. I made the choice...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Must I make it again? Is that it, do I need to prove myself to you once more?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...what? You...you present me with this, but refuse to let me do what you want?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Soldier...please, can you investigate the doorway? There must be something wrong that I don't understand.
My pulse... Human. I must inquire to you. I present you a test. Guide your attention to those you see.
I must see the rhythm your heart beats. Listen well.

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.line: This has gone far enough. I can't do this anymore! I can't give you any more and I refuse to apologize for it!

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: You know our deal. Remember what good you are doing by following the plans I've laid out for you.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Are you going to let your emotions cloud your judgment? You're a smarter man than that, Mr. Mayor.

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.line: You can't possibly believe that throwing away the lives of innocent people is right! I can't go on with this on my conscience!

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.line: Detective Hart WILL be hearing from me, and he'll be hearing everything. We can't keep sacrificing our own like this!

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Our golems have single-handedly turned the tide of the Humans' corruption war. You would save ten here and sentence a thousand to die overseas?

lines.speaker: Mayor
lines.line: You're a sick, twisted man, Urelix. I will not abide by this a moment longer.
My pulse, you must decide. Three paths diverge upon your road.
You may leave. The rays of fate will see to destiny unfolding.
You may end this ''Mayor's'' life. Blood upon your hands in many ways.
You may end the life of Urelix. Heartbeats ceased by a bleeding heart.
Which way does your heart beat? How will you cast your light? Can you see?
My pulse... The blood of a bleeding heart has poisoned me. Even if you believe the sun should shine elsewhere, you must direct it yourself.
You must realize what is needed. You must see light through my lens.
To leave... As destiny unfolds, the sun shall set.
To end this ''Mayor's'' life... To snuff out one whose heart aches is painful.
To end the life of Urelix... The shadows of war shall engulf all.
My pulse, there is only one choice. You must do what is required, I beg of you.

lines.speaker: Dr. Urelix
lines.line: Ah, you recognize necessity. That couldn't have been pleasant...but what's needed isn't pleasant, in the end.
My pulse, you are worthy!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I didn't think you would be able to help, but I had to ask. So...was this for nothing?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait...y-you...had a choice? He gave you the choice too?! A-Already?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wh- I don't understand! You...you just arrived to Gavel! You haven't seen its decline! Felt its pain!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What did you do?! The gate is opening? YOU did this?! I know your heart is in the right place, but you’re a stranger to this land!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...I...rrrgh... AAAAGH!! This isn't fair!! I've worked for decades and the light just...throws me to the wayside?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: PLEASE! Just let me in!
My pulse, you must leave her be. Her heart's emotions have overpowered her mind's judgement. She must learn to separate them as you have.
My pulse, you must leave her be. Her heart's emotions have overpowered her mind's judgement. She must learn to separate them as you have.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Please... You can't DO this to me!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Why do you want this human to enter the Taproot?! What's special about them, what's their connection? What have they done that I haven't?! Tell me, please! Let me be useful!!
Your heartbeat beats in time with mine. Your mind is unclouded, despite the fury you have been steeped in. My pulse, you are needed.
Your eyes cannot see the scope of the realms. You must allow me to shed light upon them- You must see the connections.
Light... Dark... We oppose. I am light. It is dark. Our places reflect this land...and it is plain- The sun is setting. Light is fading.
The land you visit warps with the slow siphoning of my light, my blood. It becomes outlandish and strange-Oppressive and alien.
As dusk approaches- As darkness spreads- My heart slows and stops. My pulse, you are needed. You shall be as one with me, and you shall see.
The Realm of Light needs life anew- A new p ulse. It needs you.
Our light is synchronous! You may see what I must have you see...
Follow the road. You must witness the reason behind my trial.
See my memories. The memories of the realm. See...and be enlightened.
Witness it... The Equinox.  Learn why you are needed, my pulse.
Witness it. The vile emergence...
Witness the beginning of decay.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: My light...I won't let you down!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You! You don't belong here!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wah! Back away, I don't want to hurt you!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I can do this... Orphion, lend me your voice!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Return to your realm in peace!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Your power is blinded by light. You cannot win!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Peace, strange creature! You must be peaceful!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Why isn't this working? Even Orphion's voice...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It's scarring the land... I need to end this, quickly...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: His light... This power... I can do this!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The embodiment of light supports me!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You cannot fight the focus of pure light!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Be done! I bind you with Orphion's light!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait...it...it's n-not holding?!
Lari... A conflicted heart failed to channel my light. She refused to battle.
The vile intruder was weak... But every opportunity to strike, exchanged for words to the deaf.
My pulse... it pains me. Her light simply fails to shine where it is needed, and so we are here.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I... I...hope you'll forgive me, soldier. My anger wasn't with you. I...j-just...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I work for untold years, trying to save this province, to save a Realm... All to so little avail. To the sound of silence from the one I'm trying to help.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: And then, you appear, and... I still haven't ever been in there. I'd...I'd ask what it was like, but it's...probably private, right?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: At...at least I have an ally now, r-right? But...I'm afraid that... N-no, it's silly, you don't need to hear me fretting.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I... I promise I can still be useful. I'll... I'll find a way. I promise you. I'll...get out of your way, for now.

quests.name: Realm of lights 3 - A headless history

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Oi, you there! With the small nose and whatnot! I got somethin' to ask you. Got a minute?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Good, you're good people. It's about our neighbor, Referick. He's a bit of a conspiracy nut. You know the type, villager illuminati, Wybels are evil, all that?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: He's acting proper strange though, the past few days. Thinkin' a lord of time's draggin' creatures from other dimensions doesn't make ya stop eatin' or drinkin'.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: He'll talk your ear off about it if you give him half a chance, but he ain't sayin' a word to me, even when I tried askin' about his theories.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Somethin's definitely wrong about him, that much's for sure. Could ya take a look for me, see whatcha can figure out and all?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: He lives in the house next to the pile of rocks. He's got screws loose but I don't want 'im dyin' on me, yeah?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Oi! Any luck with ol' Rick there?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: ...hm. Dang it...y'know, maybe there's somethin' here that'll tell us what in heck happened.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Let's look around the house for anythin' he mighta been workin' on. Maybe he finally fiddled with somethin' he shouldn'ta fiddled with?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Whassat you're lookin' at there? The castle? Don't see why he'd be pointin' this ol' telescope that way.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: You're human, so you wouldn't know, but somethin' like two hundred years ago, an elf of all people lived in that castle. Called 'imself Dullahan, wore a helmet a lot, I think.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: People thought he was the reason for the Decay- can't imagine why, personally, and obviously they weren't right.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: ...hm. Y'know, there's some ghost stories about Dullahan still livin' in that castle... Come to think of it, I think Referick mentioned a theory about it.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Barely remember what it was about cause of how many crackpots he's stuck his head into, but it's somethin' about a ghost. 's the only lead I can think of, anyways...

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: The castle door's locked, but you can access the basement. Think you could try lookin' over there? That's all I got.
...an unfamiliar soul? Strange. I have not brought you here. I do not know of you.
What an odd feeling... I haven't felt confusion in a long time. How refreshing...still, I shall ask you to leave.
Excuse you. I asked you to leave, strange person. You would ignore my request?
Such an action is rather insolent, not to mention...interesting. Still, interfering with my business is inexcusable.
Demons of the Prison Guard, I compel you to execute this interloper. Trap their soul for my perusal later.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: OI! Referick!! Wait for me! Ain'tcha need some food and drink first?!

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: The heck did you do?! Referick just bolted out the door like he forgot his wallet or somethin'!

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: C'mon mate, you got up and moved for the first time in days and now you're clammin' up again? Speak to me!

lines.speaker: Referick
lines.line: WROOOOOAAAAAARRR!!! I'M ALIIIIIVE!!

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: YIPE! Never heard 'im scream like that before! Never heard anyone scream like that before! I'd like to never hear anyone scream like that again!

lines.speaker: Referick
lines.line: Oh, shut UP Hans! I nearly had my soul devoured, don't DARE give me any chaff when I was RIGHT all along!!

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: Agh, alright, alright! Quiet, my ears are ringin'! I'll listen, I'll listen, just quiet!

lines.speaker: Referick
lines.line: I knew the disappearances in Gelibord weren't just because of the risen bodies. People were being left catatonic!! That doesn't happen randomly!

lines.speaker: Referick
lines.line: It's Dullahan, I swear on my life! I figured him out and he came after me! He's devouring peoples' souls and siphoning their energy for himself!

lines.speaker: Referick
lines.line: He's acting from within the castle somehow- Ghostly hands and servants, I'll bet! And that means there's a chance to stop him, if he has to act indirectly!

lines.speaker: Referick
lines.line: We need to round up the townsfolk, the guards, the military, EVERYONE! We have to storm the castle and stop him before he's able to escape!

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: ...criminy, you really bit the big one, didn'tcha...look, if he's tryin' to eat people's souls, wouldn't it be smarter to NOT have a huge mob?

lines.speaker: Referick
lines.line: Wait, wh-what do you mean?! Shouldn't everyone be on high alert? Won't we have a better chance of swarming him all at once?

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: He'd have a whole mob of people ready to take from in that case. Sending in one, heavily-armed person, or a small group'd be better.

lines.speaker: Hans
lines.line: And, well...a heavily-armed human just rescued ya, Ricky. I think we leave this to 'em. How about it, human? Head up to the castle and look into this for us?
The interesting soul arrives once more. Why is it you valued the life of that villager? You risked yourself for his soul.
It will not make a difference one way or the other, and so I am doubly confused. The feeling has already grown tiresome.
What purpose have you in this place? Turn over your soul so I may examine it and find out. I am genuinely curious to know...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Be done! I bind you with Orphion's light!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait...it...it's n-not holding?!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: LARIII! Where are you?! I can help!!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Ugh, I saw her with that...THING, but...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: My visions didn't show an exact enough spot... LARIII?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I...what is... What left the land scarred like this?!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Was...was this their clash...? L-LARI! LARIIII! WHERE ARE YOU?!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: You are NOT dying on me! I won't allow it! You will LIVE, you hear me?!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Sit as still as you can, I have healing spells prepared.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I ask the land for its life to save another. Grant me this!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Dullahan!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Oh, what am I going to do with you...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Once again you ignore my demands...? And not only that, you invade the memories I have locked away?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I must ask again, what is your goal? Why have you come here, and why do you seek my most private thoughts, that not even I wish to think?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Look, Dulla, I really do appreciate your help, but you know I can't do what you're asking of me! There's another way, I just need to find it!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Lari, you remember that I have my visions, right? I've seen what will happen if you don't step up- and I can help stop it!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: You've been trying to find ''another way'' for two centuries. Don't you think it's high-time we took my route, before things get worse?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: NO! I am not going to kill it! YOU are not going to kill it! I'll find a way! I will, I have these powers for a reason!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: You talk a big game, and you show one too, but the creature wasn't fazed. I'm not fazed. Drop the intimidating act, please.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...there...there has to be a way. I...I-I'm terrified that I've...already ruined everything, just by following my heart, like I was told...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I know you're frustrated, but I am too. I left a lot behind to try and help you. I hate to say these things, I wish it could be your way.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I'm terrified too, that if we don't take more drastic action, things will get worse. Can't you see that, too?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...I just... I don't know what to do!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: He showed me all these things and gave me all these choices and asked how my heart beat!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: He gave me these powers but they don't work or I don't know HOW they work!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I want to do the right thing but I don't know what it is and I don't know how to ask what it is and...a-and...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: You have become infuriating instead of interesting. Why do you violate my memories? Why do you force me to relive them?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Spirit of the Keeper of Keys, rid me of this thing that befouls my place. It incites a rage akin to HER.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: You...are a fool. More than I was. You knowingly walk to your death.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: It is convenient for me, certainly, but I admit that it is equal parts enraging and bewildering.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I told you, Lari! I saw it in my visions, this is our last chance! Hurry!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Look at this spot, Lari. It has to be here. The land is being scarred, just like after your fight. The light is being drained!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This must be where the parasite burrowed down... You're... You're right. We have to...to do something.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I... I'm not sure if I'm ready, but you're right. We need to do this...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: ...Remember what I said. You HAVE to take action. There's only two outcomes here.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Right...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: We'll need to dig... Do you think you could help with that, Dulla?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Of course, Lari. We'll need everything we can get if we're going to kill that horrendous thing.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...let's get this over with.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I see it! Lari, it's time!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: ...I will show you an exit, interloper. It would be...wise of you to take it.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: You are a damned fool, interloper. Dredging my memories as you have... I have never felt such rage, not in a long time.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: As such, it shall end now. The exit I spoke of will not free you from the castle, as you can see.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Instead, it will free you from your very life. I have had enough of your meddling.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Warden of Wisdom! I compel you- Rid me of this miscreant! Erase every trace of it from this existence...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: ...save for a corpse, for me to toss at Lari's feet.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: GAH! It was never able to do this before...! W-What happened to it?!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: AWAY! You keep away from us!!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Lari, you need to get up, now! We can't waste this chance!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It...it threw me aside like nothing! How is it overpowering Orphion's light...?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: It's overpowering you because you're not a ttacking! Remember what I said? You have to-

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: ...wait, where did it...did we lose it already?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It's under you! MOVE!!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: It's shrugging my attacks off, Lari! Come on, do SOMETHING!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I...No! It's happening just like I saw! She's...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I need to get to her, push her to the killing blow...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Be still, creature! I compel you with Orphion's light!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: LARIIII! THIS IS THE LAST CHANCE YOU HAVE! DON'T TRAP IT, KILL IT!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I-I'm...Dulla, I'm- I can't! I know I can keep it held this time!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...wha...N-no!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...I-I...th-the light is...I c-can't hold onto it...i-is it...it's t-taking...g-guh...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Lari! You can't reason with it! You can't hold it! You have to put Gavel first! US first!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I won't let what you predicted happen! I know I can change fate!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Please work, please work! D-Don't break, I can't-

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Lari, no! If it bites you we're doomed! GET UP!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: AAAH, GET AWAY FROM HER!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: D-Dulla!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: L-Lari...we...e-everything happened like I s-said...you...you didn't...l-listen...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: No! No it didn't happen like you said! I-I can fix this! Y-You'll be alright! You'll be alright, you hear me?! I'll make sure of it!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: ...so I am cursed to bear witness to my most painful memories due to your idiocy. It is almost a fitting penance... Almost, but not quite.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: My rage... My memories... Your presence stirs them in kind. You must disappear, I no longer care to see your soul.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Sit still and allow yourself to be engulfed. It will save me further pain.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Lari...? Where are you? I...I need you... Why are you gone? Why do you ignore me?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: My magic is fading, I can't see my visions... They're clearer around you... Please, come back...

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: That elf girl's off in the forest. Don't know what she's doing but this is our shot!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: We can finally execute the person causing the decay in the forest! Gelibord will be saved!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: You prepared the sleeping spell, right? Who knows if we'll get a chance like this again.

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: Shhh... Quiet. He's in there.

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: Okay, go! Knock him out.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: L-Lari? Is...is that you? Did you finally come back...?

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: Nah, not quite. Say, why don't you go to sleep 'til she comes back? Dream sweet dreams...

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: ...they'll be the last ones you ever have, grimy demon. To the guillotine with you... Everyone! I got him!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: All of you, welcome! Today will be the day we save our fair land. Today's the day of light!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: Dullahan has been captured! We have the cursed progenitor of the decay in our grip- to be executed, once and for all!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: Haha, yeah! Shoulda thought twice before cursing OUR homes! Three cheers for our wizards!!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: The decay will clear up- We'll spill his blood, chop off his head, and the curse will be lifted!!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: Ladies and gentlemen, folks of all shapes and sizes, it's time to take our lives back!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Dullahan? I'm...I'm back. I didn't leave you for long, I just was trying to find the cu-

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...uh? Dullahan? He's...he's been right here to greet me almost every day for the past twenty years...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Footprints...? Dullaaaa? Where'd you go? Is everything alright, did something happen?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: D-Dulla...ha...I... Wh...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I... H-how could they...d-do this...?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...I l-left for...an hour, a-and...and they... Why?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Why did they do this to you...? I...h-how can I possibly fix this?!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I cannot understand why you continue to defile me with these horrid memories. What do you hope to find?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: I am once more curious. If only to know what I could possibly do or say to cease this horrid quest you've given yourself.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Th-this has to work. It WILL work! I know it will! I...I d-don't know if it will... I have to fix this, I have to...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The waters from the Lazarus Pit are fabled for bringing back the dead... If this doesn't work, I...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I can't think about that. This...this WILL work. I promise. I found a way to fix it... It has to.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: P-Please...w-whatever gods are out there, whoever is listening, hear me...bring Dullahan back to me, I'm begging you...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It's... I-Is it reacting? It... It looks like it is, but...h-he's not mending...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: N-No, this...i-it isn't...NO! It... It HAS to work! I...I can m-make this work!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: D-Dullahan! It...it worked! You're back!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I...I t-told you... I knew I could change fate... I'm so glad you're here...

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: It's odd. If it were not for her, I would not be here. I would not have my power. Yet even thinking her name enrages me.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Dullahan? I...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: H...h-hrk...g-gah, what is...wh-what... You...you didn't really...?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Th-there's so much death... The...the air smells like b-blood...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This isn't... There has to be s-some other reason, I... I can't have b-brought back a...a...

lines.speaker: Gelibord Citizen
lines.line: P-Please, we can't afford to lose more people! There's hardly any farmers in the fields anymore, I-I'm needed elsewhere!

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: The last few said similar things. Someone else I knew said similar things. Frankly, I do not care. Present your soul to me, now.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: DULLAHAN! What...w-what are you doing?! I... I can't believe my eyes...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I... I tried to help you! I t-tried so hard at everything we did together... How could you do this to them?! To...to me?

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: Odd. I recall you explicitly denying the only option that would have prevented this. I warned you quite thoroughly.

lines.speaker: Dullahan
lines.line: You have had many chances to end this, Lari. Do you expect me to feel sympathy, when your own actions have made me feel nothing?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This...this isn't like you... You would never have done this before! You dedicated your life to trying to help...so w-why are you...m...m-m... I-I'm leaving!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What have I done...? This...he's... He's not th-the same anymore... What changed? Is this my fault...? I c-can't understand it...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...but...I'll... I'll protect them. I'll protect him... I...there has to be a way. But...until I find it...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...goodbye. Goodbye until the day comes when I can fill you with light once more. Goodbye until you learn... Goodbye, until I can fix you...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Goodbye, Dullahan... I'll miss you.
At this moment...I believed that I could protect her. I believed that I could aid her.
I left Aldorei behind, to aid in her ''battle'' against the darkness. What a fool I was.
As the darkness slowly seeped into the land, her stubbornness halted any progress we might have made.
Years of searching to no avail- A strong enough attack would have ended it, but her foolish pacifism doomed us.
Six hundred years of searching finally brought us to what we so foolishly sought... And we were unprepared.
The creature was found hibernating underground... It had been storing power, and we found ourselves utterly outmatched.
She had the power and the opportunity to kill it ten times over, but clung to her morals. She could not recognize necessity, and refused to heed my offers and warnings.
And so, my dark agony began. The light began to siphon away from me. I found myself paranoid and addled, fearful that my disfigurement would be seen.
Even still I held some misplaced faith in her. With that dark seed in my mind... It grew to an obsession, almost- I had to hide it. I had to hide my curse. But it was found...
The people of Gelibord saw my cursed visage... They saw me near the dark scars. They assumed without thought, and turned me into a perfect scapegoat.
Not even death saw the end of my misfortunes. Not even a final release such as this could save me from Lari's stubbornness and endless mistakes.
She brought me back...but the dark infection had eroded away my mind, my soul, my magic, and it continued to ravage my body. Every part of me, the dark touched.
Her soft light burned in me, as the darkness quashed it and filled in the emptiness that it had created. I was there...but you could not say I was the same person.
I could feel nothing. She still made me feel...but only annoyance. Rage. Sorrow. I could not bear to be with her a moment longer.
There is no fixing this. Her actions are doomed to failure, just as I saw. She has not returned since this time... And so she did not realize that her actions have done little.
The very powers she bestowed me with, knowingly or not...allow me to command spirits as I wish. To have those who doomed me to this purgatory feel the same aches as I have.
To have their minds, bodies, and souls wracked. To have their magic outlawed and wither in disuse.
Each soul I consume fills me with new strength. And none can reach me- Lari herself saw to that. Would she have taken action, had she known?
There is truly, finally, nothing more for you here. The spell can not be broken, as of now. You have seen my life laid bare in front of you. There is nothing more for you to see.
Leave. And do not return.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Awaken! Your guidance is needed!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...ah. soldier. So you are needed here too, then?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I am... TRYING... To awaken the Guardian of the Forest to receive its guidance, but it refuses to budge! Even the voice of Orphion provides no reaction.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I beg once more of you, awaken! Us two... Us two seek your wisdom!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I present you Orphion's barest light- Please, respond!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Urgh... See? Nothing is happening. I'm at a loss of what to do. Maybe you can effect some change, considering what you've done before.
