My pulse, it is time. I shall shine my light upon the roots of the Guardian. You and she must learn now.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: An inscription! That wasn't there before! It was... That was completely instant. How did you even...?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: But, still! I knew I could be useful, let me translate this for you! As a stranger to Gavel you wouldn't know High Gavellian...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It says... Secrets uncovered in the oldest of libraries in Cinfras.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...of course. A place that Elves aren't allowed, but humans are. soldier, you'll have to find this library on your own, it seems.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Do you reject the light of Orphion? Waken, please!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Urgh... soldier, please tell me you were able to make some progress. The Guardian still refuses... To... WAKE!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What is this? A spell scroll- Of the Waking Forest?! In Cinfras, of all places? Where it would have been... Impossible for me to go...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: So I am Orphion's chosen, yet I would not have been able to do what was asked of me. That... No, I can't dwell on that, let me see the scroll.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...hm. It says, The seeker must rest these words upon those of the Guardian.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I suppose that means you need to place it by the inscription. So yet another task that you must finish...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...go on, then, do it. I'm just needed here to be a translator for you thusfar, it seems.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Let me go ahead and read this, too. This will be tedious, I fear...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It says... Awakening the Guardian of the Forest requires more than just magic. The home of the elves will house the answers and revelations...?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: That... This is finally my time! I still have a hand in this!! Finally, I can do something more than just holding stasis here!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Listen, soldier. Achara... This is my time. I can finally help you more directly. I know the elders of Aldorei- They're sure to have answers!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You truly have been helpful, even through my own worries. I must thank you, but you can relax now! I will be the one this time!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You can continue doing...whatever else it is you need doing. I have seen you helping in various places- Concern yourself with those for now. I can handle this.
Pursue her, my pulse. She must take dire action- Alone, her light shall illuminate nothing. You must provide her direction.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: W-What? You- Why did you follow me? I can handle this! I can finally be useful again! Do you...not trust me?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Please, just respect my wishes! If I need your help, I'll go find you- For now, just leave! You don't need to worry about this!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Get out! Just...get out.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: ...if this human has truly done what you have said, then why do you spurn their aid? It is unlike you.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I know, I know. I just am in disbelief. They've been contacted by Orphion himself, allowed into the Taproot, they have a symbol of Orphion's blessing!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: They just...walked up, after a thousand years of my putting my entire life into trying to save this province, and do everything I couldn't, in the span of weeks at most!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Do you understand how infuriating this is? Can you comprehend such a thing, not having been in my position yourself?

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: No. I cannot understand. But I also cannot understand how you are not grateful for this aid.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I know I should be! It's all I've been able to think about. I should be ecstatic! The light will be saved, it should be everything I've dreamed of...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: But it makes me feel like a complete failure. Like everything I have done has been for naught, that I have somehow been doing everything wrong!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I know I have made mistakes. Dullahan would still be... Still be himself, if I had taken faster action, but I can't have done nothing right. I can't accept that.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This is my chance to prove I can still be useful- that Orphion choosing me wasn't a fluke! Please, the inscription said you would know where to go!

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: ...even after a millennium, there is so very much for us all to learn. Fine then.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: But promise me to accept the aid you receive. This opportunity cannot be wasted, Lari.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I have to do at least one thing right. I can't just keep up this holding pattern. I'll do whatever is necessary!

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: You must seek the Canned Abis plant, then. It rests within a cavern shaded by giant fern leaves.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Thank you. I can finally do what I was meant to do! I won't let anything stop me this time!!

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: ...Human, I can see you. Consider yourself lucky that she did not. Come talk to me.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: So you are Orphion's new chosen, then. It is both surprising and not- Humans have an interesting reputation.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: Often said as being able to get anything done, without limits, be it completing impossible tasks or breaking moral tenets.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: In this instance, however, you've both to do. Orphion has commanded it, has he not? And so you must, and for that I apologize.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: I have seen Lari's work- And she has done this land a priceless service. Alone, she has kept the Decay from creeping south, and thus the Guardian remains with us.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: However, her own morals prevent the situation from progressing. She cannot kill- And the source must be exterminated for light to once again fill the land.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: Orphion's circumstances are dire- And so you must come to understand something. He is above us, in terms of morals. Such concepts do not apply to him.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: As the embodiment of Light itself, he has no sense of morals- Merely survival and stasis. What he asks of us, many will balk at.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: It is a matter where morals must be set aside... And such a thing is one that Lari cannot abide by, for she has stubbornly clung to them for a thousand years.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: To break them... I will admit, I believe there to be some other way to solve these problems, but the fact of the matter is there simply is no time left.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: She must use the extent of her powers, and while she retains her pacifism that will not happen. I must ask you to follow her, as Orphion would wish.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: There is, unfortunately, no right to this. There is simply necessity- And there, you must push her to her limits. Seek the cave of the Canned Abis.

lines.speaker: Elder
lines.line: It is north-east from here. The entrance is shaded by giant fern leaves. I only pray that this will be enough.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I can't believe this. What am I doing wrong? What is it? There has to be some reason, what IS it?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: There's not another inscription...it's just the same words! What does it mean by ‘’dire actions?!‘’ I've done everything I can think of!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Is- Is this not dire enough? Is poring over you and putting aside my role and pride to someone else not EXTREME enough?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...soldier. I. I have to know. What did Orphion tell you, exactly? I can't stand not knowing any longer. Did he really replace me?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I can't think of any other reason why everything for me has just...stopped working. Did he? Please, tell me-

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...wait... You... You have Canned Abis on you!! Where did you get that?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You... There's no way you would've known that unless you... YOU! You eavesdropped on me!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You FOLLOWED ME into the cave even after I asked not to! You... After everything I said!! After you heard all those private thoughts!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You STILL decided it was a good idea to come after me! What are you planning to accomplish like this?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What, are you thinking ‘’oh, let's follow the funny elf girl and see her FAIL, OVER and OVER AGAIN!?‘’ IS THAT IT?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You heard me then!! It's ALL out in the open! I can't succeed! You're there! You're doing everything I couldn't!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'm NOT a failure! I'm not! I won't be! I refuse to be! You don't GET to watch me flounder and flail!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I DON'T CARE ANYMORE! STOP STEALING MY LIFE LIKE THIS!!!

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: YOU HAVE GONE FAR ENOUGH!

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: This is enough, Lari. I waken. And thus, your task is complete, soldier. You have done as Orphion asked.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wha- I... What just... What did I...?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I j-just... I nearly...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...GRAAAAAUGH!! TELL ME HOW THIS IS ‘’ENOUGH!‘’ TELL ME, NOW!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I-I NEARLY KILLED THEM! I JUST BROKE AND DEFILED EVERYTHING I'VE EVER STOOD FOR!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: TELL ME!! HOW COULD THIS POSSIBLY BE THE ANSWER?! HOW COULD THIS BE WHAT NEEDED TO HAPPEN?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: WHY WOULD I BE NEEDED TO... To...

lines.speaker: Guardian of The Forest
lines.line: To do something ‘’dark,‘’ you are about to say, and to that I say you have not.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: T-Trying to murder them because they did what I couldn't isn't dark? How can you possibly think that?!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What kind of guardian are you, permissing this kind of violence? How is anything I just did alright?

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: For a thousand years or more of your own thoughts, I understand that you are conflicted.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: However... You have, in that time, made a grave error. You have grown to realize an incorrect assumption.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Dark and Light... They oppose. They clash. They create a cloying pox. But, allow me to ask.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Is the axe evil for chopping the tree? Is the wood evil for resisting the metal?

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Are the flames evil for burning up the leaves? Is the water evil for dousing the fire?

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Is a victim evil for striking back against those that have struck them?

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: And most importantly... Are any of these things light, or dark?

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: What connection does a primordial force have with the moral leanings of mortals- or even immortals?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...you. You can't possibly be saying that what I did was the right thing to do. I refuse to accept that.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: I will not ask you to. You must understand that Orphion has no moral bearings- He simply needs action.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: What you have done may not have been the right thing, by anyone's account. However, it was necessary. You have thrown off your bonds, in a sense.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...then... Shouldn't I feel... I don't know. Shouldn't I feel less restrained? Less afraid? More... More free?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: If what I've done was what needed to happen, why do I feel like the scum of the earth? Why do I feel so terrible?!

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: I admit, such a thing is a conundrum. I agree that it is a tragedy to kill, in many instances.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Yet when such an action could save the lives of others, it becomes a conundrum with no answer. An impossible value to weigh.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Despite the circumstances, you have done the best you could. I cannot fault you for your thoughts and morals.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: And so... As you are now proven, as I am awoken, the gateway to the Light shall reveal itself to you. Lari... You must prepare for your journey to the Realm of Light.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...I... I need time to process this. I... Do you understand how difficult this is to hear? To bear?

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: I do not blame you for it. By the time you have composed yourself, your ally will be ready. Understand that they are as necessary as you are.

lines.speaker: Guardian of The Forest
lines.line: For now, soldier must learn what you have learned, of the nature of realms. They must know what you know if they are to aid you fully.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: I must ask you to pay close attention. I shall present it simply- though the enormity of this cannot be understated.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Allow me to show you our reality, soldier. It is difficult to properly present its scale... So here is an approximation.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: This is our world, the world we stand in right now. The physical plane of existence.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Only a select few are aware that there is more of the world than this. Even the astronomers and those who view the enormity of the sky cannot understand.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: For, you see, this realm, this plane- It is mirrored upon a second plane, as the embodiments of Realms clash.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: This is the Plane of Influence, comprised of many realms. There are three you must know- But only one you must pay attention to.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: The Realms of Influence are connected to the physical plane, tied inexorably so to it. This is why even those gazing at the cosmos cannot grasp the enormity of it.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: These realms are in a constant push and pull- Battles that could not be seen by those of this world, waged constantly.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: However, they can be felt. Wide-scale changes to the balance of one realm or another are reflected on the physical plane.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: The Realms of Influence are, themselves, reflections of a Beast- They themselves, a physical manifestation of their realm, as their realm is a manifestation of them.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: So surely, you must know- As Gavel has decayed, it must mean that the Realm of Light is in peril, and thus that Orphion is, as well.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: The Light is infected- That abominable parasite has breached the Realm of Light, and sought Orphion to leech away his light.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: And so, as the sun is forced to set, the land of Gavel grows dark. As the dark parasites spread and devour the minds of those here, so too is Orphion subject to this torture.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: The balance shifts, and Orphion grows weary. Angered, desperate. He called to you as a last plea- and you have done admirably, for what he has asked of you.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Now, you must enter the Realm of Light, and aid Lari in purging the parasite, before its work is finished and Orphion's mind is consumed.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: You must ready yourself before this, of course. To venture to another realm is a lofty task.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: I will bestow upon you two things that will surely aid you in this, however. First, I shall provide you the way to the Gateway to Light.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Once you have reached it, I shall bestow upon you a personal blessing of mine, in the hopes that your path will become clear.

lines.speaker: Guardian of the Forest
lines.line: Enter the portal, soldier. I shall show you the Gateway to Light... And I shall wish you luck.
My pulse, your light is brilliant... It has shone upon Lari, and soon her light will shine my way...
Enter the roots, and witness the path to my realm. And then, prepare yourself. Muster your most blinding light...

quests.name: Realm of light 5 - the realm of light

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: soldier... Achara... I do not believe I can ever atone for what I have done to you. An apology simply isn't enough.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: As infuriating as what you did was, you were following orders... I had every right to be angry, but to try and take your life was ten steps too far.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Even though it is not enough, I will say I am sorry for the pain I caused you. The Guardian was right, in the end.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Without you carrying out Orphion's will, we would not be here. You truly are necessary in this, and I believe I have finally made peace with that.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It has been a long time since I had a partner willing to help me in this way. I was unused to it, I suppose... Still.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: If  you'll be willing to aid me, it would be a great relief. It has been a thousand years since I entered the Realm of Light...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I can only hope things have not changed much. I remember how it was, right down to the last petal...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait a moment, soldier. I have one more thing I would like to say before we enter.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I... I need to thank you. For helping, as you have. For staying by me as you have. There was one other before you like that...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I promise that you will not meet the same fate as him. I will fight with you to the bitter end, achara.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It's time, then. To visit Orphion.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Welcome to the Realm of Light then, soldier. Once you've re-oriented yourself, come over here.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It's so much smaller than it used to be! There used to be many more landmasses, all connected to each other...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I feel... I feel everything in here. With Orphion's light, I can tap into the very core of the realm.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: And I can feel disturbances. There are dark creatures here, where there should be none!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I mean, even look at this creature. The light emanating from it is-

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait. Wh... Why is it attacking you!?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Its mind was addled by darkness. Poor thing was terrified... Nothing for it though.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I suppose your more ruthless nature is a good thing, in this case. We each will need to fight, if this is as widespread as it feels.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'll have to prepare myself for that... Being willing to take action will not make it any easier on my conscience.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: But I will set that aside, until the day this all becomes a memory. We'll both need to seek the Nexus of Light, Orphion's home. Follow me!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I should have expected this. With the connections severed, of course the bridge to the Nexus would be gone.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This must be because of that horrid parasite... The Guardian of the Forest informed me of the situation afterwards.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The gap may be too far for me to carry you over... Is there a way I can bypass this, I wonder?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Perhaps I can try to bridge the gap myself. Let's see if this will work.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...hm. That ought to have worked! Is the Nexus too far to reach?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: There has to be some way over... Maybe the direct method is- Hm? Another creature?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: This one doesn't seem hostile, soldier... I'll try and talk with it.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Its mind is whole, but it's wary of your presence. You should stay back, just in case.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: So tell me, achara. What is it you sought me for?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Ahh, I see. You wish to see your master once more as well...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The monoliths? Are they what's severed the connections?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Ahh, I understand. I assure you, we will fix this!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It said that the connections to the rest of the realm were severed intentionally by Orphion, in order to protect them.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Two monoliths on this landmass controlled the connections, and they are being drained of their light- As such, they closed the bridges.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The light is still there- But it must be drawn back out. We have our task ahead of us now, achara. We need to go to the first monolith. Follow me!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I never knew the monoliths kept the realm together as they did. You can see that it is inactive, yes?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: There should be bright bands of color going along it, and light pouring from it. This is where we play our roles, Soldier!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It may be getting drained, but there is certainly still light within it, and if that parasite is battling Orphion we should be able to recharge it.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'll tap into the monolith... You'll need to enter it, and find its core. I'll send a part of Orphion's light with you to activate it once you do.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The damage here is minor- Nothing that can't be fixed, thankfully.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Its aura is lowered- Now your soul must enter. I will keep you safe, soldier.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Allow my magic to open your senses... Good luck, achara.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Welcome back, soldier. I had few troubles dealing with the creatures trying to get close. Did you have issues inside?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The light is starting to pulse out from the monolith again, so I would say you've succeeded. I suppose we do make a decent team?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Look! The colours are returning to the monolith! It's definitely reactivated. I'll run ahead and get to the other monolith.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Follow the path! The way there is up the big cliff where we first entered the Realm.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'm unsure if you can feel the light returning from the monolith, but I can. I almost feel reborn, with all this energy!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The rift ahead ought to take us to the second monolith, but it doesn't seem to be working, and I'm unsure why.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: See? It's inert, which is... Odd. These aren't connected to the energy of the monolith.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It shouldn't be inactive as it is. There's some dark influence around here, but I can't seem to place it.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: My only guess is that it's interfering with the rift's energy. I've already scoured the hill though- No dark patches to be seen.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Do you think you could take a second look-

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: ...maybe you won't need to, after all. That was...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The gliders!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Back up! I'll hold them.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: We've found the disturbance... Even beyond this, I'll need to charge the rift with energy to activate it.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Go in peace, tortured ones! Be at one with the light!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Get the rest of them, Soldier! I'll charge the rift!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Thank you, achara. The rift is charged again- Just walk into it!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: The process here should be roughly the same. I bring down the barrier, you enter and charge it with the light I provide.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'll need to focus the energies of the monoliths to reconnect the Nexus of Light to the mainland here, so you'll be alone.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I'll leave a barrier around you. Few creatures live on these cliffs, but best to be certain, of course.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Once you're done, meet me at the cliff near the Nexus. If we're to free Orphion from the parasite, having you along would be a great help.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Good luck, achara. I will see you soon.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Careful, soldier! Step back a moment!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: There. The connection to the Nexus is established, and so we'll cross.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait! Something... Something's not quite right...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Something's emerging from the gate!

lines.speaker: Bak'al
lines.line: Weaklings. You will not interfere.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Interfere?! You're one of the dark!

lines.speaker: Bak'al
lines.line: You. Elf girl. You are to be eliminated.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You're the one trespas sing in realms not your own!

lines.speaker: Bak'al
lines.line: Fool. The Beast quakes with our influence. This land is ours.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: soldier. I think. I found someone. Who deserves to be killed. Help me out?

lines.speaker: Bak'al
lines.line: I will not waste my time with that specimen. Now. Face death.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: soldier!! Stay back! I'm keeping up but he'll destroy you if you get close!!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: AGH, ENOUGH OF THIS! You aren't allowed here, foul thing!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: No! You won't run- I'll kill you before that!

lines.speaker: Bak'al
lines.line: You shall not. Surely your god will smile seeing me leave.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: YOU DON'T GET TO TALK ABOUT ORPHION LIKE THAT!

lines.speaker: Bak'al
lines.line: We have already won. Your peon is outmatched.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It's not over... IT CAN'T BE, DON'T YOU- TAKE THIS!
There's a faint buzzing in your ears...
soldier... I apologize for leaving you like that. I felt like this was my only chance at defeating this plague - by attacking its core.
I have a slight idea of where I'm headed, but... If I'm able to handle him, then maybe I'm powerful enough for this.
I've never been one to say goodbyes, but thank you for everything. I know you'll find people just as strong as you are to rescue Orphion in my place.
I- I see the end of this... Tunnel. There's- Wait...
By the light what is that thing?! S-Stay away f-

lines.speaker: Orphion
lines.line: The delicate stasis was disrupted... And it cannot be blamed solely on the dark itself
9/10orphionrestnowmypulseandprepareforthereisanotherforcewhoyoumustbringtopeace
10/10orphion

lines.speaker: Orphion
lines.line: Enough. My gratefulness does not exceed my patience. Let this act as a warning, my pulse.

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: Oh, you look tough. You must be one of those humans I keep hearing about, right? People talk about your kind all the time.

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: You know, that you're all scrappers. Tough as nails, and willing to kill all sorts of beasts, you know?

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: I think you know what I'm getting at. I saw some massive thing lumbering around the swamp one night! Tall as the trees, it was.

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: I couldn't make out the details, but if its size was any indication, it could just step over the Olux walls and wreck the whole town!

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: Of course, there's so many scam artists around here trying to sell anti-monster underwear or whatever that no one believes me.

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: So, that means it's up to you! Ehm, supposing that you're willing to help out, at least... The one thing I know for sure is that it was eating something.

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: See the blood on the ground? That stuff is fresh. Follow it, see where it leads, and hunt that beast before it does something terrible!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Oh, this is such a mess! And my axe is busted, too...how am I going to get this fixed?!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: I can't pay for- AAAH! H-Human! What do you want?! Not a good time!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Something destroyed my cow pen and wrecked up my entire farm!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: And they were solid, good-quality Willow, too...uff...

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Wait, what? You're hunting the thing? Well, that's fine and dandy, but do you think you could help here first?

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: I have an idea of where it went, so...you scratch my back, I scratch yours?

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Okay, this can work, this can work! I have to figure out how to fix this, and some of my cows ran off in a panic.

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: So, you can take care of them while I re-plan my fencing. Simple enough, right?

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Three of my cows ran off. Look around the farm for them. They were eating, so look for fallen wheat on the ground!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Oh, back aleady? I haven't even finished my stuff, where are the cows?

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: ...eheh. You. You're. This is a joke, right? We're having a chuckle?!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: WE'RE JOKING, RIGHT?! FOR THE LOVE OF ALL THAT'S HOLY TELL ME THIS IS A JOKE!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: WHAT IS THIS?! ARE YOU BRAINDEAD?!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: NO, WAIT, YOU'RE HUMAN, THAT'S THE PROBLEM! IDIOT THUGS, ALL OF YOU!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: DID I NEED TO SPECIFY THAT I WANTED THEM BACK ALIVE? WAS THAT NOT OBVIOUS TO YOU?!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Hff...haah...hrrgh...I...I can't bellevue...bellevue? Believe! I can't believe this!

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Uff, settle down, Tolem, settle down...you can still salvage this...

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Alright, two things. Your new name is Idiot, and I'm changing our deal. You owe me [10 Willow Planks].

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: You're going to help me get at least one thing around here working. You get the wood, I'll keep looking over the fencing.

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Oh lovely. Idiot's back! Joy of joys. Willow planks, please.

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: Good. Even if you've got murder on the mind constantly, you have decent woodcutting arms.

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: I'll sell the remainder of these planks to try and recoup the money for my cows you mulched.

lines.speaker: Tolem
lines.line: So go on, get out of here now. Make yourself useful and follow the giant footprints in the ground. Hunt something that NEEDS hunting, instead of cattle!

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: Oh, look at this...all my years of carpentry and my bad back does my poor house in.

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: What on earth could have done this?! It must be the biggest beast in the swamp!

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: I was just sitting inside having some dinner, I hear some rumbling, and suddenly my house is falling apart!

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: You human folk are good with physical labor, I hear? Do you think you could help me out here?

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: There's a mine just over there. Think you can get [10 Cobblestone] out of it?

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: I'll go find someone who's selling any spare wood for the roof...

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: Did you get enough cobblestone? I found a guy down the street selling this top-quality Willow...

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: Good, perfect. That should be enough. Though, I do have one other thing to ask you, soldier.

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: My back's already screaming at me just from lugging the wood over here, there's no way I can climb up there and fix the roof like this.

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: I can compensate you for the trouble, but d'you think you could do some patchwork for me with that cobble?

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: Oh, you're a saint. Can't imagine why the guy was grumbling about humans... Just climb right on up the ladder!

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: That'll do just fine, kind soldier! You're a lifesaver, really, you are.

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: Wait, you're going after the thing that did this? Really?! Fantastic! That's a load off my mind.

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: Looks like there's tracks off to the east...big tracks. Good luck following it, stay safe!

lines.speaker: Kroac
lines.line: Oh, I'll never be able to fix this with my back in this state...

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: EVERYONE, MOVE! THE BEAST IS ON A RAMPAGE!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: Aah, no! There were people in that house!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: Wah! H-Human! Get away, there's nothing you can help with here!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: All your type does is break and hurt! You have more in common with the giant there than any of us!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: Aah, there's so many people hurt already, don't make it worse, please!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: We don't even have any medicine...

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: Ugh, think Rileen! You have the herbs, what else goes into those poultices...

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: Oh, right! Fish oil...but I don't have a rod, gah!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: There's no way I can get [10 Salmon Oil], even if that pond out back is teeming with fish...

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: No, there's no time to make a fishing spear- AAH! You're still here? What do you WANT?!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: W-wait, what's...is this... This is salmon oil! Ten bottles of it! You...you heard me talking?

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: And you went out of your way to... What kind of a human are you? I've only ever heard horror stories about your kind.

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: ...maybe you're not so bad. I don't have anything that I can give you in return, but thank you, still.

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: Wait, you were chasing the giant? That's why you were here? That...that's amazing news!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: I think it went into the cave east of here. Go for it! Stop that thing before it causes any more damage!

lines.speaker: Rileen
lines.line: I think the giant went into the cave east of here. Go for it! Stop that thing before it causes any more damage!

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: You're back! Any luck hunting the thing down?

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: What? You actually found the beast?! Heck of a hunting job, human!

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: You wouldn't be back here if you didn't manage to kill it... which means our problems are solved, right?

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: Heheh! That bone powder looks giant enough to me! Great job, bucko!

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: Y'know, come to think of it, I remember something that might be interesting to your sort.

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: The weapon merchant in Olux researches cryptids as a hobby, and that beast seemed one-of-a-kind to me.

lines.speaker: Dereg
lines.line: You should show him that bone powder! He might have some good gear for you.

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: Hello, esteemed tourist sir or madame! I see you have found my illustrious resort, Zhight Island!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: Normally, you'd need a reservation to stay here, but our human visitors are ALWAYS welcome! Ehm...

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: ...w-well, actually...wait, no, it's nothing, nothing, friend! I guarantee you'll enjoy your stay here!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: Even if m-my usual supplies haven't arrived in weeks, I, um, I'm TOTALLY sure we can accommodate for you!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: We can just...um...w-well, I won't impose on you, dearest most welcomest traveller, no sir! Or madame!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: B-But, if, perchance, you were to, um...happen to find my supplier, Phief, who hasn't come around in weeks the bas-

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: I! I mean! Nothing, nothing! Just, ehm, our extra reliable supplier often stops by Mage Island for supplies...

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: S-So, if you just happen to stop by there after your lovely stay here, and tell him to get off his sorry butt and send me my supplies that'd be just peachy!

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: Hello there. I see Zhight has sent you, correct?

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: I do hope he isn't mad at me. I fully intended to bring the supplies to him.

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: But things took a turn for the worst quickly, and I no longer have access to my ship.

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: A madman jumped onto my ship, overpowered me, and held me hostage!

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: He was telling me how he wanted to "take back what was stolen from him", and it looked like he was heading to Maro Peaks.

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: I have no clue whether he was deranged, paranoid, or if someone really did take something from him.

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: I am certain of one thing. Nobody is going to sail my boat but me. I took my first chance to escape, broke the controls.

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: And I swam back to land, here. Problem is, I haven't exactly decided how I'll get the ship back for myself.

lines.speaker: Phief
lines.line: Maybe you can help me with that. The ship should still be stuck, due north of here, it has a red and white sail. I'd love to get my sea legs back.

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: He told you what?! That fumbleknuckle...

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: We didn't steal the ship from Phief, we were taking back what he stole from us years ago!

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: He attacked us on our way home to Maro Peaks, kicked us off the boat, and sailed it to who-knows-where.

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: We didn't think we would ever get it back, until we started seeing him sailing to that doofbumble Zhight.

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: Luckily, he decided to claim an island so close to Maro Peaks, or else we would have never seen him.

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: My father started following him with a small sailboat he made, and decided on the perfect place to attack.

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: But then Phief just had to throw a hissy fit and leave us stranded here.

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: My father took a paddleboat back to Maro Peaks to gather supplies. He took the cargo the ship had with him.

lines.speaker: Tirt
lines.line: If you need that, you should go talk to him. His name is Czytash.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: Ah, yes, I did find plenty o' supplies on that ship.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: I assumed it was more of Phief's thiefed goods, so I took it home to use it myself.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: It is Zhight's supplies you say?

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: Aye, of course it had to be that idiot's.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: I guess me thinking he's dumber'n a box o' rocks is no reason for me to let him starve... Here, take the crate.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: I haven't opened it yet, so everything is left exactly how he ordered it.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: I wonder what is on that numbskull's menu, that crate smelled rancid. Almost threw it off me boat.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: Anyways, good luck on your adventure matey.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: Sorry, what was that? My son?

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: Ah, I figured it is about time he learned how to maneuver a boat. I fixed everything before I left.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: When he returns, he will return a man.

lines.speaker: Czytash
lines.line: Wait, why am I telling you this? Butt out of my personal life, and just bring the man his crate.

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: Ahaaa, esteemed sir! Or madame! I can't actually tell under all that armour...

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: ER! I MEAN! N-No trouble at all, esteemed visitor! We at Zhight Island Resort are always welcoming!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: ...wait, is that the... Oh my! The supply crate! You went out and found Phief?! What an upstanding fellow you are!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: Wait, he was a boat thief? Well, good thing you've told me, we can't have pirates here at our resort! I'll blacklist him ASAP!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: You're only a visitor but you've been more help today than anyone else, really, I'm honestly in your debt.

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: So here! The repairs at the Zhight Grand Exchange and Zhight Treasure Tour have just finished, so you can head in and see the fruits of your labor!

lines.speaker: Zhight
lines.line: And, as a token of my thanks, some exclusive currency for our resort, Zhight Money, on the house and just for you! I hope you enjoy your stay!

lines.speaker: Wirt
lines.line: Not so fast, you!

lines.speaker: Wirt
lines.line: My dad said I can't let any strangers through this passage!

lines.speaker: Wirt
lines.line: If you want access, talk to him, he's the recruiter of the town! His name is Ildan. He's just southwest of here.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: Oh! So you want to become a member of this town?

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: You will have to help us first, of course!

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: I'm sure you've noticed, but there is a tribe camp not far from here.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: They used to have a powerful chief, but he eventually died in battle.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: The tribe couldn't bear the fact that he was dead. They performed some unethical necromancy spell on him.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: They quickly realised that it was a bad idea, so they locked him in a tomb.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: He keeps reviving his minions and it's causing quite some problems to our army.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: You can access the tomb from a sacrificial shrine I've heard, but I'm not sure how. There are probably hints nearby the shrine.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: Bring me back [1 Antic Bead] as a proof of its death, and I will let you become a citizen.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: I've marked the direction to the shrine in your book. Remember, there should be hints right nearby the shrine. Good luck.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: Impressive! You got the bead!

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: Well, welcome to this town, adventurer! You are now officially a citizen.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: Oh, but before you go! I do have a few things to say. First, about the beads here.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: The tribesmen accept these as currency, so if you collect enough, I've heard they can offer you powerful masks.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: Second, about the shrine. Now, this is just a rumor, but apparently that tomb is not unique.

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: There are supposed to be a bunch of these altars scattered around the province, even in Gavel too!

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: If true, you should look for them. While the fights will be tough, I would imagine great rewards could be gotten from them!

lines.speaker: Ildan
lines.line: Anyway, I've talked enough. I'm proud to have such a powerful fighter join our town! I wish you luck, friend!

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: Ugh... I really, really, reeeeally don't want to go...

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: Hey, who are you?

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: Do you...not have any manners at all?! Just running into my parents' house like that! Jeez!

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: I oughta... Hm. well... maybe...

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: Oh, I know! Here, go into my room real fast, and grab the letter in there.

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: Bring it to me when you do, I wanna make sure it's the right one.

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: Yep, that's the right letter. I hope you like school!

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: My parents were super excited when that letter flew into my room, but magical school sounds so boring...

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: I don't even want to learn magic! I just want to write my stories and play games. You can go instead.

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: I know the picture on the letter is of me, but you can, um...

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: You can say you had a growth spurt! Uh, that should work, I think!

lines.speaker: Seasum
lines.line: Now go on, you should get out before my parents see you. I don't want them to find out I gave that letter away...

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: Hey! What are you doing all the way over here? This dock's broken.

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: Oh, a student, you say. Aren't you a little old to be learning fundamental magical knowledge?

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: Well, if I could see your invitation letter, then?

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: ...hm. This...wow, you really look quite different than the picture. Did you get a new haircut?

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: Well, no judging from me! Keep walking to the end of the dock. Have faith!

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: Alright everyone. Ready for a magical experience?

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: We're headed to the Nexus. You've been told where to go. If you've forgotten, ask your fellow students!

lines.speaker: Boat Captain
lines.line: If you ever need to come back here, just walk out onto the dock again. Good luck, now!

lines.speaker: Mamui
lines.line: Psst. Are you a student at Grookwarts?

lines.speaker: Mamui
lines.line: This is the way in. Do you see that weird looking dirt wall?

lines.speaker: Mamui
lines.line: Just run straight through. Don't tell any non-wizard folks, though.

lines.speaker: Student
lines.line: Through the wall, right? I hope my uniform doesn't get dirty...

lines.speaker: Cidre
lines.line: Hello, new students! Over here!

lines.speaker: Cidre
lines.line: Welcome to the island of Grookwarts! I will be guiding and helping all the new students.

lines.speaker: Cidre
lines.line: So all of you will be getting two vouchers each, and with them you will need to buy one wand, and a book or tome.

lines.speaker: Cidre
lines.line: You can find everything here around the docks. Choosing your materials is very important, so buy the ones that speak to you!

lines.speaker: Cidre
lines.line: When you're done, meet with Miss Una at the front gates!

lines.speaker: Una
lines.line: Alrighty, fledgeling Grooks!

lines.speaker: Una
lines.line: Seems like you all have your materials in order. You are now free to enter Grookwarts and begin your lessons.

lines.speaker: Una
lines.line: The door is just behind me. Walk on in!

lines.speaker: Student
lines.line: Hush, hush! The speech will be soon!

lines.speaker: Student
lines.line: Hurry, take a seat! The banquet will be starting any second now!
Magical children of Wynn and Gavel alike... We welcome you here, to our fair academy.

lines.speaker: Student
lines.line: Oh lordy, the headmaster! I didn't even see him come in!

lines.speaker: Student
lines.line: Uhm... I don't see him at all, actually...

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Well, I should hope you can see me now, all of you. Oh, what a splendid turnout this year!

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Apologies, I simply can't resist a bit of theatrics. But now, it is time to listen and learn, fledgeling Grooks.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: We knowledged mages and scholars, the Order of the Grook, are pleased to see each of you here. Whether you be a young mind aching with curiosity...

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: ...or an old hat looking to refine their knowledge, all seeking to learn magic are welcomed here. We expect great things of you.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Now, to business. You will write your schedules for the semester. Look down on your paper and write in what classes you wish to participate in.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: You will need to choose four classes, one from each category. The categories are: Elemental Magic, Practical Magic, Magical Creatures, and Types of Magic.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: The schedule book is at the end of the table. Worry not, there is no limit on class size. If you wish to take it, you may take it.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Just fill in what subject you want to take and our guides will lead you to your classes.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: The element of nature and physicality. Now, choose a Practical Magic lesson.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: A true wizard after my own heart, seeking wisdom! Good choice. Now, choose a Practical Magic lesson.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: The element of freedom and high spirits. Now, choose a Practical Magic lesson.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: The element of bravery and resolve. Now, choose a Practical Magic lesson.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: The element of destruction and force. Now, choose a Practical Magic lesson.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Effects and materials are intertwined in function, but each has applications independent of one another. Now, choose a Magical Creatures class.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Artificing is a very useful tool for the burgeoning magic user! I'm fond of it, myself. Now, choose a Magical Creatures class.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Ah, yes... as well-liked as that class is, those Wybels are more trouble than they're worth to keep sometimes. Lastly, you must choose a Magical Type class.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: So you seek a broad spectrum of knowledge upon magicality! I wholeheartedly approve. Lastly, you must choose a Magical Type class.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: What you take from the earth, you must give back. That's nature's way. Remember that as you learn. And with that, your schedule is completed.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: To learn of the Corruption is a great risk. While admirable, remember your mind has limits. And with that, your schedule is completed.

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: I'll be leading you to your classes, everyone! Talk to me when you're ready to go.

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: Alright, fledgeling Grooks! Your first class is starting in just a minute. Follow me!

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: Here are the elemental classes. Step on in. Your magical journey truly begins here!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Now, all of you. Sit. Listen.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Earth is an element of great power. Versatile and everpresent, nearly as the air.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Thunder provides force... Earth provides sheer power. The difference... Force chooses its own path. Power is force, directed.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Earth is also the earth itself. Stone, metal, trees and soil. Trees sway in the wind, but do not break. And the mountains do not crumble.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The Touroto, steeped in earthly magic, are nearly invincible to all but themselves. It is proof of the earth's strength.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The Doguns... They were masters of the earth, and fire alike, shaping caverns to their will... And now, nearly extinct. A terrible crime...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: But we shall honor them, and move forward. We shall strike the earth and claim it to be our own.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The tome directs the earth's force. Take it, and utilize it to shatter the stones I summon.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The darkest parts of the stone are weak points. Find them, and learn the power of the earth.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: You know the earth's power, fledgeling. There is nothing more for you here. Go.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Remove the dark stone using your earth magic by right click the tome.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Uh oh.... Time is up! Try again!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Hee hee, take your seats, take your seats, TAKE. YOUR. SEATS! A marvelous batch of eager students today!!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Almost as marvelous as the powers of Thunder! Energy! Pure, unfocused energy! Devastation, desolation, and industrialization all alike!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Yes, yes! Thunder is technical and versatile! Unreliable to all those who don't know how to rely upon it, to those dextrous of hand and mind!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: But woe, woe, Thunder is reviled, reviled! Pure energy has no morality! If used for good, yes yes, ho hum, but if used for evil, oh, burn the witch! Burn, burn! Evil, they say! Pah!!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: All magicks are unaligned with silly concepts such as morality. They are pure chaos! But thunder, the element of energy and force, it seems ever so EASY to use for evil...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: And evil has found it, found it! CORRUPTION!! DEMONS!! Forces anathema to us, but knowledged in the ways of force, and thus, thunder! So terrible, terrible, and thunder mages feared, feared...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: And then, then! Joyous day, the Corkians arrived with their marvelous machines, and their electromagic! Thunder controlled, thunder tamed! The wonder of it all!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Electromagic makes handles crank, gears spin, metal move, gives sheer stones the power to THINK, and to PLAN! A Corkian original, and a splendid, splendid development reintroduced!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: And so, you shall see for yourselves! Electromagic at work! You will control thunder and electricity, and make the machines bend to your will today, today, this shocking day!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The mechanism is behind me now! Come up, come up! See the power of thunder, shackled by our whims, won't you, soldier?!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Whee hee hee! Thunder tamed, thunder shackled, and your magical wings unbound by such petty concepts, soldier! What a show!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Expand your knowledge ever further, further! Your task is complete, complete, and your next awaits!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Good to see a decent turnout this year for my class. Too dangerous, pah! You can take this just fine.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Anyways. The Fire element class. Many misunderstand just what fire stands for...but after today, you will leave with courage in your hearts.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Fire is, of course, related to physical fire, magma, etcetera. A burning torch is a source of fire magic, but that is not the only source of it.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Courage, bravery, and defensiveness are also tied to the fire element. Those stalwart and selfless, willing to sacrifice themselves for others.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: In addition, although water is tied to healing magic, fire is tied to self-healing. Regenerative capacity, if you will. Many fire-based artifacts heal the user passively.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: And while they are on the verge of extinction after the war in the Molten Heights, the Dogun species used to embody fire and earth magic alike. It is a shame what happened to them.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Unfortunately, it is also notable that corrupted creatures are often connected to fire, by nature of the corruption seeming to bring heat wherever it goes...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: But aside from that, onto our practical test. You will all come up to me, starting with soldier, and hone your courage. I will be lobbing fireballs at the wall behind you.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: You will need to destroy the fireballs before they hit the wall, by attacking them directly. If you are hit, it counts as a failure! Now. Let's get started, soldier.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Are you ready? Summon your bravery.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Ok Grook. I hope you're ready.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Lets start with 1 fireball.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Go!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Ok Grook. I hope you're ready for another test.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Now with... 3 fireballs!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Go!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Ok Grook. I hope you're ready for the final test!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: With only 5 fireballs!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Go!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Well done, fledgeling Grook! Continue to sharpen your instincts. You'll be a fine hero someday, I am sure of it.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Dismissed, soldier. You may leave. Now, do I have any volunteers for the next round...?

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Aah, wow! Everyone s-sure got here quick...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Welcome, w-welcome. The Water element class is...certainly an interesting one, I-I'd hope... Because water doesn't j-just pertain to, well, w-water...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: It also is the element o-of knowledge, and pure magicality. Water i-is a sort of magical default, if you w-will. If it isn't focused on o-one element or another, magic ends up being water-based.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Learning a-about the water element and e-expanding your horizons can allow you to cast spells easier... C-control the flow of magic better, you see.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Most aquatic creatures are t-tied to water, though creatures that live in icy or snowy environments are, t-too...often, they are also connected to air, but not always.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: In a-addition, many holy artifacts are enchanted with water magic... S-something about how it's a pure type of energy, I believe.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Lastly, healing abilities are b-bolstered by water magic. Just knowing magic well d-doesn't help, but actually having artifacts charged w-with water magic can increase healing capabilities.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: N-now, for your test, I have...um, a...a test. Anyone who wants to try it f-first, just go up and start.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Good w-work there! I h-hope I wasn't too boring with all my talking... You can go now.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: N-now, who's n-next? And...i-is it really cold in here for all of you, too? Or, is it j-just me...?

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Arright class, the sooner we start, the sooner we finish, so everyone, take your seats! You'll be getting up soon enough anyways!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Movin' right along. Air! You're breathin' it, we're surrounded by it, but ain'tcha know what it's all about yet, so pay attention.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Air is the element of freedom! Speed, wind, and agility. If you're trained well in agility, attacks'll seem like they just phase through ya!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: But over and above that, 'cause of air's ever-presence, it's one of the most versatile kinda of magic in existence. People use it in all sorts of ways.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Over in Gavel, the Bantisu Air Monks have managed to extend their sight by the wind! They use this to help guide folks who get lost in that canyon over there.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Many winged sorts a'creatures are tied to air, but not all of them. Some air magic users just straight-out float! Now wouldn't that be nice, eh?

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Due to their tenuous physicality, souls and spirits are also often related to air magic. Makes ya wonder if you could just blow a ghost out the window!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: And finally, some old, old tales tell of a woman who crossed the sea before it was calmed using air magic to fly. 's just an old legend, but an interesting one.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Now, onto the practical test! It's time to get those bones a-shakin'! You'll be runnin' an obstacle course I have set up, but with a twist.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Everyone up to the table! You'll need this feather with ya to get through. It'll help you jump higher!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The goal is to grab three crystal balls I put in the obstacle course. Once you find 'em, bring 'em back to me.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The course is behind me. Shake a leg, now!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Lessee here, one, two, three, yes indeedy! You got through that pretty quick!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Now, if you'll just hand me back that feather ya got there...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: ...then you'll be all done! Congrats, little fledge, you've finished this class! Now get on along to your next one!

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: Moving swiftly on, the next class is just across the way. Follow me!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Okay class, everyone take your seats, and listen up. This class is going to be interesting.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: As you know, this class is all about magical effects, specifically those tied to various materials, and how they'll affect you!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: This is going to be a hands-on learning experience, so those of you with weak constitutions may request to skip the demonstration if you're concerned for your health.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: If you've read my books, you know about Quartz, and how dangerous it can be if overcharged. So, of course, we have an overcharged sample here so you can feel the signs of it.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: It may be explosive, but it will be in a controlled manner. The worst that'll happen to you is your face will get a bit dusty, or your glasses will fall off.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Magical crystals, as we have to my left here, can be charged with all kinds of different effects. This is an incredibly valuable aspect for artificers.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Depending on the formation, they can have natural effects as well. These crystals were found in Gavel's floating islands, and...well, let's say it's difficult to keep it in its case.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Our last sample is of cosmic material, and if you're sickened easily, then don't examine it. Its effects are mostly unknown, but one thing's certain...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: ...it's dangerous to be exposed for long periods. Now, each of you will go back behind me, and examine and interact with each of the three samples provided.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Once you've done so, then you can leave. Hands-on training is the best way to learn, after all.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Well done. How did that feel?

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Personally, the void sample is the most interesting to me. You may now leave the classroom.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Alright everyone, take a seat but don't get comfy. You'll be getting up soon. Hope you brought your reading glasses.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: See, I'll just be giving you a short primer, then sending you out for your practical exercise, since I have all this written down already.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The basis of this class is that many materials, whether you know it or not, are inherently magical in some way or another. If you want to be an artificer, you need to know how each one works.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Thankfully, the field of artifice is a very popular one, so there's a wealth of knowledge out there on magical materials and on how to use them effectively.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Heck, Wynn soldiers are cobbling together rings out of copper and old spider silk, so you know this sort of thing is easy to get into. Tough to master, though!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: For those intimidated, you don't need much crafting knowledge for this class; you'll be reading up on everything you need to know in the back.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: You all will be crafting a magical amulet using different items. I've got stockpiles in the back; everyone will be crafting a different kind of necklace.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Here's a note of what you should craft. Once you have the materials you think you need, come to the crafting table. It's enchanted, and will craft the item for you if you have what you need.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Mhm, that's the ticket, soldier. If you're interested in learning more, you can probably find my books at most libraries.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Your feathers are coming in just nicely, fledgeling. You can scoot off to your next class now.

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: There's a bit of a walk to your next class. Follow me.

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: These staircases were supposed to move, but... That was too much work to put together, apparently. They're a pain to navigate, aren't they?

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Hello, students. This is your magical creatures class, and I will be your instructor.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Different species have different levels of innate magicality. This is often an invisible aspect of the species. You must never assume.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: To begin with, Doguns. They are ancient creatures, artificial-seeming at first. Despite this, they are highly adept at earth and fire-based magic.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Able to quite literally move mountains, it is theorized that they were the ones to carve out the inside of the Molten Heights into the caves we know today.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Tales also tell of their utilizing demonic energy for various purposes. However, we are only able to assume their magical energy from Dwarven tales, as they are nigh-extinct.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Moving on. We'll touch on the societies of Trolls, Goblins, Orcs, Ogres, and Hobgoblins. Some include Gerts into this grouping, though by technicality they are separate.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Though many of these types of societies have mystical practices, the only known way for Orcs and such to utilize magic is through artifacts. They've little magical potential.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Meanwhile, Villagers are of the opposite persuasion. High magical potential, often unrealized out of laziness.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Humans are often thought of as more magical than Villagers, due to Fruman soldiers seeming to know some magic innately, but this is untrue.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Dwarves have a similar level of magicality to Humans, but like Villagers, it often goes unrealized. Their culture values physical strength more.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: It is theorized that the reason for this is due to their distaste for the demonic energies of the Doguns. They reject their magic potential often, such that it is lessening over time.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Inversely, Elves have a deep connection to their magicality. Despite their reclusiveness, they are known for their open share of magical energy within their own society.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The outcast Elves of Efilim have shared their connection to what they refer to as 'The Light.' This connection is supposedly unfathomable, but guides them and protects them.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Now, we see if you were paying attention. You will come here and order the societies I have referred to in this class from least magical, to most.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Correct. soldier, thank you for paying attention. No one ever seems to in this class. You may go.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Alright, fledgeling grooks. Time to hit you all with the info you're really here for!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Wybels! Pronounced like ''nibble,'' they're a rather popular pet nowadays. But you all knew that, you want to know where they came from.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The explanation that we got was that they lived in the Ahms region, and when it split open, they eventually burrowed onto the surface of the Sky Islands.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: But no one actually KNOWS for sure. That means they. Could. Be. ANYTHING! What could lie beneath that veneer of fluff and playful demeanor?!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Oh, speaking of fluff. They wooly fur never actually stops growing, ever, and neither do their hooves, their horns, or their teeth. They shed often.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: These materials have innate magical energy to them. Stable like lodestone and reliable like quartz, but not as powerful as either. Interesting, that a fluffball has that potential!!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Wybel fluff is also able to be boiled, and it turns into a sticky molasses-like substance. It's used for candy, and it's very popular...but it's all POISON!!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: It's poison, I tell you! Wybel meat is horrendously inedible! It'll give you the worst stomachache of your life! The candymakers are feeding us DEATH!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: And the worst part is, if too much fluff gathers up in one spot, ANOTHER WYBEL APPEARS! They reproduce by budding!! Growing out of lint and dust! It's a no-win game they're makin' us play!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Wybels do have some good use though...they can sniff out sources of cosmic magic, like a pig sniffs out truffles. Sometimes they even try to take it home.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: It's almost like they miss it, somehow. It's almost like they might be FROM outer space! It's ALMOST like they bring insanity-inducing things into our houses ON PURPOSE!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: They're here to kill us all, I swear it! How else would you explain a wybel VAPORIZING a group of poachers? Ten colors of wybel, every one of them rotten evil!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Everyone says there's only nine, but WE know the truth! There's a tenth out there, an ultimately powerful one that wants us all gone. Pray you never see it, kids.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Anyways, my lesson's safe from all that. All you have to do is re-order these plush Wybel toys on the stand. You'll figure it out once you're up here.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Alrighty, fledgeling, good job. You're armed with the REAL truth now! Go on to your next class.

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: Next class is actually rather close!

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: Just follow me.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: ...I was hoping for a smaller class size.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Corruption is incredibly dangerous...it'll be tough to keep so many students safe. If anyone wishes to leave, you may.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Now... Corruption is a force of nature of...some description. Yes, you heard me right. We don't actually know much about it.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Even though it's plagued the Wynn province for a thousand years, the way it behaves is so incredibly alien in nature that it's nigh-impossible to study.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: We know it raises undead bodies... The working theory is that the more heavily injured a target is, the more susceptible they are to being corrupted.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: And...well, you can't exactly get more injured than "dead." Hence, the growth of zombies and skeletons and all, over in Wynn.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: It appears to spread by a complex "root" system. A scientist from Nesaak, Orikal, has studied this. The corruption spikes appear to spread it in greater concentration.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: As for the effects on your person, most often paranoia and anger are seen. And that's about the only consistent thing with it; it affects everyone slightly differently.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The worst part is that practically every single thing we've touched on here is conjecture and theorycrafting! The force of corruption is terrifying.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: The only thing we know for certain is that powerful ice-based magic can halt corruption, as seen in the Nesaak region.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Now, the dangerous part. Everyone, come up past my desk here. We'll examine a corrupted creature in a controlled environment.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: We have one in captivity, and its cage is reinforced with the strongest metals we have...so dear god let it be enough.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Bringing it out now...be sure to back up. We don't want anyone caught in the crossfire here.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: One thing to note about undead corrupteds...they can't be cured. You can weaken them, but that's about it. ...wait...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Wait, why's it spreading here? It's never done this before! E-everyone, back up, now!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: A-as you can see, corruption is very powerful, eheheh, c-can someone go get another teacher or something?!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Wait, no! It's corroding the bars! Everyone, RUN! NOW! GET OUT OF HERE, CLASS DISMISSED!!!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: GAACK! No, soldier, I said RUN! Don't fight that thing, get OUT!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Dear lord...that was awful. soldier, I can't believe you were able to kill that thing!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Class absolutely dismissed. We've got to cancel this class...it's far too dangerous for the students...

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Welcome in, guys and gals...we're learnin' about nature magic today!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: There's two main ways of usin' nature magic... Shamanism and Druidism. Two sides of the same coin, man.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Druidic practices tend to deal with healing more, and nurturing. When life's created, it gives off energy...and Druids use that energy for their magic.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Shamanic skills are a lot more direct, man. They take the life from other things and use that to do their stuff. It's way more varied than Druidic magic.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Each has its ups and downs, man. Druidism is chill and helpful...but you can really expand your mind with Shamanism, buddies.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Either way, it's all about equivalent exchange, y'see? You can't get somethin' from nothin', man. Either make life or take life.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: But, it's not picky about what life you take, man! A good shaman takes from plants and animals, not people!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Don't be a Slykaar, kiddos. He asked for human sacrifices, but he lived in a jungle, man! Like, what the hey! He coulda done anything else!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Anyways. Our test today, little buds, is to practice some shamanic skills. We got a sick cow in the back, and you're gonna nurse it back to health.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: You'll need to sacrifice some old Grooks, but it has to be just the right amount, man! The practice is through the door behind me.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: When you think you have the right amount, activate the altar and see your results, man!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: You may now leave.

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Groovy work, man! You're at one with nature!

lines.speaker: Teacher
lines.line: Your feathers are all grown out, man! Time to head out!

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: That's all four classes! I hope you found them magically enriching! Now, off to the graduation hall!

lines.speaker: Ghost Guide
lines.line: It's the room all the way at the bottom of the stairs. Hurry, don't hold up the ceremony! It won't start until everyone's there.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Take a seat. The ceremony is starting.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: And so, your teachings, or at least their basics, have ended. Your magical feathers have started to grow!

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: You have all been performing very well during your classes today. I've heard quite a bit of praise from the teachers being passed around.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: But now, for your efforts, you shall not go unrewarded. You will leave here with more than simply knowledge.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Your tools have shaped your minds, subtly but inexorably. And so with that, what you leave with today, both in mind and in treasure, shall be different for each of you.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: Let us start with soldier. Please come up to the stage!

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: There is a reason I've called you up first, you know. Recall what I said about old hats earlier? Don't think we didn't notice the armor, or the weapon, or the grim countenance.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: But no need to worry. Those who truly have the drive to become learned in the ways of magic, no matter who they are, will always find their way here, and be accepted.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: A shame about Seasum, but not to worry. Now, hand over your materials, and you'll receive your rewards.

lines.speaker: Headmaster
lines.line: And there you have it. Your feathers are grown, and you can spread your magical wings! Good luck on your adventures, Wynn soldier.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Garh, you look like a mighty fine adventurer, lad. But perhaps your pockets are a little lighter than you want, eh?

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Perhaps we be making a deal, lad, and it'll make us both rich!

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Ye see, lad, me treasure has been lost for quite some time, I kept it in a ocean village named Sarnfic, in a secret room.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Argh, but lad. The village vanished out of nowhere! Like some kind of dark magic! I swears to ye, I tell no lies!

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: So ye see, in me old age I could use a spot of me lawful gold to see me through me final years.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Don't fret though, chuck, old Javier always kept a back up plan.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: I left me old sea farin' map in me old hideout, it'll tell ye where we can find me old gold.

lines.speaker: Javier
