lines.line: So, lad. Are ya willin' to make ye'self mighty wealthy? Good.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Me old hideout's hidden inside that there skull at the entrance to our mighty fine establishment. Bring me that map, lad!

lines.speaker: Deceased Buccaneer
lines.line: Halt it there, laddy! The wind has told us that yer looking for treasure map. Ah, ye'll not get it so easily.

lines.speaker: Deceased Buccaneer
lines.line: Ye see, us spirits are as greedy as our physical selves were. 'ere's no foolin' 'round there. We want yer money, and only then will we open the paths to the map.

lines.speaker: Deceased Buccaneer
lines.line: One full block of smashed together emeralds will satisfy our needs. Go to the front of this tomb, and flush it down the middle of that raised thing.

lines.speaker: Deceased Buccaneer
lines.line: Good luck on that petty journey of yers. Just find the whole path, and yerself'll be just fine...

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Argh, yer talented aren't you lad! Many thanks indeed, now we can see where me treasure be buried.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Hrmm, well, garr, blast it all!

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: I canne read me own darn map, lad! What'dya do with it? Scratch off the ink with yer pennies?

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Gar, sorry lad. It be the test of time that failed old Javier, not you.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Fear not, lad. There be an old friend of Javier's that can help decipher this old rag.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Go to the old Mage Island, there be a man by the name of Dalben who can restore me map to its former glory. Get it done lad, and bring me treasure back!

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: What's this? A traveller? How might we assist you?

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: Ah, I see, you wish to explore the ocean depths? But for what possible reason?

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: This map... How did you acquire it? This is enchanted by our people.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: You... You seek Sarnfic, don't you?

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: Alas, that place has history. We, the Mage Council, banished that city long ago to hide the horrific power hidden within a treasure a pirate hid there.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: A pair of boots, made from a black material fashioned from the stone of an evil place, incredibly dark magic. But we do not believe the filthy idiotic pirate knew what he'd found.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: I must say, we, the council regret having to lay waste an entire village over a pair of boots. There was no other way.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: Who knows why he even kept the boots. If he had known about their power, I'm sure he would have used it for evil. But we sense no evil in you, so as such we will aid you in your quest.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: We hope that you will use the boots for good, despite the dark intentions. We will lift the enchantment once lain upon the charts, but it will cost you.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: Give me [5 Emerald Blocks], that should cover the cost.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: Brilliant. That seems in order. Here you go.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: We only hope that the boots will never fall into the hands of that pirate again, we'd much rather they fall into yours.

lines.speaker: Dalben
lines.line: Well? What does it say? Go to that location! Find the treasure!

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Gnar, you did it lad! Ye brought back old Javiers gold! And as I promised, heres yer share of the loot.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: I threw in something extra for ye. It's an old key I salvaged a few years back, from the shipwreck of a legendary pirate.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Who knows what it leads to? Maybe a treasure hoard, or maybe the ol' swashbuckler wanted to lead someone into a trap.

lines.speaker: Javier
lines.line: Me bones are too old for a grand adventure like that, guess ye'll have to figure it out for yerself.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Oh, a Wynnic soldier out here in the boondocks? Honestly, you're just what we need- I could use your help, if you're able?

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Good, thank you. Let me lock down the camp before I give you the briefing, though.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: My name is Elphaba. I've been working with the Gavellian army for a good few years now.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: I'm the commander of the Olux Outpost down ahead. It's a strategic fortress, placed to monitor the Orcish capital.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: It was safe for a long while, but especially in the past while the Orcs have gotten far bolder, more aggressive.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: They overwhelmed the outpost- we had to retreat and set up this camp to watch over the place we used to watch over them with!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: I need more firepower if I'm going...to get...

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: ...oh no. See, this is what I mean! The orcs are coming!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Brace yourself, soldier! Protect the camp!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: This is the third attack in three days! How many reinforcements have they got?!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Gah! Their casters are strong, careful!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Ugh, I think that was all of them... Come here now, I'll start up where we left off.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Not sure I could have done that myself. I'm lucky you came around when you did, soldier.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Anyway, it's clear that I'm going to need more firepower if I'm going to have a shot at reclaiming that outpost.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: You've certainly got the fighting chops, so I'd appreciate the aid, but we've got to come up with a plan, fast.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: There's an old tower near the outpost- some old storage silo. It was built taller than the fort, so we might be able to spy on them from there.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: It's a risk though, since it's so close by, but we have no other options. Meet me at the tower southeast of here so we can survey the situation.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Soldier! I'm right behind you. You can see our outpost- and the tower I mentioned.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: We need to find a way in. A lot of soldiers were caught unaware during the Orcs' assault, too.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: If there's any survivors in there, we should make rescuing them a priority.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: After all, it means more manpower for us. We can't count on that being the case, though...

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Come on, hurry inside before one of the orcs spots us!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Alright, this is a pretty clear view. Let's see what's going on in there...

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Wh- I'm shocked! In the middle there- they just caged the soldiers instead of killing them? That's...kind of a relief.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: There's definitely too many orcs in the plaza there for us to take down on our own...

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: ...but that cage is held up by those ropes. If we can cut them, the other soldiers should be able to help!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Alright, now I just need to figure out how we can both get in... There's sentries on the perimeter, so going over may not be an option...

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Maybe we can keep an eye out on their sentry patterns and look for an opening-

lines.speaker: Orc
lines.line: Humans on old tower! Junhur will shoot! This our place now, get out!!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Aw, not now! I knew this was a risk, no time to get out... Brace for impact!!

lines.speaker: Orc
lines.line: Old tower fall! Junhur is best cannon shooter!!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Agh, soldier!! Are you alright, where'd you fall?!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Ah... Wow. You barely look scratched, you must've gotten really lucky.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Not so much here... I'm pretty battered after that. At least one of us is in good condition...

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Unfortunately, that means figuring a way in is up to you. We can't examine their sentry patterns from down here.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: I'll survive, sure, but I won't be able to walk around and defend myself for a while.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: I hate leaving you on your own like this, but if it's any consolation, you should be tough enough, or lucky enough, to get through.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Explore the perimeter of the outpost. Try to find a way in, but be careful, okay?

lines.speaker: Orc Guard
lines.line: Someone outside door? Check!

lines.speaker: Orc Guard
lines.line: Oh, orc from mud bath. In, now!

lines.speaker: Orc Guard
lines.line: More muddy orcs? In, now!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Good thinking with the mud disguise, soldier! They never suspected a thing, now come help us out over here!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Kill the Orcish Overtakers, we'll help keep the other ones off you!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: The Overtakers are down, the other Orcs are flailing! Open the outpost's entrance with a spell now, we've got this under control!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Phew... That's some fine work there, soldier! The outpost is back under our control!

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Glad to see some more capable Wynnic hands over here. Though, I didn't catch your name. Would you mind?

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Soldier, huh? I'll remember that. You barely even needed my help, heh... Wish I hadn't been such a burden, but at least it worked out.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Here- it's some of my own personal spending money, as a thank-you gift.

lines.speaker: Elphaba
lines.line: Alright everyone, let's get this place ship-shape! Everything needs to be repaired in case of another attack!!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Ah, ahoy matey! Are ye here to get a glimpse of ol' Redbeard's sunken galleon as well?

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: A fine ship it once was, aye? Accordin' to the stories, it sank in one o' the greatest sea battles in history! The cap'n sank beneath the waves, ne'er to be seen again!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: ...Say. Have ye ever wanted to go on a real treasure hunt? Ye look like someone with an eye for treasure, aye?

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Good for ye then! I bought meself a real treasure map on Pirate Cove, a fine deal if ye ask me. And, if the jack wasn't fibbing, it leads to the feared Redbeard's real treasure!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: I ventured 'round, spied some fine jacks at the island, and I collected a crew to join me on a grand, fantastic voyage!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: O' course, there always be room for another! Ye joinin'? We could use another hand.

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Aye! Let's find the booty and bring back some doubloons! Here be that map I snagged. Swim or whatever ye landlubbers do to get to Pirate Cove. It'll be the first house to the right when ye arrive.

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Do ye remember where to go?

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: No? The crew be loiterin' at Pirate Cove. I'll be along soon, don't ye worry!

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: And that be when ye will...

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Cor lad...ye don' look like a pirate ta me, and I be but a young lass!

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: 's right, bucko. Who be ye, bargin' into our home in yer fancy armour 'n whatnot?

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: Ah, ye be accompanyin' Marston, eh? Well if ye insist on that, where be the man 'himself?

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: Comin' later? Hm. Well, more hands always be helpful. Let us go down to me ship, the Black Ring.

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: So he told ye about the plan? We'll bathe in doubloons when we get back! Ah, me fair lass will be so happy.

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Aha, quick on yer feet, lad! Ye got 'ere before us!

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: No trace o' Marston yet?

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: How's about we wait up fer him? He's the one who's givin us the opportunity fer this hunt, anyways.

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: I be getting impatient... The whole crew is 'ere, 'cept fer him!

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Argh! Where be our mate? It be getting dark out! We will have to leave Marston at land.

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Do ya have the map Marston bought?

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: Let us take a looksie at the map and see where to go.

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: It seems like one of these islands have the treasure... A'ight, yer in charge, landlubber! Set us on a course fer an island!

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Ahoy, this must be the booty. Fret not, Argus is keepin' the ship prepared so we can leave.

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: A'ight, let's us dig it up, jacks!

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Aha, I see somethin' gleaming in there! Methinks we hit gold, lads.

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Now Martim, knock the lubber out.

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: What? Another clue! This be just a wild grook hunt, where be the real booty?! No one ever got rich off a heap o' keys!! Maybe this 'ere jewel attached will sell...

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: Wait, there be a clue on the key! Presented to the ruined Galleon, a true path forward will arise.

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: Garh...I be losin' my patience. Argus arrived, let's ditch the lubber before they awake, hm? This island be hidden by magic, ain't no way they're gettin' found.

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Arright! This key... We might be able to bring Redbeard 'imself back to life... He'll strike terror in the seas again, and we will be 'is crew!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Can't say I expected all that... Those dogs are quick, eh?

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Fer a landlubber, ye sure are quick. When I got ta Pirate Cove, ye were already but a speck on the horizon.

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Seems they found a way ta open ol' Redbeard's graveyard... Speakin' of, what'n the name o' Davy Jones' Locket happened out there?!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Ye look a bit bruised! Reckon ye ran aground o' trouble with 'em too, eh?

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Well, lad! Methinks ye oughta go in after 'em! We may be a rowdy lot, but a mutiny's somethin' ye don't tolerate.

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: They don't deserve that treasure, lad! It ain't be mine either, since I missed ye. That gold be yours fer the takin...so take it!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Speakin' of...I ain't got much a penny ta my name, but I found this fish while ye were gone. I hear it sells for a decent haul, so here.

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: It be disappointin' that I wasn't able to accompany ye. Mighta been able to thump the dogs together, eh?

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: Eh heh... We've done it, mateys! Treasure an' glory on the seas be ours!

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: Arrgh! An' all we got to do is guard the captain's hoard fer a while! Let's get goin'!

lines.speaker: Karkun
lines.line: Huh?! You again! When will ye get the hint, lubber? Ye ain't welcome 'ere!! Martim! Get th' gate shut!

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: No way through without th' keys... We'll be waitin' for ye! If ye can make it past th' rest, heh...
Arrgh! So me new recruits weren't wrong, eh?! A stowaway! On me ship! This treasure be mine, ye hear?!
I've seen Landlubbers like ye come an' go, an' not a single one 'as bested me in combat! An' ye won't be any different, stowaway!!
Let down the gates, me mateys! Don't let tha stowaway through... OR AH'LL SEND YE BACK TO THA' MUCK YE ROSE FROM!!
Huh?! Which of ye rats let the Landlubber through to tha key?! DON'T LET THA STOWAWAY GET BACK TO ME SHIP!!!
YER ALL WORTHLESS!! ENABLE ME TRAP, BLOW THE STOWAWAY TO BITS!!!

lines.speaker: Redbeard
lines.line: Ye've dodged me crew fer far too long, stowaway... DODGE THIS THEN, EH?!

lines.speaker: Redbeard
lines.line: Call down th' cannons, mateys! DEFEND ME TREASURE!!

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Ah, ahoy matey! Are ye here to get a glimpse of ol' Redbeard's sunken galleon as well? A fine ship it once was, aye?

lines.speaker: Marston
lines.line: Lots o' treasure attached to that name, ye know? If ye were Level 61, maybe ye'd be able to join me on a fine treasure hunt.

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: It's you... You're the one who doomed us. And for what?

lines.speaker: Argus
lines.line: Back then, you didn't feel an ounce of remorse, did you?

lines.speaker: Martim
lines.line: If you're that willing to kill... Then just try it. Get 'em!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Redbeard
lines.line: Yarrr! They return for more plunderin'! I've been missin' this!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Redbeard
lines.line: Hav' at ya, soldier, see if ya can do anythin' against THIS!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Redbeard
lines.line: Behol' me crew!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Redbeard
lines.line: Blimey! Seems ya've gotten p'etty far!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Redbeard
lines.line: Why don' you go say hello to ya mateys?!

lines.speaker: Redbeard
lines.line: Alrighty, Landlubber! I'll battle ye meself!

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Excuse me, traveller... I am dreadfully sorry to ask this of you, but I need your help.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: You see, my son, Aryn. Very recently, he underwent a traditional coming-of-age ceremony from our tribe.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: He was tasked to enter the dangerous Dernel Jungle, just south of here, and brave the wilderness for three days. He returned a true man, successful.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: However... He also brought with him an odd purple gemstone. Our shaman saw it as a bad omen, but I was so caught up in the celebrations, I brushed it off.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Strange happenings began around the village. Aryn walked about at night, talking to someone, but no one else was there with him.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Just last sunrise, he vanished entirely. We sent out a search for him, but even our hardiest warriors could not venture deep into the jungle.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: We returned empty-handed, having lost our newest tribesman. The village is in terrible spirits, and I feel as though I am responsible.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: You Wynn warriors, however... Great stories are told of your exploits. Surely, you will be able to brave the jungle, yes?

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: I beg of you, please, find my son. I do not know quite where he is, but undoubtedly he has been taken quite a ways in...

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Hm, I just now am seeing a strange trail on the ground... it matches the color of the gemstone! It may take you to him, please, follow it!

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: P-please, I beg of you spirit, let me go free! The tribesmen must be so worried-

lines.speaker: Aryn?
lines.line: DO NOT RESIST, BOY! YOUR BODY IS MINE. I WAS TRAPPED IN THAT STONE FOR MILLENIA, AND NOW I AM FREE.

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: Aha, I hear someone coming! Surely a tribesman here to rescue me!

lines.speaker: Aryn?
lines.line: Oh! If so, the body of this warrior will be far better suited to my needs! Grant me your power, boy! I need to thrash them first to possess them!

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: Hahah, take that, evil wraith! You'll never match the power of our tribe-

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: W-wait, you aren't part of our tribe! Who are you, why did you come here?

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: Oh... My father sent you? Well, I am very impressed, Wynn warrior. You fight with the ferocity of our own!

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: I...can't say the same for myself. That spirit completely overtook me, I still can't move right now...

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: For now, please. Take away this gemstone. It caused all this, I don't want to be near such a bad luck charm.

lines.speaker: Aryn
lines.line: Tell the tribe that I will return on my own. I made it back once, I can do it again once I am prepared.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Oh my... Aryn was possessed by a spirit residing within the gemstone?

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: How shameful... Our shaman has never been wrong before, why did I disregard his warning...

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: But that is beside the point. You say you have destroyed the spirit, and it does not feel tainted any longer, so I will trust you.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Looking at it now, this is actually quite a valuable stone. If crushed to dust, it can be used in special charms we make.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Here, allow me to grind this down for you. You can keep the shards for whatever purposes you may find for them in the future.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: Our tribe, and especially myself... We thank you for your service. We shall consider you one of our own, from this day forward.

lines.speaker: Gracen
lines.line: In fact, if you'd like, you may even enter my house here whenever you'd like.

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: Did ye two hear about some guy wandering around town? I've heard strange rumours about him...

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: Of course I have, he's the talk of the town! I heard he only brushes his teeth once a day and that he enjoys books about gardening!

lines.speaker: Viola
lines.line: I don't know, you guys, all these rumours seem a little far-fetched. What next? Will he suddenly turn out to be some mad scientist?

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: Oh shush you, we're not living inside some storybook! Besides, if he *was* a mad scientist, wouldn't he be trying to take over the city like all mad scientists in stories do?

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: To me that doesn't sound all that strange compared to these other things I've been hearing, anyway... Something about labs and a "hermit".

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: I think that's a type of crab or something. Adults are right old weirdos sometimes.

lines.speaker: Viola
lines.line: Hey, a stranger! How long have you been listening to us? Didn't your mom teach you any manners?

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: Wait Viola, this is our chance! This stranger sure seems like they could tackle anything, even evil hermit crabs! We could just ask them to see if these rumours are true!

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: Ignore my friends over there, they're always like that, but what Prentiss said was true. This might be our only chance to really know who this mystery man really is!

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: It might be a good idea to look at that weird house next to those spooky ruins south-east of the city. We found this key you could try out, but if you lose it there are some spares in our base.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Hello stranger! Welcome to my humble wooden abode. Comfy, isn't it? I bet you'd like a cup of this coff-

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Oh yes, I am the affable Ariodo, friendly neighbourhood neighbour. What do you need me for?

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Kidnappings? Poaching? Not brushing my teeth?! Who is this lowly person you're talking about... they don't seem like a nice fellow such as myself.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Let's go, I'll take you to the exit so that I don't waste your time any longer!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: This is the room you came from. I call it the "Vivarium", creative name I came up with, right? It keeps my pets that aren't quite ready.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Ready for what? Well that would ruin the surprise, wouldn't it? Can't have anyone finding out before the big event!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Let us go now, time is precious!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: So you must be thinking, how have you never met a fine fellow such as myself until now? To be quite honest, you must have just been terribly unlucky, I used to travel the world, you know!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Oh the places I've been were wonderful! From the depths of the jungle to the lesser depths of the jungle to even my back garden, I've done my fair share of exploring, if I do say so myself!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: You are the first normal person I've seen recently, Soldier. I went out recently and was met with some very rude remarks by some very rude townsfolk!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: The last time I visited the town it was all empty too, but I could feel people were hiding in their homes, even on such a lovely day as then. There was no one even there to hide from! Strange people.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: I'm just a normal guy, so why can't anyone appreciate me for once? I'm sure you do, right?

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Here we are, the library! I could spend years in here, but who has time for that? I could talk about books for hours too! Here's one right now.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: This is 'The Long-Winded and Painful Death of Sweeney S. Greenville' and I must say it is a hidden gem among books! One day it just suddenly appeared in here so I couldn't resist reading it. So it starts off with Sweeney S. Greenville...

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: We're here now! Take the exit right in front of you, don't mind the corridor to the right, it's only decoration!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Maybe you can come back some day for a tea or coffee and a long talk about books, since I noticed you were very interested in my long-winded review! Have fun out there and don't forget, I'm always here for you!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: The ground is shaking... I thought that was supposed to happen later! Come back friend, I can't do this alone!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Help me keep this door shut, or else my surprise will be ruined!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Just keep to the sides, it's safer that way.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Just stay here for one more momen-

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Oh my, a ghost? Wait, is this just you, my trusty friend, playing a prank on me? No? Well that certainly is a problem!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: If you remember, we were talking about keeping the door shut when suddenly something heavy fell off a shelf hitting you square in the head!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: I think I heard something about fighting fire with fire, so I think I have a way to get you back! You are a bit too heavy for me, so we need to think of a workaround.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: During the shaking, some of my machines broke apart, but we could use these to build something capable of dropping something heavier on your head for the second time.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Surely by that logic everything has to go well, you know. Now let me explain how we can do this. First, choose what part you want to use to make our machine, then choose were you want it to go and face.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: The [Cart] can carry the coconut from one end of the platform to another for a few tiles, while the [Fan] can push the coconut even further.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: The [Hammer] is able to knock the coconut over a one space gap while the [Cannon] can shoot the coconut one grid up diagonally in the direction it is facing.

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: I think I hit my head too, so I'll need your help deciding where to place each part. You want to get the coconut across to the green tile, remember?

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: You're back! To be quite honest, I didn't think that would work, but I'm glad it did!

lines.speaker: Ariodo
lines.line: Quick, head through the large door and stop the cause of all that shaking!

lines.speaker: §2Ariodo
lines.line: §r Oh no no, this is not good! If I had known that my little pet has grown so much I would have rushed you out sooner. Now it is wilted...

lines.speaker: §2Ariodo
lines.line: §r You did what you had to, though. I am sorry to say this friend, but I think I'll stay inside a little longer. Sorry, my only friend..

lines.speaker: §2Ariodo
lines.line: §r We'll surely meet again in the future, so don't be sad. I'll still be the one and only friendly neighbourhood neighbour when that moment comes, I promise. Goodbye now!

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: You're back! You were gone for ages too, and what happened to your head? Who did the mystery man turn out to be?

lines.speaker: Viola
lines.line: That sounds ridiculous! Who could ever belie-

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: Wow that sounded just like in the stories, but it came from you, so it must be true!

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: I don't know about you, Todd, but I feel we should make them our new honorary club member for finding such amazing things!

lines.speaker: Viola
lines.line: Why do I even try... You two would believe anything.

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: I'm pretty sure they mentioned something about being hit by coconut crabs, and just look at their head. One.. two.. two huge bumps!

lines.speaker: Viola
lines.line: Oh fine... whatever you say, Prentiss. I'm sure they'll bring you on some wacky adventures next time around!

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: Ignore Viola, she's acting up today, probably because you've got the spotlight this time. However, I agree with Prentiss.

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: Thanks to you, we solved the case of the mystery man as well as the mystery house! For this I'd like to...

lines.speaker: Todd
lines.line: Welcome you to the club, new member! Here is your shiny new badge that you can parade around town to show off how cool you are to others with style.

lines.speaker: Prentiss
lines.line: Also since all the adults do it, we'll give you some emeralds that you rightly deserve for such an achievement. We all pitched in!

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: The orcs are getting unruly... Could you come back when you're Level 64, and have some experience dealing with orcs?

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Hm. It's been long enough, we should've heard back from the diplomacy squad by now...

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Ah, hello there, Wynn soldier. You should stick around! We were just launching a counterattack against the orc citadel.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Since you've helped with curbing the orcs elsewhere, you can join in the festivities- Oh, that's them coming over the hills!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: ...A CATAPULT! Since when did orcs have the knowhow to make a CATAPULT?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: I don't know, but they just decimated our golems with it. How are we supposed to deal with that chieftain without our protection?

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Let's just get to the medical tent and go from there. The captain will need to hear about this.

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: Nonono, you don't understand- a CATAPULT?! Seriously, I can't get over this! Orc catapult! What's the world coming to?!

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: ...why do you always have to embarrass me in front of the humans, you idiots...

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Obviously it seems we need some backup, soldier. Would you mind coming along to the medical tent with me?

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: You lot are useless, you are! We had you sent off with thirty golems! THIRTY! And you come back with nothing to show? Do you have any idea how much that cost us?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: ORC CATAPULT! I'm telling you, Captain! They crushed our guard golems with huge honking boulders! What are we supposed to do against that?!

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: He's right, captain. After the golems were crushed, the orcs spilled out from the fortress. If we didn't retreat we would've been killed, with just the four of us.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: ...fine. I suppose you have a point. And that means it's a good thing we have a human here to pick up all your slack.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Human! Let me give you the lowdown. Since you helped us reclaim the outpost up north, the orcs have gotten much more aggressive.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: There have been many attacks here at town, and we’ve been struggling to fend them off. Thanks to the incompetence of our troops, we haven't been able to-

lines.speaker: Soldier
lines.line: ORC CATAPULT!! ORC CATAPULT!! Listen to the words I am telling you! ORC! CATAPULT!

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: ...we haven't been able to get the orc chieftain to listen to reason and sign a new ceasefire yet. If this keeps up, we'll be overwhelmed. The brutes only seem to listen to force...

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: And that's where you come in, soldier. We need you to go to the orc fortress and break through their line of defenses. Maybe if we show them we can equal their force, they'll listen, right?

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: The fortress is off to the northeast, it's visible from town. Don't come back without a ceasefire- Or the chieftain's head, if peace is out of the question!

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Make whatever preparations you need to break through the orcish defenses, and then go to the orcish fortress!

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Remember, don't come back without a cease-fire...or if peace is out of the question, the chieftain's head!

lines.speaker: Guard Bitteliso
lines.line: Hmh! Human! Just like say, Serepe. Villager fail, then send human to kill.

lines.speaker: Guard Serepe
lines.line: Idiot big-noses! Human strong, but only one. Need more to break Centerworld!

lines.speaker: Guard Serepe
lines.line: One against four... Human not beat even one. Ismikku! Hulve!

lines.speaker: Orc Guards
lines.line: KNOCK HUMAN DOWN!!
Idiot. Idiot human. Will die in open. Come.
RRRGHH! Armor heavy! How human carry much weight, but so weak without?!
Need medicine for...urgh. Blood... Where yarrow root...
Mmh. Get up. Human! Get up! See human breathing, you awake!
Name Zuett. Your name, Idiot. But only because taught wrong. So will help idiot. Take medicine.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Hmh! Better than silly magic potion. Earth heals best...

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Anyway. Why you here? Why now? Give me good reason. Because kill orcs for "peace"?

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Hmh. Mhm, mhm. Yes, idiot villagers come by, lots of metal villager too. Say want peace- just want kill. Evil war machines.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Human really want peace? Then listen to Zuett. Killing not the way. Orcs strong, but not killers. Villager say, but villager wrong.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: We... Orcs... Not listen to just force. Orcs see strength, not idiot-killing. Human been idiot-killing. Time to stop.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Whole war stupid. War killing us. Not all Orcs meant to fight. Human need learn first.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Need talk with Arrai-Veretel. But first, need trust. To start trust, listen to Zuett.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Will give guards peace offer. [Elite Boar Meat]. Go hunt. Look bushes up north.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: If want walk away like coward, do now. If human trust me...meet by fort after get meat.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Human. Hunt meat- chase boar out of bush. Hunt boar, and bring meat. Simple?

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: RRRRGH! HUMAN!! WHAT YOU DO?!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Zuett not stupid! Zuett saw human hunt!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Zuett saw human THROW AWAY MEAT!!! WHY IDIOT HUMAN BEING BIGGER IDIOT?!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Human think Zuett joking?! Human think war some sillyfunny?! GET MORE MEAT!!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Hmh. Hunt like child, but succeed anyway. Human should rely less on magic. Human serious, though.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Good. Human really want peace. Help stop stupid war... Even though human and villager start anyway...

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Follow. We go Centerworld. Guards still angry, but can say good for you. Stay quiet- Zuett do talk.

lines.speaker: Guard Serepe
lines.line: Zuett! What you do? Thought drag away human to kill for good! Why bringing back now?

lines.speaker: Guard Bitteliso
lines.line: Zuett bleeding heart. Strong in compassion. Saw hurt, thought help. Stupid, but can respect.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Listen to Zuett! Human want peace. Came for peace, but was taught peace come from idiot-killing by villager.

lines.speaker: Guard Bitteliso
lines.line: Grrrh! All human say! What special about this human?

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Human listen to Zuett. Hunt spineback boar, bring meat. See? If human not care, human not listen. Not hunt.

lines.speaker: Guard Serepe
lines.line: ...hm. ... ... ...can respect human strength. Can hunt spineback, mean strong.

lines.speaker: Guard Bitteliso
lines.line: But strong not mean trust! Strength of body only one thing.
RESSINTER HURT! RESSINTER HURT BAD! NEED HELP!! HELP NOW!!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Onluk! Tell what happen! Ressinter...healer hurt?

lines.speaker: Guard Serepe
lines.line: !! Ressinter only healer! Zuett want be healer, Creinu want be healer, but not!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: KREIMU! Get Kreimu! Mudspring camp! She good healer!

lines.speaker: Guard Bitteliso
lines.line: Will go! Fast runner! Ressinter no die today! Serepe, deal with human!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Hm... HM!! Human, uh, human good healer! Heal own injury with medicine! Human will help!

lines.speaker: Guard Serepe
lines.line: Gwuh?! Zuett! Lying bad! Human idiot no hea-

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: RESSINTER DYING! NO CARE IF LIE! ANY HEALER BETTER THAN NO HEALER!

lines.speaker: Guard Serepe
lines.line: HEY! ONLUK IDIOT! NO LET HUMAN IN!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Onluk, tell! How Ressinter hurt?

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Cannon backfire! Caught in blast! Cut up all over, bleeding bad! Healer already brought medicine tent!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Hhhgh. Bad injury... Human. Heal Ressinter, fast!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Make balm to keep healer alive! Even if only keep alive for Kreimu to heal, keep Ressinter alive!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Mix herbs. Use medicine book. And stay in tent!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Nunexetor! Why you here? Should be with goblin!

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Heard you yelling from under the tower. Wondered what was going on. Now I'm here. Why's there a human here?

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Zuett say human good healer. No other healers here! If Ressinter die, will kill human, and hit Zuett since lying!

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: ...mmh. None of the goblins know healing here. You're right. Help our healer, human- or it's your life on the line too.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Not know much about medicine yet. Medicine give to you, last one- Was made before. Know this though.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Ressinter bleeding bad. Find herb good for bleeding. Won't need more than two herb of type, too.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Make balm to keep healer alive! Even if only keep alive for Kreimu to heal, keep Ressinter alive!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Mix herbs. Use medicine book. And stay in tent!

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: KREIMU HERE! HEAL RESSINTER!! NOW!!!

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Gwuh, yes! Stop shouting! I- Urgh!

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Here in time. Ressinter still alive...why other balm on cuts?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Wait, why human here? Ressinter hurt because human?

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: No, human try heal Ressinter!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Human try heal Ressinter. Thought better healer than Zuett. Try hard to keep Ressinter alive.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: ... ... ...Nunexetor. You sensible. Is true? Human try heal Ressinter?

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Yes. The human made herb balms and tried to heal Ressinter.

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: So Zuett not lie. Human care about orc?

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: See? Human try. Maybe not heal Ressinter full, but try save life of someone call enemy by idiot Villager.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Human learn Villagers lie. Trying learn about us. War only because Villagers trick! Not because human bad!

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: ...hmh! Can respect. Strong in mind if able to learn.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Agree with Bitteliso and Zuett!

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: ... Agreed. We should get back to our tasks though.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Will stay for while in case Ressinter need medicine more.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Sorry to put human up to task sudden, but now more orc trust you.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Since orc trust...maybe can talk to Arrai-Veretel now. Follow.

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: No enter! Much camp see human heal, but still no trust human!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Ureietun! Human help save Ressinter life! Why no trust?

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Human being led by you. Human led by villager too! Teach good thing, yes, but what if human just copying?

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Human can earn trust alone! Zuett, stay in Arrai-room.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: But-

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: RRRRRGH! STUPID ZUETT! WAR HAPPEN FOR REASON! GO AWAY!

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: ...can trust human not kill. Human can walk around Centerworld. But human no see Arrai-Veretel!

lines.speaker: Ressinter
lines.line: Whuh! LOMOSTER! LOMOSTER HURT!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: No! Lomoster okay! Ressinter not okay- Wait. Ressinter sort of okay! Need rest still!

lines.speaker: Ressinter
lines.line: But Lomoster at cannon when explode!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Lomoster wear armor. Armor took hurt, Lomoster okay!

lines.speaker: Ressinter
lines.line: ...mmmh, fine... Wait, why human here?

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Human heal Ressinter. See? Human good healer!

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: I don’t believe it. How did-

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: KREIMU HERE! HEAL RESSINTER!! NOW!!!

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Gwuh, yes! Stop shouting! I- Whuh...

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Ressinter already okay! Bitteliso lying?!

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: Wait, Ressinter okay? How did- HUMAN?! WHY HUMAN IN CAMP?!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Human heal Ressinter! Not know how, but human save Ressinter life!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Told Bitteliso. Human learning! Save life of orc, even though idiot Villager say kill.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: ...how. How. HOW! How human so good at healing?! Why human help?

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Can trust human. Human try unlearn bad villager teach.

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: ...fine. Good human, not stupid human. Bitteliso sorry for beating. Here.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Shouldn’t we get back to what we were doing?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: ...will stay in case Ressinter need help.

lines.speaker: Ressinter
lines.line: Ressinter not old man! No need sitter!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Not know that human actually good at heal! Very good! Healer, not hunter. More orc trust you now.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Since orc trust...maybe can talk to Arrai-Veretel now. Follow!

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: No enter! Much camp see human heal, but still no trust human!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Ureietun! Human save Ressinter life! Why no trust?

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Human being led by you. Human led by villager too! Teach good thing, yes, but what if human just copying?

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Human can earn trust alone! Zuett, stay in Arrai-room.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: But-

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: RRRRRGH! STUPID ZUETT! WAR HAPPEN FOR REASON! GO AWAY!

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Can trust human not kill. Human can walk around Centerworld. But human no see Arrai-Veretel!

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Human stupid? I say no see Arrai-Veretel!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: HRRRGH!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: GRRGH! GRRGAAAH! MOOOOOOVE!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: YUNELSU NOT BEATEN...HRRRK...BY ROCK!!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Hrrf...haaah...hhhuman! Weird...weird kind human!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Rock stuck. Trying to lift- for train strength! No one able to lift rock.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Yunelsu try throw rock into river! Have thrown other rock, not this one.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Human! Try move rock!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Human! Try move rock, use magic!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Hmm...human magic strong, but rock still not moving.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Work together! Cast magic at rock, I try lift again! Ready!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: HGGGGRRK! GO!

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Hrrgh... Hrrf. Must be...old earth rock.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Been here very long time. Stuck here, rock where earth wants rock to be.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Yunelsu find other rock then. Sometimes rock break, though.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: See? Many broken rock. Hear can be good for armor though. You take.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Earth say what earth should be. Only need to listen to her.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Earth say rock should stay here, then rock stays here. Simple.

lines.speaker: Yunelsu
lines.line: Hurts, seeing earth rot in north. Big-nose grubs should feel her pain too- they make earth sick!

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Hey! Human! Human who hunt spineback boar and help heal healer!

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Not stupid human who go around kill other orc! Good human! Can trust. So trust, will ask for small thing.

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Human OFFERING help- Hmh! Very good human! Task simple. Southeast of fort, past ridge, Teiren old camp.

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Used to live, but left because Freelancer jump down from mountain. Forgot important thing there!

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Need stay here, make sure stupid Peloros no run into firepit. Has done before. So, you go get!

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Oh, human forget. Teiren tell again! Southeast of fort, past ridge, Teiren old camp.

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Forgot important thing there. Need make sure Peloros no run into firepit. So, you go get!

lines.speaker: Freelancer
lines.line: Oi, oi! Y'oughta gimme 'at back right now, li'l lady!

lines.speaker: Alraune
lines.line: Absolutely NOT, you craven wind spirit! This belongs to me now!

lines.speaker: Freelancer
lines.line: Lady, everything the wind touches is OURS! Not ta mention we’re so close to the mountains we live on! This camp's our property, and that thing you got's part of the camp!

lines.speaker: Alraune
lines.line: Nonsense! This camp was built by those who respected the earth and its bounties. Now that its inhabitants have left, nature is free to reclaim it, as is right!

lines.speaker: Freelancer
lines.line: Aw yeah? Issat it? You're a peach, gal, but I'll clip those petals, you don't give it up right now!

lines.speaker: Alraune
lines.line: What a brutish lout you are, threatening an embodiment of nature! I won't give this up without a fight!

lines.speaker: Freelancer
lines.line: Shouldn'ta crossed me, doll! Remember who spreads your pollen next time, huh?! Now to just take this back up the mountain...

lines.speaker: Freelancer
lines.line: Oi! Who's THIS joker now? You lookin' ta empty your wallet for me or something?

lines.speaker: Freelancer
lines.line: What, you want this thing too?! It's mine, y'hear? MINE! You can't have it!

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Human! Was right to send out. Peloros fall over chair and almost burn! Did find thing? Very distinctive, only thing left at camp.

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Hmhm!! Yes! This what looking for! Very good human! Human deserve reward for be good human!

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Oh? Human not know what thing is? Want know?

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Silly! If human not know what thing is, no tell! Can learn for self.

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Still. Here, for good human!

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Will say, got thing from Earthpit. Was brought by Holehold gofer during party.

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Special thing! Kept for long time. Important, so was bad to forget.

lines.speaker: Teiren
lines.line: Will maybe invite human to next party!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Grrh...stupid Jixy. Dumb human language!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Hrrh! Human! You language dumb! Name smart, flow like water in Orc language, look like dungpile on paper in human language!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Say name! Look at spell, say name! Try!! TRY!!!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Want human try again! Feel pain of good name in stupid language! SAY NAME!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: NO! Wrong! Say wrong, all wrong! Sound even stupider than normal!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: GRRRH! Confusing name! Not confusing in orcish! Human say all wrong!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Stupid stupid STUPID! Not at all say like spell! See stupid language now?!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: GAAAH!! No, no, no, no!!! Why need learn human language?!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: NAME NOT JOE! WHAT KIND NAME JOE?! JOE STUPID NAME!!! AAAAHH!!!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Hmh. That right, human. Willing to try at least. See how bad name look?

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Said "shoon-bur." Not even LOOK like that in human letter!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Here. Needed show anger at stupid language, not show anger at human.

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Supposed to learn human language for peace. Show orc good because big-nose grub say bad.

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Idiot villager get human before orc, so human greet orc with weapon and death!

lines.speaker: Xoeinbor
lines.line: Now learn language but only in half, and name all stupid!

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Hm! Human, hunter, healer, halfwit soldier. Many things! Human also runner?

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Peloros from Holehold. Camp home to messengers and runners. Have thing to deliver to Fruludir in green tower.

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Human do instead. Want to see if human able. Supposed to be soldier- soldier must run to battlefield fast!

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: RGH! Can understand just fine, just not speak as good! No mock us!

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Human want try again? Is training, not end of world. Practicing makes all stronger.

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Then human run fast to green tower- deliver in 25 seconds! Or else come back. Not urgent delivery, so delay fine.

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Will know human delivered in time. How? Human will see if run fast!

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: NO WASTE TIME! GO!

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: Hm! Human have Peloros box. Peloros give human run training. Give here.

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: More than Zuett with human? Good sign. Maybe fighting stop soon.

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: Patience, human. Box full of signal flare. Will light one to show Peloros human got here in time.

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: Peloros train hard. Peloros work hard. Peloros work everyone hard, do everything hard.

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: Heard that Peloros thinking of making more race spot.

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: Maybe if war stop, then all orc can try run. Maybe human try run too.

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: Weird human. Talk with Zuett? Try hard to stop war. Fruludir no care about fight. Strong eyes, not strong body.

lines.speaker: Fruludir
lines.line: But, human not supposed be up here. Should leave.

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Saw the firework. Human did well, finishing single morning exercise!

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Orc do much training to stay strong. Orc runners must be fast and not tire to become Marathon!

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Here. Human take. Train harder. Maybe visit Holehold- also place for relax, not just run. Stamina good for all.

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Cliffhearth also have runners, but Cliffhearth more for communication. Make message instead of bring message.

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: All camp have purpose. Was more camp before, then villagers chase orcs away and make earth rot!

lines.speaker: Peloros
lines.line: Maybe half many camp as before now. Need to be strong so big grubs not chase away again!

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Grrmb. Dumb Kreimu. Stupid Wynn language...Gavel language...pfeh. Whatever language. Not orc language.

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Her name, my name, sound same. Don't sound same in Orcish! But in YOUR language, sound same!

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Not just that- Learning to be medicine orc. She medicine orc too! Healer, brewer, herbalist, whatever. Too much same!

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Angry about it. Been distracting from training too. Human want help like help with Ressinter? Get Creinu- Crei...nu...not Kreimu...ingredient for medicine.

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: [3 Leafy Stalk]. Need to learn how to make much medicine out of little herb. Easy?

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: What, human get confused and give stalks to Kreimu instead?

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Bring me, Creinu- not Kreimu- [3 Leafy Stalks].

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Grrmbl... Dumb Kreimu... Human have stalks?

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Good. Can take these, then- Alraune girl have sometimes. Tasty, but not good medicine.

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Durbeo might like, actually. Durbeo orc in food storage tower behind me. Maybe he want help too?

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Even when Kreimu not here, others say "Oh, Kreimu! Am cut, please help!" Things like that. To me!!

lines.speaker: Creinu
lines.line: Ressinter right there too! Explain that name is Creinu, not Kreimu, they go him. Then can't practice! Stupid not-orc language...

lines.speaker: Ressinter
lines.line: Bah... Kreimu worry too much. Will be fine now.

lines.speaker: Ressinter
lines.line: ...did not expect see good human in lifetime.

lines.speaker: Ressinter
lines.line: Armor still look gaudy though. Should wear orc leathers if want match style.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Oh. Human who help Ressinter. You are strange. Not like other human at all.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: This? This food storage. Mostly for meats and roots. Though, large ritual happening soon.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Festival with Earthpit. Will be coming soon- so stocking up food for that.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: ...human look like want help. You...really are strange. I suppose...if you want help with food, could do some fishing.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Won't ask human to do everything- just [5 Carp Meat] enough to help. Though, could bring more if wanted.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: If want bring more than 5, will accept more than 5.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Just need [5 Carp Meat] from human. Could bring more if wanted, but will not force you.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Mhm, mhm. You are strange human, but not bad human. This enough meat.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Festival will still be long time away, but here. Since human help, you get reward. Only fair.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: All must work together to survive on earth. All have places, all have paths.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Many just take and not give. Villager, bugs, other human... You are different.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Still not understand why helping so much. It good, but was not expecting from human.

lines.speaker: Durbeo
lines.line: Can say, happy to be wrong about this.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Human healer! Hello! This Onluk tower. Onluk tower two! Human help, so human welcome.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Tower one call tower one cause Onluk build tower one! This not usual spot for Onluk.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Usually at tower on small hill, across bridge. But because build tower by self, tower rickety.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Human helpful. Human get sturdy wood for fix tower? Swamp has sturdy wood. Forest has wood too, but more magical than sturdy.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: [6 Willow Planks] enough to make tower better, maybe. Willow strong wood! Can get?

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Human welcome in Onluk tower two, but Onluk tower one better. Not safe to be on without fix tower though.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: If want go on Onluk tower one, bring [6 Willow Planks] so Onluk can fix!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Aha! Human have willow wood! Onluk fix tower now!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Will repair Onluk tower one! Come see after fix!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Should go and see! Climb tower, shoot crossbow at Freelancer!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: TOWER ONE REPAIRED! Hrahaaah! Yes! Human very helpful!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Should go and see! Climb tower, shoot crossbow at Freelancer!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: See? Onluk tower one much better than Onluk tower two! Cozy up here, and can see Fruludir tower too!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Human very helpful. Healer and woodcutter! Repairer of tower- Well, human not repair tower. Helper of repairer of tower!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Here, for help repair Onluk tower one!

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: If bring up lots of arrow, maybe can shoot Freelancer. Like to run through sky. Cause problem for everyone, and Freelancer never actually die, just dissipate.

lines.speaker: Onluk
lines.line: Fun time sometimes! Though sometimes Freelancer shoot back. That how Onluk tower one broke.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Hm, healer human. Could swear, saw you walking around plains some time ago. What here for? Ressinter hurt again?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: No? Well, am curious now. You try heal Ressinter...luck, maybe? Or did human really know what herbs do?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Want review. Want see human medicine knowledge. Will ask questions, human give answer. Simple. Ready?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Fine. Take your time. Will be here for while to make sure other healer okay.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Good! So, first question. Ginkgo Leaf. What Gingko leaf good for?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: No. Gingko leaf bad for that. Hm, maybe human heal Ressinter through luck... Can try again if want.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Yes! Good. Gingko leaf help brain. Make feel better when stress, but make blood runny. Can be good for sometimes, but can be dangerous.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: So, second question. Sweetgale. What Sweetgale good for?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Nope. Sweetgale not for helping with that. Hm, maybe human heal Ressinter through luck... Can try again if want.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Mhm. Good! Sweetgale pulp make bugs avoid. Also make irritated skin soothe. Very good for bug bite.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Here third question. Elderberry. Elderberry good for two thing. What Elderberry good for?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: No. Elderberry not good for those. Hm, maybe human heal Ressinter through luck... Can try again if want.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Yes! Though, Elderberry also good for third thing. Can make good drink! Get drunk if ferment elderberry, but that not medicine.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Last question for human. Feverfew. What Feverfew NOT help with?

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Feverfew very good for heal that. Hm, maybe human heal Ressinter through luck... Can try again if want.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Pfff...hawhawhawhaw!!! H-Human, yahoo! I- Harhar!

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: That...correct! Not right, but correct! You...haha, you only help Ressinter through luck, right? Human not actually healer.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Human have humor though! And human try hard to help. More than can say for most humans. Here then- try more heal, instead of be soldier.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: World need more people to help other people. That human was willing to try mean many good thing.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Being healer difficult. Need to be used to seeing death, and gore.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Zuett trying be healer, but not sure if Zuett can do that. Very easy sick. Maybe why Zuett not try heal Ressinter.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Seen it- Zuett try heal hurt orc before, but was scared. Eyes big like full moon when see blood.

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Human say Zuett heal them? Mention blood, too? Hm. Must be very focused...

lines.speaker: Kreimu
lines.line: Zuett good, but still need overcome that fear. Brave in other ways, since Zuett talk with you, though.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Oh! You! Saw Zuett dragging you to camp. And saw other thing.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: And you helped Ressinter! Will apologize later. Was my fault. Human seen Freelancers?

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Freelancers think everything belong to them. Loiter around fortress a lot, try to jump in sometimes.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Was trying to shoot flying one down, but cannon broke, and cannonball explode.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Now Ressinter okay, but still need repair cannon. Human feel like helping, will need [5 Iron Ingots] to repair.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Long walk, but there iron in valley east of villager quarry. There also other villager there, with weapons. Not sure why.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Human can't find iron? There some in valley east of villager quarry, around villager with weapons.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Maybe someplace closer. If so, not know where. Need [5 Iron Ingots] total though.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Human being weirdly helpful. That good though! Make Lomoster job of shooting enemy easier.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Here. Freelancer like steal metal and other thing too, have found a lot from shooting. Human can have.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Not good for repair cannon, but probably good for make other thing.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Onluk like shooting from tiny tower on hill. Use crossbow or something. Cannons stronger.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Tower broke while ago. Still standing, but shake when climb and shake if on. Might fall soon.

lines.speaker: Lomoster
lines.line: Maybe human help with Onluk. Human get metal, so maybe human get wood for tower too?

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: Oh, that human who healed Ressinter. Yes, I've heard of you already. News travels fast here.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: You have a weird face. Uh, a weird look on your face, I mean. What, not used to a more eloquent orc?

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: I'm studying languages, is why. I haven't got everything known yet, so if you feel like helping, I could use it.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: I used to have a very smart hobbit friend who lived nearby. They've left, but I want you to check their hobbit hole to see if they left behind any language books.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: It should be close to the blue tower on the hill. That should be easy, right?

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: You forgot already? The hobbit hole is close to the blue tower on the hill. I wanted you to look for language books in there.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: And you gave me a weird look for being smart! Is it just because you've got a small brain?

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: Oh, good, they did leave a book behind. This even completes the collection I have. I have the first, second, fourth, fifth, and sixth volumes of this.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: Hopefully I can learn something new here. I still don't understand what all these weird "figures of speech" are supposed to mean...

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: What does busting your hump mean? Or two shakes of a lamb tail? Well, anyway. You probably know, so me trying to guess is boring.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: Here, then. That friend of mine wrote everything he came across down in some diaries, and he gave me them to keep, but I can't read them.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: The pages are too flimsy- I'll rip them if I turn them. It's a good thing the book you gave me is bound with strong leather, but I still need to be careful not to ruin it...

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: Well, maybe if you read what these have written in them you can learn some things yourself.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: We have to strip our leather into...I think your word for it was vellum, in order to make pages for our books that we won't rip so easily.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: Anyway, we tried to learn Wynnic and low Gavellian when the villagers moved overseas- How conceited the villagers are to name their language after the country!

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: The goblins learned the language very quickly- they're good at that sort of thing. But orcish and Wynnic or low Gavellian have very different spoken structure.

lines.speaker: Jixy
lines.line: Combine that with the war going on, and most orcs are stuck with the language only half-learned.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: You that weird human helping instead killing, right? Nunexetor and little goblins talking about you.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Trying to make weapons and tools better. Training, but running out of grindstones. Etemitoro- that is me, my name... That how say it?

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Weird human language. Anyway, know where good grindstone is- top of mountain east of fortress.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: There shortcut to top by running through Ledant cave. Maybe dangerous, but not too much. Follow dead bushes on road and can get to top quickly.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: May have something useful if bring me [Leaden Stone] for grind metal.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Look- human want help? Then get Etemitoro- that is me, my name... Get [Leaden Stone] from top of mountain east of fortress.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Can climb quickly if go through Ledant cave. Follow dead bushes on road- Now go! Have to keep working. No bother unless you have stone!

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Look- human want help? Then get Etemitoro- that is me, my name... Get-

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Oh! You have [Leaden Stone]! Was focusing on work, didn't notice.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Here. Human like green gem for money, right? Not good for smithing though.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Broken weapon parts not good alone, but still sharp. Can be used to make other weapons! Reuse good for earth- waste not!

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Not blacksmith yet. Just assistant- looking over forge til real smith get home.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Good at sharpening and making weapons and tools better, not good at shaping metal while hot, or making mixed stone pure for use.

lines.speaker: Etemitoro
lines.line: Earth provides what we need- But must work to make usable. Etemitoro- that is me, my name...think that is fair price.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Ah, the weird human. Why you looking to be helpful?

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Must be some reason. Not sure if tired of fighting or some other reason, but if human feel like helping, can use some help.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Running low on blue dyes. Have plenty of the other colors, but need blue. Know where to get them, too.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: The cave outside the villager bridge, with the pond and arch by it. Go in, and there will be blue flowers.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Get [8 Terramarine Buds] so can make more dyes. Don't know why you helping, but won't turn down help either.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Can't find the cave? Is outside the villager bridge, with the pond and arch by it.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Get [8 Terramarine Buds] so can make more dyes. Bright blue flowers, very dusty.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: The weird human again? You all covered in blue powder. You found the flowers then!

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Here. Will get that for you. The buds are enough for what need, but you can keep the dust.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Little more, too. But, again- why you looking to be helpful? Don't understand. Humans kill orcs a lot.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: You unlearn villager stupidity, maybe? In the middle of unlearning? Perhaps a sign from the earth things will heal. Perhaps not. We will see.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: The earth shows things if you show respect for her beauty. We decorate our body for it, put ink and dye in the skin, paint on the skin.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: Adorn our bodies with her gifts. She should be respected. Instead, villagers keep themself plain and bare like grubs.

lines.speaker: Miliyus
lines.line: The earth cries seeing them. She cries, weird human. Listen and maybe you will hear. You listening to us now, so maybe.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Huh. You again. That weird human who helped Ressinter. Something wrong?

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Hm. Looking to help out still? What is it with you looking to be helpful? Have to say I'm not used to this. But, I can think of something.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: HEY! Any of you feel like playing a game?
Ugh, yeah! We're so BORED in here!
What in the... HEY! Why's one of those big, scary humans in here?! Nunny, I thought you said we were gonna play a game!

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: We are. This human isn't actually so bad. Care to introduce yourselves?
Well, sure, but...even if you say this one isn't so scary, I know I don't wanna tell them my real name!
Didn't we just eat a bunch of fruit though? We can use those as fake names!

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: Okay then. Well, call me Mango then, weird human!

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: I just ate a bunch of blueberries, so I guess I'm Blueberry for now?

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: Hey, I wouldn't mind being called Grapes by anyone, really!

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: Then I'm Peaches! So we're just doing a little hide and seek game?

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Yes. Just hide around the fort someplace. If the human doesn't find you, you win.

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: Well, that's kinda boring, so I'm gonna go find a really tough to reach spot!

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: NYAHAHA! Everyone scatter!!

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Well, there you go. I'll tell you how many you have left to find if you talk with me.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Silly little goblins. Who goes and names themself after fruits?

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Guess goblins are just sort of fickle like that. But again, you just have to find all four of them.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: None of them will have left the fortress, so it shouldn't take too long.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Three to go. ...what's with the look? Your face scrunches up when I talk.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Oh, probably since I can speak fluently. Goblins picked up on low Gavellian and Wynnic faster than us orcs.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: But I accompany the goblins a lot, so I picked up on the nuances over time.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: That's two left. And yes, goblins live here too.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Place is called Centerworld for a reason, even if villagers call it Leadin. Dumb name for it, and they respect the names of the plains camps, so...

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Just real weird. Used to be like it sounds- the center of orcish territory. Had roads leading from all the forests and the plains.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Then the villagers moved in and kicked us out, and the earth started to rot because of that, and...

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Depressing talk for the middle of a game. I'll be quiet now. Should get back to looking, you.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Just one more to find. Pretty good at this, have to admit. Wasn't expecting you to be so quick.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Goblins usually hide in tiny places, like tree stumps and small caves, so we carved out some spaces for them here.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Course, then they filled in the entrances so most of us are too big to get through. Tried before and just got myself stuck.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Ever since the villagers paved over the settlements by the coast and put that big white eyesore of a city in the way we've looked out for the little ones.

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: NYACK! For such a big human you really know how to sneak up on someone!!

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: Gah, I thought I was a goner for a second there... If Nunny says you're okay then I'll trust him, but that doesn't make you less intimidating!

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: And, I guess out in the open like this, the other orcs wouldn't let you bully us, so...

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: Suppose you're alright, maybe. But even still, you found me, so I lose. Unless you can't find everyone else!

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: I bet you'll NEVER find Mango, hahaah! She always takes these games SUPER seriously!

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: Uh... I wonder where Peaches went? I know he loves playing in the creeks at Waterway, so... Oh. I shouldn't spoil their spot.

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: Aw darn it. I guess it's pretty easy to see me up here.

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: I mean, I knew that, but I thought you wouldn't think to climb the tower!

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: Well, anyway...you really went and tried to heal Ressinter? That's pretty admirable!

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: I hear most humans are bullies. It's why Veltu over at the Trunkstump camp was training us to be tougher.

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: Aaaand then a human went and killed her, because I guess they got told to do so! At least you seem halfway decent.

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: Anyway, back to the quiet ol' grouch with me!

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: Y'know, I probably shouldn't tell you this, but I could actually see Mango over in the other tower! She probably figured it was tough to get to.

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: ...wow. You're good. I thought you might be able to see me up here, but I didn't think you'd be able to reach me!

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: I don't really care about the fact you're human. As long as I get my entertainment I'm happy. Which kinda isn't so great, cause there isn't a lot here to tinker with.

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: Tinkernook is so much better about having machines and metals and things to experiment and build than here is.

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: Anyways, you win, I lose, so I better get back to stick-in-the-mud Nunexetor. See ya!

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: I lost, so I don't care about the game anymore. I saw Blueberry over by that one orc who keeps trying to lift that rock.

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: Ack! Thought you wouldn't notice me behind the stairs!

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: Ugh, you...you human types are scary up close. Is Nunexetor really sure you're not a bad guy?

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: I mean, look at your armor! You, you look like you could splat me against the wall in a snap!

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: ...I feel like I just gave you an idea and I'm not sticking around to find out! You win!

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: Ack! I saw Grapes on the hanging flag! Don't hurt me!

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Looks like the human wins. Guess I know how you managed to find that spineback boar.

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: There's no way you REALLY hunted one of those things. Those even give the orc hunters trouble!

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: Are you kidding me? Humans are terrifying, Blueberry! They've hunted way stronger stuff than some stupid pig!

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: But, the game was fun, right?

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: Yeah, I guess it wasn't as boring as I thought.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: That's all I wanted from you. Can go back to whatever it was you were doing now.

lines.speaker: Peaches
lines.line: Yes, finally! I don't have to spend time wondering if the human's gonna try and poke my eyes out!

lines.speaker: Grapes
lines.line: Oh, quit being such a scaredy-baby. This one's nice!

lines.speaker: Mango
lines.line: Good game, I guess! Back to being bored again.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: What, nothing to say?

lines.speaker: Blueberry
lines.line: ...Your shoe's unlaced, human.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: What? You aren't even wearing those kinds of shoes.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Anyways, to the winner goes the spoils. Here, for entertaining them for a bit.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: They have me watch the goblins but I'm no good at having fun with them, so thanks I suppose.

lines.speaker: Nunexetor
lines.line: Not much else to say. Was fun, I suppose.

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: ...fine. Maybe human not so bad.

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Human want talk Arrai-Veretel. In hut. Follow.

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Arrai-Veretel! Human try help orc around fortress. Want talk.

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Up to human now. Will not help more- choice is up to Arrai-Veretel.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Hmh. Zuett spoke about you. So you are human trying to end war?

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: YOU! You human who kill Rai-Poxper! You human who attack other fort!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Need talk with Zuett again. You follow. And you stay quiet. Understand?

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: ZUETT! You say human want peace. Do you know who human is?!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Whuh- This good human! Heal Ressinter-

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Human ALSO kill Rai-Poxper!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Wha- no-

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Human ALSO attack other fort! Many orcs dead because this human!
