lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: How can Zuett say human trying end war, when human START WAR AGAIN?!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Only because villager-

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: THAT. IS. THE. POINT!! Villager get human to fight for them! Cease-fire say Villager not attack orc. Then, human come over ocean. Try make peace- get attack!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: See human attack. Villager get human to attack, say lies to trick humans. Orcs defend self. Then, three Rai-orc die at Earthpit, Cliffhearth, Trunkstump goblin camp.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Human attack! Rai-Poxper take rightful toll for break cease-fire, but not war yet. Take magic axe from Villager city while magic power gone bad.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Villager and human attack first, but attack orc for take rightful toll like orc attack first! And human kill Rai-Poxper!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Orc take human fort built in dying earth forest. Cannot know if human planning another attack! But not kill human. Hold human instead.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Then same human who kill Rai-Poxper come, kill bathing orc, break in fort, kill many Centerworld orc! Villager start, orc finish, villager no respect end!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Yes, human tricked by Villager. But human still attack orc. Human still kill many orc! Human say want peace now?

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: What human done? Hunt boar? Help healer? Done busywork for other orc? That not make up for life lost.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: ...Arrai-Veretel right. What human done good, not make up for that. But, human still trying. If one human try to stop, more human can try to stop.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: War only killing us! If tried talk to human instead of go to sharpen spear and fight back, maybe human would learned faster than now.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Maybe. Maybe more orc be dead instead. Zuett, you cannot say what would happened. Wishful thinking, and I wish would happened too!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: But with unfinished Wynnic, orc cannot talk well. YOU try learn language when idiot killing you! All sound stupid, and no time to learn for most!

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: But human listen to Zuett, even if not sound smart. Arrai-Veretel not respect human. Justified, but still cause problem.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Grrh. FINE! Zuett want peace so bad? Human want peace so bad? Human spilled much orc blood. Only way out of war, is through. We will battle.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: No tricks. No backup. Nothing but battle between human and myself. If human can fight in ritual arena and win, then will listen.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Listen. Zuett. I want war stop too. But you must understand the risk here. Cannot make decision lightly. Villager go back on word- see writing, find way around writing.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Try threaten us with iron corpse machine! So, battle will happen. Will prepare ritual and gather crowd. Prepare, human.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: ...that right. Prepare, human. Arrai-Veretel strongest orc. Strong in everything. Mind, body, power, spirit.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Zuett still think human trying to be good. Still think can help stupid war end. Knock sense into Arrai-Veretel.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Prepare, human. Arrai-Veretel strongest orc. Strong in everything. Mind, body, power, spirit.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Zuett still think human trying to be good. Still think can help stupid war end. Knock sense into Arrai-Veretel. Arena is down stairs.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Before fight... Must perform ritual. This challenge need respect. I do not respect you, human, but will show respect anyway.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: May the earth herself hear us... Though we do not speak as we once have.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: We, as humble inhabitants of the land she has gifted us, pledge this show in honor of her.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: May she be sated, grow healthy, and honor us in turn for this offering.

lines.speaker: Watching Orcs
lines.line: HMH! HAH!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Now...begin!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: HMH! Human tough. Fine- Will take battle seriously now!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: For sake of those killed before me, I will not lose!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Ghh...hrrgh...

lines.speaker: Audience Orc
lines.line: Arrai-Veretel...lose?!

lines.speaker: Audience Orc
lines.line: No, no! Arrai-Veretel hurt bad! Human try kill Arrai-Veretel!!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: AM FINE! Stupid, idiot! No interrupting while ritual fight!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Human win. Hate to say, but human win. Not even try kill me.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Give time. Battle hard-fought- Need to wind down. Wait in meeting room. Will...discuss terms.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Feel like insult to stop war we did not start. But, gave promise. Human strong. Still not make up for so much death...

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: But human trying. Really, really trying. Will admit, did not know about human killing all when saw... Still. If war ending, deaths also ending.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Hmh. Human probably trying end war to start with. Just on wrong side. Can agree, Zuett.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Will stop attacking cities. Orcs still defend selves! Will not turn bellies for spears. Still not trust villagers- only give cease-fire.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Give opportunity for human to learn and and villager to show respect. They not attack, then will be open to more negotiation.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Will say- many orc hold grudge, in plains. Many orc probably still attack. If so, human also can defend self. But, human should avoid fight there.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: ...if villager continue attack, will defend selves as before. Human, make sure villager know this.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Mhm. Villager more stupid than human. Villager do many terrible thing. But endless war not help fix.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Peace first step to heal. ...unless villager keep doing stupid thing. Then may need fight anyway.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: So Zuett not naive. Some things...cannot...be...forgiven. Villager treading line close.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Human seen earth rotting in north. Have to have, since took fort in rotting place. Forest used to be living thing. Now dying. Dead in north-east.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Start happening only few decades before Villager leave across ocean! Villager always run away from problem.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: And villager create own problems. Can only mean villager hurt earth, and make her die, slow and sure. Many orc used to live there.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Even after villager move in, try kick orc out, many orc live there...then earth start to die. Has not come south- and we are south!

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: But...that off-track. No more war. Give this to whatever villager need to see it.

lines.speaker: Zuett
lines.line: Maybe see human again soon. Hopefully in good spirit and on good faith.

lines.speaker: Arrai-Veretel
lines.line: Go on. Give to whatever villager need to see it. Let them learn.

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: ...Think new thoughts. Difficult ones, from now on.

lines.speaker: Ureietun
lines.line: Keep thinking too. Not just copy what see. Figure for self what good and bad.

lines.speaker: Serepe
lines.line: ...wonder if villager know about death machine. Not machine that make death, machine that run on death.

lines.speaker: Serepe
lines.line: Bury parts for them. Not right to use tainted metal for things.

lines.speaker: Serepe
lines.line: Human know about death machine?

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: Thankful human try help, but how even get into fort? Serepe should stopped...

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: ...hmh. Onluk take inside. Makes sense now. She like Onluk. Like Onluk MUCH.

lines.speaker: Bitteliso
lines.line: Like look at Onluk, like talk Onluk, never hit Onluk...

lines.speaker: Serepe
lines.line: SHUT UP!

lines.speaker: Ismikku
lines.line: Tough human, to survive four-way attack. Or maybe just tough armor. Gaudy, bulky armor...

lines.speaker: Ismikku
lines.line: For tough human, will tell something that villager and human not know.

lines.speaker: Ismikku
lines.line: All skulls on pikes outside, at other camp, not villager skull. Not human skull. Orc skull.

lines.speaker: Ismikku
lines.line: Show people who attack the cost of it. Show those who were killed as reminder. Not escape consequences.

lines.speaker: Ismikku
lines.line: ...human trying now, but Ismikku see many things. Know human contributed many skulls to pikes. We watching you.

lines.speaker: Hulve
lines.line: ...what?

lines.speaker: Hulve
lines.line: On lookout. Not talking.

lines.speaker: Hulve
lines.line: Do not talk unless important thing.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Human! You're back! That certainly took you a while. I suppose all things considered I shouldn't be surprised. Those orcs are tough.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: What's this? You actually managed to get the brutes to sign a ceasefire?! I was expecting you to come back with a bloody prize, not a signature!

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: After the way they so savagely attacked our outpost and the way they've rebuffed our diplomacy squads, I wasn't expecting this.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Still, this is good! The terms are a bit more airtight than I'd prefer, but I suppose as long as they're out of our hair anything will do.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Hm? The orcs were talking about the decay up north? Not sure how that matters. It isn't like anyone knows what's causing it.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: I mean, have you heard the rumors flying from Lexdale? Saying witches are cursing the land, hah! Well, that’s besides the point.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: Here- your reward. I'd intended on giving you the mask so you could try and sneak in like one of them, but I...well, I forgot about it til you'd already left.

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: But I DID magically fortify it into a potent piece of gear instead! So it ought to serve you well. We thank you for your service, human!

lines.speaker: Captain Goruca
lines.line: You know, that one guy was going off about that orc catapult or whatever the entire time you were gone. He’s shut up now, but criminy!

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: Oh, hello there! I had hoped not to bother you, adventurer, but this is urgent.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: You see, the king is very...erm, distracted, and you are just the kind of willing, able-bodied person I need.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: You see, the king's son has gone missing, and with him worrying so much, the problems of the city have festered unsolved.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: We believe he was kidnapped by the splinter cell mercenaries in the jungle... Unfortunate, too. They used to be quite honourable.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: Well, anyway, they're usually spotted outside the run-down farm outside of town. Go there and see what they want in return for the young prince.

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: Excuse me?! What are you doing here, how did you find our secret hideout?

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: Oh, you're here for the boy? A mighty fine steal, that one! The boy won't be leaving this establishment for free. I'll need some nice loot for him.

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: Ah, but what to have you fetch... oh, haha! This would be a perfect opportunity to obtain that... Alright, ears open!

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: There's a certain talisman that we aren't able to get to in the temple not far from here. It has special abilities that allow my men to be strengthened, see.

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: The guardians there pack quite the punch, and there's some nasty mechanism in the way that we just can't crack.

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: The temple is found just across the waterway, in a crevice in the mountain. It used to be blocked until those WynnExcavation fellows tried digging there.

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: You get that talisman in my hands, and the king's boy is yours. Now off you pip! I'm a very busy man.

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: You've gotten the talisman! I can't believe you actually got through that puzzle!

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: At this point I would usually keep the kid and throw you out of here, but since you've done what I've asked in such a timely fashion, he's all yours.

lines.speaker: Mercenary Leader
lines.line: When you get back to whoever asked you to do this, tell him to leave my men and I alone! We guildsmen lay down our lives every day, we don't need any more hostile onlookers!

lines.speaker: Prince of Troms
lines.line: Uh... Hi? Err, why did you free me? I'm trying to run away, I hate being the son of the king.

lines.speaker: Prince of Troms
lines.line: He expects too much of me! I hate politics, and I want to be a great mercenary like Tisaun, to help protect people that can't protect themselves!

lines.speaker: Prince of Troms
lines.line: It's not like my father ever listened to me when I told him. He wouldn't even let me out of the castle.

lines.speaker: Prince of Troms
lines.line: Could you please tell Yavlis that I want to be free? I would be grateful if you could.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: Ah, finally! You're back. Did they let you bring him back? Those mercenaries have an awful habit of failing to honour their deals.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: Wait, the prince said what? He truly wants to be a mercenary? Oh my... then he must have escaped on his own.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: Alright then, if that's the path the king's son chooses to walk, then there's nothing we can do.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: I can only hope that he chose to join them out of a will to protect the people, rather than simply brutishness or money.

lines.speaker: Yavlis
lines.line: Such a shame that old guild has stooped to such a level. Well, we must thank you for your help. You can have the emerald ransom we had intended to pay.

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: Have you seen boots called Abysso Galoshes on your journey? A pirate stole them from us years ago! I could reward you if you could bring me the [Abysso Galoshes] and help us!

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: I see you have the infamous galoshes with you. But do you know even half of the story of them?

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: The boots were once owned by my ancestors, who decided to lock it away in this manor years ago.

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: Nobody knows why they decided to hide the boots just after they got into my family's hands. I was told they were acquired from a strange man with pale grey skin.

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: We think they hid the boots in some kind of basement in the manor. You can get to it by following the river to the waterfall, but you will need some kind of code to open it...

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: I remember Grandon saying that he found a book which is apparently a diary from one of my ancestors. Ever since that filthy pirate raided our home and stole our treasures, weird things have been happening.

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: Grandon should already have finished reading it. If I allow you to enter my home, would you talk to him?

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: There are strange things going on in this mansion and I hope that book reveals everything we need to know...

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: I almost forgot to give you your boots back, I am not sure if I want to have them near me. Remember, it is imperative you find the 4 digit code to the basement.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Ferndor sent you here, correct? That must mean you’re here to help find the hidden 4 digit code in the manor.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: The book is actually a diary written by our ancestors decades ago. It is actually very interesting, how they remodeled almost the whole house.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Ferndor probably told you about the boots, right? The diary has some information about them...ah, here, on this page.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Here...our family bought them from "a dark and mysterious humanoid creature" a long time ago.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: The boots were apparently so valuable that the creature as part of the deal, said they put some kind of spell on them, but that was a lie.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: It was found that the boots themselves were horrendously powerful, imbued with dark magic that will deteriorate and decay everything around it over time.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: They were given a special boot container with similar effects, but when the Galoshes are within the Container, they cancel each others' effects out.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: They hid the boots in the mansion, along with the case. The writer of this diary wrote down some hints as to how to get to them, maybe you can find out what they mean. Here, try this one:

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: "The face above the hall owns the nose that needs to be heavier to open the way".

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Hmm, all the hints appear in a chapter about this room, the dining hall. Any idea what this meant? It feels like it should be obvious, but I can't for the life of me figure this out.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: "Throw something behind the map on the wall to uncover a piece of the code"? Wait, that probably means the code to the basement!

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: A room hidden underneath the big head? Why didn't I think of that!? I always wondered how self-centered they had to be to put that in, but who knew it actually had a valid purpose!

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: So, there was a sign telling you to look for stone in the corner? Hm...intriguing!

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Whoever placed down that sign might have meant a secret way up to the second floor. It hasn't been accessible for a fairly long while, not since the stairs collapsed. Except for Leacen, but she's a bit crazy...

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Anyway, seems they guessed that we would have to search for a way to return the boots, and made preparations. Good thing, that.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: As I said, the stairs are all broken. I mean, I certainly couldn't climb up those rotten scraps of wood. Suppose it might be best to look for that stone, hm?

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: But where could it be...oh? Is this a hint? I just noticed this on the next page.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: "The carpet of different colour will show you the stone to reveal the tables secret".

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Sheesh! Quite the engineers, these old fellows! Never would've imagined any of this in the house. Anyway, was there a message? What did it say?

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: The hole nobody wanted? He can only mean the little rat hole in the back part of this hall. Though, it's more just a hole anymore, all the rats are gone.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Well, details, details. We never checked it any more than just laying mouse traps, so I suppose there could be something in there given how complex these contraptions have been.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: I would say, you look into the hole and then search on top of the blue flags!

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: But if that's the way up to the second floor, what does the diary mean by this?

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: "Throw something behind the map on the wall to uncover a piece of the code"? Wait, that probably means the code to the basement! Come back to me at once when you've done that, I have more to tell you!

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: You found a piece of the code!? Hahah, excellent! I must say, you've made more progress in a few minutes than I have in a few years! You humans really are something!

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Now, the diary now says you must make your way to the second floor to find the other 3 digits of the code.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Remember, to get up to the second floor you need to use the button in the rat hole to open the passage above the blue flags hanging from the ceiling.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: It doesn't say where they are, just that they're well hidden and that there are additional clues around the house. The other 3 digits should all be up there on the second floor! Maybe Leacen has seen something about them while she's been up there, as well.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: Once you've found the whole code, head to the basement. Just follow the path and signs outside the manor once you have it.

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: So you have the container and the boots! I wish I would have gone with you...

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: At least we can stop the manor's slow decay! Let me just put the boots into the container...

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: That was easy. I still can not believe that such a small thing can cause so much trouble.

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: Well, I can not just let you stand there without a reward, right?

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: Here, how about some emeralds, and these boots? They're heirlooms given to my family by the Sodeta Guild who once owned this mansion. I promise they aren’t evil! Feel free to visit us at any time!

lines.speaker: Ferndor
lines.line: Now that the boots are back in place, we only need to repair the mansion, and we can live normally again!

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: This building has such rich history, it would've been an absolute shame to have lost it over just a pair of silly old boots.

lines.speaker: Grandon
lines.line: I mean, what would the Sodetas have thought? Well, I guess they probably wouldn't come all the way over from the Guild Hall to check anymore, but...still.

lines.speaker: Atisun
lines.line: Oh, a human? If I could beg your pardon a moment... could I talk to you about the mansion here?

lines.speaker: Atisun
lines.line: All you have to do, is go in there and find answers. I'm sure the past won't haunt us both. Something happened here all those years ago... I want to know what.

lines.speaker: Servant
lines.line: Mr. Caritat is always writing so intensely in that book... I do wonder what he could be saying.

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: He won't even tell me what he's writing.

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.line: I'll bet he's writing insults about us or something. He can't be as nice as he appears, no one is!

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: I accidentally dropped my Library Key down the drain, do you think my dad will be angry?

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.line: Come on, Timmy. Mr. Caritat is crazily sweet. I doubt he'd be upset, even if you'd thrown it down there on purpose.

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: I still want to find the key though, do you know where I should look?

lines.speaker: Servant
lines.line: Well, the drainage pipes have probably taken the key to the basement in the southeast corner of the mansion by now, that's most likely where it is.

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.line: I've heard about weird things happening around the house. People are saying the mansion might be haunted!

lines.speaker: Servant
lines.line: Ghosts? Preposterous! This mansion isn't haunted, don't believe those silly rumors!

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: G-g-ghosts?!

lines.speaker: Maid
lines.line: It's so kind of the Caritats to donate these supplies to the struggling people in the forest.

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: I've forgotten, where should I look for my Library Key?

lines.speaker: Servant
lines.line: The drainage pipes have probably taken the key to the basement in the southeast corner of the mansion by now, you should check there.
Page 1: Today was my first day as the butler for the Caritat family. They gave me quite a warm welcome. I think I'm going to like it here.
Page 2: The Caritats are as nice as people say. They're some of the kindest people I've ever met, let alone work for.
Page 3: That Timmy boy has been acting rather unusual lately... Uncharacteristically hostile. I wonder what's come over him.
Page 4: I've been hearing strange noises at night. Scratching, and sometimes yelling... I do hope nothing bad is going on.
Page 5: I don't even know how this happened, but Timmy performed dark magic. He shot a fireball! The north wall of the library was wrecked!

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: Timmy, is something bothering you? You have been acting so weird lately.

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: You cannot command me, mortal! You and all of your inferior species will bow to the darkness!

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: I don’t know what game you are playing, Timmy. But I will not stand for it any longer, snap out of it!

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: You shall pay for your insolence, mortal!

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: Dark magic? What foul books have you been reading? And what's that in your hand?

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: Casting spells with a black spoon? I'm going to get rid of this foul thing!

lines.speaker: Timmy
lines.line: That is an item beyond you, mortal. Give it back to me this instant!

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: Attention, attention everyone! I have an announcement I'd like to make!

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: My son, Timothy, has just turned eighteen today.

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: Now, there have been a few slight hiccups over the years, but we've made it through mostly in one piece.

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: And I'd like to say, I'm very proud of him. To Timothy, a new man!

lines.speaker: Timothy
lines.line: Thank you very much, Father, and everyone here. Here's to more years of health-

lines.speaker: Mister Caritat
lines.line: Please, everyone stay calm. I'm sure it's just the cooks spilling something...

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: Oh my god... what is that thing?!

lines.speaker: Chef
lines.line: Everyone out, now! We can't fight these things!

lines.speaker: Timothy
lines.line: How was any of that even possible? What are we going to tell their families?

lines.speaker: Timothy
lines.line: No, of course not! I overcame that years ago, you know that, I can't believe you still suspect me of-

lines.speaker: Servant
lines.line: Ah, sir, we did find something rather unusual in the kitchen that might interest you? Maybe?

lines.speaker: Servant
lines.line: We found this charred-looking black spoon. I've worked here for years, and I've never seen any spoons of this style in the mansion.

lines.speaker: Timothy
lines.line: Wait, that spoon? I remember sneaking into your study that one time to get it, but how did it survive the fire?
Page 2: There is a dark power beyond our control within this mansion. There is no use trying to fight it.
Page 3: I felt like all of the skulls were watching me. I have had to turn them all towards the fireplace.

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: No, no! I said three feet left, you absolute...

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Mr. Caritat! What are you doing?!

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: What are you doing here, Elf? You need proper equipment to be on this site-

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Mr Caritat, you can't build a house here!

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: I can do whatever I like here, I bought the land.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: You don't understand! This is where it came... this is where the darkness invaded!

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: Don't be preposterous. I'm building here to show the people that there's simply nothing to worry about!

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: Besides, even if there was something, now that Dullahan's gone, it'll go too.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What?! He wasn't the one causing all this, it was-

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: Well of course you would think that. You and him had some... history, didn't you?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: I... Please, Mr Caritat. You don't understand what you're doing...

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: I am securing some prime real-estate right here. Oh... Perhaps that is why you're here?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What? No, I-

lines.speaker: Caritat Senior
lines.line: Trying to expand elven territories, are you?! Well, I'll be having none of that! Leave, before I have my men escort you!

lines.speaker: Atisun
lines.line: Hey! Human! Are you alright?! Please, calm down, quit flailing around, you're safe!

lines.speaker: Atisun
lines.line: Oh thank goodness, you're back to us. I was so worried... er, you might not recall. Let me explain...

lines.speaker: Arnod
lines.line: Mmph! Humnym! Mah houfhs fhs om fifhre! Gft hfrelp, tiff brafze womd strfp!

lines.speaker: Arnod
lines.line: ...well, that explains why you didn't help. But, uh, did the RAGING FIRE escape your notice somehow?!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Hm...where am I going to get help now- Mh? You're one of those human types, right? Do you have-

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Huh? Someone's house is on fire? Guess that's a little more pressing than what I was going to ask. Where is it?

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Oh, that valley by the gate? I think I know where you mean. Let's walk together. So, tell me what exactly happened?

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Hm...didn't think they'd be this far out, but it'd make sense if...

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Aha! Here's the problem. It's just a little Fleris. Ehm, to explain, they normally live in the Heights.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Pretty affectionate, good if you can stand the heat, but if you take them away from their mounds they get spooked.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: One fleris could've kept setting this man's house on fire, but all the other fallout...there's certainly more where this one came from.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Let's go talk to the villager outside. He might've seen where the others got off to, or where they came from.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Sir, I figured out why your house kept re-igniting and solved that issue, but tell me, have you seen any moving sludgy things around here?

lines.speaker: Arnod
lines.line: Uhm, I don't really know. I've been trying to douse my house so many times over that I haven't really paid attention!

lines.speaker: Arnod
lines.line: I remember seeing some tar-looking stuff dripping from the mountains behind my house, but that's it!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Sounds concrete enough to me. Let's check out what's going on on top of the mountain ridge. Check that book of yours if you need directions.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Hm, you're a pretty quick climber. I thought I'd get ahead of you. Well, this looks like the scorched area down in the valley... Hm! I thought so.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: There's only one reason I can think of that there would be so many Flerisi around here... If that wagon's reinforced, then...

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Gah, I knew it. Traffickers! And incompetent ones, too, considering they couldn't hold the things.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: There's a black market issue in the Molten Heights. Things that you can't find anywhere else are harvested in the Heights for their high value.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Flerisi are one of them. In the Heights, they're kept as pets. They're relatively friendly, keep your house warm, and don't need much care...

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: ...But if you take them away from a warm place, they burn everything. To think- Some people use the things as weapons. Can't leave well enough alone...

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: We'll need to catch these flerisi. Here, take this net. While you catch them, I'll repair the cart so we can put them in there later.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: I've got the cart all repaired and ready, did you get all the Flerisi? Come over to the cart then. We still have work to do.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: I'll keep the Flerisi in a smaller fire to keep them calm, see if I can't get them back to the Heights when this is done.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: For now, I want to see if I can find anything on who these traffickers were. Let's see if they left anything in the front of the cart.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: ...oh. Well, didn't notice that the fires went THAT far earlier. That's a problem, isn't it?

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: To explain, Flerisi aren't all as tiny as the ones we've found here. They feed off cinders and fire... And for this much damage to be caused, well...

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Methinks this one's getting a bit out of control. This is right next to that big forest, too. Could be a problem if we leave this one be.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: We're going to have to track it down and subdue it. Here, follow me. I'll dig us down to the valley. Watch a dwarf at work!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Not bad, eh? Anyways, dunno what that huge gate's for, but it looks like our Fleris friend has commandeered it for a bonfire.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: At least it's a little more contained than I thought, being in that cave, but we still have to catch it. Lead the way. I'm right with you.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: What the...?! It inflamed the creatures in this cave! Fend 'em off!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: There are more of them coming! Get to the end of the cave!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Gah, more?! Behind you!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Hey! Back up! Don't approach the enemies!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Both of us stopping is going to make it take too much time, the traffickers might come back!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Listen up. I'll handle these things, while you go after the Fleris. If it's a big one like we think, it'll be a downhill battle- It should shrink if you attack it!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Alright, time for a little royal rumble!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Phew, you're alright! Charred and covered in soot, but that's to be expected. Subdued the Fleris, too! I have the net with me, so allow me.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Well, this is probably a bit of thankless work we just did, but so is a lot of work. Let's get out of here. We can talk outside.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Well, I say the work is thankless, but that won't stop me, anyways. Thank you for the help, human- This would've been overwhelming alone.

lines.speaker: Garull
lines.line: GWUH! Oh god, don't scare me like that! Who... Who even are you?!

lines.speaker: Garull
lines.line: Thank you for listening to me about not being so quiet coming over here. I'm guessing you've got everything?

lines.speaker: Garull
lines.line: Oh, a visitor? Interesting. I thought I only knew about this cave, considering I was called crazy by my master.

lines.speaker: Garull
lines.line: Ah, need help about the items? I'm fine with giving you a refresher, yeah.

lines.speaker: Garull
lines.line: If you see Kelight again, tell him "I told you so" about the Creepers!

lines.speaker: Jorkin
lines.line: You may want to get out of here, traveller. The Nether is very dangerous!

lines.speaker: Jorkin
lines.line: You have the Light Dust, then? Hand it here, I want to see something.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: I see you want to enter this mighty temple! Do not deny it, I see it in your eyes.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: It is only natural, after all, to want to join the esteemed ranks of the Legends, such as myself!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: However, as a Legend, I am very busy, autographs and the sort, and that's not to mention my guard duty! Let me see if you are even worth my time.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Hm... At a glance, you don't look anything special! Why, you may as well be a common soldier, for all I can imagine!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Tell me, why should I bother giving you this chance? Because thus far, I'm not impressed.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Hm? What are these oddities you have with you? Curious, yet useless. Allow me to dispose of them for you.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Indeed. Now, run along. Return when you have something truly impressive to show me.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: So you return! Very interesting. That certainly puts you a level beyond any others who have tried... But it is not enough.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: So? Tell me, why should I bother giving you this chance? Because thus far, I'm not impressed.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: You're stubborn? Hah! Don't make me laugh. Do you think you are the first to attempt entry without anything great to show for it?

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Of course you aren't. Run along, now. Return when you have something truly impressive to show for yourself.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: So you are! And so am I. You will not get past me that easily, I'm afraid.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Off you go, then. Don't come back unless you have something to show!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Yes, I am starting to get that impression. You are such a headache, you know that?

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Fine! Fine. I'll give you a chance. I'm certain you won't succeed, but anything to get you to stop bothering me.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Ahem. Hidden deep within a nearby cave is a beast beyond compare. Corrupted, yes, but nothing like the foes you may have faced before.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Rumor has it this creature was one of the miners which first ventured into the Nether Portal... Of course, as a Legend, I would usually disregard such things.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: In any case, its power cannot be understated. Simply entering its cave will greatly weaken you, even with the best equipment!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Getting close to it would quickly corrupt you, which is why you will need protection. Only a light whose origin is from the same realm from which the beast arrived will do the trick.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: As such, your very first step on your journey to become a Legend will be... to visit a friend of mine who studies the Nether.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: His name is Jorkin, and he knows more about that realm than anyone else I know. Find him in the Roots of Corruption, and request his aid. Tell him I sent you.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: ...And? Surely you do not hope to bribe me, do you? What use would I have for whatever meager wealth you have?

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: I'm a Legend! I have everything I could possibly need for the rest of my life! Now, run along. Return when you have something concrete to show me.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Ha! You? A Legend?! What a joke. You aren't the first to have tried that, by the way. I know each and every member of our ranks, and you are not one of them.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Ah, truly, being a gatekeeper of the Temple is an entertaining position. Run along, now. Return when you have something real to show me.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Hmph. Ridiculous. I don't need you to convince me of anything! Clearly, you are nothing but a pretender.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Run along, now. If you don't have anything to show for yourself, don't waste my time!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: ...But- ah. Since you are still here. Perhaps- no, no, don't be ridiculous, Kelight.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Come on, Kelight, don't do this, you can't just let them get you with the silent treatment...

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Oh, fine. You've got me interested. What is special about you? You look like a common soldier, and yet...

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Very well. I will allow you to attempt the trial. Perhaps, then, you will be able to prove yourself.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Hidden deep within a nearby cave is a beast beyond compare. Corrupted, yes, but nothing like the foes you may have faced before.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Rumor has it this creature was one of the miners which first ventured into the Nether Portal... Of course, as a Legend, I would usually disregard such things.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: In any case, its power cannot be understated. Simply entering its cave will greatly weaken you, even with the best equipment!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Getting close to it would quickly corrupt you, which is why you will need protection. Only a light whose origin is from the same realm from which the beast arrived will do the trick.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: As such, your very first step on your journey to become a Legend will be... to visit a friend of mine who studies the Nether.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: His name is Jorkin, and he knows more about that realm than anyone else I know. Find him in the Roots of Corruption, and request his aid. Tell him I sent you.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Well? You've been given a task, haven't you? Don't come back until you've retrieved the light you'll need for protection.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Hah. Took you long enough! This is the light dust, I presume?

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: I'll hold on to this for now. While it is a vital ingredient for your protection, it is not enough on its own.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: You'll need an item to focus the magic around yourself, preferably something you'd wear. Hm... How about a helmet? Certainly, it'd do wonders for your poor sense of style.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Ahem. As for creating it... I know only one man capable of crafting a piece of armor good enough to ensure your safety.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Unfortunately, he will be hard to reach. His name was Garull, and he was the finest craftsman I'd ever met! A bit on the eccentric side, though.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: He was always ranting and raving about Creepers... he really thought they were real, can you imagine? What complete and utter nonsense.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: When I suggested the notion to be absurd, he seemed upset by my comments, and stopped visiting. Truly, I don't know what I did wrong. What a ridiculous man.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: As it stands, I have no idea where you could find him. He spoke of wanting to research the Pigman Ravines several times, though none of our rank have ever seen him there.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: In any case, it is somewhere to begin your search! Should you manage to find him, and convince him to craft you the helmet, return here and we can proceed.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: ...Hm? Oh, it's you again. Did you manage to actually find the blighter? Good to know he isn't dead, at least.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: You have the helmet, I presume? Hand it over, here. I'll quickly apply the light dust. Then, you'll be able to enter the cave.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Hopefully you'll do better than that last group that tried to fight it. Six fighters strong... never came back.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: ...Well, good luck! I'm certain you'll either succeed, or you'll fail spectacularly. Either or, really.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Bring me concrete proof of your triumph over the beast, and I will grant you passage into the Temple of the Legends! Do be quick, would you?

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: ... You... You did it? H-how?!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Even one so brave and powerful as myself could not possibly survive against-

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Er... I mean, of course you were able to defeat the beast! I believed in you from the very start!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: ...Ehm. I suppose you are welcome in the Temple of the Legends, now! You have... certainly proven yourself. My apologies for misjudging you. Feel proud of your accomplishment!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: I am proud to have you in our temple! Perhaps one day you shall be almost as great as I am!

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Only the bravest adventurers who succeed in my quest can enter the temple of the legends.

lines.speaker: Kelight
lines.line: Only brave warriors of level 68 may attempt to join this temple.

lines.speaker: Rayshyroth
lines.line: Oh? Well, greetings. What brings you to our quiet lonely island, let alone all the way up here?

lines.speaker: Rayshyroth
lines.line: Aha, you're back with the Sky Vapor! Sorry about the climb, even I find it rather inconvenient at times.

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: Oh, what am I to do...? How am I to be our next elder if I cannot even help him... Oh? Ehm, hello, stranger.

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: You most likely heard me. Our elder has fallen ill of some vile disease... I am to be our next elder, but I am not yet ready.

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: We have tried everything we can think of, but our healers and shamans have failed to cure him. We had some hope, however...

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: A man in your city, Troms, insists that he sells healing water that could cure him, but he is selling it for an exorbitant price that we cannot afford!

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: I do not know where else to turn. I must ask you for help. If you can purchase it, I am sure that we could find a way to repay you.

lines.speaker: Salesman
lines.line: Oh, why hello there! Come for my patented healing water, have you? Any problem instantly cured! Sniffles beware!

lines.speaker: Salesman
lines.line: You're quite lucky, I only have a couple of bottles left, so it won't go cheap, but this is the good stuff! Only [64 Liquified Emeralds]!

lines.speaker: Salesman
lines.line: What? Don't give me that look! This is the real stuff, very valuable and rare! What do ya take me for, some guy who'd sell lake water for a fortune?!

lines.speaker: Salesman
lines.line: Agh, agh! Put away the weapon! Put it away! Jeez, buddy! Alright, I admit it, I'm a fraudster! But, I do know where you get the real stuff, I ain't lying about that much.

lines.speaker: Salesman
lines.line: There's this group of mages out in Dernel who know how to get the stuff. They're a bunch of tightwads and wouldn't give me any real healing water to sell.

lines.speaker: Salesman
lines.line: I doubt you'll have any better luck with it, but go on, try your luck.

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: Hm, hm...if it really does that, then...oh, is someone there? Erisk?

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: Oh, a tourist. Heard about the healing water, I presume? Well, if you are here to make a quick buck, you can turn right back around from where you came.

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: Hm...ah. Iboju's sister settlement...I see. I will trust this is an honest venture, then. The tribesmen are honourable.

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: I will provide you a specially-prepared bottle to hold the water in. My colleague, Erisk, is within the fountain here. He can fill up the bottle for you.

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: There are a few animals in the fountain, however. They're wild and will most likely attack, but you look well-armoured. I doubt you'll have trouble.

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: The entrance to the heart of the fountain is right below us. Take a deep breath and dive right in.

lines.speaker: Erisk
lines.line: And who might you be? We certainly don't get many visitors down here.

lines.speaker: Erisk
lines.line: Aha, Isfurus referred you. Yes, let me bottle this up for you, then. Once I do, make sure you don't drop them! Both the bottles and the water are valuable and difficult to replace.

lines.speaker: Erisk
lines.line: But what a marvel this place is...water to cure all ailments, even aging! I even hear there is a similar fountain someplace in Gavel, can you believe?

lines.speaker: Erisk
lines.line: Oh, I nearly forgot. Just make sure to check back in with Isfurus before you leave! There is just one more step to the process he has to take care of.

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: Aha. You had no trouble, I assume? Hand the bottle here, I'll finish the seal and remove the impurities...

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: ...done. There is much potential here...ancient tribal markings repeat the word "youth" over and again. It could be used, or abused...

lines.speaker: Isfurus
lines.line: Anyways, you have your water. Not to be rude, but I must ask that you leave me to my research now. You have your delivery to make anyway, correct?

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: You have returned, I see. Have you the healing water?

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: Aha, perfect! If this will not work, then...no, I must have faith.

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: From the bottom of my heart, thank you. I know we surely will not be able to compensate you for the price of the water...

lines.speaker: Monte
lines.line: ...but here. This is the summation of our village's riches. For aiding us, consider it yours.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Ah, one of you adventurin' types, huh? We see a lot of you around here... Going in and out as you please. Must be a nice life.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Though, if you could spare some time, the town could use you-

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Wait, already?! It's only been a day since last! How insatiable are they...?

lines.speaker: Gelibord Guard
lines.line: THE UNDEAD HAVE OVERWHELMED THE GOLEMS! EVERY CITIZEN FOR THEMSELVES!!

lines.speaker: Gelibord Guard
lines.line: The horde's retreating, but we have one citizen dead! Regroup at the square and prepare the pyres!

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Hey! Over there, you alright? Come talk to me, I can explain what just happened.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Phew. That was a smaller horde, thankfully... Still, good thing you were there. That could have been worse.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Still, c'mon now... We have to burn the bodies. Can't leave the job half-done.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: It's a bit sacrilegious, but necessary to do right now- otherwise they just keep coming back, like they do across the ridge in Kander.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: The ones around here all come up from the river, though, and since it runs right through town, well... You can see the problem.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Since we don't live in a reeking, pockmarked plain, we have to burn the bodies so any dead don't turn right around against us.

lines.speaker: Gelibord Guard
lines.line: Say your goodbyes, all. Irahe will be missed. Step away from the pyre!

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Some conspiracy theorists think that the Lazarus Pit is the issue. It's an urban legend, a well of water that can revive the dead.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Supposing that it's real, it would make some sense, at least- If it started feeding into the river or water tables, then we'd get the current goings-on.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Of course, no one knows where it is, since it's just rumors, but there's supposedly an "Order" of pit-keepers. Conveniently long dead, and buried in that small graveyard just north of here.

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: It's...probably just Referick having made the rounds to any drunk who would listen a while back, but it's also our only shot. If you could give it a search, and a yay or nay?

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Oh, you found something? Well, color me shocked that there was any stock to Referick's ranting...

lines.speaker: Lord Plaatic the Kind
lines.line: Ugh. And who put YOU in charge of waking me up? Where's Gwendolyn, my maid? Incompetents- she was supposed to be buried with me too!

lines.speaker: Lord Plaatic the Kind
lines.line: Ah, my favorite little weird-small-nosed-person! The graveyard is so lovely when it's quiet- you really did do a good job!

lines.speaker: Poclo Wabblebuff of Gelibord
lines.line: Greetings! Thank goodness, that dreary old tomb was simply awful. No furniture, no natural light, not even a lick of paint! So drab, the whole thing.

lines.speaker: Poclo Wabblebuff of Gelibord
lines.line: So, is Mrs. Fluffles doing alright without me? Oh, I bet she was so affectionate, always such a softie!

lines.speaker: Poclo Wabblebuff of Gelibord
lines.line: W-wait, Mrs. Fluffles... She was...d-dead? No... It can't be! I left her a lifetime supply of food!

lines.speaker: Poclo Wabblebuff of Gelibord
lines.line: Oh, thank you so much! I was so worried that after my death she wouldn't be okay... What a relief!

lines.speaker: Uggword Pollywaggon the Murderous
lines.line: I oughta deck you for waking me up!! Don't you realize it's RUDE to re-animate the long-dead corpse of a murderer when he's trying to get his beauty death?!

lines.speaker: Sir Pigglesworth the Thirty-Fifth
lines.line: My goodness! Ah, it feels good to stretch these old bones. It's not easy being cooped up in a coffin, you know.

lines.speaker: Sir Pigglesworth the Thirty-Fifth
lines.line: Oh, you found it! Wonderful! Just pop it on that fingerbone right there... Ah, it fits even better on the other hand!

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: Ah, you're back! We were getting a tad worried about you. Were you able to figure anything out in the chapel there?

lines.speaker: Burtur
lines.line: I'll stay back at the town square, in case the undead attack again. Give me a shout if you find something you aren't sure about.

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Aha, perfect! You'll be perfect! Lucky a human decided to come here!

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: I'll get to the point- I want you to go get something for me, and then bring it back here. Simple, right?

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: When you do that, I'm going to fix it up and try something out on you. Something magically enlightening!

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Oh, don't give me that look, it should be perfectly safe! Unless you've been mired in darkness for the past however many years...

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Anyway, what I need is a specific kind of mushroom that grows close by, the Bluecap Mushroom.

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: They grow underground- in a cave out the gate northwest of here. I'll even pay you if you bring it back, so what have you got to lose?
Looks like someone rolled about the air fuzz too much, so indeed hello! A light hello to yourself, soldier, and a greetings to Professor Eih, which is me!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: I don't rhyme all the instances, I feel the need to say. But what do you say? Very little! But I bet you're wondering where you are.

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: I am no gambling man, but the chips are down and it is time to play 52-Pickup with the puzzle pieces, and I'll eat my bowtie if you aren't ready.

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: The betting pool says the way to go is the opposite of in front, so that leaves someplace we can't talk about in front of the kids as your path!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: I will be around! Or asquare, as it were. Technically amultiplesquares, replete with alines! And abevels! And other some such things like-

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: The punks scramble like eggs, and your skillet is sizzling! Certainly the heat in the kitchen is too much- so where is the fire extinguisher?

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: It won't rocket you! The hole in the shape of a door looms out of your transparent grasp- frogs can't skip leg day, so be froggy! Bounce and jump!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: Swoosh and sprint! Speed and non-slip shoes! With a CLICK upon me I give you all but one, as much as you need!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: The colors! Shimmering as a prism- oh, no one likes those things. The writing is on the wall, but the window mugs it for pocket change! The inhumanity!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: Use your eyes as ears and hear what I shall write! The cockpit is missing ground control and the cornfields all look the same in endless rows!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: So Eih, esquire professor PhD, will provide the coordinates in helpfully non-literal fashion, and one's joystick shall lead the holder to bliss!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: At one's boots, the colors paint themselves towards an orientation. Above one's head, the lights match and fling you the same!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: I'm all out of airplane food, but the goal is more than peanuts- it's progress, just opposite our position. Fly well!
Hey, look to your left for a moment.

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: Familiar to the nursing home, with no IV in sight! Phenomenal, and now my gambling metaphors will be apropos!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: A solid, 100% pure, statue-made-out-of-tons-of-things what looks like me! I call it, “Ill Of The Ooze, Young!” And it begets your path amongst the lilypads.

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: Likeru? No, no, she can’t find you here- her eyes deceive her. But I won't! Not any more than the film reel degrades, and the theater is ahead!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: Now, don't tell the kids about this one either! The way forward is through my masterpiece- but I can't imagine a gullet glorious!
Don't come any closer... I don't want to have to fight...
I-I'm warning you. You'll stand no match against me...
That's it...

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: There we are! Snapped out of it! Though perhaps writing in the mud was better- Soon it will dry.

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: Without the static of the fungal caps, the radio station will be off-air- and the device unplugged!

lines.speaker: Professor Eih
lines.line: Scratch it in your eyelids- the lightbulb screwed between the arches, and the feather-duster's sunset shades will reveal my deepest compatriot. Quick now, wake!

lines.speaker: Elder Berusia
lines.line: Ugh. Rats chewing the roots. They've their place, it simply isn't here. Neither is your place in the koi pond, stranger.

lines.speaker: Elder Berusia
lines.line: I believe Likeru tossed you into the deep end without meaning, so to speak. I understand your being overwhelmed, but still...

lines.speaker: Elder Berusia
lines.line: Speaking of which, it might behoove you to let her know you've recovered. Though, should you need rest, you may take it here.

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Ehm. Okay, that was...a bad idea. Should NOT have done that with a human. Uh, noted for the futu- oh, you're actually alright?!

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: You came back and just leapt into the koi pond! I thought you'd drowned down there!

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: I guess the spores from the Bluecaps got to you before you could bring them back. I wonder what you saw?

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: You reacted like you were crazy when I tried to talk with you... You were supposed to get visions of the light! A deep connection!

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Wait, maybe it's cause of that portal...the signals got mixed? I'll have to look into this more...but hey, I got the Bluecap, anyways, so...

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Here, your payment- and a little extra I whipped up too. Um, really sorry about all that!

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: The Bluecap Mushrooms grow in a cave out the gate northwest of here.

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Yeah...the more I think on it, the more that the corruption portal messing with the visions makes sense.

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Well, if you ever want to try again and see if I'm wrong go ahead, but please don't dive into the pond again?

lines.speaker: Likeru
lines.line: Mmm, might not be strong enough mentally... Hey, come back around Level 70, I have something to try.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: Hey there adventurer, can I speak with you for a second? I need you to do a spot of detective work for me.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: My grandfather once told me how beautiful this place was, and how to visit here if I wanted to relax.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: But as you can see, this island is the least bit relaxing. It is a sorrowful place, corrupted and dark.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: This can't be right. My grandfather was an honest man, he wouldn't have lied.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: I figure something must have happened. I really want to know how it got like this.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: There's an old creepy man living up on that hill in a big mansion who seems just old enough to know what happened. It might be a good place to start.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: What do you want? I'm busy. Brewing potions takes focus, you know....

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Oh, you want to know about the island's history? Well you certainly came to the right man. I've lived here for a very long time.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: There is a way for you to see for yourself what happened here. It's quite... an interesting tale, too.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: I'd sit and tell you, but I feel you might get a better experience first hand....

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Using some of the more... frowned upon methods in the alchemists library I am able to send you into the 'memory' of a dead person that lived here at the time.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: It will require a little work from you though, if you wish to proceed....

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Bring me [3 Umbral Essences] and I will be able to cast a spell on you which will allow you to pass into the 'memory' of the deceased.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Excellent. You acquired the ingredients. Just give me a second and I'll prepare you for your journey into the mind of the dead.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: *Mumbles a strange, dead language...*

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: *Mumbles a strange, dead language....*

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: There, look into my eyes. Yes, you're ready. Ah, there is a drawback though....

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Once you are inside the memory, it will feel like you are actually there. You won't be able to return until you have succeeded in your task.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: To enter the memory, you need to find the dead man at the end of the crypt in the graveyard.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: The dead roam those caves in heavy numbers, so watch your step.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Oh and one more thing, If you die in the memory, you die in reality too....

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Best of luck....

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: Oh, hello there. Would you mind helping me with something for a second?

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: Recently, some strange things have been happening to the miners around here. New diseases, unexplained disappearances, and things like that.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: The villagers have been getting very worried. So, in an attempt to protect the island, I bought a strange egg and placed it in a cave close to town.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: The egg, however, isn't what I thought it was. It is producing monsters and giving off some sort of dark aura.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: I want you to go check out that egg. See if you can get rid of whatever it is producing. Bring me [5 Monster Hides] as evidence.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: You're back! Were you able to stop that egg?

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: No? Well, I guess we'll have to wait and see what it hatches into.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: I see you got some rather rare dark monster hide. Maybe I could use those in a potion for something, maybe to prolong life.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: Some of the villagers believe that it is unwise for myself to dabble in the dark arts, dealing with mysterious eggs and brewing potions of death.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: I'll outlive them all, you'll see!

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: As for you, you have done what I asked. You may return to your personal affairs now.

lines.speaker: Siwel
lines.line: Thank you for your work, though. Only time will tell what that egg will hatch into.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: What? You... you made it back? Oh... Very well. Alchemy can be a... dangerous practice.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: Anyone who tried to find out the island's history came to me at some point, and I sent them on a one way street to a memory. But not you....

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: So now you know my dreadful secret, I am racked with guilt and cursed with eternal life.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: There is no need to fight me, I am suffering enough for what I... wrought on this island.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: I could not destroy the egg. It hatched into a... monstrous beast that cursed this island until this very day.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: A powerful warrior from... Ragni slew the beast, yet the island did not rejuvenate....

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: I leave the bones of the beast as a reminder of my failure, the destruction it brought still... lingers in the monsters it left behind.

lines.speaker: Old Siwel
lines.line: So adventurer, now you have the knowledge of what I have done. You may tell the others down in the village, as it is no longer a secret.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: So, did you find out what happened?

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: Siwel was the one who caused this sorrow? He does have a very dark presence about him, doesn't he?

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: Thank you for your work! I know it must have been tough getting that out of him.

lines.speaker: Cinfras
lines.line: Now that this mystery is solved I will be returning home. I hope we will meet again!

lines.speaker: Merchant
lines.line: Hey, hey, humie! Yeah, I'm talkin to ya here..
OI! Wake up, you damned miscreant!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Took ya long enough.. Alright, listen up, maggot!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: We found ya outside of Gelibord, passed out near some dead body, and... Well, we had to arrest someone for that merchant's death!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: So, welcome to the Lexdale Penitentiary. You're in here for the rest of your life, short-nose, so no use complaining about it.

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: And don't think you get to just lounge around all day in your cell. You gotta do work here, or you're getting thrown in the hole.

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: But for now, you’re stayin’ in your cell, understood? Now, stay here, and take a look around your cell. You'll know when it's time to work..

lines.speaker: Old Prisoner
lines.line: GWAH! Who the hell are you?

lines.speaker: Old Prisoner
lines.line: Oh, thank grook, you're just another prisoner... So young, too...

lines.speaker: Old Prisoner
lines.line: You just got here, right? Well... I can tell you're innocent... Just like almost everyone else in this forsaken prison...

lines.speaker: Old Prisoner
lines.line: Listen, human... This prison... You couldn't have come to a more horrific prison in the entire world! This place is hellish!!

lines.speaker: Old Prisoner
lines.line: The guards here, they're sadistic! They'll pluck random prisoners out of their cells, and nobody ever sees them again! They're trying to kill us all in here!

lines.speaker: Old Prisoner
lines.line: I'm being serious, human! If you stay here, they'll kill you, too! You HAVE to escape this place, whatever it t-

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Oi, filth! You're comin' with us. Get out of your cell, NOW!

lines.speaker: Old Prisoner
lines.line: Are you sure, uh, sir? I don't think I'm supposed to be anywhere today...

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Oh, ya think you're smart, trying to resist?? Oi, Jon, block the entrance!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: H-HEY! WHAT ARE YOU- GET OFF- AAAAAHH!! SOMEONE!! HELP ME!!! PLEASE!!!!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: OI! Quit starin’ off into space, maggot! Come over to your cell's bars.

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: It’s work time, filth. I'll escort you to the hallways. Once you're there, someone will tell you what to do. Do as they say, and you might come back tonight.

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: You got that, wretch? Alright, now get out of your cell!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Guess you're the one on cleanin' duty, huh? Alright. Listen up, scum!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Take this sponge, and look around the hallways. If you see a mess, use the sponge to clean it up. Someone will escort you back to the cells once you're done.

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Got it? Alright. Now, get to work!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: You're done cleaning? Alright, it's time for rollcall. You're being escorted back to the cell block. Follow me, and don't move.

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Well, well, well... Looks like the dross of society is here on time!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Alright. Stay in line, and don't move, maggots! It's time for roll call...

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: You’re all here... Ha! That’s a surprise, you outcasts can actually follow orders!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: ...Hm... Looks like we’ve got a new arrival too.. Don’t worry, peon... your soul will be well secure here for the rest of eternity.

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Alright. That’s it for now, you worthless menaces. It’s meal time. Head to the cafeteria, and pray that we’re not giving you your last meal.

lines.speaker: Starving Prisoner
lines.line: Hi... Say, could you... do something for me...?

lines.speaker: Starving Prisoner
lines.line: I'm... starving to death here... those blasted guards won't... let me get any food...

lines.speaker: Starving Prisoner
lines.line: Please... to my right.. There's some food sitting there, if you could get it for me, I'd be... eternally grateful..

lines.speaker: Starving Prisoner
lines.line: Is this... it's... Food!!

lines.speaker: Starving Prisoner
lines.line: I... I can't thank you enough, human... I should be able to keep going with this...

lines.speaker: Starving Prisoner
lines.line: Say... if you ever get out of this slaughterhouse... could you go to Lexdale... and try and talk with my family, there? Let them know that I'm still alive...? I'd appreciate that....

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: Oi, who’s this guy right ‘ere? We don’t know ya. Move it!

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: ‘Ey, ‘ey, let it rest, Don. They're not hurtin’ nobody.

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: ...Got it, boss... Sorry...

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: Don't worry about it. So... You know who we are, novello?

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: We're part of the Placido Crime Family. We do business across the entire world; all parts of it, you know what I'm saying?

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: Almost all of us at this table got caught for running with the family-... Ah, bet you're surprised to hear that there are some guilty people up in this slaughterhouse, yeah?

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: It’s alright, you don’t have to worry about us getting plucked and killed like those other piacevole here. Guards keep on sayin’ something about “our souls are too tainted”, whatever they mean.

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: Hah! Maybe you'll get the same treatment too, novello. I saw it the minute I laid eyes on ya. You're a killer too, ain't ya? Hey, gotta be one to know you're dealin' with one..

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: ..Anyways... You thinkin' about staying in this prison, fratello? Word of advice: Don't. If you can, you gotta escape. You might think it's impossible for someone to escape here, or whatnot...

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Alright, meal time's over! Get to your cells, filth!

lines.speaker: Mafia Prisoner
lines.line: But no, you're different. I can see it in those eyes. You just gotta find a way into that Control Room, somehow. And hey, if you do get outta here, go and raise some hell in the Levtus Black Market for us, yeah?

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Hey.. It’s alright, you can sit here, don’t worry.

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: So... you’re new here, right? Hah... Guessing you’re innocent, just like the rest of us... and I mean that...

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: He’s tellin’ the truth, new guy. Most of us here are just average civilians. I worked at a transportation company in Cinfras, and was delivering some crates to Gelibord when they snatched me just outside of town.

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Me too! I don’t know why I was put in here at all! I wasn’t even given a trial in court, or anything! They just plucked me off of the streets and threw me in here!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: They wanna kill you, that’s why. Did ya hear about Revan? He got taken away a couple of days ago, after he accidentally stumbled during roll call. Nobody’s heard from or seen ‘em since.

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: I... you’re probably right... I just dont understand any of this anymore... I just want to escape this damn place for good...

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: ...Good luck with that.. Only way out is through that exit door, and even then you gotta get into the Control Room, as well. It's...just impossible, y’know?

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Alright, meal time’s over! Get to your cells, filth!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: ...Well... That’s this place in a nutshell for you, human. Just try not to get in anyone’s way or step out of line, and you should be alright until they end up taking you.
Alright! Everyone, get up! Out of your cells, NOW! It's time for rollcall!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Alright, look straight, scum! Morning rollcall is about to start.

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Let's see here...

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: ...you’re all here...? Hm... Disappointing, honestly. Rollcall is over. All of you, head to wherever your job is, and get to work!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: You're done? Alright, now follow me. Rollcall is about to start.

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: What with you all, showing up late like this?? It's time for rollcall!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: You're all here, huh? Alright then, head on to dinn-

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Oi! Quit steppin' on my shoes, cretino!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Hey! What the hell are you talkin' about, making up something like that! I didn't do anythin'!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Shut it, fat-nose! You know what you were doin'! Now stay out of my way!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: OI! Are you blind, or something?!? Get those lowlifes under control, guards!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: You two got some damn nerve, fightin' during rollcall!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Don't touch me!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: W-Woah, HEY! This maggot has a shank! Back up!!!

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: LOCKDOWN! LOCKDOWN! ALL OF YOU, IN YOUR CELLS, NOW!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: You two really are stupid, huh? Fighting in the midst of all of these guards? And you got a shank, too...

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Well, looks like it's game over for you two outcasts. You're heading straight to the hole!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: You, take these two cretins to the hole, and you, go to my office and get one of the spare control room keys. Now, LIGHTS OUT!
Alright! Everyone, get up! Out of your cells, NOW! It's time for rollcall!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Alright, everyone get in line, and stand straight! Don't move, or it's game over for you!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: H-hey! Stop pushing me, mate! Seriou-

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Well, well, well... Another peon thought it was wise to step off course..

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: W-wait a minute, miss! Someone pushed me out of line! I swear!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: BE QUIET! I didn't say you could speak, filth!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Get back in line! Once this is over, you're out, slime!

lines.speaker: The Warden
lines.line: Alright, now, the rest of you, get to work! Rollcall is over for you all!

lines.speaker: Injured Prisoner
lines.line: H-hey, human- URGH! Help me out here! Some damn guards beat me bloody...

lines.speaker: Injured Prisoner
lines.line: I need somethin' to patch myself up... Oi, check that supply closet east of where I'm standin', there's gotta be something to help me in there!

lines.speaker: Injured Prisoner
lines.line: Aaahh, that's better... Thank you, human... You probably just saved my life there!

lines.speaker: Injured Prisoner
lines.line: ..You're gettin out of 'ere, huh? Well... If you do get outta this hellhole, could you head to Gelibord and let my 'pops know I'm still alive in here? I'd appreciate that...

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Huh, what's that noise?

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Oh, thank the bovine! There's a friendly face around here..

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Listen, human, you gotta get me out of here! They've been killin' people in here all day! If you don't help me out, I'll be next!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Look, next to my cell, on that desk! There's a key! Grab it and hand it to me!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Yes, perfect, PERFECT! That's the key, hand it to me!

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: I can't explain the debt I owe you, human... You have no idea how grateful I am..

lines.speaker: Prisoner
lines.line: Say, what's your name, human? soldier? Alright, my name's Kaetan. Go on ahead and get out of here, I'll catch up. If you do get out of this chop-shop, meet me in Cinfras, I want to give you something there.

lines.speaker: Prison Guard
lines.line: Huh..? Oh- HEY! The table caught on fire, someone get over 'ere and help me put it out!
HEY, soldier, soldier, wait for me!

lines.speaker: Kaetan
lines.line: There you are! Good to see you managed to escape that horrid place!

lines.speaker: Kaetan
