lines.line: I managed to get back in touch with the transportation company I work with. I got transferred to another route now, so I won't be going anywhere near that prison now!

lines.speaker: Kaetan
lines.line: But seriously, thank you, soldier. I thought I was going to get killed in there! This isn't much, but hopefully it can help you get back on your feet after all of that.

lines.speaker: Kaetan
lines.line: Anyways, I have to go now. But if I can ever help you with anything at all, just let me know! I'm forever in your debt, human.

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: We have an enemy amongst our own in Lexdale! This witch's illegal practice of dark magic threatens us!

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: Ms. Amira's home was found to be plagued with spreading Decay! We must kill the witch to protect our sanctity!

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: WAIT! Let me GO already! I told you what was happening!!

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: The deceit of your dark magic won't work, Ms. Amira. Go quietly- leave us in peace!

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: SHUT UP ALREADY! You can't just single people out like this!!

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: Just hear me out for a second! It's not me, something infected my home! That's the reason it was so dark!!

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: My basement, some outlandish thing dug into it! Wherever it went, the area withered and decayed!

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: There's proof in my house that it wasn't me! It's the one that's decayed and barren! You'll see if you LOOK, you gorehound!!

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: Quit with the insults! We'll delay for now- If there's no proof of the witch's innocence she will be executed!

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: Further...intruders...? You are not of the worms...the parasites?

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: Another stranger... You must have witnessed the tunnels. They blight the stone, wither the roots, make lifeless the land...

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: And here, we starve in isolation. My people are lost, as the very earth itself warps and shifts.

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: The water, stagnant and gray. Nothing but those horrid magic scourges, and the worms themselves to sustain ourselves.

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: We cannot escape, for the sun scorches us. There is no place to go, no place we can burrow that they do not wait.

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: You... You... You have life. You have a heart, and muscle, and meat... To survive till this torture ends...

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: Stranger, you must perish.

lines.speaker: Tunnel Dweller Chieftain
lines.line: Wait... These earthquakes! IT'S THEM! AGHHHHHHHHHHH!!!

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: You're back. Did- Wait, what in the nine hells is THAT?!

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: That! That was the thing in my basement!! I knew that human could find it! Thank you!!

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: That thing was spreading the decay through my house! It's NOT witches or magic like you suddenly DECIDED one day!!

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: ...Fine then. This...creature...bug...leech? This whatever-it-is... I'll accept your explanation.

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: Step off the podium, Ms. Amira. You're innocent.

lines.speaker: Amira
lines.line: Gah, finally! You're seeing sense! It's almost like something just...took you over one day and never left 'til now!

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: ...hm. That... Mmh. Regardless. Human, you've proven yourself to be trustworthy. We'll keep our doors open for you.

lines.speaker: The Mayor
lines.line: As for the...THING... Well... I'll be sure to inform the Gavel government.

lines.speaker: Ka L'argwit
lines.line: Fa yna tuusat! Dra sykel uv drec cylnat dnaa ryc paah lunnibdat.

lines.speaker: Krattson
lines.line: Hey! Aren't these people fascinating? They sure smell bad, though! What? That Tribesman said my name?! Amazing! I've been trying to communicate with them for weeks.

lines.speaker: Inrekei
lines.line: Oui ryja y bufanvim vaam ypuid oui, cdnyhkan. So baubma yna eh tyhkan. Bmayca, dyga drec yht ramb dras.

lines.speaker: Inrekei
lines.line: I have cast a spell on you. If you can understand me, you are pure of heart.

lines.speaker: Ka L'argwit
lines.line: For as long as I am able to recall upon, my people have called this tree our guardian. She shares her magic with those who respect her and keep her healthy.

lines.speaker: Entamis
lines.line: Thank you for coming. We haven't but moments. The monster's name is Aenara. He's a fiendish monster of corruption.

lines.speaker: Entamis
lines.line: You musn't let me be reborn a creature of evil...

lines.speaker: Inrekei
lines.line: Hello again. I am grateful you have returned safely. You don't need to say anything, though. I no longer can sense Entamis. I know she has died...
Eileen, Eileen... That girl never listens to me! Her own mother!
Every day, I find books sticking out of the bookshelves! And she keeps on coloring random letters in them...
She told me that those are her favorite books, there's some sort of 'clue' in them for... something.
I can't comprehend her reasons for doing that... Can't she come up with something that's less of a nuisance for the maids?
Garvan... he worries me more and more by the day. My sweet, beloved Garvan.
I remember, at the beginning... Yorman had hired Garvan out of concern for this 'Decay' plaguing the land. We told him that he must find a cure for the Decay before it subjugated the entire forest.
Over time... Well, I suppose love can corrupt. How else would I have...
Fallen in love with Garvan and forsook my own marriage under the nose of my husband and my beloved daughter-
But I digress. Garvan's done great research on this Decay, but... recently, he's changed. Something's wrong with him.
His eyes are glazed and dull. His tone of voice is... disturbing. He's made very little progress on the cure we tasked him with, and... I don't know what to do.
I suppose... I should just leave him be for the time being. Surely me butting into his work would just make him even worse, no?
Besides, if he ever gets too bad, he lives just east of the manor. I can be there for him if I need to, right?
Do not trust that man.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: Hey.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: Welcome to my home.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: I'm Runo. I live here.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: Not much else to say.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: Since I was born.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: Yes, I grew up here.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: The Forgery apparently has something hidden inside of it.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: The chains have something to do with it.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: I dunno what else to say.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: ...You know what? Neither do you! You've said, like, 5 sentences in the past 3 minutes!

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: I just don't like talking, sheesh! My voice gets way more tense if I don't keep my words short. And it hurts.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: What, are you offended? Well, I am, too! You'd be mad if some random human walked into your village and egged you into damaging your vocal chords!

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: ...You don't have a house?

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: ...You poor soul. Go buy one. Unless you're one of those guys who owns those flying land bits.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: What is it?

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: No. Ask the old man.

lines.speaker: Runo
lines.line: He knows most of the things here.

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: Hey, you! Got any money? If you give me 5000 Liquified Emeralds, I'll give you a spot of dust from the underside of my floorboards!

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: No? Awww... that sucks.

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: Whatcha need?

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: I'm Bip! Yeah, Bip! The best guy to ever grace the entertainment industry!

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: Or... I was... Man, I miss my glory days! I used to be a big time man, you know? I was living it up in Cinfras, but now I have to live in this dump!

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: Damn this world! I blame them for all of this! Everything has been nothing but trouble after trouble. Now everyone can't see how much of an honest guy I am!

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: B-BE QUIET! I don't like living here, so don't remind me!

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: I don't even truly have my own place! I've gotta live with some crony who owns the house I'm staying in right now.

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: One day, I'll get out of here, though! I'll be a big time man again, and I'll reclaim my status in society, just you wait!

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: Rumors? Do I look like a gossiper to you??

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: Well, human... I'm an honest entertainer, so don’t worry. Good 'ole Bip will tell you a bit of something!

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: So, apparently there's a WITCH... living in LEXDALE! OOOOOO, spooky...

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: But the thing is, she's causing... the Decay... dun dun DUUUN!!! Uhh... I don't know, her house is decaying, or something.

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: So now, she's gonna die. The end! Didja like that story, human? Every relation to in-real life people was 100% intentional, 'cuz this is actually happening.

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: Oh yeah! That's the name of the guy who FIRED ME! DAMMIT!!!-

lines.speaker: Bip
lines.line: ...Oh, wait, no. Sorry human, I was thinking about Gavin. I don't know who this Garvan guy is! Ask someone else; I can't entertain you with that knowledge.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: S-Sheesh! You scared me, human! Don't you know that you shouldn't walk into people's houses out of nowhere?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: You know there are creepy guys out here who rob people like that? You should be more careful!

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: How can I help you?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: I'm nobody. No, I'm serious, I literally don't have a name. Parents just didn't bother to name me.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: Apparently that's considered sacrilegious around here, so I was taken away from them and I now work for Pastor Arwes.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: What do the others call me? Uhh... Big-nosed girl. Yeah, I know, a bit on the nose-

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: ...That sailed right over my head. But it's true, though! I have the biggest nose in the village.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: What should you call me? Hmm... I don't know... maybe... Eua?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: I know it won't matter anymore, but sure. Call me Eua. That sounds like a nice name.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: This one's not necessarily a rumor, but... have you ever heard of someone that they call the Wanderer?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: He's a weird guy who just... wanders. He's completely despondent, and doesn't really interact with anyone. Even a lot of the dangerous creatures around here just tend to ignore his presence. He's almost like... a ghost.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: You've probably seen him before in the forest. Hooded guy, doesn't talk at all? That's who they call the Wanderer.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: Well, he doesn't really hurt anyone, so I don't really worry about him too much, but still... it's spooky...

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: Wait, THAT manor? Nah. No one goes near there anymore, not since it was abandoned. What, do you not know what happened there?

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: It used to be owned by a family of nobles called the Faltachs. Big, important people in the forest, very rich.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: Well... A lot of stuff happened with them. The mistress of the family supposedly went insane and killed her husband at some point, or something like that...

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: There's a lot to unpack there, human. And you honestly shouldn't unpack it.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: Hmm... No, can't say I have. Whoever this person is, they certainly don't live here.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: And nah, it's not me, either, even if I don't have a real name. I wouldn't even be here if my parents had named me something manly like Garvan anyways.

lines.speaker: Villager
lines.line: Ask around, though! I'm sure others probably know him.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: Hello, soldier! Welcome to this... hick village. I presume the neighbor's kid has been stealing apples again, hmm?

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: Oh, Ann... Your voice is so delicate, so soothing that— Ah, soldier! Are you here for something... or someone?

lines.speaker: Ann & Qunit
lines.line: What do you need?

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: My name is Ann!

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: I'm Qunit.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: We're the best couple in the entire forest! Nobody can match our love!

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: Do you have someone special to you like we are, human? A handsome little man? Or a pretty little woman? Or... neither? We won't judge.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: Absolutely we're married! Everyone finds it very hard to believe, but I don't blame them! It's a tough world... we... live in, yes!

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: Four years it has been, ever since we kissed under the starry sky amidst the blossoming fields near Aldorei. I can still see it in my dreams...

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: Yeah, what Qunit said! We've been married for 4 years! And soon that number is gonna go up to infinity!

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: Be quiet.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: Oh! Sorry about Qunit, he doesn't like thinking about our... circumstances.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: We're in heavy debt to the government. We can't afford to live anywhere else.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: This forest is also safe from their prying eyes, which has inarguably caused certain... opinions to fester here...

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: Yeah, yeah! It doesn't matter why we're here, soldier! Haha! We're here, and we love each other! That's all that matters. Yes.

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: Yes, actually. There's something dark to the north. There are parasites in it. It's dangerous.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: O-oh! Don't worry about what Qunit’s saying. He's been having this recurring dream of a big worm creature laying dark eggs inside of a weird cave. He won't let it go, either!

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: It's not a fantasy, Ann. I've told you this.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: Shh, honey... we'll talk about this later, not in front of the soldier... Who probably has much more important things to do, hah!

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: Nope.

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: No.

lines.speaker: Ann
lines.line: See? We're both on the same wavelength! Neither of us have met this person! We're... so in love, darling...

lines.speaker: Qunit
lines.line: Yes...

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Huh, weird. Whatcha doing all the way out here, human? We don't see a lot of your kind often.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Got anything you wanna say?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: My name's Vera. I'm a farmer, but you probably already guessed that. That's all this damn village is good for anyways.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: I also deal with getting supplies from other towns! Pretty cool, huh?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Uhh... all my life, actually! Too damn poor to go anywhere else, so I've just hunkered down here and decided to stick it out until I'm dead.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: It's bad, living out here, but once you get used to it some of the edge is taken off. This village is all I've really known, and I owe it to everyone here to stick around, you know what I mean?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Still... adventuring sounds like fun, sometimes... The furthest I've ever gone from here is halfway through Cinfras County.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: I bet you have some pretty good stories to tell from adventuring, ain't that right human?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: You know the massive prison near Gelibord? Yeah, the Lexdale Penitentiary.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: So, apparently... The place is actually really corrupt. They arrest innocent people every other day, and they never come back out.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Gavel's government hasn't done anything about it, but everyone in the forest knows damn well something shady is going on there. I'd watch myself around that place if I were you!

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: ...Hold on, WHAT?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Get to talking, human! You can't just leave off like that! Tell me, are the rumors about that place true?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Are the rumors true??

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: ...You're serious? Y-you are?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Oh my word... and you saw it with your own eyes?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Human... Thanks for letting me know. You gotta tell more people about this, though! You could probably publish a book about it once you spread the word! You'd be rich!

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: ...Well, I'm not gonna believe you if you're saying it all forced like that, you know.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: I won't push it, though; it was probably just too awful to talk about, right? You don't have to go into detail if you don't wanna.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Just stay well away from that place, and make sure nobody else goes near there, alright?

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: Uhhh... no. That doesn't ring a single bell.

lines.speaker: Vera
lines.line: You could probably ask some other people, though! I'm only the youngest guy in the village, so the older people here would probably know who this Garvan guy is!

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: An outsider? Here? We don't get many of you people often...

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: What do you want?

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: The name's Aunoa. I'm a farmer. Not much else to say.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: I've got a kid, but he doesn't live here. His mother took him away to live in Cinfras a while back. Don't have any other family.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: This village is the only family I have.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: It's my home. The people I know and trust live here. It's a dump, but it's still my damn home.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: Wish I could leave, though. This forest is awful. The crops are in horrible condition. Government doesn't give a damn about us either.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: Apparently the House of Talor has a massive crypt somewhere underneath its floors. Rich people used to be buried there.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: There's probably some rare artifacts down there. Go take a look if you want, but everyone here has tried and failed to find it.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: Yes, I do. But I probably can't stop you. Humans like you have a thing for invading privacy whenever you feel like it.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: And I'm too weak to stop you. You've got all of that strong gear on you, and I barely know a lick of magic. We're not on equal footing.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: So... don't go in, but I won't stop you if you do anyways.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: No clue who that is. If someone like that lived here, then they're dead.

lines.speaker: Aunoa
lines.line: Ask someone else about him if you want; I don't really care about this Garvan guy you're looking for.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: You're new... we don't see a lot of youngsters around these days... especially humans.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: How can I help you?

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Very on the nose, whippersnapper. My name is Lokno. I'm what's left of this town during its olden days...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Mhm. This village... has definitely seen better days. This Decay stuff has ruined us, just take a look around! Nothing here has been suitable for living for over 50 years...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Hah... well, right now, it's a crowd of shacks, but before the Decay came along, we used to do great...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: We always had enough food to go around, we could sell off what we didn't need to eat, and everything was thriving.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: My great-grandmother, Aki, always told me stories about this place. Our little village. I wish I could have been around to live in it then.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: She was always convinced though... that if the rightful rulers of Gavel returned, all of these issues could easily be squashed.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: To be honest... I believe the same. The government has abandoned us. So... why not bring back the old one?

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I may not be the most religious villager around here, but it would feel more right to be ruled by someone who has the heavens' approval.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Nope. I don't deal with that kind of stuff, bahaha! Sorry human; you're out of luck.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: G... Garvan... yes. I know that name.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: He isn't here, though. I don't know his whereabouts, what he's doing, or if he's even alive. He's... just nonexistent.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I don't know why you're chasing after him, but... if you want a place to start, go look at the abandoned laboratory on top of that hill, just to the west of here.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Fair warning, though... My great-grandmother is the only reason I know about him, and even then... she was always put off by him, and told me to stay away from him. I'd be wary, if I were you.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Or don't. He sounds like a nice man. You're strong, as well. I'm sure you'll be fine.
I've been hired by Yorman and Katarin Faltach to study and hopefully cure this ''Decay'' that's appeared recently. I'm quite excited to get to the bottom of this.
It looks like I'm finally settled in. The Faltach Family has been quite kind with giving me this laboratory to study in.
Where to start... where to start...
This Decay is interesting, to say the least. I've never seen anything like this before in all my years.
Simple plant life appears to wither even when given proper nutrients and conditions to grow. What little magic they usually contain appears to be sapped as well...
It's odd. the Decay doesn't violently alter whatever it touches, like a pestilence would... It appears to be removing something in a coordinated manner. Almost as if a living creature was doing this.
But what organism could be removing magic from the plant?
I've been trying to expose this piece of Kanderstone to different types of magical energy to see if I could reverse the effects of this Decay upon it.

If I can just find whatever energy the Decay is sapping from the forests, then in all probability... this Kanderstone will revert to Cobalt, the mineral that was found in this forest before it began its decline.
...What could it be, though? I've tried every sort of magic I can think of. Nothing is reversing the effects of the Decay.
I'm certain of it. The Decay is caused by the removal of magical energy. I just can't pinpoint what exactly, though...
Eheheheheheeh... I've found it. I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it I've found it
The source of the Decay.
Throughout the forest, especially in caves, one can find strange, parasitic creatures that specialize in living underneath the earth.
When I touched one of these creatures after capturing it... It was as if my skin began to shrivel. It... siphoned energy from my hand.
I gave the thing access to a few fresh plants from the Light Forest, and watched with awe. Within a few minutes, it rendered the plant into a state identical to that of Decay-afflicted life.
I was right. I was right I was right I was right I was right I was right.

These parasites are what are causing the Decay. This is no otherworldly force or pestilence, no. This is an assault created solely by magical creatures. I... should thank my new friends for this discovery.
I've decided to try and talk a little more with the villagers just down the hill. They're quite interesting...

It's odd, though... Most of them keep glaring at me every time I return from my business in Cinfras. This one farmer kept asking me what my thoughts on the Gerten War and the government's involvement with it...
I just explained that I was a scientist researching the effects of the Decay. I might have lied a little and said I was almost about to find a cure. One of them seemed interested in that...

I went to the secret study inside of the Faltach's basement to look at some texts about the war and the government out of curiosity. I believe those people were just freaks. I should stay away from them-
Huh?
Huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh huh?
What lies. Lies lies lies lies lies lies lies lies lies lies. I don't really mind those people.
I quite like them. Yes. Yes yes yes yes yes. They're trustworthy. I should have believed them from the start.
They'll help me.
...What the hell is my wife THINKING?? Defending Garvan, as much of a lunatic as he is??
The man's made so little progress in the past few years. At this point, it's just a waste of our wealth...
Why is she defending HIM?? She's always been like that, so hopeful and defensive of the scientist... what could she POSSIBLY see in him?
Unless... No. That is impossible. She is not... like that. Damn it, I might be in the need for some well-deserved sleep...
Hmmm... Odd. There's a lot to take in here related to Gavel's deceased monarchy. It's quite interesting, though there is nothing about the Gerten War.
There are a few philosophical books that dive deep into the divide that the Cinfrasian Uprising has caused within the province. Very... strong opinions indeed.
The Decay has certainly drowned out that conflict. I myself have never heard of any of this! Though again, I never was a lover of history in the first place.
Huh. One of the more recent books suggests something has resurfaced in Kander. Villagers are ordered to keep an eye on their neighbors...
I should ask Katarin about this. She'd likely know more than I about any remaining royal politics, no?
''You died at 6 o-clock that night. Only 4 people came to your funeral.
3 of them couldn't have cared less. The other person wept for 8 hours afterwards.''
It's more clear. Day by day. This pestilence. Clear. Clear.
The creatures that cause this... and their wellspring... are sent by something beyond my comprehension.
Yes. Yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes yes. The Decay has been... brought here by divine intervention.
Then... I will use the divine's sentries to cure this. Just as they suggested.
I will begin at my research outpost in that stone city of Lexdale. I'll bring her there.
And all of this will finally end. By a cure.

lines.speaker: Yorman
lines.line: Dammit, Katarin! I'm not dealing with that loonie anymore! It's been years since I hired that scientist, and he STILL has nothing! If he doesn't find a cure soon, then I'll just get rid of him!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Y-Yorman, you can't be serious! What we're asking him to do is heavily unresearched, firing him for taking time on that wouldn't be a good idea!

lines.speaker: Yorman
lines.line: Woman, have you SEEN the state that cretin is in?? Even if it does take long, he's in no damn shape to deal with it! Now stop arguing with me, and help me get rid of him--

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: NO!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: This is too far, Yorman! Garvan MUST stay! You will do this if you still love me!

lines.speaker: Yorman
lines.line: ...Why do you even care so much?? Some lunatic scientist like him isn't good for anybody! We both know that we'd save more time and money by letting him run off!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: I still have faith in him, unlike you! I'll talk to him to see what's going on if I must, but I will NOT tolerate you throwing him out simply because you're too eager for results!

lines.speaker: Yorman
lines.line: Fine. But know this; I will see to it MYSELF that his head is taken off of his shoulders if that man continues to waste my time, understand??

lines.speaker: Yorman
lines.line: ...I'm leaving to take care of some matters in Gelibord. Ask one of the maids to make sure that Eileen goes to bed. I'll be back before midnight.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...That... was close... I can't have him getting between us anymore.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I-I am here, Katarin. You wished to s-speak with me...?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Yes, love. Yorman is becoming suspicious of you. He thinks that you're not making any progress on the cure and wasting his time. Any more of this, and he may attempt to get rid of you.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: I just wanted to check on you, love. Are... you doing alright? Is your work coming along well?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I... I am...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: PLEASE HELP ME

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: F-Fine. I am fine. I appreciate the concern, but... It truly is u-unwarranted. I'm q-quite close to finding a cure to this disease, y-yes.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Ah! That is good to hear. Now then... How are things? We haven't had many chances to catch up recently.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: ...Wonderful. I've met... many peers. Recently. They give me the strength I need to advance my progress. Now... how is our daughter, Eileen?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: She's doing great. She takes a lot after you, actually. Intelligent, beautiful, an inquisitive mind. I just hope this Decay can be dealt with and we don't need to live in fear any longer.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Wonderful. And... is our eternal bond safe? The gemstone? Has... Yorman found about it?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Yes, it has stayed hidden. As long as it's kept intact, our souls will stay bound to it. You just need to take care of your little project and we'll ride into the sunset, just like you said, mhm?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: ...And what about our daughter?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: We... I will not risk her life for our love. She has a future in Cinfras, Garvan! She isn't a part of this and I don't think she–

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Eileen... She is a shining star in this world. Her noble blood and natural talent makes her something truly special.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Do you realize, Katarin? Our daughter is a gift from the heavens! Once she has matured, she will accomplish things that Gavel has never seen! Bring back the holy and royal will that was los-

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: ...Forgive me, I-I'm rambling once more. I... must leave now, research calls. Goodbye, my love. Great things will happen, sooner or later.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: I truly hope so...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Ah... N-now you're finally here. I... need you, my darling. We– no... I can cure this Decay with you.

lines.speaker: Eileen
lines.line: W-What do you mean...? I-I don't like this... I-I w-wanna go home. It's getting late and mother–

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Ssshhh... This will only take a moment.

lines.speaker: Eileen
lines.line: W-What is that thing?? M-Mister Garvan, I-I don't understand...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Hush, my daughter. I-I'm doing this for your s-sake... You'll t-thank me later, once it... g-grows acclimated to you.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Now then... Hold still.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Hello, my love. I-I-It's... been a while.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: You... G-Garvan... Why are you here? And what's happened to Eileen? She has been sick for days!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Mmmm... I... Ha-a-have a bit of a... how should I phrase this... a confession to make.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: W-Well... I-I've done... I've... done Eileen a great service... she will live forever, just as we do. Thanks to what I have done.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Y-you... Bound her soul?? Garvan no, I told you she wasn't part of this!! WHY??

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: No, no no no no. I've done much b-b-better. She has something now. In her brain... Don't worry about the s-sorry state she's in now. The parasite will need time to acclimate to her flesh.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I-I realized... a cure. My work is done, love... Eileen will be cured. The Decay can be s-stopped. It's wonderful-

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: WHAT DID YOU DO TO MY DAUGHTER?? WHAT IS WRONG WITH YOU??

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Aaaahhhmmmm... True... I might have stepped out of line. But it's for the best.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: OUT OF LINE?? This is too far, Garvan! What even happened to you?? You've been acting like this for so, so long! I-I can't take it anymore!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: You've changed, Garvan! I-I can't even recognize you anymore!! I'm... I'm DONE! GET OUT! STAY AWAY FROM MY FAMILY!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: You again... W-What do you want from me this time...? You've... already ruined me.

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: It doesn't matter. You've accomplished what we planned for, and that is perfect. The girl will grow into a suitable leader... Now then, we have some questions for you.

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: Tell me Garvan... Where is the heir?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I... will not tell you. I have lost Eileen and my love thanks to you. If I am to lose her... then you shall lose her as well.

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: ...Lunatic. You; take him in. Keep him alive.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: NO, DON'T TOUCH ME!

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: Garvan. Garvan, Garvan. I think there's a misunderstanding here. You are in no place to defy us.

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: Now then... You will tell us where the rightful heir to the Gavellian throne is... No matter the cost.
It seems you've arrived. F-Forgive me... I-I'm not quite used to talking anymore. It's been quite a while.

...Nevermind. I d-don't want your forgiveness in particular. In fact, w-why do you even care? The forest has died, generations have lived on... and yet... You just had to tear the scar open, didn't you?
My sins... you did not need to see them... all the things that I've done wrong. H-How I destroyed the bonds tying me and my love together.
...Y-Yes... I mean her. Katarin. She's watching us as we speak, no? A-and with that... I suppose it's obvious what lies under this veil.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Greetings... I-I'm s-sure you're well acquainted with me, by now. I-It was me all along. Quite the- well, it was a predictable twist, I suppose...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: ...B-But... I take it you don't have the full story. So... so so so so so so... Let me explain to you, human... The bitter end to our shared tale.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: AAAAAAAGGGHHH!!! F-FINE! I-I’ll tell you... I-I’ll tell y-you where Eileen is...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: S-She... is with her mother. At the Faltach Manor. T-That is all. Just s-stop...

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: ... Good. This had better not be a lie. You; tell the others that we are heading there now. Kill everyone at the manor and any witnesses; leave the heir alive.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: W-WHAT?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: N-NO! GET BACK HERE! DON’T YOU DARE HARM THEM! I'LL KILL YOU!! DO YOU HEAR ME???

lines.speaker: Eileen
lines.line: ... M-Mother... why d-do I have to stay here?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: It’s for your own good, dear. Now, remember to stay put. Garvan won’t be able to use you if you’re kept inside of here...

lines.speaker: Eileen
lines.line: I-I miss Dad...

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Yorman won’t be bothering us anymore, sweetheart. He wouldn’t understand, so... J-just don’t worry about what happened to him. It’s irrelevant-

lines.speaker: Servant
lines.line: L-LADY KATARIN! T-THERE ARE INTRUDERS— AAAAAAHHHHHH!!!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ... Who the hell are you all?

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: Step aside, Katarin Faltach. This will be much simpler if you stand down and tell us where your daughter is.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...Come again? No. YOU WON’T TOUCH HER! GET OUT OF MY SIGHT-

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: You’re not the one making demands here... You all, search the house and find the child.

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: There she is. Hmm... it seems that the parasite injection worked well. Garvan wasn’t so useless after all.

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: Oh? Too terrified to speak? Worry not, Eileen Faltach. You won’t be harmed... too much. You’re quite important to us, you see.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: N-NO! STAY AWAY FROM MY DAUGHTER!

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: You have little choice in the matter, Miss Faltach. Stand your ground.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: GET AWAY FROM HER, DO YOU HEAR ME??? RAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAGGGGGGGGHHHHHHH!!!!

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: Tch... Some people will never understand what we do for the world. Thank you for protecting us from her, Aki.

lines.speaker: Mysterious Leader
lines.line: I will deal with the heir myself. You all can head back to our village. Thank you for your help today.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: ... I should have known. I-I... my love... y-you’re gone.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: DAMN IT! DAMN IT DAMN IT DAMN IT DAMN IT AAAAAALLLL!!!!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: This is... W-why did this have to happen? ... I-I can’t... this can’t end like this...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: T-This will be enough. You have a wonderful grave, m-my love...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: W-We won’t be separated, though. I-I will leave our true selves here, as well.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: My soul... and y-yours.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: T-This is our final act of love, K-Katarin... This stone will keep us here. Eternal, and in bliss.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I-It’s like nothing ever h-happened, right?
And so it ends here. At the same time, it begins my desperate attempts to flee from my past.
I tried to forget. I tried to forget everything, even my own name. I ignored Katarin’s spirit calling out to me, demanding I return to her.
I became... nothing. A nobody. I had no purpose. I wandered the forest, pretending that nothing had ever gone wrong... Indeed, I had become a Wanderer.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: But that changes now.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: N-Now you understand. T-this is... all my fault. I have ruined everything. E-everything I touched, I destroyed.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Have I not repented enough? Have I not suffered for decades in this god-forsaken forest?? And why did you have to-

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: No... You know too much. B-But I can't kill, not again. I-I can make things right. I-I'm going to fix this. I'm going to fix this. I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to I'm going to—

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: KATARIIIIINNNNNN!!!!!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: K-Katarin! My l-love... is that you?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: My word... I-It is you! I missed you, love... and I'm s-so sorry... for all of this!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I realize n-now, thanks to this h-human's efforts. What I've done has t-torn us apart... I hurt you and our l-little girl so much...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I-I'm so sorry, Katarin! P-please, forgive me! Let us f-fix all of thi-

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: H-huh? Why c-can't I...?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: K-Katarin...?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: For.. For... give... ness...?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: What... What do you mean?? Speak, my love! I don't understand

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...Forgiveness...? You... beg for me... to forgive... you?

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I... Yes, yes! P-Please, my love! I-I know I've spent the last century and a half running away from u-us, but...

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: It was all my fault, from the beginning! I was wrong! W-We can fix this...! We can make everything go back to normal, j-just like it was before!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: Please, Katarin! A-all I ask is that you forgive me!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ..You... You must really have a deathwish-

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...Maybe I can... Forgive this. But I need something from you, as well...

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...Where is the gemstone? I'd... I'd like to know. And then... I could... forgive... this.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: O-Oh! Is that all? Of course, my love, I can tell you!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I-I placed it in the catacombs, right next to where—

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: W-What... W-WHAT I-IS THISS?? I-I C-CAN'T B-BREATHE! P-PLEASE!!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: NO!! NO, NO NO NO NO!! HUMAN, H-HELP ME!! KATARIN... K-KATARIIIIINNNNN!!!!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: YOU... TOOK... HER... FROM... ME.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: YOU... POISONED... HER...!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: YOU... RUINED... EVERYTHING!!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: WHERE IS IT?!?!?!?!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: TELL ME WHERE IT IS, GARVAN! I KNOW YOU'RE STILL LISTENING!

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: You knew where it was— Hmm... what did Garvan call you things...?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Right, a human. You knew... that it was just beneath this rubble?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: There it is... Thank you... Now this eternal hell will finally end. After so long...

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Do you hear that? It's the ocean waves... The heavens... They're calling for me—
YOU WON'T ESCAPE.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: OUR LOVE WAS MEANT TO LAST FOREVER.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: YOU.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: INTRUDER. YOU MADE THE WRONG CHOICE.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: IF YOU REFUSE TO FORGIVE ME, THEN I WILL SIMPLY ERASE ANY PROOF THAT WE EVER EXISTED.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: AND NOTHING WILL REMEMBER YOU ONCE YOU DISAPPEAR.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: STAY AWAY FROM ME!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: WHY WON'T YOU FORGIVE ME?!?!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: DON'T DO IT.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: DON'T DESTROY THE GEM!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: I CAN'T LET YOU!

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: FORGIVE ME.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: DON'T YOU DARE.

lines.speaker: Garvan
lines.line: NO NO NO NO NO NO

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: He's gone... All of this will finally be done...

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Thank you, stranger. Thank you for... everything.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Now, I'm... finally free. But... I suppose I still have unfinished business. Before I leave, I must know something.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...What has become of my daughter, Eileen? Has she suffered any more? Or did she escape?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: I must know. Is she okay?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...I see. That is... wonderful news. Thank you, human.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: I must... leave... The pain...

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...The pain is receding... The heavens are calling... for the final time...

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: Goodbye... Thank you human, from the bottom of my heart.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: ...What?

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: No.

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: No...

lines.speaker: Katarin
lines.line: NO NO NO NO NO NO NO NOOOOO!!!!!!

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: ...I-I-I... T-They're a-all...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: O-Oh g-grook... I-I'm the o-only one l-left...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I'm s-sorry, human, j-just... G-give me a m-moment to l-let me get my b-bearings...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: ...What do you want?

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I’m not even sure what to say. Not much happened after we last talked, but at one point... The entire forest began to shake. Like a battle between two enormous powers.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I don’t know much magic myself, but even I could feel all of that. Not to mention, I heard explosions coming from the old manor.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Then, it all went quiet. A few moments later, we all heard a bloodcurdling scream come from the manor, and soon after... that thing appeared.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: It looked like... the spirit of a woman? All I know is that it was furious, and was dead set on killing everybody here.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I managed to hide, though. T-The others were too damn worried about me being too old to let me help. So... I just watched from afar.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: After a while... it all went quiet. I could hear that spirit wandering around the village. She was searching for something. W-Whispering... something about her ‘daughter’.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: And then she too disappeared. W-when I finally came out... Oh g-grook... S-she... d-didn't even leave them in one piece...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: ... Y-You say that as if you were responsible for this, human... I don’t need any apologies. This wasn’t your fault.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I j-just wish that thing would have at least shown the respect to let me give m-my friends the f-funeral they deserved. I c-can’t send them off to the afterlife in good health without that...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: ... I don’t know. I just don’t know.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: I can’t go to Lexdale, because those loonies will just kick me out for being an outsider. I can’t afford to live anywhere else, though...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: B-but I can’t stay here... After t-today, it’s too dangerous. And too many bad memories linger here now.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: ... Huh? W-What do you mean?

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: ... So, that Garvan was really alive?? And h-he caused something to happen at the manor?

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Y-You killed him?!? S-so that must have been where that scream came from. His dying breaths, huh?

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: W-well... I suppose I could check the manor out, if it’s really safe to be around. Hah... maybe I could finally make a decent living there after all these years.

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: Y-you... c-caused this???

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: G-Grook, t-this m-must be a nightmare, it h-has to be... I-I can’t... n-no...

lines.speaker: Old Man
lines.line: *hic* T-This... c-can't be happening. I-It can't... I-It just c-can't...

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: Stand back! This is a crime scene, under my authority. I cannot let you inside, not while you're this inexperienced, at least.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: Come talk to me again when you're level 73, and we may have need of you...

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: Stand back, human! This is a crime scene, under my authority. I cannot let you inside.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: Although we are in need of some... assistance... and you are fairly experienced, are you not?

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: Well, straight to the point... do you think I might be able to hire you as a private investigator?

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: To put it bluntly, the owner of this house, Eminar, was murdered a few days ago, and what few leads we had have all gone cold.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: This is acting outside protocol, of course... but if you manage to catch the killer, I'm sure I could pull some strings and pay you for your work!

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: I'll make sure no one stops you inside the crime scene. Head inside the house and see if you can find anything helpful.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: My soldiers and I will keep watch outside the house, and make sure you're not disturbed. Be careful in there!

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: Have you made any progress? There was a smashed window in there, it might be a good place to start.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: If you find any more leads remember to come to me - and if you find the murder weapon, make sure to bring it to us immediately!

lines.speaker: Captain Lorias
lines.line: Thank you for your help in catching the perpetrator!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Heya there! Fancy a quick game of blackjack?

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Ah, new to the game huh? No worries, lemme tell ya all about it!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: The rules are simple! I deal two cards face up to ya both face down, and two cards to me, one face up and one face down.

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Ya can then hit and get another card as many times as ya want, or stand and end ya turn. The aim is to get the value of your hand as close to 21 as possible!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Number cards are worth what they say, all picture cards are worth 10, and an ace can be worth either 1 or 11, whichever works best for ya hand.

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Go over 21 and that's it - you're bust! Stand with your current hand and it's my turn to hit or stand to try and beat your hand.

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: And if ya get a blackjack - that's an ace and a picture card or a ten - ya automatically get double ya money back!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Sound fair enough? Alrighty, just right-click me again to play!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Not right now? No worries - come back another time!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Alrighty, let's play some blackjack!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Not feelin' up to playin' right now? No worries, just drop by later!

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Good stuff! Put ya money in the pot and I'll start the deal.

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Woah! That's a whole lotta emeralds on one hand - a bit over our house limit. Try something smaller.

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Come on pal, you can't go that low! Bet something proper, yeah?

lines.speaker: Blackjack Dealer
lines.line: Hey, pal, you gotta have the money in your inventory if you wanna place a bet!

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: That's enough, Rohem! Stand down, or the guards will attack.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: Whatever, you pale-faced walking cowlick. You're headed to Lexdale Penitentiary with a charge of first-class murder. Guards, take him away.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: As for you, human, please accept my immense gratitude. We probably wouldn't have caught that rat without you.

lines.speaker: Detective Lorias
lines.line: On behalf of the city of Cinfras, please accept these emeralds as compensation for your services. You were a fine detective today!

lines.speaker: Valimare
lines.line: How did ya find us down 'ere? I don't remember you... you're with the police, aren't ya? Here after Eminar, I suppose?

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: What brings you here today, human?

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Ah, a human! A refreshing sight these days. You've come to see me, I presume? What brings you here?

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: An investigation!? Eminar? That's... that's absurd. I've done nothing wrong.

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Still, the poor man. Eminar and I were good friends, you know. If it could help find his killer, I may have some information for you... strictly off-record, of course...

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Well. You see, there's an underground gambling den hidden in the city's sewers. Only the elite can get in, and Eminar happened to be a frequent visitor.

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Once, he even brought me along with him.

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Eminar, though, he often tried to cheat the other gamblers. I suppose it was only a matter of time before they had enough; most do not take cheating lightly.

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Back to the point, many of them, including poor Eminar, had a symbol built into the sides of their homes, shaped like a snake. A proof of membership, you could say.

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: If you can find it, it will show you the way to get into the sewers. I'm sorry, I would tell you more if I knew more. But good luck with your investigation.

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Some of those gamblers had a symbol built into their homes, shaped like a snake. If you find it, it'll show you the way into the sewers. Good luck, officer.

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Ah... you again! You're back. I see that. I must admit, I did not expect you to return... so soon...

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: You really did find your way down there? Oh, that's... excellent... I hope the investigation is going well. Now if you'll just leave me be-

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Valimare? Bah! Why would you trust anything he says? He's a criminal! A scam artist! I mean, I did direct you to him, but...

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: He- He's the one you should be arresting. Eminar was a danger to society, got what he deserved, the fool-

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Wait! No! Don't turn me in! Can't you let me finish my drink in peace? Get out, get out, you can't prove anything!

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Besides, have you ever heard of a little thing called evidence? You don't have any proof!

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Now, officer, if you don't have a proper warrant, I expect you to vacate my property immediately!

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Get out of my house, officer, and don't you dare go rooting around in my property!

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: For the last time officer, would you either show me a warrant or get out of my- what are you doing in my garden?!

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: A... a hatchet? I don't know what you mean, I- I've never seen that before in my life!

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Gah! Curse you, human! I might be headed to jail, but I can send you straight to hell!

lines.speaker: Rohem
lines.line: Augh! Fine, you've got me. But mark my words, this won't be the last you hear of me, human!

lines.speaker: Child
lines.line: Hi! I'm digging a hole in my garden, just like Mr. Rohem did last night!

lines.speaker: Elf Guard
lines.line: Halt, traveler! Entry to Aldorei Town is forbidden at present.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: An outsider in our midst? Exciting to see. I have wished to share our magic with new people for a long while.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: However, I am...well, rather hungry. And I must tend to my garden here for the time being.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: Have you heard the saying “You scratch my ears, I scratch yours”? People must help one another..

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: If you would be so kind as to bring me a loaf of fresh bread you may take my enchanted bucket.

lines.speaker: Vaenr
lines.line: This is utterly inane. A full lockdown, over a petty theft... Are we not to help one another? To thieve is unnecessary.

lines.speaker: Sylvar
lines.line: The thieving is not the reason, from what I have heard. It is that the grove was jealously hidden due to the potency of the plants there.

lines.speaker: Sylvar
lines.line: Tattytale, Iridesca, Subtraxerim... The Light only knows what else. It is impossible to reach without unusual means- And that is cause for grave concern.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: I saw you toil to bake this yourself. Frankly, that is above and beyond what I expected, so here is your exchange.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: If you require help in the future with anything, do not be afraid to ask. If you put such effort for me, I shall give you the same.

lines.speaker: Guard
lines.line: Halt! This area is strictly off limits, especially for an outsider. Turn back now!

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: Aha, the outsider returns. Is there something troubling you?

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: ...mmm. Unfortunate, that. I cannot help with this.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: It is not a matter of secrecy or morals- I simply do not know what that leaf is from or what it may be capable of.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: I am no botanist- Simply a gardener. The mistake is understandable, if regrettable.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: However, I was taught under a much more storied botanist who may have the answers you seek.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: Her name is Fiona- Her home is across the valley from here. Take the bridge across. She often stays inside studying.

lines.speaker: Damys
lines.line: She has forgotten more than I will ever hope to know about plants. If she cannot help you, I fear none can.

lines.speaker: Fiona
lines.line: This is outrageous! To think one of our own would stoop to such thievery and destruction!

lines.speaker: Fiona
lines.line: ...disgusting. I will have to hang the pages to dry later, but first, our exchange.

lines.speaker: Criminal
lines.line: ..you! You have been seeking me! I have seen you tracing my footsteps...

lines.speaker: Criminal
lines.line: I apologize for this... But what I do is a necessity!

lines.speaker: Criminal
lines.line: I beg you, do not pursue me any further!

lines.speaker: Criminal
lines.line: Outsider, I realize the circumstances appear damning, but you must stop!

lines.speaker: Criminal
lines.line: What I have done is needed, and if there were another path I would have taken it over this.

lines.speaker: Criminal
lines.line: I must take my concoction to where it is needed!

lines.speaker: Criminal
lines.line: See me as I truly am- My name is Korben, and I musn’t be delayed further!

lines.speaker: Korben
lines.line: A damnable pace you have... I cannot let you stop me for a moment longer!

lines.speaker: Korben
lines.line: It will be done soon, but I must reach my destination first!

lines.speaker: Korben
lines.line: Finally... I apologize for the delay. I needed to take strong measures to get this to you.

lines.speaker: Korben
lines.line: ...you... You are... You would lie to the guards and say I perished in the chase? You will keep my identity secret?

lines.speaker: Elf Guard
lines.line: Traveler, I must remind you- The doors shall remain shut until the criminal has been found.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hey! You!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I know who you are, soldier. Do you know who I am?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Yeah why would you, haha!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Enough playing around, I need your assistance. You see... there is something fishy going on behind these doors.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Have you ever heard the saying ´´Elves never die´´- well it's true, or so I thought.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let me explain, follow me!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: You see, my family and a few other elves left Aldorei a long time ago to start a new life in Efilim.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I've always heard since I was young that Elves cannot die from old age. Well... recently, my parents both died.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: More and more elves around Efilim have died- but none in Aldorei. I believe something bizarre is going on here.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Please, soldier- I really need your help. Us Efilim elves aren't exactly welcome with open arms in Aldorei. It's a surprise they even let us in at all.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Could you try asking around, see if these elves know anything about this?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I will wait up here. Return to me if you find out any valuable information.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Ask the citizens if they know anything about what's going on.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I'll wait up here for you.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Welcome to Aldorei Town. Home of the elves.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Oh its you. I can't believe we let a human into this place.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: So what do you want?

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: GAH.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: You dare speak to me like that?

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: I will get you deported if it's the last thing I do, mark my words!

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Pfft. No way I'm telling you any secret information about Aldorei.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Elves may die, elves may not- I don't know!

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Thats me! Sol the Smart, Sol the Cleaver, Sol the Best- I go by many names.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: So what is it you need?

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: So what are you wondering?

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Farewell, make sure to let everybody know that I'm the smartest!

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Oh- yes that is peculiar isn't it?

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: If you don't mind me asking... is your friend from Aldorei?

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: It seems like my theory is true, Efilim elves are dying.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Anything else?

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Hmm- I'm sorry but I can't talk about that too much.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: I would love to spoil you with my knowledge but... the grass has ears here in Aldorei.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: Though I will tell you this, Elves used to die from old age around 1000 years ago.

lines.speaker: Sol
lines.line: I hope my knowledge was of assistance.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Good day.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: I've heard of you and what happened in the Valley.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Oh... yeah, good job.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Enjoy Aldorei now.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: How come you are so curious?

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Goodbye.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Oh my.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Your attitude is really starting to annoy me, young traveler.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: I don't care if you've defeated all the monsters in the world, never ask a woman like me of her age.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Okay.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: I'm sorry to hear that.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: But why are you telling me that?

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Uhm. Actually I'm busy, I have a lot to do today.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Sorry, please leave.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: You seem like such a kind adventurer, you humans aren't all so bad.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Sure I'll answer some questions!

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: You never ask a woman her age, did you not know that?

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: All I can say is that I am old enough.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: I'm so sorry to hear that.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: I don't really see how that is connected to Aldorei though.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Humans die you know.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Well... when I think about it- no.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Actually, there is an old tale for children about a dying elf.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: I never thought about it much since I've never seen anyone in Aldorei die before.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: I heard that there is some old graveyard somewhere in Aldorei, probably just some weird folktale.

lines.speaker: Mona
lines.line: Hope I was of assistance.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: ... Zzzzz...

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: ... Oh-uh, good morning?

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I was just taking a... little nap, no need to be so loud.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: So why did you wake me?

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: ... Goodnight...

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: ... Meh

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I'm not that much for... image and status.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: That's all anyone ever talks about here... zzz...

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: ... Because I'm tired?

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: What a strange question.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: You see- I'm a moon elf, I draw power from the moon.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: You humans are really stupid I have to say... zzz...

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: It's the capital of the elves, a dream come true for all elves to live here.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: Well... almost all.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: Aldorei might look really pretty from the outside, but really, they are all hiding something here.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I'm younger than most here, you see. I'm just about a hundred years old.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: There's a few places where we aren't allowed in. The more you think about it, the more controlled everything is here.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: Anything else?

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: No. Do you not know of the child regulations here?

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: There are very strict restrictions on who or when someone can have children here.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I'm the only new elf this century, at least around here.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: This is the main reason elves have started moving to Efilim, to start families.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I can't really say... you really don't want to break the rules here.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I'd keep a low profile if I were you.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I can give you some information but you need to leave me alone after.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: I heard about a hidden chamber under the town. Coincidentally, we aren't allowed to go down there.

lines.speaker: Mané
lines.line: Please keep your voice down.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Amber here! Reporting for duty.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Are you lost, little adventurer?

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Worry not, the great Amber is here to help you find your way!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: What can I do for you?

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Goodbye human!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Enjoy this wonderful town, don't hesitate to ask me for help!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: What.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: ... That is... not nice.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I... I.... No! Bullies don't affect me... *sniffles*

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I am very happy!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Everyday I get to catch bad guys, I'm living the dream!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Well... more like every month or so, or... even once every year. There aren't many bad guys around here.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: My name is Amber of the Sol Embassy Royal Task Force!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: It is my duty to protect the city from wrongdoers!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: YOU AREN'T A THIEF ARE YOU? OR A ROBBER? OR MURDERER!? ARSONIST!?

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Sorry, sorry, sorry!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I let my imagination get the best of me!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: My main job is patrolling the grounds and making sure no one is doing anything they shouldn't.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I also report anything I hear people talking about that they shouldn't be.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Maybe I shouldn't have said all of that...

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Can I help you with anything else?

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Goodbye human!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Enjoy this wonderful town, don't hesitate to ask me for help!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Anything I see!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I report who comes and leaves the town. Who sells what, who buys what and who talks with who.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: The list goes on and on and on and on and on.... and on... and on.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: They like keeping track of what happens inside the town!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: The Sol Embassy and its elders.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: There are six elders who rule over Aldorei!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: They don't often come out in public, usually they like to keep to themselves. I don't even know what all of them look like!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: If you see anything out of the ordinary, report it to me!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hmm... that is all very interesting, the more I hear the more right I feel like I am.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Even though the relationship between Efilim and Aldorei isn't the best I would still hope that Aldorei isn't doing something to kill us off.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I think it's worth looking into the information you've gained.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Where should we start?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I don't know how that will help solve anything.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hmm- maybe you know something that I don't?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Sure, let's meet up at the potion merchant then.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Good idea! I overheard some elves talk about an underground river running under the town.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: So if you come across water, you'll find the river.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I'll keep my distance, don't want to draw too much attention.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I don't know if that'll help us, but sure.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's talk to Amber again.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Amber here! Ready to catch the bad guys!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Are you here to report something?

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Hold on! Why are you with an Efilim elf? Is this some sort of spy mission to take over Aldorei and turn it into a capitalistic society?

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I will have to report this to the elders immediately!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: soldier, deal with this situation... NOW!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: This is a serious offense.. I think...

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I am a respected member of the task force. My only friend is the law.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Say goodbye to... your freedom!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I'm not sure what the punishment for talking to an Efilim elf is, but I would imagine at least hanging at dawn. Or is there even a punishment?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's just get out of here. I say looking into the underground river would have been the smartest move in the first place.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: I am a respected member of the task force. My only friend is the law.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: But money... I could go shopping in Cinfras.

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: GAH! MY BRAIN, IT'S BECOMING CORRUPT! But money!

lines.speaker: Amber
lines.line: Fine! [128 Emeralds], now

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Alright time to listen to me now.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I heard about an underground river, so let's try to find that, shall we.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I'm going to be completely honest with you.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: What exactly are we doing here?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: A... drink?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Why didn't you just say that. Here, it's on me.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Two Elven Herbal Brews please.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Here you go!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Can we get back on track now?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I overheard some elves talk about an underground river running under the town. So if you come across water, you'll find the river.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's hope we didn't draw any attention doing all of that unnecessary stuff.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: You know, finding this mysterious location might be harder than I thought.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let me think...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: So realistically, if it's an abandoned elven site it should have some leftover artifacts.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Can you manage this yourself? Look for markings on the walls that resemble Aldorei.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Seems like no elves have followed us down here.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's look around for artifacts that resemble Aldorei down here.
[1/] Olon: Let's start this way!
[2/] Olon: AAHHH! I SLIPPED.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Erm- thank you.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hmph- this looks pretty suspicious to me.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Sounds like it's hollow on the otherside, maybe we can get through here.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Barely a scratch.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We should try combining our magic, soldier.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Get close to the boulders and cast a spell, I will follow your lead.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Again! Looks like it's working!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We almost got it. Again!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Good job! Team work makes a dream work, or whatever the saying is.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's take a look around.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Did you just... dig up a grave?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: This is an important piece of history!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I will look away and pretend I didn't see that.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's take a look around!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Try looking around the graves a bit? Maybe they can give us some information.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I assume you found the same stuff I did...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: So what changed?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: What do you think about all of this?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: It's sad to say, but it's true.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: People who are knowledgeable, magically gifted or well versed in the arts are seen as better.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: In that case- I assume majority of elves were buried in the lesser ones.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I- I'll make sure Efilim never becomes like this...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: What do you think about all of this?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: 1000 years ago... could this be connected to the portal over in the Wynn province?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hmm...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Seems unlikely, how come they gained immortality?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Did the elves of Aldorei actually grasp the light?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hmm?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: It's the biggest accomplishment an elf can reach.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: By working and studying the arts of magic and manners an elf may ascend into the light.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: And witness him- The Beast of Light, Orphion.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I think it's time we pay the elders a visit.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: They have some explaining to do.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's go soldier, they meet up above the bank.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Exactly what I was thinking.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's go soldier, they meet up above the bank.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: They should be at the top of this building. Follow the golden carpet to get there!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: soldier! Wait!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We need to watch out for the guards.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: The guards are coming!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: This is our chance to run past!

lines.line: HALT! A meeting is taking place, no one goes past us.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We don't have time for this... GAH!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: The truth is so close! I...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I'm sorry!

lines.speaker: Sol Embassy Guard
lines.line: Hey! What are you doing?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I feel really bad...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: This wasn't supposed to happen, I just want to know what happened to my parents!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I hope they didn't get too hurt from that... but we have come this far.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: No point in turning back now. Come soldier, let's go.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Alright- this meeting is over with, glad we got to an agreement.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Pardon me!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Ahm- excuse me!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Ehm- I know this is impolite of me, which is exactly why I'm doing it!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We know your dark secrets and we have proof!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: What nonsense, who let this ginger rat in here!?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Who are you calling a rat!? Pulling the ginger card too!

lines.speaker: Elder Willow
lines.line: Can somebody please get the Sol Embassy Guards for us?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Wait a second... human, what are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: We saw you arrive with this elf, us elders aren't that gullible.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: soldier... I really thought you'd have my back out there.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: What are you really doing here?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: So you admit that your invitation to Aldorei is being used to threaten us.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: I knew letting foreigners into our town would come back to bite us.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Guards- arrest these pests and get them to the dungeons!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: An explanation to what exactly?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: And you admit you're apart of this elf's posse?

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Wait- before you do!

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: You said you had proof of something, tell me- what have you found?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Aldorei's secret, you obtained immortality!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We found the old cemetery under the city and aren't afraid to expose you to the world!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: My parents both suffered and I only have you to blame for it.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Really- that's quite... interesting.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: That's enough! To the dungeons with you now!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: I'm sure you must realize by now we are the elders for a reason?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
