lines.line: Us elves are ten times more powerful than any human by nature.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Just because we tend to solve things peacefully doesn't mean we can't use brute force.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: No! soldier, I am not letting this go! I will get justice for my parents.

lines.speaker: Elder Willow
lines.line: Pfft- it's merely a design flaw.

lines.speaker: Elder Willow
lines.line: Don't try to trick us with your mind games.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Okay, where are the guards?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: You did WHAT?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: I guess we'll just have to escort you to the dungeons ourselves!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: You've practically doubled your sentence- a thousand years and another thousand!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Hmph-

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: So you managed to time it with their lunch breaks.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: You're more cleaver than I thought, Efilim Elf.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: I guess we'll just have to escort you ourselves!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Thats it! soldier, let's run!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Follow me!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Up the stairs, soldier!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Get behind me!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Quickly- let's head outside!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: You know... I didn't really think that would work, and I was right.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: But I think I figured it out...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I mean obviously?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: No- but I noticed something that didn't add up with our previous information.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: One of the seats were empty and one of the elves mentioned six elders, did she not?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I glanced over at the shelves behind them and saw papers signed by another name.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: So the question is... what happened to them?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I'm guessing the Elders got into a big disagreement and decided to rid of them.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: So I doubt they have any records of that occurring here...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Our best bet is to find somebody that may have seen what happened here.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Y'know I'm pretty good friends with the Cinfras Scouts.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: They are really observant of everything that goes on in and around the canyons.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Meet me outside the Cinfras Guild Hall, speak with me if you'd like to travel there together.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Exactly! You've got a keen eye for this kinda thing.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: The question is if she lied, or if something else happened.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: One of the seats were empty but most importantly...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's go then! Glad you want to travel with me.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Here we are! The capital of Gavel, home of a lot of things I'm sure.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Alright- so we have to come up with a plan on what to do next, I have a few suggestions myself.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I've done some work for the Guild Hall staff in the past and happen to know a few of them.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We are actually quite good friends, what do you think?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Sounds like a good plan to me.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Head inside and look for someone who doesn't seem busy.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Harvy! How're you doing?

lines.speaker: Harvy
lines.line: ... Olon?

lines.speaker: Harvy
lines.line: I haven't seen you in so long! I'm doing good, family too!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Glad to hear! Listen- we're quite busy today, do you know where the old military documents are being kept?

lines.speaker: Harvy
lines.line: Is this about the theory you had going? Actually- I recently did some work there.

lines.speaker: Harvy
lines.line: There's an elevator up the stairs next to me.

lines.speaker: Harvy
lines.line: Please come back and talk later! I miss our conversations.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Perfect! soldier, let's take that elevator upstairs right away.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Wait for me, soldier!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: ... Nice weather today!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: So you want us to sneak in?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Do you even know where we need to go?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Thought so... good thing I'm here then!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: As I previously mentioned, I've been helping out with keeping the gardens inside tidy.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I've picked up a few things here and there, obviously! The conclusion I have is...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: There's a room at the top of the guild hall that stores old military documents.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: It isn't really in use anymore, meaning the way up won't be easy... meet me under the bridge.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: The archive should be at the top of one of the big towers of the Guild Hall.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I had a brilliant idea of blessing you with some of my magic that you can hopefully use to get in.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I want to go meet up with my old friend, I'll hopefully see you soon.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Do you see the pool of white magic next to us?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Just hop in when you are ready to start.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Alright. Get ready!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hopefully this will help you.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: The documents should be in here somewhere.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: You found it? Great, it's just as I thought.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Alright- this is the plan. I will stay behind and look for a map of the place mentioned, they almost always mark the reports properly.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Meet me in Aldorei Town, at the eastern town exit. Let's try to avoid the elders for now.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: If you want to get back to Aldorei Town I heard that there's a so called ''juggler'' merchant in Cinfras that will bring you there for free.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: You could always walk too, I suppose.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Alright, here we are.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: This road leads to the canyon of the lost, so we may have to look around for a while.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: The canyon moves on its own. Alright, let's get going.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Olon! soldier, wait!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Oh no- the elders.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: I'm not here to stop you. Actually, I wanted to help out.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: There are a lot of things wrong with this town, this society. The judgements that we've made...

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Us elves aren't perfect. We like to say that- and frankly, many of us believe it too.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: I've always wanted to be the change in Aldorei but it's troublesome to convince those who are stuck in their crooked ways.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Please, bring back Elder Birch- for me. Follow the mountain road to the right until you come across a cave with mushrooms.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: In the meantime, I have some things to ask the Elders- good luck, both of you.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: You have one minute to explain what you're doing here and who you are before I collapse the mountains around you.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: An elf and a human- inside of my home!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Woah-woah! Let's take a breath.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: You can tell THEM I haven't left my home since my banishment. I haven't said a word, nor have I even considered doing anything.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We aren't with the Elders. I'm from Efilim! We are here for the truth.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: So this is a test, huh?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: What? No!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Do they... want... me back? Is this why you are here?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We aren't connected to the Elders in any way! I'm here for personal reasons.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I won't tell you anything!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Don't play dumb.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: This is some sort of test from the Elders.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: If not, convince me otherwise.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Even though I have been banished, I would never want something like that.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Aldorei is my home!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Tough luck- I don't know how that would convince me you're not with the elders.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: You'll have to try harder than that.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: If the Elders sent you, then you should already know the answer.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I am not telling you anything...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: What!?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Where did that accusation come from?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Are you two a bit slow or what? We are not killing anyone!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: If anything, the Efilim elves brought it upon themselves by leaving our city.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Elves are magical, that's why the city is magical.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I'm not going to tell you anything.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I've already told you.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Aldorei doesn't care about Efilim elves, why would they kill them?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Well, why are you here then?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: If you are so close, what do you need me for?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I've said too much.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Let's just say the town is magical. That's all you need to know.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Why are you even wondering?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Wow!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: You sound like a genius.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Of course things happened- things happen everywhere!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Really... it seems I can't escape the past.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I don't know what it is... but I want you to tell me more...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Maybe it's time- time to confront the elders again. We must go.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: What?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Prove it! I can't believe they would just forget about me so quickly.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Keep trying.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Alright that's enough!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: So what? That doesn't prove anything.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Alder...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: What... what did he say about me?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Alder would never say that... especially not to the likes of you.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Although- I do miss him dearly...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Of course... yes...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Of course he did, he has always taken my side.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: You know what- I will come with you.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: But I won't tell you anything. I'm only coming because of Alder.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Let me get myself together...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Go on ahead. This is not something I expected to happen...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: We're back.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: You've got guts coming back here after everyth-

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Actually- we have someone that you might be interested in meeting.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: What is the meaning of this?!

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: B-birch...

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: It's been so long, I didn't think you would come back...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Alder- I am sorry but the only reason I have returned is to set things right once and for all.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: These two individuals have the right to know what's going on.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Are you out of your MIND! We voted on this all those years ago!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: If you tell them ANYTHING about the tree I will make sure your eternal life ends right here and now!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Oak- that is ENOUGH! Can't you see- this human is fighting the war we begun!

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: They've earned it- they should know. Salvation of our light, our redemption!

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: I agree with Elder Birch, sir.

lines.speaker: Elder Willow
lines.line: Sorry sir, as do I.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: soldier, Olon- the war you are fighting...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: We- we are the ones to blame. Our kind, our people...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: The elves are the reason the world is in calamity. All because of one, senseless, selfish mistake.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: The worst fate that this world has seen, a fate beyond comprehension.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: Your leading question, about our immortality. The answer is simple- but there is more to it.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: We... we revealed the first gate- giving way for the darkness...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: But- I don't understand... why?

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I'd rather if we show you. Meet me under the Cherry Blossom tree.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: I- I will join you as well.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: This place- here is where it all began.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: The center of the Elven society, under the tree that protects our civilization.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: And, brings upon us our immortality...

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: The roots expand deep inside this cavern that we've used for storage over the years.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: At least two Elders are required to open the passage. We will open the way for you two now.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Be careful, nobody was meant to return there so certain defense mechanisms were put in place.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Also, the information you will learn can harm all elves, unfortunately some things must be kept a secret.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Wait up!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: What is this place?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I've had a very bad feeling that we won't like what we see...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Well... It's too late to back down now.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: What is this place?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Do you feel the magical energy, it's almost like I can touch it.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Is the water filled with logs?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Have you noticed this... plant in the middle.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: It seems like this place is so alive, I mean just look at all of this coming from the logs!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: If you are here to stop us, we won't hesitate to hurt you!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: On the contrary. I... realize, that this is something we can no longer keep quiet about.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: When you brought back Birch... it brought back memories, and I must admit. It made me realize I had lost myself along the way.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: We were ashamed of our actions- all of us. Scared for our people. If they knew the truth... there would be riots, wars, innocents would die!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: But because we locked up Aldorei from the outside, we grew a... god complex, so to speak.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: We lost track of why we locked ourselves in.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: You will find the answers to your questions once you lay grasp of the wood.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: I assume you two already noticed the intense magical energy coming from here.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: This is the source of our immortality.

lines.speaker: Elder Birch
lines.line: The remnants of the original Guardian of the Forest.

lines.speaker: Elder Alder
lines.line: Enter the log- please.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: I have summoned you two for an important meeting.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: I had another vision...

lines.speaker: Elder Elm
lines.line: What did you see this time?

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: It was unclear... The only thing I'm certain of is that he contacted me.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: I think... I think he wants us to witness him. This is finally our chance to grasp the light.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: And I know how we do that!

lines.speaker: Elder Hickory
lines.line: What are you implying?

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: The Guardian of the Forest.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: You must have realized by now that he is a direct contact to the other side. I think... I think it's time.

lines.speaker: Elder Hickory
lines.line: You don't mean...

lines.speaker: Elder Elm
lines.line: ... cutting down the Guardian of the Forest!?

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: Believe me- I hear how ludicrous this all sounds.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: But think, why would I have visions of witnessing him moments after visions of the Guardian?

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: We would be the first of our kind to witness him before death!

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: I believe that's what he wants!

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: People of Aldorei!

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: Today is the day we meet our God!

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: We will take down the Guardian of the Forest to open a gateway!

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: Today we establish history and a new chapter for all elves!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Uhm... Elder-

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: ... What do you want?

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: We do not have the time. Move along, young one.

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Wait! I don't think.. this is a good idea.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: And... who are you?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: But... I really don't think you should go ahead and hurt the Gua-

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: As the Elders of this town we've already decided on this. You are welcome to join us for this moment, young elf.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: But if you as much as try to stop us, you will be banished.

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: This.. THIS IS IT!

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: We... WE DID IT!

lines.speaker: Elder Prometheus
lines.line: I can barely.... this pressure!

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: It's leading me... here?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: What do you want?

lines.speaker: Lari
lines.line: Why me?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Let's hear them out...

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Do you realize now?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: This secret can never leave Aldorei. If it does- people will riot and wars will break out.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Elves who had nothing to do with their decision will die.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: This is far greater than any of us.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: I understand you may have questions.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Elder Prometheus died of old age, almost everyone from that time is dead. He elected us six to keep the secret safe.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Apparently the immortality hadn't set in just yet- magic takes time.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: I don't think he really understood the extent of what he had done. We slowly began connecting the dots.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Everything seemed to lead back to the portals opening- the war in Wynn and the attack on Gavel.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: I understand you may have questions.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: The magical wood from the Guardian of the Forest must radiate magic that grants us our life.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: This is why we locked up Aldorei, letting people live immortal lives would have dire consequences.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: We tried to at least make up for some of the damage we had done...

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: The portal being opened here caused a chain reaction that opened every portal.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: This is unfortunately what cursed the world and made it possible for the corruption to leak into Wynn and beings of darkness to breach Gavel.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: This used to be an open cave that we decided to hide the rest of the Guardian in.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: It seems like the immense magic transformed this place to look like this...

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Please... keep this quiet.

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: We can't put innocent lives at risk- don't you agree?

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: Take these please!

lines.speaker: Elder Oak
lines.line: We will make our leave, you can jump after us to return to Aldorei Town.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I need to think.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I knew that I was getting myself into... things- but not this.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: My own people have cursed the world...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Please, visit me in Efilim sometime. Hopefully I've come to terms with everything by then.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Book number three finished!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Oh, hi soldier.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I didn't even hear you come in. I was too sucked up in this interesting book ''Live Life Love Life''.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: *sigh*

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I've been reading all day to get myself in a different head space.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Ah, who am I kidding- this book SUCKS!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Come back tomorrow, please. I have about five more books to get through.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hi there! Great timing.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I got inspired from my journey through the world of motivational writing yesterday.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: The best thing in the world is to help people around you, is that not right?

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: This way I'll keep myself busy while still being of assistance.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Well, I'm doing better. Thank you for asking.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: My shame is slowly turning to hatred for those old elders, maybe that's progress.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Please come back tomorrow, I have a gift for you.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I... I know that.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I know I couldn’t have done anything, I just find it so stupid.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Stupid that the so called, ''all mighty, selfless elves'' did something like this.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Please come back tomorrow, I have a gift for you.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Goodbye.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: ''Sunshine after Rain''... I can't wait for this one...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Shoot!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: You are earlier than I expected.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I was planning to cook you a nice meal as a thank you for getting me through these past two days and for helping me earlier.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I decided to pick up a couple of new hobbies to get my mind working, cooking being one of them.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: You have truly done more for me than I could have ever imagined. I’m proud to call you my friend.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: However...

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I may or may not have forgot a couple of ingredients for my stew!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Can you go around the forest and see if you can find [4 Leafy Stalk] and [2 Mycanoid Spores] please.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Here you go!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I think I’m finally getting over my guilt.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I realized that I never really took time to grieve my parents' death and I guess I was so occupied with finding an answer to my big conspiracy that Aldorei killed them.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Then finding out all of that information... it all just came crashing down on me.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I'm grateful that you managed to pull me out of that dark space, soldier.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Come visit me tomorrow again, please.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Come back tomorrow.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Finally!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I stayed up all night working on this new project of mine.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I picked up the wonderful art of painting and decided to make something for you.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I've also gone the entire day feeling good, for once.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I feel like I'm back on track. So it's time for me to start stressing over another conspiracy.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I'm actually on my way to the Cinfras library to do some light reading, hoping to stumble upon another mystery.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Anyway, here you go!

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: Hope you're careful on wherever your journey leads you. If you ever need me, just drop by.

lines.speaker: Olon
lines.line: I do some gardening when I'm stressed.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Hello adventurer! I see you want to solve the mystery of Bob's tomb also? Glad to meet you.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: My name is Batelu. Lately, I've been studying these strange symbols on the walls.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: It's about Bob. Hopefully you do not believe the stories of his death, right? Bob couldn't have died so easily. Not to something so mundane as a wolf.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: He wasn't only strong, he was absolutely un-killable, a master in almost every skill.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: I believe he knew he was about to die. How? What of? Nobody knows, but he left this world prepared.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: You see, it says here Bob had three loyal animals. Before dying, he scattered them across the ocean.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: I think those animals are the key to accessing his real tomb...

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: You see that little gap right there? It's the entrance...

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Unfortunately, nobody was able to remove the spell blocking it.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: But I can. I know how to open the passage to Bob. This is where the animals will come in useful...

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: I believe Bob did something to those animals. I think if we could reunite them in some way, we could open the passage.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Bring me [1 Cluckles' Favourite Feather], [1 Baab's Wool] & [1 Mooington's Skin] if you can find them.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: I am sure that together, we can open the passage. Good luck.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Wonderful! We can now open the passage to the true tomb of Bob...

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: I am not worthy enough to enter it. I did not complete the task of the animals, merely read it. You shall go alone, be careful.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: I am Bob, master of the arts of Wynn.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: Let me explain why you are here.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: My animals, were my greatest allies in my travels through the world.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: I travelled too far, mined too deep, and of course, challenged what should not be challenged. My time in Wynn was coming to an end.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: I knew so, too. But I refused to leave without giving the power i had attained to those worthy of it.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: Using what ability I had left to me, I transferred my power to my animals, in three pieces. In the hope that those worthy to harness it will seek them out.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: The spell I placed on the door to this realm will only break to the one who collects my power. But it cannot have escaped your notice, you do not have my power.

lines.speaker: Bob
lines.line: The truth is, you must pass a test, the ultimate test. Hone your skills you have learnt throughout your travels, and face me. Face me, and earn your place amongst soldiers of Wynn.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Ah! You have returned! Tell me, what did you find within?

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: ...You faced Bob himself in combat? And you triumphed? That's quite remarkable!

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: And he gave you his Seal of Approval... Hm. If that is the case, then there is something I may do for you.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Before Bob passed, he left his mythical weapons with a trusted friend. They were, so he said, to be kept for one who would be worthy to wield them...

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Yes... Yes, I am certain. You have proven yourself worthy. Take this relic, the Stone of Myths, and bring it to the Temple of the Legends.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Within, you will find a merchant who will offer you a weapon in exchange for it. I wish you luck with your future travels.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: Hi! My name is Batelu, I've been studying those strange symbols on the walls for quite a while now.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: I've learned a lot about Bob. Unfortunately, I do not think I am the person you are looking for.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: If you are looking for Bob's corpse, it's under the stairs in the icy chamber. Talk to me when you are level 74, I've got some work for you.

lines.speaker: Batelu
lines.line: You can't enter there yet!

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.line: I'm sorry sir, but I can't just give you a new passport... You'd need approval from-...

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: But sir, my passport was stolen! I have a flight to Detlas in under 30 minutes. I really need one, quick...

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.line: I've already told you where you need to go to get a new one. Next in line, please!

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.line: Hmmm... soldier, is it? Unfortunately, humans are required to get their passports in Wynn.

lines.speaker: Officer
lines.line: I'm afraid I can't help you. Next in line, please!

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Hey, you! Yes, you! Come outside, would you? I think we can help each other.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: So, I overheard your conversation with the Officer... You're also looking for a passport, right?

lines.speaker: Kid
lines.line: Where are we going, dad?

lines.speaker: Father
lines.line: We'll stay at the Blackbird Inn for a while.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Oh, you brought us to the Inn! Hmmm, the Barman's been working here for a long time...

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Maybe he knows something about the Black Market! I'll try and ask, y'know...all, uh...sneaky-like.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Excuse me, sir... You, uh...wouldn't happen to know any really cheap stores around here, would you?

lines.speaker: Barman
lines.line: The table's been set for the great feast, have stout or beer, what will it be?

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Is that a secret code...? Beer?

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Did that work? Is he gonna let us in?

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: I guess it wouldn't be that easy to find a way in... Where do you think we can go with that lead, soldier?

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Let's just keep exploring. Lead the way.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: The restaurant... That makes sense!

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Hey, uh...do these people look suspicious to you, too?

lines.speaker: Waiter
lines.line: The airship commanders love what they hate.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: I think we're getting onto something! Let's keep going.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Hmmm... These crates are full of items. Maybe we could give some of them to the commanders?

lines.speaker: Commander
lines.line: I wish my airship was black, I can't say I'm a fan of that white palette...

lines.speaker: Commander
lines.line: You know, maybe white isn't so bad after all.

lines.speaker: Commander
lines.line: All those other airship men carry around those vile face fruits, but I have to say, I've always had a soft spot for potatoes.

lines.speaker: Commander
lines.line: Though, really, the face doesn't mean it has to be evil, does it? It could be a nice face, after all.

lines.speaker: Commander
lines.line: I can't believe this place! They only have some rancid wheat stored here, what am I supposed to do with that? I'll take a carrot anyday over... wheat.

lines.speaker: Commander
lines.line: ... Oh, fine, wheat's not bad. I'll take some, I guess.

lines.speaker: Commander
lines.line: Once torn, forever broken beyond repair.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Oh, let's keep going! Where can we go with that lead?

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Who's that on top of that platform?!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: The two of you have come real far for this, huh?

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Well, I can give you the answer to the stout and beer question! But you won't enter the Market just with that.

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: You see, to enter the Market you'll need something to sell! And it won't be something you can exactly buy around here, if you get what I mean.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: We need something... illegal, right?

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Exactly! Luckily for you, I'm in a good mood. There's an airship docked close by. We'll be able to take it and I can help you get an item!

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Uh... What do you think, soldier? I really need that passport, and well...you could get something out of this too, right?

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: ... Fine, we'll do it.

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Great! Follow me, it's not far.

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Wait! There are guards protecting the airship. Don't let them see you!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: They're near the edge... Push them off.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Uhh... I'm sure they're fine, I'm sure that fall wasn’t too big...

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Well, that's your only way inside! There are more guards up ahead. Take care of them without being seen, and we'll be in the clear!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Well done! Let's get on the airship.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Did you just... Push them all...?

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Buckle up! We're heading to the Sky Islands, there we'll be able to collect some dragonling eggs for you to sell at the Black Market!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: The island we're heading to is home to a Dragonling nest! They use it to lay their eggs, as it's quite a difficult place to access.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: And those'll be worth a lot in the Black Market, right...?

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: They sure will! Dragonling eggs are rare, and this island can only be accessed by airship... They're worth a fortune back at Letvus.

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Oh, there it is! I can see the island from here, buckle up. We've got some eggs to steal!

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: What's that?! Oh... It looks like we've got company...

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Drat, the skyraiders are here! We can't let them get away with those eggs...

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Well, if that's the case, then there's only one thing to do! Come on, follow me!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: We can't get to the nest with so many pirates on the way, kill them!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Alright, follow me! Let's go harvest that egg!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Protect me while I harvest the egg, soldier!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: We're halfway there, just keep defending me!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: There we go! Let's get back to the airship, run!

lines.speaker: Skyraider
lines.line: Don't let them get away! Fire the cannons!!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Soldier, don't let them hit us! Attack the cannonballs using your weapon before they hit our airship to deflect them!

lines.speaker: Skyraider
lines.line: We can't take more cannon shots... We're wasting our time, let's get going! We got bigger fish to fry!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: That was close... Well then, let's head back to the airbase!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: The two of you have certainly proven yourselves today!

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: So, I'll give you the password to enter the Black Market.

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: Go back to the Barman at the Inn and tell him 'I'm not thirsty, I always carry a bottle.'

lines.speaker: Mechanic
lines.line: That might just give you the chance you need to get in. Good luck!

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Thank you for your help, sir... Let's go back to the bar, then.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Here we are again. Let's talk to the Barman.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Um, sir? I'm not thirsty, I always carry a bottle.

lines.speaker: Barman
lines.line: Talk only to the Black Market member in the end of the hallway and do not talk to anyone else.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Let's go, soldier.

lines.speaker: Market Member
lines.line: I've heard you've stolen some eggs from the Skyraiders. That's a bold move!

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: That's what we need, soldier. Sold! The egg is yours.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Let's get our passports, soldier!

lines.speaker: Market Member
lines.line: So do you have the emeralds?

lines.speaker: Market Member
lines.line: Hmm... This will do it. Here, your passports.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Uhh.. Soldier, I think you dropped your passport. Let me get it for yo-...

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Wait... That's MY passport?! It was in my pocket all along...

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Well, uhhh... I guess you can have some of these emeralds, then...

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: ...Uh, soldier? I don't think we should leave this area yet, those must be the commanders the waiter mentioned over there.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: Remember what the passport seller said? We shouldn't always talk to the same merchant... I think this one won't like another price raise. We should talk to the others.

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: We have to get to 2000 emeralds in 5 bid increases. Let's try again!

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: So that's our intial bid. Now we need to ask for a higher bid, remember? We can't always talk to the same merchant or they'll lose interest...

lines.speaker: Doan
lines.line: And we can't talk to more than 5 people for a raise or they might get angry.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: I'm glad you came along, I could do with a little help if you're not too busy.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: I'm Dodegar Bandysnoot, the world famous Hobbit swordsmith! Perhaps you^ve heard of me?

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: No? Oh... Well, I've had an idea about how I could make the best weapon that the world has ever seen!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: But, I need some help getting the special resources to make it.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: You'll help?! Excellent! We shall gather enough resources to make one for each of us!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: So firstly, I need some living wood for the handle, [1 Enchanted Stick] should be enough.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: The wood sprites located across the river to the west, in a big tree trunk, have magical properties! The handle can then mold to the user's hand! One shouldn't be too hard to come across!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: I hope you are prepared, this will be your best quest yet!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Wow! You got the wood I needed, thanks!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: While I'm making the handle, could you help me with the blade?

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Since we want this weapon to be as good as possible we need to find some sacred Hobbit metal!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: The hobbit village, The Shiar, is really close! Follow the southern road. My brother Gogedar should be there!

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: What a beautiful day to stand here and do nothing.

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: My brother you say... Trying to create a weapon...

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: Hmmm...

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: Oh he needs Sacred Hobbit Metal!?

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: Hmm..!

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: Sorry can't help you. I don't really know what that is.

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: Maybe ask our cousin, Togedar?

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: Togedar is much more knowledgable than me...

lines.speaker: Gogedar
lines.line: Hmmm...?

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: This ground sure is soft...

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: Dodegar? Does not really ring a bell I'm afraid.

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: Oh! Gogedar's brother, why didn't you tell me that.

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: Sacred Hobbit Metal... This is a metal forged by master blacksmith hobbits within our village. It is a bit expensive to get by but holds great potential, if used properly.

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: Oh. You need a piece?

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: I don't have any. Maybe ask my nephew's brother Alegdar?

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: The metal is rather rare so I don't know if you can even find it...

lines.speaker: Togedar
lines.line: My best guess is Alegdar, though!

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: Sometimes I think about things.

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: I don't know why I do that.

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: Oh?

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: I actually don't know much about... anything.

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: I kind of just... stand around here.

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: Everyone I have ever met just calls me annoying and useless. So I decided to stop trying.

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: You know, life is hard. We all just have to fight through, and then eventually, we might become happy.

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: Right sorry... Ask Balegar for any information. He is way smarter.

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: Oh?

lines.speaker: Alegdar
lines.line: I actually don't know much about... anything.

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: My family in the Shiar are all so stupid.

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: I just want to go study at the Llevigar university.

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: My cousin's nephew's dad has had a rough year... I feel bad for him.

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: Oh well!

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: I have nooooo clue about that metal. I heard it was just as valuable as a normal rock.

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: Maybe my cousin Reyoretrsed knows anything about it.

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: People really think the metal is special...

lines.speaker: Balegar
lines.line: It is just a normal soap stone that looks fancy.

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: Reyoretrsed? That's me!

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: You are wondering how my name is pronounced? What a rude question.

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: Ray-ore-tree-sed, obviously. What is a human doing here?

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: You are wondering if I have Sacred whatever metal?

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: I'm 7. Now if you excuse me, I am busy standing still. Go bother Richard or something.

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: If anyone ever mentions my name and how dumb it sounds again, I will finally snap.

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: Mark my words. You do not want to mess with a 7 year old.

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: I'm sleeping.

lines.speaker: Reyoretrsed
lines.line: Shush, old person.

lines.speaker: Richard
lines.line: Come talk to me! I have the item. I have it!

lines.speaker: Richard
lines.line: I've been trying to tell you that I have what you need.

lines.speaker: Richard
lines.line: You humans really need to practice your communication skills, please.

lines.speaker: Richard
lines.line: Anyway, here. Take it! This metal is just a scam anyway, nothing special with it.

lines.speaker: Richard
lines.line: If you knew how to listen you wouldn't have to go through all of that.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: I hope it wasn't too much of an issue to get!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: ... I forgot a step. I can't attach a blade without a binder material.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: I need the nectar of a native flower of the forest to attach it. [1 Diplacus Aurantiacus] would do the trick.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Finding the flower can be rather difficult, here's a riddle on how to find it.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: On the side of a hut, hidden inside a hole. Resting in a forest of light, without plight. Whatever that would mean.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Hold up! This feels waaay, toooo easy.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: If I'm going to give you this amazingly, incredible, showstopping, crazy item practically for free, you need to at least work for it!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Give me that!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Let me just...

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: This looks so much better! Anyway, bring me that flower now!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Took you a while, did it not?

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: It's starting to look pretty amazing! Just like it's supposed to I'm sure!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Maybe this will actually work out. Either way, last ingredient we need!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: So to finalize and apply some magical properties to this uniquely amazing item we need something known as Luster Blood.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: The only known creature in the west, probably the whole world if I'm being frank, is known as the Glow Dust Leaf Beetle of the Underworld, not sure where the name comes from.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: I happen to know that this Beetle lives in a cave in the eastern ravine thingy! If you walk straight east you will stumble upon it, I promise!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Oh! Almost forgot to mention, about 2000 Luster Bloodis probably enough.
Do not step any closer... Or I will be forced to obliterate you!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: The final component! It is finally here!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Oh my Orphion!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: Do you see how it's glowing, sparkling and... and radiating!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: You don't? Uhm... maybe you need glasses humie.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: As promised! Here you go! Always happy to practice the art of weapon creation.

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: This weapon will definitely be something put in the history books!

lines.speaker: Dodegar
lines.line: I'm sure of it!

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: Good day, soldier! Will you be flying with us today?

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: May I see your passport please?

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: It's a bit dusty! It looks very old, but the picture looks like you.

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: Well everything seems to be in order, climb aboard and I hope you have a pleasant journey.

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: You may now board the airship! Enjoy your flight!

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: Can I see your passport please? Oh, without a passport, I'm afraid you can not board.

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: I am sorry, this is a private flight for experienced customers only.

lines.speaker: Airship Clerk
lines.line: The minimum requirement is level 75 for this flight.

lines.speaker: Attendant
lines.line: Good day to you, soldier! This will be your quarters for the flight. I wish you a pleasant trip with us!

lines.speaker: Attendant
lines.line: You can sleep through your journey here if you have nothing else to do!

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Are you here to volunteer to search for the missing child?

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: We only just set off and there is already an incident.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: His mother informed us that her son disappeared soon after boarding.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Poor parenting, if you ask me. Alas, we must find the lad.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Since we don't have any leads, it might be best to ask some of the passengers for information.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Most of them will be in the dining area or in the lounge.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Thank you so much for your help; I hope you find the lad soon.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Hello again, did you find him?

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: How did he get down there?! There is supposed to be someone on duty!

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Thank you so much for finding him. You were the only volunteer.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Hopefully that is the only hiccup in the journey.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Feel free to return to your quarters and enjoy the rest of your journey.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Oh, hey! Are you here to help again?

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: I really appreciate it. My crew seem to be absolutely nowhere!

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: OK, well the situation is pretty bad. The engines have broken down.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: The engineer downstairs is trying to figure out a solution, but he's not the brightest villager in Gavel.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Would you mind having a talk with the engineer, and see i f you can help?

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: I have to stay here and man the brig, but if you head down to the engine room, we would greatly appreciate it.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Wow... You single handedly took out a skyraider invasion.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: And you're a passenger! It's a good job you did...

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: We have no defense on this ship. We are a civilian carrier.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: What is this? A ring from the Queen?! It looks valuable. You should keep it.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: I still do not know how to thank you... We owe you so much.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Wait! I know! You can have free travel between Detlas and Cinfras!

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: A private airship owner called Calo owes me big.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: I will tell him the deal. All you have to do is enter his ship and he'll take you back and for th!

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Oh, and you will also be rewarded kindly monetarily. I will also personally send him the ring, so that it doesn't get damaged on the way, and you will receive it there.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Just head down to the entrance deck, and we are about to arrive at Detlas Airbase now.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Thanks for helping us, really!

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Please remain seated, passengers. We'll be taking off in a moment!

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: I am busy at the moment. Look in your quest book if you are lost.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: What in good heavens was that? Crew, report!

lines.speaker: Airship Crewmember
lines.line: Sir! One of our engines blew out! We've lost all thrust on that side.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Blast it all! We are sitting dead in the water without both engines.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Go check on the condition of the passengers.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: Soldier, go report to the Engineer in the engine room and see if there is anything you can do to help us get moving once again.

lines.speaker: Captain Ackbar
lines.line: M en, hold her steady. We can still survive this! We just need to stop them following us.

lines.speaker: Missing Child
lines.line: Hey! Look at that ship over in the distance. It's been following us since we lifted off.

lines.speaker: Missing Child
lines.line: I know I shouldn't be down here but...

lines.speaker: Missing Child
lines.line: I love airships, and I've never seen one like that.

lines.speaker: Missing Child
lines.line: Oh, my mummy wants me?

lines.speaker: Missing Child
lines.line: Okay then, I'll head back right now!

lines.speaker: Found Child
lines.line: I'm sorry I caused such a worry earlier...

lines.speaker: Engine Instructions
lines.line: In event of shut-down, maintenance must be performed.

lines.speaker: Engine Instructions
lines.line: Worker must restart all wooden switches before the engine overheats.

lines.speaker: Engine Instructions
lines.line: DO NOT PRESS THE STONE SWITCHES

lines.speaker: Broadcast
lines.line: Attention passengers. There has been a missing person reported aboard. If there are any volunteers to help search for them, please report to the bridge and speak to the captain.

lines.speaker: Broadcast
lines.line: All staff report to stations! This is not a drill! All staff, report to stations!

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: I heard fighting? Is someone there? I am in the jail cell!

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: Hey! Don't leave before talking to me!

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: I heard the fighting above, well done! Any chance to see those raiders get what's coming warms my old heart.

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: I used to be the greatest locksmith in all of Gavel! I was known all over, unfortunately.

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: These fiends captured me, years ago, and made me create hundreds of keys for their raids.

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: I am much too old now, but I would love to see them taken down before I leave this world.

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: My key making gear is stored down the hall, behind the staircase. You can use them to craft a way inside the Queen's quarters.

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: Just look into the keyhole to see how to make them. Good luck!

lines.speaker: Captured Prisoner
lines.line: My key making gear is down the hall. Use it to make a key to the Queen's quarters.

lines.speaker: Skyraider Queen
lines.line: So you think you can just come on my ship, huh?

lines.speaker: Skyraider Queen
lines.line: Kill my crew? Interrupt my plunder?

lines.speaker: Skyraider Queen
lines.line: I know how to deal with 'problems' like you!

lines.speaker: Ship Crew
lines.line: This area is off limits to passengers during take off. Climb up to the passenger decks, there will be an attendee at your cabin.

lines.speaker: Baron Axol
lines.line: Greetings, young adventurer. You haven't seen my glasses, have you?

lines.speaker: Passenger Nancy
lines.line: *Sniff*... Have you seen my child? We were in our cabin, and then he just disappeared!

lines.speaker: Sub-engineer Akot
lines.line: I heard that a big ship was approaching from north. I saw it from the entrance deck. I wonder what they are doing.

lines.speaker: Passenger Casula
lines.line: Apologies, I haven't seen the kid you're looking for.

lines.speaker: Passenger John
lines.line: The interior of this ship is beautiful!

lines.speaker: Passenger John
lines.line: Ah, yes...I saw a little child run past me. He was shouting about an airship outside or something.

lines.speaker: Passenger John
lines.line: He swiftly made his way down the stairs to the bottom deck. Nobody seems to have seen him inside the ship after that.

lines.speaker: Passenger Nancy
lines.line: Have you found my child?

lines.speaker: Passenger Jeremy
lines.line: That ship the little kid was talking about...

lines.speaker: Calo
lines.line: Hey there. You must be the Human Ackbar told me about.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: Ye must be the 'uman the captain done told me about.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: We sure are havin' quite the situation down 'ere.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: I hafta stay here and man the 'ngines, else she might damage 'erself

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: If ye wanna help 'uman, go on up the riggin' and take a gander at the props.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: Ye can get to 'em through the access 'atches in the bridge.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: If'n they are stopped, just hit the breakers that are off.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: Come back here when ye done. I need ta stay here and keep her cool.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: I need ta take care of the 'ngines, stay clear!

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: If'n you are lost, take a gander at ya content book.!

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: Thank ye! The 'ngines are back up and running!

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: I couldn't have dun it without ye.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: You go back to yer quarters and get some rest. A passen'er like yerself shouldn' have to help the crew.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: I hope the rest of yer journey is good. I'll let the good cap'n know so he can turn her up ta max and get us movin' again.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: Thanks 'uman.

lines.speaker: Engineer Eric
lines.line: Hol' togetha old girl, ye got this!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Welcome, large human! What's that look for, never seen a Gnome before?! My house may look small, but it's perfect for me!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: I actually need some help, you see Razorice plague my home! They are similar to the rats of your province, but vicious and deadly to Gnomes!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: An easy fix exists for it though. There are many magical mushrooms in this cave and a rare one called Subtraxerim Utilium is the one we need.

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: It emits a sleeping spore that will knock the Razorice out long enough to kill them! I’ve seen one in the cave but every time I go to get it, I fall asleep!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Since you're so big, you won't fall asleep! Please retrieve some mushroom for me.

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: I think I left a trail of rainbow spores last time I tried to collect some, just follow the colours through the cave to find the mushroom!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Did you find any? Wait, something is different about you. Have you gotten smaller? Oh my...

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: ... You have.

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: I'm really sorry about this, I didn't think the mushroom would have a different effect on humans! But what did I expect from a mushroom that changes colour?!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Do not panic. I have a mushroom in my house that wakes people up; logic says that if the sleeping mushroom shrinks you, then this one should make you grow again!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Oh my, you are still shrinking before my eyes. You must hurry to the mushroom. Be careful, though! The Razorice will probably hunt you!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: I keep it on the top shelf, so you will probably have to fight them at some point... If you take care the razorice whilst you're there, we can kill two birds with one stone! Just follow the cheese crumbs to find them!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Good luck! Oh and, do watch out for my pet zombie.

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: What the... my house! What did you do?!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Springy plant? Bookshelf levers? Razorice king?! Hold on a moment, slow down and tell me properly.

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: I see. Well, at least you handled those damned Razorice, and I can actually live inside my house again - not that it'll offer much shelter now you've blown a hole in the side of it!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Ah, I suppose that's alright. The mushroom will grow back over to cover it - and righto,  your reward!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Here, take some of our Gnome gold, we have plenty to go around. And sorry about the whole you-getting-shrunk thing, but hey, being small isn't so bad! See you around, human!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Welcome, welcome! My humble little home welcomes travellers of all shapes and sizes!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: However, the problem I'm having can't be solved by anyone under Level 76. Come back when you can!

lines.speaker: Psilo
lines.line: Long time no see! Why you haven't grown, or shrunk, a bit since we last met.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Oh... you're a bit low level to be hanging around Gylia Watchtower, don't you think? Come back at level 77 and we'll get a drink down ya!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Hey there... if you're looking for a suit or something, now is a really bad time. Those blasted gerts keep taking my livestock!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Oh, ho ho. A human? What brings you to Gylia Watch - want to let your hair down a bit, I bet!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Of course you know who we are! The Gylia Watch was founded over 200 years ago in wake of the Villager victory in the war.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: The Gerten war! Only the most famous war in all of modern Gavel! The might of the Villagers crushed those blasted Gerts - not that they were particuarly hard to beat, heh.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Gerts are stupid brutes, you see. The only thing they ever think about is food.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Get too close to one and it'll chomp your fingers off, quick as you like. And then the rest of you as well!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: The peace treaty keeps them inside their borders, and we get a delivery of supplies every month from Cinfras to send over to them.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Of course, we have to keep some of the supplies for ourselves - you've seen how hard these men are working, they deserve a bit of a party!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: The Watch keeps a lookout over the Gerten borders day and night... well, maybe not on poker nights!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Although... we have heard a couple nasty rumours floating about - farmers disappearing from their houses and the such.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: If I really can't tempt you with a glass of wine and a round of poker, maybe you could go and check them out for us?

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: I'd send the men, but... well, I'd feel bad if one of them went and missed all the partying!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Here, you should head over and talk to Jitak, they're one of the farmers that lodged a complaint. Their house is west of here, I'll write down the co-ordinates.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Hey there! How's the - burp - investigation going, heh?

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: If you are looking for a suit or something, I can't help you. Now is a very bad time.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Oh, you're here on behalf of the Watch? Ha, even sending humans to do their work is not beneath them.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: All they do is sit up in that tower playing drinking games and act like they own this region!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: I reported the fact there is clearly a gert camp right in front of my house and they just ignored me. Now look, my pigs are all gone!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: I knew it was a mistake getting this property so close to gerten borders. See, gerts aren't the 'brutes' people insist, but...

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Well, they'll eat anything! Animals, fish, monsters, villagers, even humans! Biologically, they're just constantly hungry.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: The watch is meant to keep them behind their borders...

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: I even bought a golem to watch over them - got it for a good price because of some incident down at the Olux factory.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: But somehow the gerts are managing to avoid it! Look, if you're here from the watch, could you help me out?

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Go to the gert camp west of here and find out how they are doing all of this!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Hey! Have you followed the trail over to the gert camp just west of here yet?

lines.speaker: Gerten Captain Vongar
lines.line: A not Gert! And a snack!

lines.speaker: Gerten Chief Snaga
lines.line: -Good job to all of you! I am proud to say we made the cave road very well.

lines.speaker: Gerten Chief Snaga
lines.line: The town folk at Gylia steal the stuff meant for us for their party, and leave us high and dry!

lines.speaker: Gerten Chief Snaga
lines.line: But those dumb over fed town folk did not catch us when we dug our cave road right under their watch house.

lines.speaker: Gerten Chief Snaga
lines.line: With our new way to get to Gylia land we have more stuff than ever!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Human! You're back... and haven't been eaten by a Gert!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: What did you discover in the camp?

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: A tunnel?! Past Gerten borders? That must be how they're managing to get in and steal my livestock.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Look, human. The Watch aren't gonna do anything about this. Please... maybe you can help me.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: If you can disguise yourself as a Gert maybe you could sneak into their main camp and check out this tunnel?

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Okay! As you can see, all Gerts wear a carved pumpkin on their head - something to do with their culture.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: There's a pumpkin farm near here at [-248,37,-5425]... maybe you could get one from there?

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Remember, you're gonna need a pumpkin to blend in with the gerts. There's a farm south-west of here you can take one from!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: ... hello.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh good, were you sent here to be my lunch?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Are you here to be my lunch?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh, goodie!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: ... Is that a joke? What are you, some kind of snack?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh... good bye. Come back soon? With some food?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: A who.. man? Oh, you mean new folk! All the way here in gerten lands? I have not seen one of you here.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: I do want to know how you taste...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Doing? I am here to guard the orange gourd farm, of course!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: This farm right here is where all the gerts get their day mask from!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh, it is a thing gerts have been doing for as long as we know.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: At wake time each day a gert takes an orange gourd and eats into it a shape that shows their mood!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: It is really nice, is it not?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: We all want to eat all the time!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: On that note...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: No, new folk. Gerts only in this farm.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: That is why I am put here. To make sure no one gets in.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: But but I get so bored... and I really want to eat...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Like, with the clear green rocks?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: No new folk, gerts do not have any need for green rocks. But...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: How about this - I will just eat you!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Ok! Here I go!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Well, I think I will still eat you. Just how it is!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh. What are you then, some kind of snack?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh man, a red tree fruit! I should not leave my post... but I want to eat...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: It is only a few steps that way...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: That tastes so good! What a good red tree fruit.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: ... If I wait here, more might fall from the sky!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Hey! You cannot sneak into the farm or do other stuff like that, I have my eyes on you!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Or... well, there are times I look at the sky. In case more red tree fruits fall. But mostly my eyes are on you!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Hey! Why are you at the orange gourd farm so late?

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Wait... why does your orange gourd mask look like that?!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Why is it not like all of the others?

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: You are not a gert! You are a new folk! Gerts want to eat all the time!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: This is gert land only. And, well... a gert needs to eat.

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Hey! Why are you at the orange gourd farm so late?

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Look, we need some gerts for a trip to hunt in the new cave road.

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: You know, the one in the camp north of Gylia watch house?

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Come over here to help us!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Hey! You cannot sneak into the farm or do other stuff like that, I have my eyes on you!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Or... well, there are times I look at the sky. In case more red tree fruits fall. But mostly my eyes are on you!

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Hey! I do not think I have seen you here, are you new?

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: I love your mask! It feels so not like all the other ones around here.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: How did you get the sides so neat with just your teeth?!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Ah, a Gert!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Oh wait... human, it's you! Wow, you look exactly like a Gert. You're definitely going to blend in at the main camp.

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Okay, head over to the main camp at [-4,33,-5516] and see if you can find the tunnel!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: You've got a mask now, go check out the tunnel at the gert's main base!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Why aren't you eating?

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: You're not a gert... you're a human! Get them!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Quiet! We need to try to hear what the bad town folk at the watch house talk about!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Watch!

lines.speaker: Gylia Captain
lines.line: -silly gerts don't even know we're taking their supplies!

lines.speaker: Gylia Watchman
lines.line: Besides, we need those supplies more than they do... especially the alcohol, eh boys?!

lines.speaker: Gylia Watchman
lines.line: I don't even know why Cinfras keeps sending all this stuff for the Gerts - can't we just starve 'em out? Screw the lot of 'em, I say!

lines.speaker: Gylia Captain
lines.line: Damned right, boys! Now look, another shipment just came in - let's skim a little more off the top this time, eh?

lines.speaker: Gylia Captain
lines.line: Our kegs are running a bit low again.

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Agh! That stuff is meant to be ours. The peace deal said we have to get some stuff each month!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Those bad town folk... -you! Go tell the chief!

lines.speaker: Gert
lines.line: Tell the chief what we heard! It might be time to fight back at the watch house!

lines.speaker: Gert Battle Chief
lines.line: What? The town folk talk out loud that they take our stuff!

lines.speaker: Gert Battle Chief
lines.line: That is it! We will go to war with them!

lines.speaker: Gert Battle Chief
lines.line: Thank you, small gert, that you told me this! We will crush the lazy town folk and eat what is left of them!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Hey there! How's the - burp - investigation going, heh?

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Eh? Oh, you're back.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: What's that?! You're accusing the Watch of stealing supplies meant for the Gerts? Well I don't even know what to say, I've never even HEARD of such-

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Actually, you know what? I was gonna make up a lie, but why bother? We have been stealing those supplies!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: It's not like the Gerts deserve them - all they do is sit in their little camps and talk about how tasty the Watch members must be.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: So if they think they can attack us, the mighty Gylia Watch, let them try! And you, human, would do well to stay out of the way!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Hey it's you!

lines.speaker: Jitak
lines.line: Hey! Nice to see you again.

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Hey! You do not look like a gert! Get out of here before I... well, I could eat a bit...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Hey! This is Gert land! Though... I do want to eat a bit...

lines.speaker: Gert Guard
lines.line: Oh man I really want to eat... were you sent here to be my lunch?

lines.speaker: Gert Chief
lines.line: Gert! Gert! We must set up for war!

lines.speaker: Gert Chief
lines.line: Look at me.

lines.speaker: Gert Chief
lines.line: Today we fight. Today we Gerts will take down the bad town folk!

lines.speaker: Gert Chief
lines.line: But first! We must eat.

lines.speaker: Gert Chief
lines.line: Then, get your knives ready. We will take back our stuff!

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: You again?

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: This is a very... inconvenient timing for me, you see.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Gamenight is starting soon. State your issue fast, please.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: The Gerts attacking us? HAH! Funny joke.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Those pea brains can't even count to three, I doubt they can take our mighty fine establishment down.

lines.speaker: Cikal
lines.line: Now, if you excuse me. Gamenight is starting, I am needed.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: Psst! Come here, traveler.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: I want to start off by apologizing for Cikal's behaviour.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: I recently started working here and I totally believe you about the attack.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: What's weird is that the guards here don't even believe it's a possibility. It's like their brains have become all scrambled.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: I seem to be the only one with any sense left!

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: When I brought up how wrong it is for us to steal their food rations they just laughed at me like I was crazy.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: Can I ask you for a favor?

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: I'll head to Cinfras to report this to the higher ups. If you can somehow find a way to evacuate the guards here.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: They may be jerks but we can't just let them die here.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: I think you should start with the people out in the courtyard.

lines.speaker: Colry
lines.line: Ya what is it?

lines.speaker: Colry
lines.line: Right... You are that crazy adventurer Cikal talked about...

lines.speaker: Colry
lines.line: Well... I'd rather avoid any awkward situations so... please leave before I have to throw you out.

lines.speaker: Colry
lines.line: I appreciate it, boss.

lines.speaker: Colry
lines.line: Only thing that could sway me is food, hahaha! We only eat meat around here!

lines.speaker: Alie
lines.line: Huh?

lines.speaker: Alie
lines.line: Right... You are that crazy adventurer Cikal talked about...

lines.speaker: Alie
lines.line: If you don't have any meat you can ''hand'' in to the watch, please leave.

lines.speaker: Alie
lines.line: I promise we take good care of the food here.

lines.speaker: Alie
lines.line: You heard him. Give us food, or leave.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Yes?

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Oh, it's... you.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: What could you want?

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Huh?

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Why are you yelling at me?

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: And no shot I'm leaving today! We are having our daily game night tonight!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Yes. Indeed. Meaning, I'm very busy.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Every day is a party here. But you. are. not. invited!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: We here at the Gylia Watch are ready to give up our lives!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Except on Saturdays!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Now if you excuse me. I have business to attend to.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: I'm just patrolling. Someone have to look at the mountains for signs of an ambush.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Well... even though I doubt Gerts can climb...

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: The details aren't that important. I am doing my job, anyway.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Was there anything else?

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: I knew that!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Obviously...

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Oh..

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: You are very welcome.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: I appreciate your comment!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: So what's on your mind?

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: It is our duty to protect the public from the Gerts!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: If what you are saying is true, we need to stay here!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: I don't even think anyone would miss the Gerts if they were to die, hah!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: I can never say no to a snack!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: What are you thinking?

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Ooh! It sounds like you've prepared a whole feast out there.

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: Alright, deal!

lines.speaker: Bory
lines.line: I'll head outside and wait for you.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: Hey!

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: Good job on emptying the tower. I explained the situation to the Cinfras military and they followed me here.

lines.speaker: Cinfras Military
