lines.line: Good thing you came to us. There is something wrong with this place because I swear... everyone seems to go coockoo.

lines.speaker: Cinfras Military
lines.line: Either way. Due to the workers breaking the treaty we have no choice but to charge them for their crimes and fire them on the spot.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: Us three have been put in place as a replacement until further notice.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: We will also return the stolen food to the Gerts, and hopefully they can calm them down.

lines.speaker: Winie
lines.line: Your job is finished here, Wynnian. Thank you on behalf of Cinfras.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: W-Woah there, short nose! What are you doing, barging into my home?!

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Did Cinfras send you? Well, welcome to Lake Gylia! I could actually make use of some assistance.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: The magic here in this place is so potent; you can actually see the mystical properties!

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I've been a scientist for many years, but I have never seen anything like this lake.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: That's why why I set up a small laboratory and started living here to study the place. It's pretty rudimentary but it does the job done.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: The deeper into the lake you dive, the stronger the magical power becomes. I think something strange is occurring in the heart of the lake. I believe a lot of answers lie inside.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Alright, that's enough context! You see, there's another... ''scientist'' across the lake. We're kind of rivals? The guy's awful, I hate him, AND... Well...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: He's been missing.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: And while I somewhat hope he's gotten himself in trouble, he might've figured something out about the lake.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I suspect he's gone in to the heart of the lake... Come with me a moment, please.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Alright, this leads underwater where the heart is. How about you try and enter?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: ...just as I thought, you can't get in just like me. We'll need to gather more information.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Human, investigate Nikoler's house for me. It's north down the coast.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Where could he be... There's no way he found access to- Hey!

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Don't just listen to me mumbling! Have you found Nikoler?!
IMPORTANT NOTES: The map to the talisman is in the basement!! That fool Korun will never see all this coming.
If everything goes right, it should grant access to the heart of the mountain... I can't wait!

I needn't forget to input the total number of lit candles inside the house in order to get in the basement... That's why I made that tube! I'm so good at handling security!! No need for blasted overpriced Corkian equipment!
The stones should be in a few bags around here.
I actually don't know if I'm making it out of this, but I absolutely have to find out what's inside the lake.
One part of me wants to bring Korun along. As much as we hate each other, it'd surely increase our chance of survival.
And, who knows, maybe the heart of the mountain is actually perfectly safe?
Though, I mustn't forget that three of the greatest minds of our time got lost to cosmic powers...
No matter what, if you really want to join me, I left you enough clues.
See you later, Korun.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Y-you've actually found a lead?! There were clues in his basement? And you found a... talisman? This must be it, then!

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: This might very well be the key to enter the heart, especially if it was as well-guarded with cosmic creatures as you say.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Alright then! This might be too dangerous for me, so I'm entrusting this task to you once more. Enter the tunnel in my basement, and explore as much as you can!

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: If you can bring me samples of any kind, I'll try to reward you handsomely. However, if you find Nikoler alive... Please bring him back.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: As for the talisman, make sure you hold it whilst in the tunnel. Be careful, you're in uncharted territory from now on.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Good luck, human. Please bring me back Nikoler, or any sample you might find.
The drill should be ready by now... In just a little bit, I'll have single-handedly conquered the heart of the mountain..!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: A human!? W..What? Did you read the notes I left for Korun? I'll have you know that's theft!! I - you..!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Don't get any closer!! I'll destroy the path if I have to!!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: This is MY story! Don't you dare interfere!!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: You're... persistent. Are you trying to steal from these meteors I'VE found?! Do you have any idea how much research I did to get this far??

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: It's too late! I've already drilled a piece. Once I show Korun, I'll be known as the better researcher...

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Ah... how good this'll b-

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: N-no!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: No no no no no no! This CAN'T be happening!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Tampering with the meteors must be making the cave instable! I... I thought this'd happen and yet-

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: This is all YOUR fault! Why'd you have to come and make me panic? We're both DOOMED!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: No... I can't die here, I can't die now, what will he think...

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: I... We might still have a shot at escaping... And then, human, I'll report you to the authorities!!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: I'm STUCK! Urgh... No... Not like this, please, not like this...

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: You... Why? You came to get me? Not the... meteors?

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: I... Fine then. Let's make a run for it, human!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Rats! That dynamite went and backfired on us! Quick, try to run in to the rubble with me, we need to hurry!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: AH-

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Welcome back! I see you're completely drenched! How did things go? I assume you've explored the place thoroughly.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: YOU! Y-You're alive!!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: ...were you worrying about me? What a fool. This mountain could never do so much as scratch me!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: This human right here actually saved me, right after endangering me. You don't mean to tell me you sent him for me?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Well, it's very simple. Where's the fun in our rivalry if you just go off and die somewhere?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: That aside, what did you find in there? What happened?

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: I found them, Korun. I found the meteors! They still seemed potent somehow, but the cave collapsed and...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: That's... fine. We can always go back and try clearing the rubble. There's always opportunities to take a hold of. Next time, please don't just go off on your own!

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Human, you made the right choice... Without Nikoler, our efforts would have been in vain. I'll try to work with him a bit more, as it seems like the logical course of action now. Thank you.

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: H-hey! I never agreed to-

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I see you're completely drenched, so I suppose you thoroughly explored the place. How did it go?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: You found... Nothing? Really? And the meteors were too unstable to temper with?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Actually, how would you know about tempering with the- wait...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Did you find him? Please... please tell me you found him, there's no way he'd just die like that. I...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: W-what? The whole cave COLLAPSED on him? And you couldn't even save him?! N-no, it can't be your fault, I... I'm sorry.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: This is all way too much to take in for me, but I suppose you've explored and served the purpose I gave you.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Here's your reward, then. Now please, just leave me be. There's a lot I have to think about.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I don't know what I would've done without your help, human.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I could never bring myself to go on with my research if I didn't have my rival.

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: I guess neither of us won... Oh well.

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: I apologize for being bitter when we met. Your presence triggered a fierce fight or flight reaction within me!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Stop by my house once and awhile, will you? I think I'll start fishing as a hobby... I need to relax.

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Why did I... What was all that effort for...

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: What were we thinking..?

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Could I... Use the power of the meteors in order to do that..?

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Yeah... Yeah, maybe... And then-

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Especially after you... You...

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Please, just leave me alone.

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: It's you! Glad to have crossed paths again!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Since the incident, I've decided to start fishing as a hobby.

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Take this- for all I care, you can own this!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Thank you... for saving me.

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: Check up on Korun from time to time for me, will you?

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: I'm still taking a break from all the science stuff... But he definitely hasn't seen the last of me!

lines.speaker: Nikoler
lines.line: After all, I'm still the one who got to the heart of the mountain! I'm even able to sleep soundly knowing that I've won...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I see you're completely drenched! There's this odd aura around you... What happened?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: So you took the meteor shard, then you lost it, and Nikoler DIED?!

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: You... You actually found a meteor shard!! That's amazing! That's... that's... um...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: You... You managed to fail at every task I gave you. That's almost...impressive.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I... I don't want to believe he's dead. Were you CERTAIN of it??

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: What... What will I do without him..?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: S-Sorry. I'm just a little shocked is all. I do have to thank you for the shard...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: You explored thoroughly, and couldn't find a shard? Well, we still have much to discover I suppose.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Uh, what did you say j-just now? The cave collapsed and Nikoler d-died..?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: That's, um, haha... That doesn't sound right, he can't die, he can't leave like that, he can't-

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: S-Sorry. I'm just a little shocked is all. And you came back empty-handed... This was just a loss for everyone involved.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: A-at the very least, you saw this through... I have to commend you for that... I think.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Just take these, and go. I have much to think about.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: This meteor shard... I guess it's a medal of honor for my victory over Nikoler.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I just can't shake the feeling that it's all meaningless though...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I still can't thank you enough for that fragment. I hope you continue your interest in the cosmic mysteries that have landed in Gavel.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: It's over... He'll never come back...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: If only I could go back in time...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Oh... It's you... I... *hic* S-sorry, I can't really talk right now.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Get outta there...! How'd you even get in!?

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: He's gone... Nikoler's gone and I finally became the better scientist... Who cares? He's not even here to know and I...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I think I'm done with all this science stuff. Maybe I'll just go and retire somewhere... And forget about all this.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: I'm so lost... Could that human really not had saved him..? Not like it matters now...

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: A cave you say? I've heard about such a thing, but have never found it.

lines.speaker: Korun
lines.line: Keep it up, you seem to be getting close!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: ...Level 79...please.

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Aaah what am I gonna do what am I gonna do what am I gonna do what am I gonna doooo! There’s no way I can solve this...

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Wh- HUMAN! No, no, no! I don't need a demolitions service! The airship downing over my house has done that enough- Hey, wait!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: You all are a reckless lot, aren't you?! You can run through some burning wreckage, right? That isn't above your paygrade, right?! RIGHT?!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Go through my house to the wreckage! Find any survivors you can! They might...I don't know! I don't know if they'll help but it's all I can think of right now!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Go through my house to the wreckage! Find any survivors you can! They might...I don't know! I don't know if they'll help but it's all I can think of right now!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Okay Bricot, your house is a loss, but...don't panic... Don't panic. Please tell me the crew is-

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: ...urgh. I didn't want that sentence to end with DEAD! Aaagh, this is a disaster!!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: My farm's ruined, there's no good help- Hey, don't give me that look, I know what happened with Tolem!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: ...wait, that smell...that's sulphur. The airship engines don't use sulphur!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Gah, it didn't BREAK down, it got SHOT down!! Isn't the government going to DO something about all these mercenary groups?!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Wait, what am I saying, there's a human here. Okay, new favor- go to the mercenary camp to the south there and do us ALL a favor, huh? Do what you do best!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Look- I don't think I'm asking the world here, human. Just go to the mercenary camp to the south and wreck some shop! They're clearly a danger- so go on! Direct that carnage!

lines.speaker: Bricot
lines.line: Oh thank goodness it was a only a mail ship!

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: Round up, fellas! There's an uninvited guest barging in!

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: ...figures that you lot would be able to crack our defenses, huh? Alright, out with it. What do you want?

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: ...Oh, is that all? Somehow, for someone who chopped through my men like a knife through paper I'd have expected more of a demand.

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: We were hired by an anonymous benefactor to shoot down the airship. Frankly, it was a ridiculous job- could've been done far cleaner.

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: The fellow wanted the mail being transported. Said we could take anything else that was left in the ship. But shooting it down only put everything at risk!

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: All the cargo, all the correspondence, it could've easily gone up in flames. I don't think the fellow was thinking straight- they just really wanted that airship downed.

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: Didn't even notice the great big hole in the sack they put the letters in. There’s stray papers all over the ground. We have confidentiality with them, but...

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: At the same time, I've got my money, and they're an utter fool. If you want to catch them, follow the papers on the ground. I certainly won't stop you.

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: Our employer ran off with the mail, completely ignoring the fact that the mail sack had a massive hole in it.

lines.speaker: Marden
lines.line: If you want to catch them, follow the papers on the ground. I certainly won't stop you- The fool's money is as good as spent.
If you've got business with us, you can knock on our hastily-constructed barricade like a civilized person.

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Oh, dang. Almost had it that time. Maybe the flux is out of sorts- Yes, of course! Need more Squirmle Residue to deal with that...

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Quick, hand me the pliers! ...what? Yes, I know you aren't my assistant, but you've got two strong arms! Blessings of babylon! Pliers are easy to hand over, right?

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Uh, buddy? This is a paper. Yes, there's writing on it, I see that, but what does that have to do with stabilizing the flux? Come on, think!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: ...wait a second, this is my handwriting. Hey, this was supposed to be in Ahmsord two days ago! How in harbledee did you get this?

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: The ship got shot down? That's no good. Could probably...wait, the Squirmle Residue would be perfect for this! A gel-based reinforcer, the cannonballs would bounce right off!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Wait, focus on what's in front of you, Gawrick... The spell scroll isn't there...so. Hmm... Well, not to sound like a conspiracy theorist, but it might just be the work of the airliners.

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: It's a longshot, though. That scroll detailed a spell that allowed for unlimited teleportation. It could really compete with the airliner business on convenience alone!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: At the same time, though... The airship representatives control the ships. It's in the job description. Why would they shoot down the ship instead of just filching the mail?

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Well, it's a place to start! Why not talk with the airship representatives? They've got an office behind the customs desk in the airbase.

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: It wouldn't make a whole lot of sense if they were behind it, so I'd just as soon scratch it off the list. Now watch in amazement while I instantly teleport you to the office!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Juuuust as soon as I grab the pliers...er, oops! Hand slipped! Um, hands and feet INSIDE the dimensional bridge please!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Why not talk with the airship representatives, see if they know what's going on? They've got an office behind the customs desk in the airbase.

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: ...need something? The representative, huh?

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: No, it's been a while since Ernold's shown his face. He's in his office- said to not have anyone bother him.

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: So, you're out of luck. You'll probably not catch him today. Especially since he looked so frantic- when he gets like that...whoof.

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: And, please don't try and sneak in and bother him either. I got my ears boxed last time someone got by me.

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: Look- It's like I said. Representative Ernold is busy having a freakout in his office. It's a very "do not disturb" situation.

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: Please don't try and sneak in to bother him either. I got my ears boxed last time someone got by me. It was very unpleasant.

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: Look, I just don't want to get in trouble. Can you please not go in there?

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: ...come on, buddy. Why you gotta did that.

lines.speaker: Office Manager
lines.line: ...might not be my business to ask, but what's a human got business at a villager airship customs office for?

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: STUPID! SCROLL! LET GO OF MY HAND!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: Why is this activated just by shaking it?! And why’s it covered in this sticky residue?!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: Wait, it- it’s you! Garni! Help me out! This maniac’s spell scroll is forcing me to teleport!!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: I can’t grab the scroll without getting zipped away! You have to catch me and grab the scroll!!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: PLEASE! I've been stuck like this for five hours! Grab the scroll off me! I promise a pay rise if you do!!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: GWEH! You almost got it! But it's even worse now! Once more! Grab the scroll off me!!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: Urp...hrk...guhh. Th-thank you, SO much, Garni-

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: Wait! You aren’t the office manager! How did a human get in here?!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: ...oh, perfect. I’ve been rumbled, I see. Fine- at least let me say my piece here, alright? I had good reason for this!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: For one thing, Gawrick’s a damned maniac! This is clearly a danger- he’s too erratic to trust his inventions!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: For another, this was supposed to be a scroll of teleportation with no drawbacks whatsoever. Supposed to be, being the key words.

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: Do you have any idea what that would do to the airship industry? It’s a nice thought surely, but think about how many people work in this airbase alone!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: There’d be thousands jobless! I told him not to mail that scroll over, and I thought he’d listened! Then I heard him bragging in the street, and...well, I panicked.

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: I’ll admit, hiring the mercenaries to shoot down the ship was hasty of me. But that scroll can NOT be made into a public commodity! Even if it’s stable, which is ISN’T, it could ruin peoples’ livelihoods!

lines.speaker: Representative Ernold
lines.line: I’ll relinquish it to you- I can tell you’re expecting it. Maybe he’ll listen to you...oh, what am I saying. Gawrick only ever listens to those voices in his head- or whatever drives his damned insanity.

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Oh, so it WAS the airship people? What in the hell possessed them to shoot down their own ship then?!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Pah. That Ernold doesn’t know a good idea when he sees it. As though anyone REALLY enjoys the airline food!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Okay, so if I can get some squeezings from the Kanderweeds then maybe that'd work as the dairy substitute! It's just as poisonous if you're lactose intolerant anyways!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: ...huh. It activated by shaking the paper? That wasn’t supposed to happen. Did I put in too much Nimbuseeker rain...?

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Well, looks like the ink got shook right off the paper, so it's useless anyways- and the notes I'd sent with the letter are missing too. Guess it's a secret lost to the ages now, cause I can't remember how it worked now.

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Ah well. I figured out how to transmute wine into cheese while you were gone anyways, so I've got a good money making racket going anyways!

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: ....mneh. I don’t really care about a small man like him. I won’t bother with the police on this one. It technically isn't on his hands anyways, but we’ll just let him try and sleep with that on his head.

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: Hey, maybe you can help me out in another way! I had a DIFFERENT idea for teleportation scrolls anyways. Here- come upstairs if you'd try 'em out for me, wouldja?

lines.speaker: Gawrick
lines.line: If you ever want to try out more of those experimental teleport scrolls, just come on upstairs!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: Between you and me, that was the first and only trade I've managed down here this trip.

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: All the historical artifacts are being traded for things I can't even begin to afford!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: Still, can't give up hope yet. 's gotta be something I can get my hands on here! I've never walked away empty handed before!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: I can feel it in my bones- there's eon's-lost history waiting here for me!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Minerals for sale! Minerals for sale! Come get your rare metals here!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Accepting bottlecaps from all types of events! Festivals, crownings, royal weddings, ravine-jumping contests! No substitutes!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Ehm. 'Scuse me, Human? You're in the way of my barking. Don't mean to be rude, but could you move? Unless you've got a trade offer?

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: Anyone interested in Hive trophies? I’ve accumulated quite the collection from those battles! Horns, scales, bone, catalysts...

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: In exchange for these trophies, I seek the finest metals! Darksteel and Gollier Iron! Jaspilite and Voidstone! If it’s high-quality, I can find a trophy of equivalent value!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: What, you think just cause I'm not one of you Corkians I can't deal in machines- Oh. You...uh. You aren't Corkian, are ya?

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Sorry 'bout that. See, a few months ago there was this big party of Corkus idjits that came round, and they had the audacity to insult our forges!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: 'specially that bald headed, square-faced, gray-haired, legendary SPITSTAIN! Oh, I couldn't STAND that guy. So I started dealing in machines, and it's going pretty well, I'd say!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: ...oh, right. Gotta try and pawn some 'a this stuff. I got some rarities in my stock, but mostly I'm lookin' to get some machinery. If ya find any, I'll see what I can offer ya, aight?

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: Ardent Magma Crystals for sale! Pure, 100%! Accept no substitutes, unless you're paying in emeralds, in which case substitute...a lot of them!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: Specifically, 200,000 Liquid Emeralds! I'll be here all day and all night, selling Ardent Magma Crystals for a mere 200,000 Liquid Emeralds each!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: It's hot work, making these genuine Ardent Magma Crystals! Dirty work for a clean product! 200,000 Liquid Emeralds, and we're running an 80% off sale this week!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: Hot work! Sweaty work! Taxing work for only the MIGHTIEST of souls! Truly a BRAVE endeavour! A man's challenge! Ardent Magma Crystals! Only 200,000 Liquid Emeralds!

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...wartime artifacts for sale.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...anything from the corruption war, human?

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...Won’t take emeralds for things like these. Sorry.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...oh, Mastro...

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: Ugh! NO SALES! None! Not now! Stupid Dohstaj!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: Quit fawning over Mastro already! I’ve got an artifact for you! But you just! Won’t! Take it!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: I SAID no sales! Get out of here!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: Ah, hey there, human! I'm certain you've noticed the bazaar down here. It's a point of pride for the Dwarves- biggest marketplace of all the Dwarf cities!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: Specialty items you can't find anywhere else- All sorts of strange, wonderful, unique things. I've been looking for a few sundry items myself here.

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: It's almost all barter, unlike the merchants above that deal in shiny stuff. Which is...a little unfortunate for me, in a way.

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: You see, I'm a historian by trade, but what I'm really after right now is some Troll Hair. See, I really like the sme- er. It's good and sturdy for binding books- wait a second!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: YOU have some? Phenomenal! I can never get it myself- was never much of a fighter. Um, here! Let me trade you that, for...this!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: A Decorative Bottlecap Set! These were hard to come by, but I've got two sets of them anyways. Check them out! You'll learn a lot. Thank you very much, by the way!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Minerals for sale! Minerals for sale! Come get your rare metals! We've got Kanderstone, Wynnic Copper, genuine Almuj Sandstone, real Voidstone from the Sky Islands!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Human, you there! If you're interested in smithing, you've found the right place! ...so long as you like drinking Dwarven drinks. I'm looking for bottlecap sets in exchange for these.

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: What's that look for? Are you new here or something? Never seen a bottlecap collector before? Or is that just your face?

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Wh- That! That's! I! How did you! It...It's in pristine condition! There's not a single cap missing! There's not even any dents from the bottle openers!!!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: There's no way you got those in person! You can't possibly understand the significance of what you're holding!! I! NEED! THEM!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Here! My rarest metal! Take them! Take them and give me those bottlecaps! I've got to complete my collection!! Give it! Give it! Give it give it give it give it NOW!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: ...er. Ahem. I got carried away there. But...those bottlecaps are from the very first Dogun Festival. It wasn't even held in Courag at the time these were made!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: I'd love to talk about them more, but I can't spend too long on the sale, or other customers might go away. But you got a good deal with that Jaspilite I gave you!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Come to think of it, some guy wanted that stuff, but he didn't even have a plain ol' sodapop cap on him! I think he's right close by. Maybe you'd have some interest in what he's selling instead.

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: Hm...a human trader? Well, I've heard of you, but I hope it isn't just the standard fare from you.

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: Yes, I've seen quite a few of your type to this bazaar- Using the community forges and smithing tables and all. You all seem to have metals in bulk...

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: ...but probably ninety-eight out of a hundred of the metal ingots I've seen humans use have been trash quality! Worthless only for practice! I seek only the finest metals, you see.

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: ...so, of course, you have to prove me wrong by having MOLTEN JASPILITE?! Oh, you must've gotten that from Dobile. Wouldn't have taken you as a bottlecap collector!

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: I've been pestering him for awhile about his stock. The metal of the Unseen Blade is incredibly valuable, you see. It’s fragile, yes...

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: ...but to wield it is to channel the power of Ockar the Unseen Blade himself! The wartime taskmaster who cowed a hundred demons with a mere dagger!

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: Sneaking behind the lines of the enemy, braving blistering heat! Remaining as a shadow, and cutting through sheer earth and magma without flinching!!

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: ...erm, yes. Anyways! For that, I can give you nothing less than my rarest stock. A Golemlus Power Core. If Qira found out I had this, I'd be worse off than a dead man.

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: She keeps the secrets of those creatures under lock and key- and it must the ticket to unlocking that particular mystery. Treasure this, human! It is no mere Corkian battery.

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Aight chief, what can I do ya for? I got all kinds'a machines here. One of em's gotta catch your eye, y'hear?

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: I jury-rigged this juicer! Put a lemon inside, give it some, heheh, juice, and you'll get yourself lemon juice in a jiff!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Or how 'bout this coin-shooter? Turn the crank and this'll spit out any coin-sized object like nobody's business! Just, uh, don't aim it at any windows, unless you really hate that window.

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: ...what? Oh, I see. You think you got somethin' that'll interest ME instead of the other way round, I gotcha. Well, lemme see it a sec.

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: ...okay, I can't make heads or tails 'a this thing. What'd you say it was again? Don't tell me this is some Corkus gadget from that not-so-Legendary island!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: ...a... A Golemlus Power Core...? This...hot DOG! Yahaaah, I'd heard about those wacko golem thingies ages ago, I always wanted to take 'em apart! Aw hell but this is an opportunity!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Gotta say, for something that came from that Hive it's a lot less purple and black and spidery-all-over than I expected. The complexity...this has gotta be the real deal, but...

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Feels like someone else made this. That Qira lady doesn't seem like the handsy type, and this is somethin' like 85% mechanics, 15% magic. Just seems out of character.

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Ah, but I'm gettin' away from myself. Tell ya what- prob'ly went through a lotta trouble ta get this, and that means you got guts. You got bravery. You got STONES, human!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: So, how 'bout these Ice Drake Scales then? It fits a brave soul like you, it does! Take 'em with pride, there!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: Ardent Magma Crystals for sale! Pure, 100%! Accept no substitutes, unless you're paying in emeralds, in which case kindly substitute...a lot of them!!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: Human! You have a keen eye for prices and values! I can tell by that glint in your eye- a real MAN's spirit! Even if you aren't a man, your spirit shines all the same as a man...!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: A SALES MAN! YES! Macho and brave! Chiseled and strong! Strong enough to carry 200,000 Liquid Emeralds to trade for this brilliant Ardent Magma Crystal!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: ...but hold on a moment. Hold on just one moment. Do I detect...a vein of ICE in that manly aura? A chill, pushing against that spirit of market machismo?

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: YES, I DO! Human, you have Ice Drake Scales! I needn't see them to be sure! I was right about you from the start- Such burning passion!!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: AND SUCH NAIVETE! Let me strengthen your MIND! Ice Drake Scales are indicative of a great challenge having been overcome! A truly macho trophy of accomplishment!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: To tame Ice Drakes required UNBREAKABLE will! To overcome the sheerest cold with MACHO HEAT! And to outshine demons of lava and flame with that same determination! Those scales represent such resilience!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: And yet...I must wonder. Such a fiery spirit you have- THOSE SCALES HOLD YOU BACK! Your spirit cannot be contained in such a manner!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: DISRESPECT YOURSELF NO LONGER! I DEMAND YOU HAND OVER THOSE SCALES! But you will not leave empty-handed, no no, friend!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: You have ignited my passion as a salesman, so I shall present you one of my own greatest accomplishments! For a spirit so WHITE HOT, only an ARDENT MAGMA CRYSTAL is fitting!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: YES! Your soul shines brighter than the shimmer of EIGHT-HUNDRED-MILLION EMERALDS! Forever may your spirit BURN, human!

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...you have good money on you.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...I heard Mastro shouting. He’s...so passionate.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...he’s married to his work. Would I were his.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...but business first. Wartime artifacts for sale.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...priciest thing is a Dogun Flameshooter. Practically invaluable. You want it?

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...good doing business.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...sigh. What a man he is...

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: I can’t stand this. I can’t stand this! SHUT UP, MASTRO! NO ONE CARES ABOUT YOUR SWEATY SPIRIT OR WHATEVER!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: MY MACHISMO CANNOT BE CONTAINED! Your aversion only inspires my salesman’s spirit! Ardent Magma Crystals! Pure, 100% gold! 200,000 Liquid Emeralds, 80% off! STRONG bargains!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: AAAGH! Stupid, stupid, stupid Dohstaj! I just need him to fork over that stupid Flameshooter and then I can get away from this tripe but he just! Won’t! DO IT!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: No, look, human! Can’t you see the kind of stress I’m under?! I don’t care about your Flameshooter, I need to get my hands on Dohstaj’s Flameshooter!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: ...wait. Wait wait wait that’s Dohstaj’s Flameshooter how in the world did you get it what what WHAT! How did you snap him out of his...emotions?!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: I’ve been trying to get hold of that for a week straight! I already have the perfect trade lined up! Please, hear me out!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: I have here the Scepter of Draani Thunderwill I! Dohstaj only WISHES he could salvage something this juicy! The real, honest-to-goodness staff of the Wartime King!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: A war relic for a war relic. It’s only a fair trade! Just be real careful- a thief’s been skulking in the yellow stall by the bank trying to steal it from me.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: ...so. I saw you talking with Syni.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: Pfft. Thief? I’m an honest man. Just following in old footsteps.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: I know you have the Scepter. I’d have thumped you and taken it if you were a Dwarf.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: But how 'bout we work out a deal, instead? Take this tablet.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: It'll explain everything. Dwarven History...if you can read it. I can. Won't let loose my secrets for free though.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: Hand over the scepter, and I'll hand over the tablet.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: I won't translate it for you, but I'm sure there's some egghead who'll get back to you on what it means in...ten years or so.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: Good things come to those who wait for others to do the work for 'em, as they say.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: Oh, what I want to do with the scepter?

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: Gotta keep some secrets, right? Keep people guessing.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: No fun otherwise. Now get out. I've got some people to call up.

lines.speaker: Yobon
lines.line: Get out.

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: Well, you've been busy, I see! You've been working this bazaar like a champion!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: I ought to tell my friends up at the topside shops- they really respect traders who know their way around a deal. You should be able to buy and use more items from the armories!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: I...haven't had such luck unfortunately. I think you might've picked the place clean, eheh. Don't suppose you've got one last deal up your sleeve, huh?

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: Oh, really? Hah, I was just joking about that, but if you really do have an offer, go ahead and lay it on me!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: Oh.

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: My.

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: HELL.

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: THAT'S ANCIENT HISTORY! FORMATIVE ANCIENT HISTORY!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: I recognize those runes, they're ancient Dwarven glyphs! This is slab number three! We already have the first, second, and fourth tablets, my team and I- this would finish the collection!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: I! I! I! Take! TAKE EVERYTHING! EVERYTHING I HAVE! TAKE IT ALL, I NEED THAT! I NEED TO DISCOVER THOSE ANCIENT SECRETS!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: AH! AHAHAHAHA! THE HISTORY! THE STORIES! THE EVERYTHING! IT'S BETTER THAN THE SMELL OF TROLL HAIR! AHAHAHAAAHAHHAHAHAAAAAH!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: YES! HISTORY! I CAN FEEL THE EONS!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: I'M GONNA FLY, PAPA! FLY ON THE WINGS OF TIME!

lines.speaker: Nakoba
lines.line: DWARVEN HISTORY WILL BE REVOLUTIONIZED!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Oh, you really are interested in hearing about those bottlecaps, huh? Well! Sit down there, fella! These have a STORY behind 'em.

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: See, almost all our drinks come in bottles. Bottles are just too useful, compared to cups or mugs. Good for improvised weapons, and so reusable!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: These bottlecaps were the first specialty ones made in Dwarven history! Someone got the idea, since the Dogun festival was a big event, to make decorative bottlecaps.

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: Each one tells some of the story of the Dogun war on it, or some war trivia! See, this one tells you Delinaed the Wise’s favorite book.

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: It became a fad, then a tradition- practically every big Dwarven event has specialty bottlecaps made to commemorate it now. Collectors like me have our work cut out for us!

lines.speaker: Dobile
lines.line: So hey, if you ever go to a big Dwarven event, buy some drinks! Save up those caps- they're worth a hundred times their weight in emeralds, in terms of historical value!

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: Oh, I see that look in your eyes. That curiosity. You want me to unravel a mystery for you! Well, I can tell you this much...

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: If I'm being honest, Jaspilite isn't much good for weaponry. It's more of a good-luck charm than anything- I plan to stud a blade with this instead of using it for the base.

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: That just makes Ockar’s success in the chaos of wartime with his Jaspilite blade even more astounding. That's why it's so valuable.

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: It's almost like if that hero you have...what was his name, John? Bob? Joe? I can't quite recall, the name, but it's something like that...

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: It's like if he carved a good-quality training blade out of some vaguely rare, but otherwise mundane wood and used it to defend the citadels for decades.

lines.speaker: Dorroc
lines.line: The wood itself is just wood...but it was used by a hero, so it must be special, yes? So Jaspilite is well sought-after. I once again thank you for liberating it from that stubborn bottlecap man.

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: This core machine's gonna be a better challenge to figure out than ANY of that smarmy idiot's "legendary mechs," hah!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: ...hm? Oh, 's you again! Suppose ya heard me and my little grudge, huh? Yeah. I forget if I told ya this or not, but a few months ago there was a group from Corkus here.

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Hoity-toity lot, they were. Got me into machinery though, even if it was just outta spite. Might not've heard about many Dwarven mages, but they exist!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Electromagic comes nice an' natural to me, so I've started riggin' up these machines. It's kinda funny you brought me somethin' from that Hive, too.

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: They stopped by here on their way to the Hive, those Corkus idjits. Somethin' about a sponsorship to go see Qira of all people!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: An'! The best part! The idiot came back with a crumpled wrist and this HORRIFIED look- Musta gotten on the Hive witch's bad side!

lines.speaker: Lodog
lines.line: Heheheh, he got what was comin' to 'im! Serves 'em all right for bein' so high-and-mighty when they ain't even provincially recognized!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: MY EYES STING FROM THE HEAT OF YOUR DETERMINATION! Yes! Such passion flowing from you, now that you've experienced a treasure of EQUAL HEAT!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: It's only right you learn more! My PRIDE! My SWEAT! My MUSCLED MIGHT! My WAY OF LIFE- Ardent Magma Crystals!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: Gold makes the world turn! But nearly every piece of gold you see- is impure! There are imperfections in it, no matter how brilliant the luster!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: But through HARD WORK! EXTREME HEAT! RIGHTEOUS SMITHING SKILL! It can be purified to shine like it was ALWAYS meant to! Shine like your SOUL!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: The process is only for the STRONG! It takes months upon months of work- single mistakes can destroy the gold! But nothing worth doing in life is easy!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: TRUE MEN will not give up! To be a man requires nothing of the body- it only requires a BLAZING SPIRIT! A weak body can be HONED! An impure metal can be PURIFIED!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: Ardent Magma Crystals are the PUREST of gold! I have perfected my craft- each one takes a season’s worth of time, but such patience only practices my own PASSION!

lines.speaker: Mastro
lines.line: And with my gift to you, we are truly BOUND by our spirits, however fleetingly! Carry yourself with grace, friend- and with POWER! HEAT! SWEAT! AND TEARS OF FLAME!!!

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...you again? Something up?

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...you know...I feel...passionate. Let me talk for a bit.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: Flameshooters... Dogun weapons. Real common to find. But they’re just hilts with buttons on them.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: They shoot out flames like a blade... It’s been millenia since they were made.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...almost impossible to repair, too. You’d need Dogun magic. And Doguns are gone, mostly.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...but almost impossible means it can be done. I found it broken, and fixed it myself.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...oh, Mastro... He’s my inspiration. Spends his life making those crystals... Does the impossible on a regular basis.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...I’ve done it once. Just can’t compete.

lines.speaker: Dohstaj
lines.line: ...least I’ve got a little bit of him now.

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: Finally, I can pack my things up and leave! I just need to endure this macho insanity til then... Thank you, human, for freeing me from this hell!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: Though...suppose you wouldn’t know the history behind that staff, would you...I can pack and talk at the same time, why not.

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: That staff belonged to the Dwarven king, Draani Thunderwill I. He started the colonization efforts in the Molten Heights, you see.

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: He led the war efforts against the demons that crawled from the stone- the ones that used the very same weapon that you so graciously provided me, as a matter of fact!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: That staff was presumed lost in the great battle against the demon god, Garaheth...but I found it! It was snapped into something like ten pieces...

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: That thing took me four years to repair. It’s good as new now- it can even channel lightning just like the legends. An effort well worth the trouble!

lines.speaker: Syni
lines.line: But the Dogun magic fascinates me- I’ve got to figure out how those Flameshooters work! I’ll bet I can reverse-engineer them, I just need a working model...and now I have it!

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: I see another challenger has found their way to The Qira Hive!

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: I can't say I am overwhelmed by your appearance. Here, the birth of many powerful and magical monsters take place.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Gavel's governments can not stop Mistress Qira. I doubt you can either.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: If you want to meet her, you will have to defeat each division of her army.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Although powerful, she is not without honour. After every floor you complete, you will receive a token for a reward from the shop. Good luck, adventurer-
Excuse me, but aren't you forgetting some things, Yansur?

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Wh- Oh, Mistress, am I? My apologies...

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: You will be disciplined later...fine. Consider yourself honoured to have even a moment of my time, adventurer. Allow me to explain in further detail, my glorious Hive.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: As Yansur explained, if you wish audience with me, you must prove yourself worthy of my presence by defeating each division of my personal army.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: It consists of five main divisions, each one based around a particular element. Thunder, Air, Earth, and so on. Clearing one will unlock the next for you to face.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: To pass a floor of the division, defeat my forces and put the catalysts they drop into the collector. You will need five catalysts to pass a floor.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: After nine floors of normal troops, you will face a Division Leader. These exceptionally powerful members of my army will be fought alone, and you will only need one catalyst from them to pass.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: The Thunder Division will be your first challenge. I do hope you will be entertaining to watch...

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Begin, the Thunder Division! Strike quickly and move on, for those within will warp your very mind should you stray for too long!
Heeheehahaaaah! I see you! You humans have such easily influenced minds, but I'll settle for beating you within an inch of your life! Come through, come through!!!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: HAAAHAHAHAAH! Idiot! I'm over HERE!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: This is your punishment for thinking you had the right to attack me so!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: You ten-ton drip! Can't even keep track of a single target, hehehahaaaah!!!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: Now, stand still for me, would you? Or keep running! Whichever works for me, heehehahahaaah!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: Look behind you! Hahaah! Nothing there?! Your mind's playing tricks on you!!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: You can't even track me! Face it, human, your brain's too worthless to beat me...so give it up to me, instead!!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: Feh, you're no fun, you little cheater! I was supposed to beat you, not the other way around!

lines.speaker: Psychomancer
lines.line: I hate you so much. Just get out and talk to that idiot servant already!!

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: You have completed the Thunder floor? How surprising. They were some of Mistress Qira's earliest successes.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: How was your first taste of the Hive? Your battle against the Psychomancer was quite the spectacle to behold, ahaha...

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: I agree, Mistress. As promised, here is a Thunder Voucher.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Take it to the shop to claim your prize. It is located at the base of the Hive. The servant there will have important information for you regarding your prizes.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: I doubt you are still worth Mistress's time, however. She has much to tend to here, as you might guess.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: She made a deal with Gavel's people long ago, after they foolishly attempted to lay siege to our Hive.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: She could continue her unethical and possibly evil work...and in return, she would allow the people of Gavel to remain undisturbed by her.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Next you must tackle the Air division, featuring some of her tougher creations.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Begin, the Air Division! Fight freely with the wind, for the coming storm shall claim you for my own if you cannot spread your wings here!
Well, nice work getting this far! Don't tell anyone, but I'm gonna pull my punches here, okay? I'm rooting for you, so let's have fun with this! Come on through!

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: Haha, look out below! Dropping some bombs on ya!

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: Bombaaaardmeeeent!! Better get moving!

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: Eyes on the skies down there! INCOMING!

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: What a rush, huh? Let's keep up the pace!

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: It's a fight to the finish, but we can have fun with it, right?

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: Woo! Betcha didn't even see me rush by, huh?

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: Whoa, you're really keeping up! Maybe it's time for me to cut loose a little bit!

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: Heehee, maybe I didn't need to hold back after all? You did really, really well!

lines.speaker: Gale
lines.line: A lot of people say I'm the roughest we have to offer, so you've got this!  I'm sorry you have to go talk to Yansur of all people now, though.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Hrm, perhaps we have underestimated you. The creations of Air have defeated thousands, particularly-

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Hush, Yansur. Not a word about her.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: ...yes. Here is the promised Air Voucher.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: The shop has your reward prepared. If you have not talked to the servant at the shop, do so next you go there.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: You still have a long way to go. It is not easy to gain an audience with Mistress Qira.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Your next objective is to clear the Earth Division. Some of the most powerful, raw creatures ever hatched.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Begin, the Earth Division! You must withstand both sheer force and deadly toxins! Be quick on your feet, or you will return to the dust of the earth!
Seems you can move on... All you hear is a bloodcurdling roar. What lies ahead...?

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Creatures of the earth were not enough for you... Mistress's most rawly powerful... Destroyed.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Managed to defeat Genesis, hm? It is normally the end of most... Interesting.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Well, here is your Earth Voucher.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: It is impressive to see how far you have come. Many have failed at this point.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: It is of no consequence, however, for the Water division is your next challenge. I am sure you will not succeed.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Begin, the Water Division! If you will not withstand the crashing waves, the creatures that lurk within shall ensure you never emerge from the abyss!
[1/1] :????: You have been judged worthy enough to face me in combat. However, I know your strength, and I do not believe it enough to defeat me. Come forth now. Make your attempt to prove me wrong.

lines.speaker: Oceanic Judge
lines.line: The ocean winds shall claim you in this bout.

lines.speaker: Oceanic Judge
lines.line: The winds intensify... Do you fear the storm?

lines.speaker: Oceanic Judge
lines.line: You have decent skill, I will admit. But the seas will claim all!

lines.speaker: Oceanic Judge
lines.line: These distractions belie my true power. Behold, and kneel before the law of the Hive!

lines.speaker: Oceanic Judge
lines.line: Seems my judgment was incorrect. In this case, however, it is refreshing to see.

lines.speaker: Oceanic Judge
lines.line: Continue forwards, honourable human. Perhaps your intellect and respect will rub off on that insufferable Yansur.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Impossible. Not even the most tactically advanced monsters could defeat you.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: I must admit I am impressed; the Judge is ruthless... perhaps he needs further tweaking?

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: ... Here's the Water Voucher you're expecting.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: The shop has your reward prepared. If you have not talked to the servant at the shop, do so next you go there.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: We are intrigued by your determination... But we are not worried. We do not expect you to make it past the next floor.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Now you must face some of the toughest creatures of Mistress Qira's imagination!

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: You must now face the division of Fire, and it will be sure to burn you.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Begin, the Fire Division! Summon your courage, and brave the heat of the volcanoes and stars for my amusement, else burn to cinders and blow away in the breeze!
Impressive, making it this far. I am your final test. Let us fight fairly, then. An honourable end to your challenge is only fitting, whether that be triumph or defeat. Come forward and face me.

lines.speaker: Solar Vanguard
lines.line: Now, you will burn away before me.

lines.speaker: Solar Vanguard
lines.line: The zeal of the sun cannot be curbed.

lines.speaker: Solar Vanguard
lines.line: That is enough- Fall!

lines.speaker: Solar Vanguard
lines.line: Hm. It seems I will need to pick up the pace.

lines.speaker: Solar Vanguard
lines.line: You fight well. We shall see if you can adapt to this.

lines.speaker: Solar Vanguard
lines.line: Defeat feels strange, after so long. You fought valiantly, and with great zeal, however. It would be a lie to say I am disappointed.

lines.speaker: Solar Vanguard
lines.line: All that is left is to talk to Mistress's servant, and claim your final prize. Surely he will not be as great an obstacle as I was.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: This is unprecedented. You have defeated some of the most recent and powerful creations.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Even downed the Vanguard...? My word...

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Here you are then, the Fire Voucher!

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: The shop has your reward prepared. If you have not talked to the servant at the shop, do so next you go there.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: This is unorthodox, as few have made it this far. But I suppose this means that you have earned an audience with-

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Allow me to stop you there, Yansur. I wish to make an exception for this challenger.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: You have intrigued me, adventurer...and I want to put you to the truest test.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Hah! Incredible! Mistress wishes to battle you herself! You astound me.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Be warned, however. This will be your toughest battle yet. Mistress Qira is the most feared being in Gavel.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: You will die...but consider it the greatest honour to die by her hand.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: I await you in my chambers...

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: So, you've arrived. You have proven yourself very capable... I am looking forward to this bout! Let's dance, mortal!!

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Many have made it this far. None have succeeded- not against me.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Oh? You look surprised! Is it a wonder that the creator may be able to use powers of those she has created?

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Yes, I am responsible for the state of all those who fight in this Hive. Wondrous, is it not?

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: That is a minute and a half you have survived in this battle. So many have failed by this point. You look promising, then...

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Endurance is not enough to best me, however... I am certain you are aware of this.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: So let us see if you can break me down. Take the first step in this waltz of the damned.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: What shall be the end of you here? Myself, or my wonderful little creations?

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Go on, Wynn warrior! Dance for me!

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: Come now, pick up the pace. We are here to battle, not participate in a marathon.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: ...you. You...ahaha...I like you. You're capable enough... Perhaps we could be allies in the future...

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: How cowardly! After defeating so many in the Hive, and receiving such praise, you've the gall to upstand Mistress's request?

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: I had begun to think highly of you, but after such a disgusting display-

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: They defeated me, Yansur.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Wha...that- No, that can't possibly be correct, you are-

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: You question your mistress? I have nothing to gain from lying to you about this. And there is no shame in admitting defeat.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: ...Masterful...Have we been cooped up in this Hive so long that our army is outdated?

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: To be defeated by a human of Wynn... I am not sure whether to be disappointed or amazed. Our ultimate challenge has been bested.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: It is simply a testament to their strength. I will prepare a special reward for them to mark the occasion.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Here is your voucher, then. The back room in the shop will have your rewards. If you still have not talked to the servant at the shop...well. You should know by now.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Mistress...if I may tell the tale? She was once called upon to help stop the decay of the forest.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: With her boundless knowledge and magic, she surely could have cured it. But she declined.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: She instead chose to create, obsessed with preparing for some sort of war.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Mistress never elaborated, but it seems like she knows something we don't.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: It is as I have always told you. The darkness is coming...but if you Wynn folk are all as strong as you have proven yourself to be, we may just be able to beat it back. Honour to you, warrior of Wynn.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: You have already bested Mistress Qira, the strongest being in all Gavel. Do you seek to further boost your ego? We have nothing more to offer you here.

lines.speaker: Qira
lines.line: I have told you in the past, Yansur. There is no "we" in this operation, you are a peon! One who will reign in his inflated ego immediately. Understood?

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: ...yes, Mistress.

lines.speaker: Yansur
lines.line: Come back when you are level 80. We will not accept applicants of the challenge who are not thoroughly prepared.
You are not worth my time to see. What could a peon such as you possibly hope to request? Prove yourself worthy...and then we will see what I may do for you.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Welcome, traveller, to The Qira Hive. I am a humble servant of Mistress Qira. My job is to inform challengers of the Hive challenge of how your prizes work.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: If you should prove yourself strong enough to fight through a division of Mistress' Hive, you will receive a voucher, which you may redeem here for a single prize.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Depending on the division you have cleared, you may redeem your voucher for different prizes, and you may exchange a prize for another voucher within this Hive Exchange.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: However, of note about the prizes. Their elemental energies are strong enough that you cannot use more than one of the same division's prizes at once.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Using two of the same elemented prize has a strange magical backlash... Your abilities will be completely nullified and you will be rendered helpless.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: For instance, you could not wear two Thunder Division prizes at once, however you could wear a Thunder Division and Air Division prize together safely.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: I will be here if you should ever need this explanation again. I wish you luck, should you choose to challenge her glorious Hive.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Welcome, champion, back to The Qira Hive. I must congratulate you on your momentous victory.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: It is not often that one should defeat our Mistress... But it is not my job to commend you. It is my job to inform you of your rewards.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: You may redeem the vouchers you have won for different prizes, and you may exchange a prize for another voucher within this Hive Exchange.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: However, the elemental energies of these items are strong enough that you cannot use more than one of the same division's prizes at once.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: I will be here if you should ever need this explanation again. I wish you luck in your future endeavours, champion of the Hive.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Oh? I didn't know that Qi- er, Mistress... That Mistress allowed travellers or challengers into the servant's quarters now.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: I suppose you could make yourself at home. It's a little dingy, but I guess you get used to it after a while. I'm new here...

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Though, don't take that to mean I'm complaining. It isn't like I had anywhere else to go, after all. I used to be just a beggar.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Hardly had an emerald to my name. It's so weird to think that money doesn't matter to me anymore, now that I'm here!

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: So long as we stay loyal to Mistress and do what we're told, we have a roof over our heads, a cozy room, food and drink, and an opportunity.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: We're able to be a part of something so much greater. People say she's evil and the rumors always fly like mad, but... I have to wonder sometimes.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Ah... Well, hello there. You look like a challenger, or at least someone who could be gearing up to take on the Hive Challenge.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: There've been a lot of challengers coming in recently. Mistress Qira has really tried to accommodate for the increased numbers, too.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: I got plucked up off the street to come be a smithy here. I help to make some of the prizes you can get for progressing in the challenge.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: I... Sometimes, I think about my family. At the very least, Mistress Qira allowed me to keep the portrait I'd gotten painted of us.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: I wonder how little Jula is growing up. It's been at least ten years, so she's probably like a whole new person now. But a father... A father never forgets his child.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Ah, the scuttlers are busy today. Welcome, deary. Here to try your luck at our Hive?

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Yes, I know your type. Bright-eyed, bushy-tailed, packing seven tons of armour. Was born here, after all.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: In my old age, I'm not useful for anything. Can't complete tasks more taxing than reading and writing, yet Mistress lets me stay.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: I enjoy watching the drones and buggies from this balcony, and sometimes challengers will fight them. I hear it really sharpens the combat instincts!

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: What? Hey, why aren't you in uniform, are you that new girl? No, can't be, your nose is too tiny. A challenger, maybe?

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Or has "Her Mistress-ship, high and mighty" started dragging in humans of all things to be her pack mules? Don't know why else you'd be here.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: Better get used to this, small-nose. This is your life now. Find someone who'll loan you a uniform 'til you get your own.

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: If you get caught outside of your pre-ordained clothes, you're gonna get punished. As though a dress code is needed in a place like this!!

lines.speaker: Hive Servant
lines.line: "It protects you from magic" my backside! The great hag above just wants us quiet and subdued so she can feel powerful, I'll bet.

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: ...snrrrk... ... ... ...mimimimimi... ... ... ...snrrrk... ... ... ...mimimimimi...

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: ...snrrrk... ...mrrf. ...five more minnns... ...snrrrk...

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: ...wh...? Oh...OH! Oh oh oh! Ahem! Yes, um! Absolutely sir! Right away sir! I don't think you're crazy at all sir!

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: ...oh. Wait, you're just one of those heavily armored human types. Cripes, I thought you were Lecade... Even nuts as he's gotten I'd get the thumbscrews if he caught me napping.

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: Hum...well, hey. You humans like doing work, right? I hear about it from folks in the army that you lot are pretty zealous about your favors.

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: Then I think today might be your lucky day, because General Lecade is running out of free hands to push asinine tasks onto. No one knows what in the world's gotten into him.

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: Between you and me, I'm using this time to work on sleep instead. I mean, honestly! He wants me to dance with the other privates to greet visitors! We don't even ALLOW visitors normally.

lines.speaker: Private Tylas
lines.line: So if you want to eat up a few hours, talk with Lecade. Up the hill and into the barracks. I'm going to try and do my actual guard duty here instead of doing the funky Grook.

lines.speaker: Tylas
lines.line: *yawn* ...look, we don't accept visitors in the barracks here. Not even if you were Level 80 like me.

lines.speaker: Tylas
lines.line: Lecade is up the hill and into the barracks. If he asks, tell him I greeted you with a squat-kick dance or something.

lines.speaker: Tylas
lines.line: ...snrrrk... ... ... ...mimimimimi... ... ... ...snrrrk... ... ... ...mimimimimi...

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.line: I have to dig this hole with only my feet. It's quite odd I admit, but I have faith in our general!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.line: The General being back to normal is nice and all, but I dug my feet in to the hole and now I'm stuck!

lines.speaker: Bartender
lines.line: Here for some whiskey? Or maybe you'd like a flower. Gahaha, just pullin' your leg.

lines.speaker: Bartender
lines.line: That general up in the fort told me to replace my bar with some of these flowers, so I had to oblige.

lines.speaker: Bartender
lines.line: Don't have much spare water in house, so I guess I'll be using booze to water 'em.

lines.speaker: Barkeeper
lines.line: Well I'll be, the soldier's crossing the tightrope.

lines.speaker: Bartender
lines.line: Well well, looks like the general's back to normal. Same time though...the flowers are actually growin' pretty well like this. Think I'll keep 'em.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: This is so exhausting... I haven't gotten any orders to stop yet...

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: Hey, do you know what a “Springy” is? The General asked me to install them down the south hallway there.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: I had no clue, so I just purchased some trampolines instead. It, uh, should be close enough, I hope?

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: Well I'm glad this is all over, but I see no harm in keeping the Springy-

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: Er, I mean, keeping the trampolines.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: So excited to start my new job here! I don't understand why diving in to a pond is a part of the inauguration though.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: The General is so nice for installing a diving board for us new recruits! Seems kind of odd to have in a fortress though.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: Why...

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: do...

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: we...

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: hafta...

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: do...

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: this!?

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: I'm currently on a mission I set myself to make elaborate pottery.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: It's quite relaxing, and Lecade conceded and gave me the go ahead.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: Speaking of, I happen to be short on clay; There's some in that cave east of here, if you happen to come by it I'll pay you some.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: That general is out of his mind... He has me on a mission to make elaborate pottery.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: No good reason for why, although it's quite relaxing I will admit. Won't see me complaining.

lines.speaker: Private
lines.line: Some clay I see! I'll take that off of you. Not without compensation of course!

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: My duty is to help extend the aqueduct, but the issue with that is we're just making it one giant loop! The general says it's for quick traversal, who's gonna crawl through a sewer for that?

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: Well, we finally finished connecting up this aqueduct. Although, I guess I never really had to do this, since a shape-shifter gave me the order.

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: This is just insane. My task was to make a doorway here, but this tower is just filled with some really dark material! Where is it supposed to lead!?

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: I've been trying to dig through this stuff... It's so dark I simply can't tell what I'm doing...

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: Can't...

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: talk..!

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: Following...

lines.speaker: Sergeant
lines.line: orders..!

lines.speaker: Advisor
lines.line: My, what an odd task to give to the chief advisor of the general...

lines.speaker: Advisor
lines.line: You see, human, I was told to dig an extension to the sewer with my own hands.

lines.speaker: Advisor
lines.line: And at that, it's supposed to just loop right around back in to the pipe.

lines.speaker: Advisor
lines.line: I think the General is starting to snap under the stress. If you need to return to the fort, just follow along.

lines.speaker: Advisor
lines.line: I think they might actually make it across...

lines.speaker: Rescuer
lines.line: WOOO!! Finally! Someone to help- Hey, look over here!!

lines.speaker: Rescuer
lines.line: Gosh, what a stroke of luck! I finally beat the Bantisu monks to one of you lost fellas!

lines.speaker: Rescuer
lines.line: I'm here searching for soldiers lost in the canyon, you're the first person I've found!

lines.speaker: Rescuer
lines.line: This propeller hat is great, by the way. At first it seemed sort of silly, but it works a treat, and it’s real fun, too!

lines.speaker: Rescuer
lines.line: That aside, just stand under me, and I'll lift you down! Come on now!

lines.speaker: Rescuer
lines.line: Here we go!

lines.speaker: Rescuer
lines.line: There you go, fella! It's back to the skies for me! Best orders ever!! WOOO!!

lines.speaker: Scarecrow?
lines.line: What's this about a general? Look, I'm just trying to scare away crows...

lines.speaker: Scarecrow?
lines.line: Hey! Shhh. I'm trying to pose as a scarecrow, and if you're around those crows will know I'm real!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: Urgh, time machine. TIME MACHINE! The man’s gone mad, I tell you. I don’t know the first thing about machinery, let alone of this caliber!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: Why would he even need a time machine?! It isn’t like he hadn’t got oodles of it, what with him sitting at his desk doing nothing anymore!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: I’m doing what I can, because far be it from me to disobey orders, but I’m certain this scrap heap is nothing but a ticking time bomb...

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: Gah, what in blazes are you thinking, Lecade?! First this confounded contraption, then...grumble, grumble...

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: ...hm? Oh, the madman’s roped you into this too?! I asked for a Corkian engineer, not- Urgh. Look, have you got any technical knowhow?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: He wants me to construct him a time machine!! Why does he even need more time when there’s plenty about?

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: Well, beggars can’t be choosers. If you think you have any ideas on how to get it functioning, step inside and see what you can do.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: ...wait. It’s ticking. Does that mean- Wait, no! HUMAN! GET OUT OF THERE-

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: GAH!!!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: So Lecade had a doppelganger this entire time...

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: If I had to guess, I bet that morphing creature came from a shipment of gear from the southwest.

lines.speaker: Lieutenant Gren
lines.line: Sorry for not catching it for you two, I had to wash myself off from that explosion you caused.

lines.speaker: Major
lines.line: First off, my task is to catch rats around the table, but the fort HAS no rats.

lines.speaker: Major
lines.line: Secondly, I'm to catch each of them, individually, with a handheld mousetrap. What folly is this?!

lines.speaker: Major
lines.line: Thank goodness that shape-shifter has been dealt with. His ridiculous speech patterns were starting to rub off on the newer recruits...

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.line: Why am I bouncing on this bed you ask? Heck if I know!

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.line: Ever since the general's gone mad, he's asked me to 'test the bounciness of these beds.'

lines.speaker: Lieutenant
lines.line: I've been doing it long enough that I consider myself quite the expert, now.

lines.speaker: Bed-Bouncer
lines.line: I loved my job so much I managed to convince Lecade to become a fulltime bed-bouncer!

lines.speaker: Bed-Bouncer
lines.line: One day I'll be the top of my craft in the world!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Hey, hey, hey! What is this person? Why is it in my administrator's? New work! New work! Get this person out of the administrator's!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Wait. Wait, you. Wait right there. Don't move until someone comes to get you. Order! I order it!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: ...okay, person. No one wants to bring you from administrator's, so instead I will give you another orders! Listen, listen, listen!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: You intended to firstly? Convenient! Here is my order then- Check the war tools. They need to be maintained for use!

lines.speaker: Lecade
