lines.line: Cannons and catpults, fortifications and barriers. A barracks needs to be armed to the tooth! I order it! Bad weapons are no weapons!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Armaments are to be stored outside fort walls at all times. To the left path leaving the walls. There will be Smithy stationed.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Move along! I have many orders to make! Return when the task is concluded!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Why is it in my administrator's? Person has work to do! Advise enclosed instruction book for tips.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Hey, hey, hey! Person is in my administrator's again! This means the armaments are maintained! That is right?

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Convenient! Very convenient! Now I will give you another orders! I must ponder for a moment.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Here is my new work then- Find the coin. A soldier has dropped a lucky charm in the wastewater!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: All is confused without fortune. Soldiers must not be confused, or else I cannot give orders! Generally orders must be given!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: The coin has been pushed into the sewage. My orders are convenient, as there is accessibility! The aqua ducts have means of entrance.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Outside, the cracked aqua ducts have Sergeant nearby. It shall mark accessibility for you. Return when the charm is gotten!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Hey, hey, hey! Administrator's has person once more! The charm has been gotten! That is right?

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Yipy! Soldier will get returned the coin very soon! Person, the actions you take are convenient! I appreciate your help. I must ponder for a moment.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Here is my new work then- Show your love. You have made me smile wide through your tasks! The other soldier would appreciate you too!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Walk jauntily across the tight rope, and make the other soldier smile as well! Soldiers must be happy at life.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: The tight rope is right from administrator's- stairs are nearby the passage. Return when the soldier is happy!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Convenient! So convenient! Many cheers for person!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Very, very, very happy! The tight rope has been walked! I saw the task!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: The soldier is very happy now! A smile is brighting the room! Yet the day still is dark. Why this is, I must ponder for a moment.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: I have devised my plan! I have observed the hills are naked. That must why the soldiers become upset.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Here is my new work then- Dress the hill. It is bare and trashy. No good! Trashy hills mean our day is trashy.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Turn the hill purple! I order it! Purple is King’s color! The fortress will feel a castle and we will feast for a hundred!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Previously, Springy were introduced. They will make easy accessibility! Person will find Springy past the tight rope.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Hey, hey, hey! Person has returned to Administrator's! The hill is King’s color now! This is right?

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Convenient, convenient, convenient! Our day is will be no longer trashy. Good tasks have been concluded!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: However, tasks must be serious. Person's next work is very important. Mister “Gren” needs of help.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: ”Gren” Lieutenant has worked on task for many days. He needs assistance, fast- Time is required of a machine!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Here is my new work then- Assist “Gren.” It is important work. Science machines are complicating.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Build the machine with time! ”Gren” is left outside Administrator's. Assist Lieutenant!
Who goes there?! What, come to try and finish the job, you beast?! ...wait...a human?! Whatever reason you’re down here for, you need to listen!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: I am General Lecade of the Kitrios Barracks! While you're on my ground, you must follow my orders!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Soldier, I order you to unlock this door! They tossed the key behind that desk; we'll be able to discuss this once I'm out.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Good. Thank you, soldier. There's a lot to explain. I'll tell you everything on the way.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: For now, though, we should get out of this dilapidated prison. Let’s go.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Inconvenient! No escape!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: What in the...?!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: You...! You're... What is the meaning of this, why do you look like me?!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Trashy liar! No escape! I order it! Generally orders must be done! Return to the room!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: What nonsense...! I'll wrestle that costume off of you, you impostor!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Agh... As insane as you sound, you’re a tough fight... Human, you need to finish this thing off!

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: Person! I have new work for you- Knock down the fake soldier! Assist fast!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: What folly! A doppelganger calling ME a fake! How about you go ahead and prove yourself?

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: Hey, hey, hey! Smart thoughts from fakeman! Our home- we called it Gravel!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Gravel? I've never heard something more outlandish, it's called Gavel!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Are the rumors about humans being brainless mercenaries REALLY true?!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Do you even know where we are...? How about this then, who's the private who guards the entrance?

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: Tiger! The soldier with dance is Tiger!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Tiger?! His name is Tylas!! A tiger is an exotic animal, not some drowsy private!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: No wonder he was asleep, it seems he was even too lazy to give you his name!

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: AHA! I have pondered- say where Springy is held!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: What in the... Springy- What in the world are you talking about?! We don’t store springs in the fort!!

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: Weak fake soldier!! Springy is held to sleep! Springy is held on top of the pillar!!

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: Convenient! Person is not stupid! Smile!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Enough of this! Soldier, you can't possibly believe that fraud, we have to team up on him!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Fine then- If I'm alone on this, it's time for the classic Lecade Power Play!!
Inconvenient! Person is trashy! Terrible fake! I will not intend the victim on returning to home!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: He... he transformed! A shapeshifter?!
I did fine work! I generally performed tasks to soldiers! There’s nothing wrong!
Too much! Too much! Too much! Escape! Need escape! Too strong!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Damn! He's gone... I don't think I'll be able to catch him on foot at this rate.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: I can't believe you actually trusted him, but I couldn't hold a grudge about it. The thing's gone, anyways.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: It wouldn't be right to leave you empty handed over it. Perhaps you can find a use for that odd slime it left behind.

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: What!? Books have told me this home is hilly and crumbly!

lines.speaker: Lecade 1
lines.line: Weak worm!! Person has been convenient with work- Why do stupid things?!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: What even is a springy?! He’s speaking utter nonsense!

lines.speaker: Lecade 2
lines.line: Good! Let's make him pay!

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Damn! He's gone... I don't think we'll be able to catch him on foot at this rate.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: Well soldier, I'll be checking out what degree of havoc he's wreaked on this fort.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: I couldn't leave you unrewarded for your efforts though. You seem resourceful- Perhaps you can find a use for that odd slime it left behind.

lines.speaker: Lecade
lines.line: The soldiers understood the situation, luckily. Can't believe it got that far. I'll make sure nothing like that ever happens again!

lines.speaker: Mehme
lines.line: Welcome to my wonderful wooden home!

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: This is just a disaster... I pray nothing goes awry with the recovery team.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: I'd never be able to live it off if I'm responsible for more deaths.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: But I must do what it takes to protect Thanos from any more disaster.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: Sir! Coulmis, sir!

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Atila, you're back! Give it to me straight, did they succeed? We can't afford any more losses.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: No, sir... I'm afraid not.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: The elevator leads right in to where the dragon lays. Without knowing when it's asleep, it's a gamble...

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: So we truly do need to go through the vault. But with the defense systems gone haywire...

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: I'm sorry sir...

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Think nothing of it, let's get back to the drawing board.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: Yes, I'll get to it immediately.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: You there, human! What's your business here? Come speak to me.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: This is not good... I'm not sure what more we can do.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: What's your business here? This place is off limits, the vault is very dangerous right now.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Now that I look, say, that gear of yours is pretty high quality, yeah? What's your name?

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Soldier I see, I haven't seen you around before.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: soldier... where have I heard that name before... Oh, I remember! You're that guy who defeated that Qira woman, yeah?

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Nevertheless, Thanos is in danger. To put it simply, a dragon is living uninvited in our despository.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Perhaps you've seen its lair above our city. Normally she leaves us unharmed, but one day she suddenly made her way in to this vault.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: My great friend Atila has been leading a recon squad, he's discerned that she's nesting an egg.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: We've tried at our greatest expenses to steal the egg, and bring it back to her nest, so that maybe she would leave... But, as you've heard, it's not going well.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: I don't normally ask this of strangers, but we've run ourselves thin. Do you think you're up to help? I'll make sure it is worth all your trouble.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: So you'll help!? Thank you so much! I'll make sure it's worth every moment!

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: You have to go through this chamber behind me to reach the depository. Our only other way in is right where the dragon is...

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Atila knows some of the inner workings of the vault. I bid you good luck and will be praying for your success. Your courage will inspire Thanos.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Oh, so it wasn't meant to be I suppose...

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Well, if we cross paths again, I'll always much appreciate your help... Back to the drawing board...

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Soldier, you're back! Have you had a change of heart?

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: So you'll help!? Thank you so much! I'll make sure it's worth every moment!

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: You have to go through this chamber behind me to reach the depository. Our only other way in is right where the dragon is...

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Atila knows some of the inner workings of the vault. I bid you good luck and will be praying for your success. Your courage will inspire Thanos.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: I've done all that I can do now. If I went in with you, I'd only be a detriment. Good luck.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: So you've taken the job. Good luck to you in there.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: What would you like to know?

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: The way to the depository is guarded by some dragon-like sentinels. They're meant to cook any thieves to be well done.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: There's a bit of a workaround though, if you kill the living sentinel, they'll deactivate and you can go through.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: Make sure you don't get scorched either, the statues take a few seconds before they breath their flames. Good luck and godspeed!

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: ...We've been unable to reach Ozoth through our second entrance. We've ought to strike while she's asleep, but there's no knowing when she is.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: You'll be going directly in to the chamber. Once you see she's asleep, you book it to the egg!

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: I understand if you're worried, but right now I can't think of anything else we can do...

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: Oh-oh my gosh!! I took you for dead, and thought the dragon was sending me up a corpse!

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: You really got it!? Hurry then, the nest is up through this cave! Maybe Thanos can finally be rid of its woes...

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: Don't wait any longer, soldier! Place the egg and we can finally lure that wretched dragon out!

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: She's a beauty, isn't she? A monster though, nevertheless.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Soldier! Over here... Atila told me the news, I came as fast as I could!

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: You're a hero, lad! With the dragon out of our city, Thanos no longer has to live in fear.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: I've prepared your reward. The people of Thanos will remember your contribution years to come.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: It's a great feat what you've accomplished. The dwarven defense system was thought to be impeccable. We'll need to rethink our security!

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: The people of Thanos have everlasting gratitude, soldier.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Thanos will no longer live in fear! You have my gratitude lad!

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: Once the depository is up and running again, we should have ourselves a hearty feast!

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: Soldier! Good to meet you again! Coulmis and I have been discussing repairs, and a new defense system.

lines.speaker: Atila
lines.line: This time it'll be dragon proof.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: What's your business here? This place is off limits, the vault is very dangerous right now.

lines.speaker: Coulmis
lines.line: We're in dire need of help right now, but I can't send you to die. If you were level 81 though...

lines.speaker: Olivin
lines.line: Mo'in! My name is Olivin.

lines.speaker: C.S.S Wavebreaker Captain
lines.line: Welcome welcome to C.S.S Wavebreaker!

lines.speaker: C.S.S Wavebreaker Captain
lines.line: Welcam aboard me ship, I'll bring ye directly to Corkus.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: It's such an honour to have a Wynn soldier visit our island.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: We were hoping for a true envoy, but you will do.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: If you follow me, I'll give you a tour of the city.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: We first arrived on Corkus 350 years ago.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: The Corkians, like you, are from Fruma originally...

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: ...But let's not talk about that.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Coming from Fruma, we of course knew no magic at all.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: We soon developed our own. The rare power of Electromagic.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: It's a difficult modern branch of magic that allows us to create machines.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Ah, here already. Welcome to Corkus City, Capital of our island.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: We've come a long way in a short time.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Let me point out where the shops are.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: North, you can buy weapons and potions. If you continue through the gate you will find the native Avos.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: West, you can buy armor, and there is another entrance to the potion shop.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: To the south is our bank, powder shop, scrolls, and our exclusive powder exchange!

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Oh! And speaking of the powder exchange, I'll start you off with some of these.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Moving on... The south gate leads to Relos. On your way there, you might pass by the-

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Uhm, nevermind. In fact, we have a gift for you.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: The Five Gears Diner is hosting any guests of the island.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Go through the western gate and head to the diner for your free feast. Enjoy!

lines.speaker: Corkus Citizen
lines.line: RUN!

lines.speaker: Corkus Citizen
lines.line: Mechs at the Diner! Run!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Psst! You! Over here, behind the logs!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Mo'in, Wynnian. Thank goodness I stopped you!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: The diner is being raided by mechs...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: You don't know, huh? Of course you don't. Let me explain.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: The name's Maxie by the way. Nice to meet you.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: This town is usually full of life...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: But Corkus has a secret...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Our own creations have rebelled against us.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: They now raid towns for parts.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Mechs are getting increasingly more desperate.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Even in rust, they are still powerful.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: We have tried to remove them but the factory always makes more.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: It is Corkus' greatest failure. It must be stopped.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: We need to act now.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: I can try to open the vent to sneak in.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Look... I know you're a stranger, but... If you want to help, talk to me.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Follow me, soldier.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Alright, I'll open the door with electromagic...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Gah! I can't even do the most basic spell!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: No... L-Let me try again..!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Yes!! It worked!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Look, I-I'm sorry for slowing you down. It's just...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Electromagic is different from your magic... And I'm not very good at it.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Oh, two paths. Well, I'm not sure which way it is, so let's split up. I'll go to the right.

lines.speaker: Collector Mech
lines.line: RETRIEVE SCRAP...

lines.speaker: Collector Mech
lines.line: RETURN WITH HAUL FOR CONSTRUCTION.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Ouch.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Mo'in. Sorry, had a problem with the-

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: ...What in the world is that mech on top of the pile of scrap over there?!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: That is definitely not a regular despermech... It looks brand new!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: One of those hasn't been seen since the factory was running...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: We need to do something! I'll clear the path for you. That’s the only thing I can do, I... hurt my... leg.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Come on...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: There! Go, defeat it!

lines.speaker: Mech X
lines.line: PARTS ACQUIRED... RETURN TO FACTORY.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Are you okay? Good. Meet me at the entrance where we met. We need to report to Corkus City!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Don't worry about the guards, they're disabled for now. Follow me!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: I know a shortcut, we'll be in Corkus City in no time.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Mo'in! Welcome back to Corkus City.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Beltrude, we have a problem! The factory is running!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: We saw a mech… A new mech! It looked different like it was made in-

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: What a load of scrap! You shouldn't talk about that in front of our guest!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Our guest... just killed several despermechs by themselves.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: And why would we take the word of someone who can't do basic electromagic?

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Don't listen to Maxie. Enjoy your stay.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: They won't admit anything with you around. They want to become allies with Wynn.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Come to my house when you reach level 89, here's a key so you get in. We must prepare to break into the factory.

lines.speaker: Security Bot N4T17
lines.line: No access without a key.

lines.speaker: Security Bot N4T17
lines.line: Key valid. Welcome.

lines.speaker: Security Bot N4T17
lines.line: Welcome inside...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Mo'in, soldier! I've been researching everything I can about the factory.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: I knew it! There was something here we could use!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: I'll have to use electromagic to make it launch, so you'll have to go alone.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Find the Avos chief. Ask for the factory key.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Alright, hop on.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Press the button when you're ready.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Off you go!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Grook feathers! Not again...

lines.speaker: Avos Shaman
lines.line: Hmm, no gears or goggles... You are no Corkian Human.

lines.speaker: Chief Avos
lines.line: Mo'in, soldier. I have been expecting you.

lines.speaker: Grandmaster Shaman
lines.line: Eh, It's the warrior. I have my orders, but still say this is a bad idea.

lines.speaker: Grandmaster Shaman
lines.line: I'll make the bridge for you.

lines.speaker: Grandmaster Shaman
lines.line: I don't see why we're helping humans...

lines.speaker: Grandmaster Shaman
lines.line: You all act the same to me. Anyway, there you go.

lines.speaker: Key Temple Dragon
lines.line: You cannot have the key. Prepare for destruction.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: You're back, and you have the key!

lines.speaker: Corkus Guard
lines.line: Something has happened in the vault.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Mo'in...

lines.speaker: Bertil
lines.line: Uh- No need to worry! We accidentally...

lines.speaker: Reiva
lines.line: Blew a hole in the wall! Yep!

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: Stop. Maxie, was right. I'm sorry. Mech X pierced the vault like it was nothing and took the key.

lines.speaker: Corkus Delegate
lines.line: The mechs were covered in farm produce for some reason and left a convenient trail. If you are serious about fighting the factory, follow the trail.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Psst! Over here, in the field!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Mo'in. See that guy up there? He hasn't moved an inch since I got here...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: ...I don't think he's actually a farmer. Follow me.

lines.speaker: Farmer
lines.line: HELLO... I AM A... HUMAN... FARMER.

lines.speaker: Farmer
lines.line: DO YOU... HAVE... ANY BUSINESS... WITH ME?

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Nice try, mech!

lines.speaker: S-63 Mech
lines.line: REPORT... COVER HAS BEEN COMPROMISED... TWO UNAUTHORIZED INTRUDERS... OUTSIDE OF BASE.

lines.speaker: S-63 Mech
lines.line: NEW OBJECTIVE... EXTERMINATE-

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Oh no you DON'T!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: That model was a S-63... It's warned the others. Let's go.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: See? We're locked out now.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Stand back, I'll open the door.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: I think we can safely assume this is the right place.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: You storm in and find what we need. I'll cover you from out here.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: You need to find and destroy that new factory mech.

lines.speaker: Mech X
lines.line: INTRUDER DETECTED. DESTROY.

lines.speaker: Mech X
lines.line: Corkus has to suffer... They shut down the Factory, locked us up in there. Once we have both keys we can open it and you are NOT getting this one.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Mo'in. Did you get the key?

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: You did?! Great! Now we need to meet at the factory. The real hard part begins.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Follow the northwestern road and enter the factory from the west side. I will meet you there.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Mo'in. Are you sure you are ready?

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: You there! You think you can get past me without paying, darling? I didn't think so.

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: You want to get to Thesead? That'll cost you everything you own. All of your emeralds, and your silly little armor and trinkets. All of it.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: Norsten? Finally! I've been looking all over for you. What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: No idea who you are, but you better pay up. You used my gate without my permission! And ugh, your outfit, so drab!

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: Why are you talking like that? And what do you mean "your gate"? What's wrong with you?

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: This is MY gate, darling. Now, pay up, quickly! And don't even think about running.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: You there, small-nose. Don't you Wynn folks love helping out? Something's clearly wrong with my friend here.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: He's normally nothing like this. He doesn't try to rob people, and he CERTAINLY doesn't talk like that crazy ol- Oh! I think I know what's happening.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: See that tower up there? A crazy old wizard lives up there. I think he's mind controlling Norsten here.

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: Mind control? Silly man. I would neve- Uh, I mean, he would never do that! He's just an innocent stylish old man!

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: See what I mean? There's a shortcut through the mountain over there. It'll take you straight to the path up to the wizard's tower.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: I don't care what you do with him, just make sure he lets Norsten go.
Ha, you're so weak I can blow you away with a fabulous little air spell!
Yoohoo! You there! Yes, you, with the silly soldier outfit. I see you!
I can see you! You can't hide from little old me. Come no further or I shall be forced to act!
Wait, where did you go?
Aha, there you are! I know why you're here, and I promise it won't end well for you, darling!
You think I didn't know about those caves? You silly old goose, I'll make you suffer!
And now your little mind is mine, trapped in an illusion for all time! You'll go mad trying to figure out what is real and what is not, and your mind will shatter!
OH, dearie me! Where did you come from? I thought I'd trapped you for good!
I'll need a more permanent solution then, won't I? Oooh, how about this?

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: GAH!

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Oh gosh, you're here! Where did I put my pink wand, I simply can't cast in black!

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Well foof! I guess you've got me! Teehee!

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Ohh, I do hate it when people make me give up my toys. I'll let the silly little man go.

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Tell you the truth, his style offended me anyway. Asking people to give him money wearing that?! Ugh, hideous.

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Well, there's no need to raise your fists, darling. I'm not going to fight you like some common ogre! Hah!

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Here, let me get the gem. With it you can bring his free will right back to his old unfashionable self!

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Here...

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Whoopsies! Silly old Volmor! Too much magical moisturiser again. It just slipped right out of my fingers!

lines.speaker: Volmor
lines.line: Heehee! I guess you won't be saving him after all! It's not like you could jump in there, that's my trash! You'd get dirt all over your outfit!

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: Huh? You again?! How did you escape from my- wait, uh, I mean... You there! Give me everything you own!

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: Stop trying, you creepy old man! We all know it's not Norsten that's speaking. Anyway, human, that was quite an entrance! Did you find anything?

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: Wait, what's that? What are you doing with that gemstone? I- Agh!

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: Ugh... Where am I...? Peli? What happened? I can't remember how I got here.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: Ah, Norsten, you're back! Finally. You won't believe it, but... You remember that crazy old wizard? He took over your body or something!

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: ...What? What do you mean?

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: He took control of your body and used it to try to rob people! But, he still talked like his normal crazy self so it was immediately obvious.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: And this human here saved you! They went right up to the wizard's tower, and then a bit later came flying back out with a gemstone!

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: I'm confused... But thank you, human. It sounds like you really saved me!

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: Here, let me repay you. So that wizard tried to use me to rob people for money, right? But I guess he didn't think to check my pockets.

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: Well, that's generous. Looks like a happy ending for everyone! Come on Norsten, let's get you home.

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: Just a second, my mind's still a bit fuzzy.

lines.speaker: Norsten
lines.line: You again! You think I didn't recognize you? Your friend here used my gate, but refuses to pay. I'll forgive his debt, but only if you pay up now! as well?

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: Again, as I already told you a hundred times, you can't just pick any random old gate and pretend it's yours!

lines.speaker: Peli
lines.line: Anyway, human, do you finally have some news? If not, I suggest you get back out there. Check your quest book if you've forgotten what to do

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Who's that? Am I finally being rescued!?

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Wait, a human! Ugh, I shouldn’t have gotten my hopes up. What did you do, take a day of cliff diving?

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: If you really did intend to rescue me, you've assuredly wasted both our time.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: If you really want to make yourself useful, get a Bantisu monk over here! You’re good at doing that, right? Fetching things and people?

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: You’re trying to kill me, aren’t you?! What, can’t take hearing the truth? Now my coat is drenched, and! AND!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: These Jinko are going to pounce any second now!! I haven’t got a weapon, were you expecting me to rush off and get into a rumble?!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Kill them! Kill them now! And get me OUT OF HERE! You got me into this mess, now get me out!!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Ugh, all that danger got me flustered. I’m swe ating in this coat...and it’s all soaked already. Let me just...

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: ...set that aside. Congratulations, human! I’m probably never getting that coat back, and it cost me a pretty sum. Thanks for nothing.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: All this walking...I’m taking a break here. You forced me to jump off a cliff, I get to force you to slow down. It’s only fair!. Besides that...

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: I only even came out here to see the view. At least that can’t be ruined. Still, some vacation this turned out to be...

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Wait, what in the world- What’s going on?!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: NO ONE TELLS ME ANYTHING! The brochure didn’t mention earthquakes, YOU didn’t tell me either, but what was I expecting from a human anyways?!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: I’m not a carrot! You’d better get me out of h- ...wait, wait, those...

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: H-Hobgoblins. Hobgoblins HOBGOBLINS THERE’S HOBGOBLINS!! KILL THEM! AAAAH! AAH! AAAAAAH!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Sweet baby bovine  I just saw my life flash before my eyes. Ugh...now pull me up. I’m stuck. But easy on the goods, I’m NOT a carrot I’ll remind you!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Great. I’m SO grateful to be covered in mud and hobgoblin blood, and to be lacking my coat, AND to be stuck with a human.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Just get me out of here already. See, if an actual Bantisu monk had come down I’d probably be at home already, sipping tea by the fire!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: I know you humans are reckless, but I’d have expected you to have SOME concern, since you supposedly wanted to rescue me.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Maybe you think anything's possible for you since you're a soldier, but I'm just a guy from Olux! I hardly know anything about the canyon outside of what the brochures say!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Ugh, my feet are killing me. Maybe this hike wouldn’t be so bad if SOMEONE hadn’t knocked me into a lake and made me lose my shoes!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: More earthquakes...? Wait-

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: The ridge is collapsing!!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: ...perfect. Just  GREAT! The only available path to the temple, and now it’s blocked off! Just my luck!!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: ...wait. You’re reckless and  willing to endanger your life, right? There’s no way that I could possibly use them, but I see some ledges.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: See, just to the side of the  rockslide? There's some ledges to jump around on.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Find me a way up, and fast! I've had enough of this stupid canyon.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: ...of course it’s a ladder. I’m going to be feeling this climb for weeks...

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Huff...puff... Well...huff... Wait, there’s...there’s no way down the other side! Huff...what a waste!!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Can you do ANYTHING right?! There’s no way I’m jumping down there, you maniac!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: You...had better count yourself lucky I haven’t broken any bones from this. Agh...but that doesn’t mean I’m not aching all over!!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: When I said you were reckless, I was hoping that maybe you’d keep that side of yourself away from other people!!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: At least we’re nearly at the temple now. Come on Seluc, silver linings, silver linings. You’re nearly away from this freak...

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Okay, you know what? No. You’ve put me through QUITE a lot here, human, so you’re going to do me a favor and I’m not going to move another step til it’s done.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: I paid two weeks’ wages for that coat you soaked. I’m not leaving here without it, and I’m way too tired to walk back down.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: So you’re going back down to the bottom of the ridge, and you’re going to get me my coat. It’s the least you could do.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: And be quick about it! I feel like these quakes are going to make the whole mountain collapse. That looks like it opened up a hole straight to the bottom!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Well? What are you waiting for? I'm freezing here!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Took you long enough, coat-fetcher! I’m practically frostbitten up here!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: You see, I was just speaking to Gana about your dirt-poor imitation of their job! You ought to be ashamed- I had to get up here all on my own!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: Anyway! Give me that coat. The monks here are going to provide me some hospitality then guide me out of these wretched canyon walls.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: This is goodbye then, human, I won’t be missing you. Shoo!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: ...uh. ...dang it, why you gotta did that.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: That's right! See, Gana? After all that, at least the human isn’t a liar.

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: WHY YOU-

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: GAH! NOT AGAIN!!!

lines.speaker: Seluc
lines.line: YOU-!

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: Welcome to Bantisu Temple, wandering human. We aid travelers such as yourself in navigating the capricious canyon walls.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: We commune with the wind, and she gives us her sight. Wherever the breeze blows, we may see.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: You appear quite strong, and well-kept by your wits. Might we ask you to aid us, then?

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: You see, a lost man is staking out in a camp on the nearby cliff faces. It pains us to see him, but be unable to reach him.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: The canyon creatures there are ruthless, and we are not suited to physical combat. We would be able to reach him, but we would be stranded ourselves.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: So we ask you to guide Seluc to us. We shall send you to him, and you shall bring him here. If you wish to help, you will be rewarded for your time.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: Seluc hides in a camp northeast of here, atop the cliffs.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: We ask you to guide Seluc to us. If you wish to help, you will be rewarded for your time.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: ...hm. I will say, there are many lost around the canyon, Seluc- it may have been a long time before we were able to help you.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: ...He did not really guide himself here. Did he.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: Let this be a lesson to you, Seluc. You cannot lie to those who see with the wind. Now show your gratitude to this kind human.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: ...Well, 'coat fetcher', getting this man his coat is still a fine deed. And for that, you shall be rewarded.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: I do hope my aid was able to help you alongside that stubborn man. He is safe now- I can only hope he will change his demeanor now.

lines.speaker: Gana
lines.line: Welcome to Bantisu Temple, adventurer. There is an urgent matter at hand, but I can not in good faith ask anyone under level 84 to take on this task.

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Ho, traveller! I could use your help with something, but I need someone more familiar with the canyon. Come back when you're level 85.

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: Oh! How on earth did you get up here? Well, I hope you're having fun. I'm far to scared to go anywhere near the edge...

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Hey there! I'm in a bit of a pickle right now, but I'm not too sure you can help me!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Ho, traveller! I need the help of a true explorer. I can see it in your eyes, you are an adventurer like me!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: While you are here, adventurer, I could use your help with something. I have gotten myself into a small predicament in my travels.

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: You see, me and three others were on a grand expedition to explore the entire canyon! Unfortunately, we ran into a slight problem...

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: The Canyon of the Lost is clearly called that for a reason, within hours, we had lost each other!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Luckily, we were prepared for it. We each carried a flag so if we ever got lost, we can raise it to be found.

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: They were all meant to come to my blue flag, but they must all be trapped in some predicament! The canyon can be a dangerous place.

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: I can see all three red flags from here, but it would be terrible if I went looking and they came back to this flag to find me gone!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Do you think you could go and check if they're all alright? I'm sure I can find some reward for you if you help!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Ho, adventurer! Have you found the missing members of my crew? If they're not by their red flag, they can't have gotten too far from it!

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: ...AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHH!!!!!!! HEEEEEEEEEEEEELLLLLLLLPPPPPP!!!!! THERE ARE BIIIIIIIIIIIRDS!!!!!

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: HUMAN! YOU, DOWN THERE! HELP ME! I was just trying to find my way back to my friends...

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: When this GIANT BIRD KIDNAPPED ME and threw me in her nest! I think she thinks I'm one of her chicks!

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: The Canyon's movements must've dislodged her eggs from her nest-

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: O-OH GROOK, SHE’S PECKING ME! FIND HER EGGS NEARBY AND THROW THEM UP HERE... QUICKLY!!

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: YOU HAVE THE EGGS?? GOOD! THROW THEM UP HERE, PLEASE!!!

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: W-WOAH, STAY BACK, BIRD! I have a... uhh... I DON’T HAVE A WEAPON, HUMAN! PLEASE HURRY UP!

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: YES YES YES!!! THANK YOU, HUMAN! Oh, thank grook, this bird’s leaving me alone now... It worked!

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: I’ll head back to Dejol, now... And I’m never going to go near another bird again!

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: A-ah, hello. I’m g-guessing Dejol sent you?

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: W-Well, I was just walking through the c-canyon, when... the ground suddenly rose up underneath me and launched me all the way up here!

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: N-Now, I’m... embarrassed to admit it, but I’m REALLY afraid of heights, s-so I don’t know what to do... Do you have any ideas?

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: N-Now, I’m... embarrassed to admit it, but I’m REALLY afraid of heights, s-so I don’t know what to do... Do you have any ideas?

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: AAAAAAAAHHHHH!!!

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: Y-YOU JERK!! I COULD HAVE DIED!!! WHAT THE HELL IS WRONG WITH YOU???

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: P-Please NEVER do that again! That was the worst thing I’ve ever done in my entire life!!

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: ...Ugh! I-I’m gonna head back to Dejol now. I hope I NEVER see you again!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Hey there! I’m in a bit of a pickle right now, you see. This house I took refuge in, well... The original owner must have left for a reason!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: It’s so sad... So many people are constantly displaced by the canyon’s movements destroying their homes every year. I remember hearing a story once, it was about–

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Wait... Hey, do you hear that?

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Hey! You alright down there?! Oh, lord, how are we going to get out of this? I'm up here, come find me.

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Oh... Well, this isn’t good! The house just went and collapsed on us!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: See what I was talking about human? The canyon isn’t really a good place to be. Now we’re stuck in this pit!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Although... there is a crafting table over there... Hey, maybe you could collect some supplies and make something to get us out of here?

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Heh, that’s certainly one way to get out of here! You made an entire catapult, huh?

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: So we’re just gonna launch ourselves out of this pit? You got it!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Alrighty, I’ll be right behind you!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Hey, no time to dawdle, right? Head on up!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Woah... That's certainly a lot of fun! Anyways, come talk to me.

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Me first? Okay, I’ll do just that!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Alright, here I... GOOO!!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Hey, I made it!! You should come up as well, now.

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Hey, come over here!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Thanks for the help, friend! I couldn’t have done it without you!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: I’m gonna go find my friend Dejol now— wait, you know who he is??

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Oh... Wow, guess it’s a small world, huh? That’s funny! Maybe I’ll see you down there later, then!

lines.speaker: Gordon
lines.line: Oh, hey there! It’s good to see you again. Thanks again for helping me get away from that house– though, I feel kind of bad for the owner...

lines.speaker: Fetu
lines.line: Hey, human! Thanks for helping me with the birds. I managed to sneak down once you gave me the eggs, so... All said and done, now!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Ho, adventurer! Looks like you had some adventures helping out my crew!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Thank goodness they all found their way back unharmed. Mostly. Yuge's pride seems to have taken a hit.

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Anyway, we ought to get back to our exploration - and we'll stick closer together this time!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: You were a huge help, though so please take this as a reward!

lines.speaker: Yuge
lines.line: EEK! A-Are you back to throw me off another cliff, human?? Keep your distance, p-please!

lines.speaker: Dejol
lines.line: Ho, adventurer! Thanks for your help again!

lines.speaker: Daffyd
lines.line: Phew... Everyone make it out alright? That was...one hell of a sprint. I'm absolutely knackered.

lines.speaker: Mihco
lines.line: I'm not sure, mate. I left a bunch of my stuff down there. Who knows if I'll get it back.

lines.speaker: Daffyd
lines.line: Forget about that, what are we gonna tell the chief? That chopsy old fool is gonna kill us if he sees us not working.

lines.speaker: Daffyd
lines.line: Oi, you! Listen, there was some kind of explosion down in the mines. We're not sure what it was or where it came from, but it surely didn't sound good.

lines.speaker: Daffyd
lines.line: The four of us were the only blokes down in the mines, so everyone should be out safely. But I reckon we can't go back if this issue isn't resolved.

lines.speaker: Daffyd
lines.line: You must go to the chief and tell him about the situation. Head down this mineshaft and turn left, and he should be there.

lines.speaker: Daffyd
lines.line: Just, uh... Make sure not to mention us by name. Now, if you'll excuse us, we'll...be on our way.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: That's right, keep it moving! The whole of Thesead is going to run out of coal at this pace!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Eh? What do you want? Only registered miners are allowed beyond this point. Speak up or get off the premises.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: ...An explosion? In the mines? Just now?

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: EMERGENCY BREAK TIME, YOU GERBILS! EVERYONE COME AND MEET ME BY THE ENTRANCE! NOW!!!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Alright, you lot better listen bloody carefully. An explosion has been reported in the mines. You all know what that means, yes?

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: No, you bunch of ingrates! One of you needs to take the ol' canary down to the mines and see whatever the hell's going on.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Now, which one of you blokes would be willing to-

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Right then. I guess that leaves you, young lad. What do you say? Want a job?

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Very good! Come on then, let me introduce to you our little feathered mascot.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: You sure? I'll pay a lot, and it won't be dangerous. Even if it is, you've got all that armour on you!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: That's the spirit! Come on then, let me introduce to you our little feathered mascot.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: You'll get a bloody mountain of emeralds, god damn it! This is a once in a lifetime opportunity! Do you want it or not?

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Good. Now, hurry up and follow me.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: You know what? This is ridiculous. The whole of Thesead is at danger, and you're playing games with ME?! I know you can do it. Follow me. Now.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Scared speechless, eh? Don't worry, it'll be an easy job. Come on, follow me to the canary's cage.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Well? You coming or not?

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: I don't have all day.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Meet our canary! She's such a beaut.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: You see, whenever we hear news of an explosion, we always bring our canary with us to check it out. They can detect potential gases much earlier than we can.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Let me just get the key and-

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: WAIT, WHAT? WHERE'S THE BLOODY KEY? WHICH ONE OF YOU LOT IS RESPONSIBLE?! I SWEAR I'M GONNA...

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: ...Listen up, lad. Take this toothpick I've been chewing on. I need you to pick the cage's lock. It's a little wet, but it should do the trick. Understood? Good, now hurry up!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: You're too slow, lad. When you hear a sound, twiddle the toothpick as fast as you can. Try again.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: You're picking the lock wrong, lad. Keep nudging it around until you hear a sound. Try again.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Doing just fine, lad. Almost there...

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Little old birdie is getting quite excited! Keep it up.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Right then, lad! It's time to begin the-

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: OW! Bloody hell! Those are some freakishly sharp claws! What are you playing at?!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Well, I think she likes you, lad. Doesn't like me, apparently.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: I was going to feed her, but I suppose you can do the honors. Or not, seeing as she's been particularly troublesome...

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Anyway, do as you please. I'll be waiting by the elevator in the mineshaft. Hurry up, and don't make me wait!

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: Hey up! Aren't you that Wynn soldier we've heard about? You look proper tough, is all.

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: No, this is definitely them! The name's soldier, right?

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: Woah, this kid's a soldier? I wish I had that kind of job... I'd imagine it's much better than this crap.

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: Yeah, I really hate this job, man. That and the chief makes me pull my hair out... In fact, I already went bald because of it!

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: Dude, the chief scares the crap out of me. I'm surprised that I still have this job. Looks like we might lose it if the mines ain't restored fast enough.

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: I-I don't want to lose this job, man! I've got a wife and two goldfish!

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: Easy, Ryan. We won't lose it. We're in this together. soldier will take care of it.

lines.speaker: Thesead Coal Miner
lines.line: Our very lives are in your hands, soldier. Good luck, and be careful. The mines are quite treacherous even for people like you.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Right then, lad! I suppose you might want to know more about this job.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: As I said before, when unknown explosions occur in the mines, that's usually a sign that something bad happened.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Most of the time, an awfully putrid gas appears. This is where our canary comes in. Once she verifies that a gas is present, we decide whether or not to temporarily close the mine.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: I presume you met Daffyd and his group, correct? Thankfully, they were the only ones down in the mines.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: ...Wait, where the hell even are they? Did I not tell them to...

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Eh, doesn't matter. Lad, point is, I want you to check whether that gas is still there, if at all.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: We'll use the elevator behind me to get down into the mines. Just let me pull this here lever to activate it...

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: ...WHY ISN'T THIS BLOODY CONTRAPTION WORKING??! WORK, WORK, GOD DAMN IT!!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Must've been Daffyd and his group... No worries, lad. I've got, uh...a last resort, so to speak.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: You'll need to ride a minecart down into the mines. Thing is, we haven't used them to transport people in...years.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Why? Erm, well... See for yourself.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Our transporter minecarts are manual. Miners around here prefer automatic.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: For you, it should be no issue controlling it. There's instructions attached to the gear stick.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Now then, go into the mineshaft, following the rails behind me. You'll be able to summon a minecart there.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Hello.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Forgive my interference.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I am but a figment of your imagination. To you, I am not real.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: The mysterious force that brought death upon me... It changed me.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: So too will it change you. I will make that happen. Just for you.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: No need to thank me. It is the least I can do.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Moments like these are cherished. Savor the moment with me. Would you like to die with me?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I was hoping we could stay for a little longer. If that is your choice, then so be it.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: See you on the other side.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I would be more than glad to. Sit back and relax.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: How was your day today?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Mine could have been better. Cramped up in a cage all day, then suddenly witnessing my death in front of an incompetent human.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You couldn't even save me. How pathetic.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: So, anyway, do you come here often?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Oh, wait. This is your first time. As well as your last time. That's very poetic. Do you want to become a poet?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I know a good poem. Want to hear it?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You are average,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: The most average Joe I've seen,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: What more can I say.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You mess up sometimes,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Mistakes are a part of life,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Death is a part too.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Your soul points are low,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You will lose a lot of things,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Better not get killed.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You're a casual,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You likely hate professions,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: At least you're with me.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You are well-rounded,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You are skilled at everything,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: The jack of all trades.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Your level is maxed,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You spend hours getting that,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Don't know why You're here.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You don't die often,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You have maximum soul points,

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: That's about to change.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: How was that? It was beautiful, wasn't it?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Silence is bliss. You must not have very many friends.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: That's okay. I am your friend. Am I your friend? Please say yes. I'm very lonely.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I had friends too, once. They were all taken by a bunch of selfish coal miners. Then died to their incompetence.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: But you are different. You are not like the others. I like you. I love you. I love you so much.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Love is patient.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Love is kind.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Love does not envy.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Hello again.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I will give you another chance to redeem yourself.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: So, kindly, I will tell you again.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I see. So you want to make this an unforgettable experience. I appreciate the thoughtfulness.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Let's have some fun.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Let's do a little warm-up, shall we?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Liked the dance party? Those moves were so utterly terrible, I may as well dub them 'The soldier'.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Let's do something I like to call 'The Canary'.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Can't hit me with that.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Are you even playing the game?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: That tickles.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Try harder.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Is this the height of your skill?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Hands off of those, if you would be so kind.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Amazing... That really hit different.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: It felt nice the first time, but now it's...different.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Seriously... Enough is enough.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Okay, who even put those there in the first place?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I'm alaready dead, how is this even possible?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I'm not even REAL!

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Nice going bozo, you fell off.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Nice try, but that won't work.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You can't escape your doom.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Interesting tactic! Do it again.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Was that you, or will you blame that on lag?

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Go ahead. Run right into it.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Even a snail could dodge that.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I suppose this is it.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: It's been fun, kid.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Alas, time runs short.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: You are about to enter the cruel, real world.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me now, so we can spend our final moments together in bliss.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Fantastic. You are the pinnacle of humankind.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Have fun.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me. Now.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me now or you'll live to regret it.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me now or I'll destroy Thesead.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me now or I'll destroy Gavel.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me now or I'll ruin every single province.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me now or I'll destroy the world.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Okay, so you don't care about the world. In that case, kill me now or I'll kill your friends.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Kill me now or I'll do LITERALLY ANYTHING!

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: No no. No no no no no. No. It's too late.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: I just wanted to play again. Oh well.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: At least I'll be in your memories. Forever. And ever.

lines.speaker: Canary
lines.line: Goodbye.
...Hey! They're waking up!

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: Keep performing CPR, they're almost awake!

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: No way! I actually did it! I saved their life!

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: We better get a raise for this!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: What the?! Who the hell let you in my house?

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: Boss! I can explain!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: No, you can't. Get outta here before I start lowering your salary.

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: But, boss! I saved-

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: GO!!

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Well then, lad! Despite their incompetence, they still managed to save your skin.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Come speak to me for a quick debriefing.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: I sent my miners down to save you as soon as we felt that earthquake. It was so strong that I genuinely thought the world was ending.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: I'm jolly sorry for forcing you to take on this job. This whole situation was completely unexpected.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Typically, gases are cleared up almost instantly. This time, however, it seemed to have been a lot more potent... But how?

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: ...The Colossus. It stirs once more. That thing... It has already caused too much hardship for this area to handle.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: It must be destroyed, once and for all. How that will happen, I do not know. But you...

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: ...No, it's nothing. Until it is dealt with, the mine must be closed down. The supply of coal will decrease, but it must be done.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Tell you what, lad! I'll give you, and only you, permission to access parts of the mine, right where we mine our world-famous Thesead coal.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Consider yourself a part-time Thesead coal miner. You've earned it, lad.

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: We still can't believe we found you. I'm proper shocked.

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: We had to use that blasted archaic minecart system because the elevator was still busted.

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: Everyone was exhausted from it. But just when all hope was seemingly lost, we found you laying on the ground.

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: You were violently twitching about, as if you were possessed by something. It was scary.

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: Whatever the effects of that gas are, we want absolutely none of it. I'm never stepping foot inside of that bloody mine ever again.

lines.speaker: Thesead Miner
lines.line: For the sake of our jobs and Thesead, the Colossus must be stopped.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: Thanks again for helping us out. Your efforts may have been futile, but at least we know how strong this gas is.

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: We just gotta be thankful that no one died. Forget about the coal, this is what matters most. If only...

lines.speaker: Chief Clight
lines.line: ...Never mind. Once the elevator is repaired, you will be able to access the mine.

lines.speaker: Nettik
lines.line: What are these? I have nothing to do with them!

lines.speaker: Nettik
lines.line: I'm sorry it ended up like this, you should've just ignored that old man.

lines.speaker: Phinas
lines.line: Oh my...

lines.speaker: Phinas
lines.line: You Wynn folk sure know your fights.

lines.speaker: Phinas
lines.line: Did you find the source of those odd handmade mechs?
Stranger detected. Security system: activated.
Security drop-chute engaging. 5... 4...

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: Yep, that's all of 'em. All my cows accounted for, not one missing. Huh? Watchu looking at, city dweller?

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: If I needed any help I'd ask for some. Not my first day workin' a barn. Now shoo!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: A human, eh? All the way out 'ere at the end of the canyon? Yer a tough one.

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: Perhaps I can give yer some work, if yer are lookin' for it? Someone's been coming and nabbing my cows!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: 'an I know exactly who it is - that blasted cow scientist that lives in the lab just north of 'ere.

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: Anyway, yer up for the job? Can't let 'im just keep stealing them forever!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: His cavern laboratory is just north from 'ere. Not too hard to find. Once yer there, get him to return my cows!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: There's one problem though. The door to the place is always shut, so you'll 'ave to find another way in.

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: Have yer gone to check out the big laboratory to the North yet? I need my cows back!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: What's this 'ere? Ibele, that you? My girl, I knew you'd come back to me!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: And to think I was going to hire some city-dwellin' 'uman to get you for me? Ha!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: Right then, back into the pen you go. Hup!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: What are you doin' out here, ya fool? Back in you go!

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: Well well well. So, any excuses for why I haven't heard of yer since I sent yer off to find my cows?

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: Yer were turned into a cow? That's the best yer can come up with?

lines.speaker: Ranol
lines.line: I knew yer weren't up to the job, city dweller. If yer didn't want to help yer coulda just said so!

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: Moo.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: Password?

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: You're right, there is no password. Just seeing if you can understand me.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: You're one of us then, the oppressed? Want to break free from these farmers? Well aren't you in luck.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: I can help you with that. WE can help you with that.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: Our people have a secret hideout not far from here. It's located right under that barn just behind me.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: It may seem close, but unless you've been practicing your athletics, you won't be able to get over these fences.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: See what haybale in the middle of our pen? I bet you could push and pull it into such a position that'd allow you to climb over the fence with your cow physique.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: The second pen might have a similar problem, but I'm sure you can figure that out yourself.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: Good luck!

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: What? What does that even mean? There isn't actually a password! Or did no one tell me that there was? Ah, nevermind, at least you can understand me.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: Moo.

lines.speaker: Suspicious Cow
lines.line: If you want to escape, you'll have to push and pull the haybale around so that you can climb over the fences.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: Oh, a new recruit? We weren't expecting anyone at this time. How'd you find your way in?

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: Wait, you're different. Something's off about you. Like you've never been in a cow's body before.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: Oh. Oh, this is not good. Uhm, you should talk to the boss. He'll probably know what to do with you.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: You'll find him in the big office at the very end of this facility. Just stick to the path and don't be nosy, okay?

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: You need to speak to the boss, he's in his office at the end of the facility.

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: Oh, hello! You must be the one cow from earlier, right?

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: Well, Drale says you're welcome to visit whenever you'd like, so... Welcome!

lines.speaker: Receptionist
lines.line: We have many amenities available in this facility, so feel free to make yourself comfortable!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: So you're telling me we've got to move this thing all the way to the factory?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Yep.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Just the two of us?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Yep.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: With our bare hands? Couldn't even give us a wagon?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Hey, it's for the cause. Remember what you're working towards.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Yeah, yeah, I know. But what's it gonna matter if my back's worse than my grandpa's at the end of this?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: So. We still haven't moved this thing at all, huh?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Nope.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Guess that makes sense. Everyone's been busy talking about... you know.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Yep.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Oh, hey, there they are! Hey, you! You're the one that helped Drale free a bunch of our friends from the ranch, right?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Looks like them.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Hey, we never got to thank you for what you did! A lot of us wouldn't be here today if you hadn't. Kyle here definitely wouldn't, heh.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Thanks.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Well, I hope we get to see you around some more! We've got to get back to... uh, moving this thing. But, hey, maybe after we can hang out?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: I'm here for a crate of this wheat stuff. How has the recent batch turned out?

lines.speaker: Botanist
lines.line: Same as usual. Growing this stuff underground isn't easy. You can grab a crate on the far left side.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Right, thank you! Y'know, they say this stuff back home is a lot high quality than the stuff the farmers fed us.

lines.speaker: Botanist
lines.line: Well it won't be too long until we find out.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Hey... Don't, uh, tell anyone I asked... But you wouldn't happen to- happen to have some... barley?

lines.speaker: Botanist
lines.line: Woah, there. Calm yourself, friend. You know the rules about that kind of stuff.

lines.speaker: Botanist
lines.line: Yeah, okay, here. Here's a package of... stuff. Don't tell anyone you got it from me.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Y-yep, of course! Thank you kindly. I'll make sure... nobody kn-

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Oh no. H-hello there, Drale's friend! It's- good to. See you! You didn't happen to, uh-

lines.speaker: Botanist
lines.line: Best get moving quick before the word spreads, friend.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Looking for the boss, huh? Well, he's just up ahead in his office, behind the big door. Pretty hard to miss.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Hey, hope you don't mind me asking, but, uh... Why are you still walking around looking like that?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Eh, I don't judge. You go right ahead, I've got some work to attend to.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Looking for the boss again, huh? Well, just as always, he's up ahead in his office. Hard to miss, as usual.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: ...So the cow thing wasn't your choice, huh? Could've fooled me. Almost did, really.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: ...Well, this is awkward. Uh. You don't need to talk to me, y'know. Just go on ahead.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: ... where did you come from?!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: You fell into the incinerator? And defeated a mutant cow monster?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Yeah that checks out. So what happened to get you thrown down here?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Oh, angered him by pretending to be a cow after already speaking? Yeah, I feel ya. When the boss is in a mood, anything you say could get you thrown down here.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Here, why don't you follow me? I'll take you back to him, you can straighten things out, and you'll be back as a human in no time!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: So... yeah. Drale isn't the best at... conflict resolution. Catch him on a bad day, and he might just throw you in the Pit.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: I got stationed down here for a week because I interrupted him during his daily yoga session.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Gerald, over there? He used to be in accounting. Until he forgot to carry the two one day, and... Well, here he is now.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Drale's alright on a good day, but we've been running out of good days lately! He keeps pulling late hours on this... wholly unnecessary project!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: He insists we have to keep trying to find our original ship, instead of just building a new one with all the materials we have! It's ridiculous!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: What ship? Oh, of course, you're not a Woc. See, our race isn't actually from- you know, maybe that's a story for another time.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: For now let's get you back up to the main lab and hopefully Drale will be in a bit of a better mood!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Well, we're here!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: You head on up that pipe and with a bit of luck it'll plonk you out right in front of Drale.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: If you try explaining the situation again I'm sure he'll be understanding.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: He usually is after he's had some time to cool off.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Go on, off you go! It was lovely to meet you.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Pretended to be a cow when you're actually a human? Must have caught him on a rough day to get thrown down for that. Usually he'd just let a cow go.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Well, here, why don't you follow me? I'll take you back to him, you can straighten things out, and I'm sure you'll be back as a human in no time!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: So... yeah. That's Drale. Catch him on a bad day, and he might just throw you in the Pit.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: For now let's get you back up to the main lab and hopefully Drale will be in a bit of a better mood! Maybe mention the human thing this time, alright?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: ...Oh! You're the one Drale told us to look out for. Accidentally dropped into the Pit, huh?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: The boss said to apologize to ya for the inconvenience. We've all been workin' late hours recently... Some of us more than others.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Anyhow, follow me. I'll take you back to him, and you can talk this out! You'll be back as a human in no time.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: So... yeah. That's Drale for you. Absentminded as ever. He said something about labeling his levers from now on, so I reckon that's a positive.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: ...You're a friend of the boss, right? Would you be able to put in a good word for us? Gerald and I have been down here for a while, and we'd like to get back to our normal positions.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Drale's alright on a good day, but we've been running out of good days lately! He keeps pulling late hours on this... wholly unnecessary project!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: He insists we have to keep trying to find our original ship, instead of just building a new one with all the materials we have! It's ridiculous!

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Maybe you'll be able to get through to him, being his friend and all. We've all been stressed, and it's really just...

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Huh? What ship? Oh, right. You're not a Woc. So, you see, our race isn't actually from- you know, maybe that's a story for another time.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: For now let's get you back up to the main lab. Drale will be glad to see you in one piece! He sounded worried for your safety.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: Remember what I told you! Try to put in a good word for us, yeah?

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: If not, well... At least I tried. Let the record show I tried.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: ...Alright! Go on, off you go! It was lovely to meet you.

lines.speaker: Worker
lines.line: What're you waiting for? Get on through that pipe and talk to Drale!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Whoop, alright! Don't want you going anywhere, buddy! Uh... What are you doing here, exactly...?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: You- what? Oh, gosh, how is that even possible? I don't think I had anything that could...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh! You must've been snooping through my laboratory. That's... okay, we can talk about that later. Did you step into my machine?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It's not even meant to turn humans into cows! I just made it to turn the exiles back into Wocs! So how does a human become a cow...?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Right, right, sorry. Here, uh- I'll try and get this cage down. Darn controls... Why did I design these so poorly?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...So while I try to figure out which lever to push, tell me about yourself! Anything interesting going on in your life?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: You... You are? You are! Oh, wow, it's great to see you again! It's been so long since our escapades back in Wynn!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: This is great, actually! I- I can show you around the place! Introduce you to some of the folks we freed together! Oh, what fantastic timing this has been.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I just need to figure out which switch to pull... I think it's this one! Probably. I really need to label these things. Alright, here goes!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Wait, no, that's the wrong-...!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Okay. So you are just a regular cow. Not a Woc. Uh... Who let you in, little pal? I'm going to need to have a word about closing the doors...

lines.speaker: Drale
