lines.line: Well, this is... awkward. So, then... cow. What's it like being... a cow?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Right. Okay. Figure I'd best let you go free.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Unless. Unless. Nobody's... nobody's looking. I could just send you to The Pit... Nobody would know.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It's... easier this way. It's fine. Maybe you'll even- maybe you'll even make your way out. Good luck, little buddy.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I, uh... Hah. Very funny. Tell me you're a human, then pretend to be a cow.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: That's... fine. You know, I'm under quite a lot of stress right now. Working hard, day in and day out. I don't really need your attitude right now!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: You know what? I don't need this attitude. I'm- I'm going to send you to The Pit. Where- where all my other mistakes lie.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...You have a weapon. You can probably manage! You don't need anything from me! Here, see how you like it down there!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...This doesn't even mean anything! What am I supposed to do with-

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh! It's- It's you! Didn't I just...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Um. This is... really awkward, haha. I'm... sorry?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: You're... the one who pretended to be a cow, right? I, uh... In my defense, I was very stressed. So I dropped you into the Pit.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Anyway! What's- What's going on in your life? Anything interesting?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Uh... Hm. Maybe- Maybe being a cow is affecting your brain somehow... That can't be good.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: We should get you back to human as quickly as possible. Come on, follow me.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: So... Have you done anything interesting recently? Besides- getting turned into a cow. Obviously.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: You're, uh... Probably wondering what this place is. Just a big city under some random guy's farm, right?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It's... heh. We've been trying to gather as many of our people as we can. We exiles have to stick together, after all.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It's a long story. I'm not sure how much of it I really want to tell you, heh. Especially considering... Yeah.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: But. This place is a safe haven for us exiles. A place for us to live until we achieve our goals.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: And- hey! You've seen our secrets now! May as well let it be a safe haven for you as well, right? Heh.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh- the elevator. Here we are. Uh... Just head on in, little buddy? It'll take us up.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...You're worrying me. Come on, let's get going. Into the elevator, let's get you back to normal.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Come on, get in the elevator!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: So... here we are. The lab!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Just... follow me, for now. The machine is this way.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: There it is! If you step into the machine, real quick, it should... it should work!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Come on! Just... pop yourself back in the machine!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Look at you! As good as new!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: There you are! Back to norm...-

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: soldier?! What are you- that was you the whole time?! Why didn't you tell me!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh gosh, this has been... An awful reunion. I can't believe I dropped you into the Pit...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I'm so sorry for- for all of that. You should have told me! Oh...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Okay, uh... Here, take this. As- as compensation for- for all of that.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I... I need to get back to work. But- uh, if you ever want, feel free to visit sometime? You'll be able to use the entrance at Ranol's farm.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Maybe I can tell you more about what I've been up to! Heh...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I am talking to a cow. Again. Why is this where my life has taken me.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: So! What's... going on, little buddy? Any- any souvenirs? From the Pit...?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Yep. Just a cow...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Well, alright. Let's just- get you in my machine, I guess. It worked for the exiles, so maybe it'll work for you..?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Don't look at me like that. Come on, let's get going.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh, you- Oh. Right! Okay. I don't- I don't quite understand why you would pretend to be a cow. But alright!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: So, uh... Human turned into a cow. Okay. How did you manage to get yourself stuck as a cow, anyway? I didn't think we had anything that could do that...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: My machine. It's- It's not even supposed to do that! I designed it to turn exiles back into Wocs, how would it have...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Great. Of course it'd have that issue, and just when I thought I...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Right. Right. Alright. We can work with this! Let's just take you back to that machine, put you in it, and see if it turns you back to normal!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It'll work. Probably. I mean, I haven't ever tried it, so I can't really say for sure... Oh, yep, you're still here. Let's get moving.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: So... Hey there, little... cow?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Uh. Do you- do you understand what I'm saying?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...This is stupid. I'm talking to a cow. Of course you can't...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Well, I guess I could- talk at you. For a bit. If that's, heh, fine with you!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It's been tough, recently. Working towards a goal that I know is important, but still feels... out of reach.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: And it doesn't seem like anybody else can see that! That this is important! They look at me like I'm going crazy, and-

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I'm not. I know I'm not. We need to find the ship. If we don't, who knows what...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Anyway! Here's the elevator! Just step on in, and we can head on up to the laboratory.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Hrrgh- You're- you're not a cow?! Why were you... I just said all that, and you could...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: D-don't worry about the door. It's... It's nothing. Maintenance. That- that's what it is.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Er... Come on, into the elevator! You want to get back to normal, right? Besides, you'd need a key to get in there, and I don't know where you'd find one of those, haha!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Moo. Yep. I agree. Come on, let's get going. Into the elevator.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Hm... Oh, hi! Welcome back to my office!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh, this is- Oh! You're alive! I, ah- heh. Sorry about... all that. I really, really need to label these levers properly...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Right! Right. You've seen... all that down there, then. I just hope you won't think less of me for it.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: I can... I can tell you more about it later. I hope it wasn't too bad? Down there? You seem to have gotten out in one piece, so...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Oh. Right. Gosh, how long has it been since I-...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Okay. Alright, yes, I'll give them better positions. And I'll- I don't know. Apologize. Give them a bonus.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It's been... hard, recently. We've been working to get back home, and I guess I just... Put too much of myself into that. It's fine! Don't- Don't worry about me.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Oh. Right, your body! I can fix that! We just need to get back to the machine, and... Poof. You'll be back to normal!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...I hope. Hey, being a cow isn't so bad! If- If it doesn't work, we can make you a home here...?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Uh... It'll work. I'm sure it will work. It's always- always worked in the past! Heh...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Anyway! Let's get going!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: So... How have you been? It's been a while since our adventure at Katoa Ranch, hasn't it?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Well, you've been turned into a cow... Obviously... But besides that!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Me? Well... heh. I've been doing pretty well, all things considered. We've been gathering exiles from all over the province! Set up a city to hold us all while we work towards...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It's a long story. I can't tell you everything- not yet. But... All of us here, we don't belong here. We just want to go home.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: And- and maybe if we can find our ship again, we'll be able to prove that we're not irredeemable. That whatever we went through- that it won't define us.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...Heh. Don't- don't worry about it too much. For now, this place is enough of a safe haven for us. It'll have to be enough until we succeed.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: We're so close. I can feel it. Just... Just a little while left to go.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Anyway, uh... Here's the elevator! Just step on in, and it'll take us back to the laboratory.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: The- oh. Uh... It's nothing. Nothing to worry about.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: It just leads to... maintenance. Yep! Just- just maintenance. Nothing else.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Into the elevator now, come on! You need a key to get in anyway, and I definitely don't have one laying around!

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: ...You're worrying me, friend. Come on, let's get going. Into the elevator, let's get you back to normal.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Heh... Well, there you are! Good as new! I hope...

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: And- to, uh, compensate you for... you know... Here! One liquid emerald. I feel terrible for how our reunion ended up going... I hope you won't hold it against me?

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Uh... I really should get back to work. But- hey! Feel free to visit whenever you want! You'll be able to use the entrance at Ranol's farm.

lines.speaker: Drale
lines.line: Maybe I can tell you more about what I've been up to! That'd be nice.

lines.speaker: Javen
lines.line: Mo'in lad! We don't get many Wynn folks round 'ere.
Seems like you are in luck today, adventurer.
Cheers!

lines.speaker: Javen
lines.line: Everything alright, lad? Looking a bit pale...

lines.speaker: Javen
lines.line: Oh by the mighty founders, everything is ruined!

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: The whole aqueduct is ruined! The city’s fresh water is just draining into the ocean...

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: Hurry, please! Just head into the big trapdoor by the bushes, the controls are in there.

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: You fixed it? Everything you broke? That's one hell of a twisted personality.

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: You fixed it? Everything you broke? That's one hell of a twisted personality.

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: It’s THEM! Someone call the authorities! It’s the one who set my house on fire.

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: You did it! So you weren't lying? Ugh, I guess you might just be trustworthy.

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: You did it! So you weren't lying? Ugh, I guess you might just be trustworthy.

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: Came back to wreck the rest of my work have you? Why aren’t you all insane looking?

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: You did it? ... -I mean, at last. Eh... I guess I was too fast with my judgement for once.

lines.speaker: Corkus City Citizen
lines.line: You did it? ... -I mean, at last. Eh... I guess I was too fast with my judgement for once.

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: Why are you here? I don't mean here and now, I mean why are you on our island?--

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: You... Look at yourself. You fight in a war you did not cause. You come from a land you don’t even remember.

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: We ask ourselves why would we invite people from two lands of sin. Invite a nation of warring travellers and a nation of greedy merchants to our doors?

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: The Corkian people are above such mundane capitalism and brutality. We work as a nation to better all.

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: You have been a pawn your entire existence on this world. The worst part is you don’t even know it.

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: Do you, for example - Know the name of your ultimate enemy? The reason for the war on your land?

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: No? Didn’t think so. I have no time for this. You served your purpose, even if you did try and redeem your barbaric behaviour... Kill them!
1/12rensatougherthaniexpectedyoudontmindifiinterfereabitdoyou?

lines.speaker: Rensa
lines.line: Hmph.

lines.speaker: Javen
lines.line: Now look who we got over ‘ere! We were all wondering if you’d ever wake up.
mixedfeelingscorkuscitycitizen11
mixedfeelingscorkuscitycitizen12
mixedfeelingscorkuscitycitizen13
mixedfeelingscorkuscitycitizen21
mixedfeelingscorkuscitycitizen22
mixedfeelingscorkuscitycitizen23
mixedfeelingscorkuscitycitizen31

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Welcome to Bantisu Temple, traveler. We guide lost souls onwards, be they wandering men to town or spirits unable to exit the canyon.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: However, recently our job has become much more difficult. The canyon shakes, and changes. Often, long-buried creatures are released as the walls shift.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: And unfortunately, the worst has come to pass, that one of these creatures is hostile. The Bantisu monks of old collapsed the entrance to its cave to seal it away...

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: ...but the rubble has shifted, and the cave is open once more. We were not strong enough to defeat it then, and we are not strong enough to defeat it now.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Even trying to collapse the cave again has ended in failure, for the beast, Krolton, slays our mages and demolitionists in but an instant.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: However, the word on the wind tells tales of humans doing the impossible as a matter of rote. Krolton must be dealt with before it leaves the cave- I beg your assistance!

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: We've no time to spare. I will prepare a short spell to bring you to the cave- Please, wait outside, and prepare yourself.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: I apologize for the suddenness of this, but you must understand the urgency. We have no way of knowing when Krolton may emerge.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: We will pray for your safety, and that your spirit will not become among those we must guide out of the canyon.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Now, hold tight, and godspeed!!

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IT SEEMS I HAVE A NEW GUEST. WELCOME.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: MAKE YOURSELF COMFORTABLE. YOU'LL BE STAYING HERE FOR A WHILE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: NOTHING IS STOPPING YOU FROM TAKING A LOOK AROUND. DON'T TOUCH ANYTHING THOUGH. AND TAKE OFF YOUR SHOES AS YOU ENTER.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: WHEN YOU FEEL LIKE IT, COME TO MY OFFICE UPSTAIRS. WE HAVE A LENGTHY TALK TO HAVE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IMPRESSIVE. HOWEVER, THAT WAS SIMPLY ROUND 1, OUT OF 20. EACH ONE WILL BE PROGRESSIVELY MORE DIFFICULT THAN THE LAST. READY?

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: ...AH, THE LOOK ON YOUR FACE. PRICELESS. GIVEN MY SKULL IS SOLID AND CANNOT EMOTE, I HAVE TO GET MY FILL OF MAKING FACES SOMEHOW.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I AM SATISFIED, AND THAT'S ALL I REALLY WANTED FROM YOU.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: NOW AS IS TYPICAL FOR WINNING A QUIZ GAME AGAINST A METAPHYSICAL ENTITY, I WILL DESTROY A WINDOW WITH A CANNONBALL SO YOU MAY GO ANY TIME.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: A TECHNOLOGICAL MARVEL- THE SCREEN TURNS OFF WHEN A GUEST RUDELY LEAVES IN THE MIDDLE OF A GAMESHOW. A NICHE FUNCTION, TO BE SURE, BUT A USEFUL ONE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THESE HOURGLASSES SHOW THE LIFESPAN OF HUMANS. WHEN ALL THE SAND HITS THE BOTTOM, I GET A NEW GUEST.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: OH LOOK, HERE'S YOURS. IT SAYS YOU'VE BEEN HERE 126 TIMES IN THE LAST THREE MONTHS. SORRY, 127 NOW.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: MY MIND MUST HAVE SLIPPED, I FORGOT TO MENTION THE MASSIVE HOURGLASS. IT SHOWS HOW MUCH TIME THE WORLD HAS LEFT.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I'LL GIVE YOU TIME TO GET OVER WHAT YOU HAVE WITNESSED.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I SUGGEST YOU DON'T EAT ANYTHING THAT YOU ARE SERVED HERE, I HEARD IT IS TO DIE FOR.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IF I HAD BOUGHT ANY WHEAT THIS MORNING, I'D OFFER A BISCUIT AS CONSOLATION FOR DYING.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IT'S A SHAME, REALLY. I'M TOLD I MAKE THE BEST LITTLE CHOCOLATE CHIP ONES.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: FEET OFF THE TABLE PLEASE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IF ANYONE ASKS, YES, I AM MARRIED. JUST BECAUSE I DON'T HAVE A HEART DOESN'T MEAN THAT I CAN'T LOVE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THIS IS AN EMPTY ROOM.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: AROUND THE MANSION, THERE ARE MANY MORE EMPTY ROOMS.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THIS IS MY OFFICE. GUESS WHAT I DO HERE. HUH?

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I DIE OF BOREDOM.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: ...REALLY? NOTHING? YOU HUMANS HAVE NO SENSE OF HUMOUR.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: PLEASE TAKE A SEAT. LET'S REVIEW YOUR OPTIONS.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THIS IS THE LIBRARY, WHERE MY GUESTS COME TO SPEND THEIR TIME.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: FEEL FREE TO TAKE YOUR TIME AND READ UP. KNOWLEDGE IS POWER, AND ALL THAT.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: YOU COULD READ ALL OF THEM IF YOU LIKE, BUT THEY ARE ALL IN LATIN, AND I HEARD THAT IS NOW A DEAD LAGUAGE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IT SEEMS YOU REALLY WANTED TO KNOW WHAT WAS BEHIND THIS DOOR.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I GUESS YOU WILL GET WHAT YOU WANTED...

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: ANOTHER DOOR.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: DO YOU REALLY THINK IT WAS WORTH YOUR TIME?

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IF YOU HEAR SCREAMING, DON'T WORRY. IT'S JUST THE WALLS.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IS MY MANSION SO DULL YOU WOULD RATHER GO ROCK CLIMBING?

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I'VE HEARD THERE IS SOME GUY AT THE TOP OF SOME ICE TOWER RIPPING ME OFF.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THIS BOOK IS SO BAD, EVEN THE LONG-WINDED AND PAINFUL DEATH OF SWEENEY S. GREENVILLE IS BETTER THAN THIS.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THE REMOTE'S FIDDLY. YOU NEED TO BE SITTING ON THE COUCH FOR IT TO WORK.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I KNOW THIS SEEMS LIKE AN ODD PLACE TO BE. SITTING IN FRONT OF DEATH.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THE TRUTH IS, YOU HAVE BEEN HERE MANY TIMES BEFORE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THE CATCH IS, A MORTAL MAY NEVER BE ALLOWED TO SPEAK OF MY REALM.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: SO I MAKE EVERYONE WHO VISITS...SIMPLY FORGET.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IT'S EASIER ON EVERYONE THAT WAY. YOU WOULDN'T WANT TO TELL PEOPLE ABOUT YOUR DEATH, THAT WOULD BE WEIRD.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THIS TIME, HOWEVER, I'LL JUST HAVE TO LET YOU REMEMBER YOUR JOURNEY HERE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: WHY YOU ASK? OH, YOU WOULDN'T WANT TO FORGET THE JOURNEY OF A LIFETIME, RIGHT?

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: THAT, AND I RECEIVED SOME POSTAGE, SHALL WE SAY. SOMEONE IS INVESTED IN YOUR CONTINUED SURVIVAL.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I ALWAYS ALLOW PEOPLE THE OPPORTUNITY TO RE-ENTER THE MORTAL PLANE ANYWAY.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: CALL IT BARGAINING WITH DEATH IF YOU LIKE. TRUTH IS, I JUST GET A BIT BORED.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IF YOU WISH TO RETURN TO LIFE, AND I CAN NEVER UNDERSTAND WHY PEOPLE DO, ALL YOU HAVE TO DO IS BEAT THAT WHICH SENT YOU HERE.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IN YOUR CASE, IT IS THE CREATURE KNOWN AS KROLTON. I SIMPLY ASK YOU SPEND A BIT OF TIME HERE AND PLAY A SHORT GAME BEFORE YOU GO, IN THE OTHER UPSTAIRS ROOM.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: I DO ENJOY MY CHATS WITH HUMANS, THEY NEVER SAY ANYTHING.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: WHICH IS ODD, BECAUSE OUT OF THE TWO OF US, THEY ARE THE ONES WITH VOCAL CHORDS.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: SOMETHING I'M FINDING INCREASINGLY ANNOYING IS HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE FINDING WAYS TO BECOME IMMORTAL NOWADAYS. INTELLIGENT COMPANY IS STARTING TO GET A BIT SCARCER.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: OH, YOU ARE STILL HERE. IF YOU WANT TO LEAVE, I SIMPLY WANT A BIT OF ENTERTAINMENT BEFORE YOU DO. WOULD YOU GO TO THE GAME ROOM ON THE OTHER END OF THE MANSION?

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: WELL, I SEE YOU ARE LEAVING.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: IT WAS NICE TO HAVE YOU BACK AGAIN, I DO ENJOY YOUR VISITS.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: TO RISE BACK TO LIFE, YOU MUST DEFEAT THE ONE WHO BROUGHT YOU TO MY HANDS.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: YOU'VE MANAGED IT BEFORE SO I CAN'T SEE WHY YOU CAN'T MANAGE IT AGAIN. AFTERALL, YOU MANAGE TO KEEP DYING.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: ...OR YOU KNOW, DON'T. I DO ENJOY HAVING A LITTLE COLOUR AROUND THE MANSION.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: ...AND ANOTHER THING. GIVEN WHAT I SAID EARLIER, IT FEELS RIGHT TO LET YOU KNOW SOMETHING.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: SO LONG AS THE BEAST THAT KILLED YOU DIES BY SOMETHING YOU CAUSE, YOU WILL RETURN TO LIFE. SO BE AS RECKLESS AS YOU WANT.

lines.speaker: Death
lines.line: AND IF YOU ARE TOO RECKLESS, THAT WILL BE A VALUABLE LESSON TO YOU. SINCE KROLTON HAS NOTICED YOU AGAIN, I’LL LEAVE YOU TO IT.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Oh, thank goodness. You've returned- not free of wear, but certainly alive. Did you need to flee from Krolton, or is he...?

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Truly? The beast is dead?

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Gracious, I don't think I've ever been so relieved. Krolton was responsible for thousands of deaths long ago. You've prevented an oncoming massacre!

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Bantisu Temple owes you a great deal. Here, then- a suitable reward.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: A powerful Bantisu artifact, as reward for defeating a beast that menaced in antiquated times.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: Safe travels, human. Whether it was luck or strength that had you prevail, I pray it will not fail you in the future.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: We have a job that needs doing, but I'm afraid you're too weak. Come back when you are level 87.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: You are truly an amazing warrior. Thank you for putting an end to Krolton.

lines.speaker: Irlok
lines.line: I have written the coordinates of the cave Krolton hides in, in your quest book.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: A human? Agh! Don't worry about getting me medical attention, I've got this under control...

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: It's a broken leg. I'm already getting it treated, but I have a job to do elsewise- and a time sensitive one, too.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: I won't be able to do it like this, but it doesn't matter if I'm the one who carries it out. It just needs to be done.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: I don't work for villagers, I was hired to come here by other humans... there's something you must keep secret.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: Swear it! If you're going to take the job, and my payment for it, you must be silent about it!

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: Do you agree?

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: Good. To business then.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: There is a hidden town in the canyon here. Up in the mountains- it was built and run by humans.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: Now, the villagers have very strict rules about humans living in their lands, and it's VERY illegal.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: I was contacted by the Mayor because he is aware that the town may have become... compromised.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: The job is to figure out who and why, of course. To let this slip could collapse the treatise between our races.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: I've never been to the city in the mountains, but I was given instructions. Here, I'll write down the location in your book.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: Be aware though, they won't let you in unless the area is safe. They can't risk villagers wandering in.

lines.speaker: Narder
lines.line: Good luck.

lines.speaker: Curious Villager
lines.line: Hm? Oh, a fellow adventurer, I see! I'm sorry, but this discovery is mine to make. There's something strange about that door...

lines.speaker: Curious Villager
lines.line: Deadly gasses? Nonsense! As you can see the two of us are breathing just fine.

lines.speaker: Curious Villager
lines.line: You want me to leave? Why, so that you can have all of the glory for yourself? Ha, not a chance!

lines.speaker: Curious Villager
lines.line: The only way I'm leaving is if I can get that door open or if the whole cave starts crashing down on us.

lines.speaker: Curious Villager
lines.line: Gweh! I just had to go running my mouth about the cave collapsing! I'm out- if you have any sense you'll leave too!

lines.speaker: Eltom Guard
lines.line: Thank you for getting rid of that curious villager! We thought he'd never leave.

lines.speaker: Eltom Guard
lines.line: I've never seen you before. Who gave you access to the town?

lines.speaker: Eltom Guard
lines.line: You're here in place of the detective the mayor hired?

lines.speaker: Eltom Guard
lines.line: Normally, I wouldn't believe that, but come in. We're desperate.

lines.speaker: Eltom Guard
lines.line: If you ever need to leave and get back, I can simply open the way.

lines.speaker: Eltom Guard
lines.line: You probably should be going now. Our mayor can get impatient.

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: What are you doing here? I'm writing an important letter, this better be worth my time.

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: What? Narder sent you? Why'd he send a Ragni soldier?

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: I didn't think the army were authorized to know about Eltom, especially Fruma recruits.

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: Anyway, Eltom's secrecy is in great danger. We have found evidence of a traitor.

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: We have locked down all of the exits. No one leaves or enters without my permission.

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: We need a detective to sniff out the traitor and expose him.

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: Start by asking the citizens around here about anything suspicious they've seen.

lines.speaker: Eoric
lines.line: When you find the culprit, remember to leave him alive! The guards will take care of him.

lines.speaker: Reder
lines.line: Sorry, detective, but I haven't seen anything suspicious. In fact, I haven't even left my house for the last week.

lines.speaker: Nichye
lines.line: The only suspicious thing I've seen is a hooded man walking around. There's not many people in Eltom, so it's weird.

lines.speaker: Sybeth
lines.line: If you want to find out anything, the best person to ask is Lumilda. She's in her bakery, next to the Scroll Shop.

lines.speaker: Lumilda
lines.line: Ah, detective! What brings you to the sweet Lumilda's Bakery?

lines.speaker: Lumilda
lines.line: Hm, yes, there is a weird person coming through.

lines.speaker: Lumilda
lines.line: It's a hooded man. Never seen the face. A trouble maker, if you ask me!

lines.speaker: Lumilda
lines.line: He's been here a few times, usually writing things on a piece of paper. That man's a real mystery. No one even knows where he lives.

lines.speaker: Lumilda
lines.line: One time my grandson couldn't resist and followed the man. Last thing he saw was the man leaving through the Eastern Exit.

lines.speaker: Lumilda
lines.line: Ain't that a place to start, sweetheart?
Ah, you must be the detective. None of those half-witted Eltomites could figure it out.
I guess the grook is out of the pen then.
This town shouldn't even be here. Humans aren't allowed to settle in Gavel.
These humans couldn't be bothered to fight their own war, so they hid an entire city here.
Traitor? I'm no traitor. I'm just looking to carry out the law where it needs to be carried out. Nothing personal, yes?

lines.speaker: Ardulf
lines.line: Maybe they'll actually use “Ardulf” instead of saying “freak” once they've seen the good I can do for them!

lines.speaker: Hilan
lines.line: H-h-help!

lines.speaker: Hilan
lines.line: Hooded man... Climbed tower...

lines.speaker: Hilan
lines.line: Demanded to use a ship... I refused...

lines.speaker: Hilan
lines.line: He beat me up... And left...

lines.speaker: Hilan
lines.line: Hurry!

lines.speaker: Ardulf
lines.line: What are you doing here? Why are you protecting this illegal town?

lines.speaker: Ardulf
lines.line: The Villagers will not be happy about Eltom. This could seriously harm the Gavel-Wynn relationship.

lines.speaker: Ardulf
lines.line: You can't stop me. You wouldn't murder one of your own, would you?

lines.speaker: Ardulf
lines.line: I will tell the mayor of Thesead all about this place, and claim my reward for doing so. I will be rich and if you want to stop me you'll have to do it yourself.

lines.speaker: Thesead's Mayor
lines.line: What brings a human to my office?

lines.speaker: Thesead's Mayor
lines.line: A letter? Oh, that. The one about Eltom? Don't look so worried. The secret is safe with me.

lines.speaker: Thesead's Mayor
lines.line: Yes, I know about Eltom. After all, its mayor is my ex-husband.

lines.speaker: Thesead's Mayor
lines.line: It may seem odd, a love between a villager and a human. I know, but our race did not stop us from being in love.

lines.speaker: Thesead's Mayor
lines.line: The person who left the letter about Eltom is our son, Ardulf. As soon as Eoric found out about our child, he panicked and left me.

lines.speaker: Thesead's Mayor
lines.line: Ardulf will never be accepted as a half breed... Still, I hope he's OK.

lines.speaker: Thesead's Mayor
lines.line: Huh, oh yeah, one more thing. The switch under the table... go on, press it!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Oh hohoho! So a human has found their way to my humble dojo? Intriguing! However, I could not ask you to attempt my training til you were level 89.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Oh hohoho! So a human has found their way to my humble dojo? Intriguing! I am called Sensei Miyagi. I welcome you.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: This dojo, I have dedicated to honing skills in all of the arts- from martial prowess and mental acuity, to craftsmanship and artistry.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Many have come- traveled from all corners of the earth to this humble one's dojo to train themselves and grow stronger. I am to presume you are the same?

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Although, while I have enjoyed my life's work here, I cannot deny I am getting on in years. I seek a successor, a master of many skills to take my place.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: To the one who should master the arts, I would bequeath The Master’s Gi, a symbol of resolute skill. Of course, do not feel pressured to take over for me, hoho!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: As long as I may teach others and bring them to new heights, I am satisfied. Whether your aim be merely to sharpen your skills or to allow me to retire, you are welcomed.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: When you are ready to begin, purify yourself in the waters of the spring behind the dojo, and I will guide you to your first challenge.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Whenever you are ready to begin, purify yourself in the waters of the spring behind the dojo.

lines.speaker: Challenger Apprentice
lines.line: I have been training for years, mastering all of Sensei Miyagi's challenges but one... the physical strength challenge defeats me.

lines.speaker: Challenger Apprentice
lines.line: I trained for years hoping to achieve the Master's Gi chestplate. All of Sensei Miyagi's challenges come easy for me except for the sight challenge!

lines.speaker: Challenger Apprentice
lines.line: All of Sensei Miyagi's challenges come as a walk in the park for me, except the abstract tranquility challenge. I one day hope to conquer it and gain the Master's Gi.

lines.speaker: Challenger Apprentice
lines.line: Alas, after all my training, I can not muster the power to conquer Sensei Miyagi's combat challenge... it is the only challenge that defeats me!

lines.speaker: Challenger Apprentice
lines.line: I see you have mustered the power to defeat all four challenges. You have my utmost respect.

lines.speaker: Challenger Apprentice
lines.line: I congratulate you my friend on your success in the challenges, but the real reward in this situation is the experience, not the physical reward!

lines.speaker: Challenger Apprentice
lines.line: I congratulate you on your recent success regarding the four challenges. I envy you and your success.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Here we are then- The ⓛⓤⓕⓐⓡ Room. Here tests your agility! Even these old bones can scale this room in short order- How shall you fare?

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: I recognize your skill, and you have passed the challenge of the ⓛⓤⓕⓐⓡ Room! Hoho, but the next challenge has defeated many an apprentice.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Now, comes the ⓕⓘⓐⓣⓐ Room! Here, your combat prowess shall be put to the test. Martial skill comes easily to me...but what of your own?

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: I hear many things about human combat skill, so I believe I shall watch this challenge myself. Enter now, challenger!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Defeat the dummies, and bring their tokens to the door! Simple, yes?

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Show no fear, challenger! There is no shame in failing.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: And worry not, the ⓕⓘⓐⓣⓐ Room is reinforced against all manner of attacks. Run wild, hoho!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: It is fascinating to see how you battle. Very different from my stylings!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: And I am to recognize your combat skill, and proclaim your passage of the ⓕⓘⓐⓣⓐ Room. Well done!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Next, however, is not a challenge of physical skill, but of observation and logical reasoning, in this- the ⓒⓛⓘⓢⓣⓔ Room. Here, a puzzle awaits.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: You must discern the path in order to bring the red block to the gold block. Simple in theory...complex in practice, as are many things.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Remember this as you work- Change your perspective, and the reality changes.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: And there, I recognize your mental acuity! You have passed the ⓒⓛⓘⓢⓣⓔ Room. You are doing quite well, but many have gotten to this point and had a single point stymie them.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Welcome then, to the last challenge I offer you, held within the ⓢⓘⓣⓗⓔⓐⓒⓗ Room and cavern.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Your task here, is to become tranquil, and at peace with nature. What that entails... I leave up to you.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: There are many paths to tranquility. Whatever you choose, you will know when you have reached the point of success.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: I see it now. The troubled heart you came here with is troubled no longer. I recognize your mastery of the ⓢⓘⓣⓗⓔⓐⓒⓗ Room.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Oh hoho... It is just like a human to do what cannot be done. That is each challenge of my humble dojo, completed!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: So! While I did advise you not to feel pressured of it, I am curious, young master. Do you wish to take my place here, so I may sit these old bones down?

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: ...Ah, of course not. Despite your mastery, this is merely a single step on your journey. Needn't worry, I understand completely.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: I am certain that I will find a suitable successor before my time comes- and equally as certain that I've many a year to go, hoho!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Nevertheless, you have completed the challenges of this humble Sensei, and as such, I will provide you what was promised.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Wear this [Master's Gi] with pride, and remember this final lesson- There is never a point in life that you will stop learning. See the world and its lessons every day of your life, young master.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Hoho... Yes, this old man still has plenty of life left in him. Do not waste the gifts you have, young master.

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Of course, you wield a weapon to battle, so of course it is different from unarmed combat, hoho...

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Perhaps you may be interested in learning to fight unarmed after!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Oh, this is getting quite good. I should get a snack to eat while I watch...

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Hmhm, I'll be right back! Continue fighting- And do not worry if you finish before I return! I will be quick!

lines.speaker: Sensei Miyagi
lines.line: Ahh, there we are. Now come on, addled old brain of mine, where were we...

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: You don't seem very mighty, come back when you're level 90!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Let's go, just you and me! On a fantastic voyage across the sea!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: We'll go in search of a long-lost island, old chap! And here I have the guidance map!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: The map, oh so grand! Why, I have it here in my hand!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: It's the map to a magical place! I sure hope it doesn't vanish without a tra-

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Good grief! That raucous parrot is such a little thief!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: If we are to explore the ocean blue, that parrot you surely must pursue!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Get on it then, no time for a  nap! That thieving parrot has our map!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Perhaps these citizens may help us out, ask them about the parrot's route!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Hey-o, human! What can I do for ya?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: What can I do for you?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Oh, you know me, pal, just doin' the rounds.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Waterin' the pots, starin' at the water, potterin' the sta-

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: ...wait, scratch that last one.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You know what, I'm glad you asked.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Lots of people these days are going crazy for that 'all-natural, multiple grains, bred ethically' garbage.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Really, I wish I could see those nutters sit down and take a good bite of some raw, authentic Rye, or a hearty whole-wheat.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: That's the stuff that puts hairs on your chest, my pappy used to say. Good, strong, proper bread from out in the fields.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: We used to be farmers, you know. Out near Maltic. WHEW! Glad I moved here though! Not so many places serve better rum than good ol' Jofash!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Back to the point at hand, though, bread. Man oh man I feel like I could go on forever about this.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You know what people always miss when discussing bread, the CONSISTENCY! The consistency is consistently the most im-

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Oh, haha, 'consistently,' didn't even mean to do that. Heheh...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Ah, there you are! The ol' train of thought gets derailed sometimes, you see.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: But I can tell that you're a real enthusiast for bread!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Back to the topic at hand! Consistency! The consistency is consistently the most important part of any good loaf.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Overusin' so-called 'refined' grains is a sure and done way to get runny slop that's not fit for the pigs.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Come to think, you shouldn't feed pig refined grains anyway. It's hard on their digestion.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Of course! Digestion. A topic I'll get to later!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Anyway, whole grains are where the money's at! I'd swear it on these plants.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: What you want is a thick-crusted, chewy loaf that you can savor! Not some frail morsel that collapses under its own weight. Why, the things I've seen...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: In particular, have you seen some of the scraps sold at Ahmsord? Ridiculous!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I'll let you in on a little secret. The Sky's Kitchen's great and all, but what passes for bread there is intolerable. No substance at all!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: What you'll want to do is get it straight from the fields, right from the soil! Well, not literally, but from the countryside! Leave breadmakin' to those who've been workin' with grain before they could even walk on two legs!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Heck, I bet even I could do a better job than those snobby sauciers.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Right. Digestion. The fiber in whole-grain bread is a real lifesaver.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Did you know that whole-grain bread has four times the fiber of white bread? Now you do!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Helps keep you full and fit. Want to avoid lookin' like a loaf of white bread yourself? Fiber's your man.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Nothin' beats a rich, fresh-ground fresh-baked loaf with a slab of flat-iron steak. Red meat and fiber makes a real man, as my pappy once said.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Oh, how time flies. Where was I? Right, white bread.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: That stuff's poison, I tell you! Not a lick of nutritional value!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: It's more milk and sugar than bread! Hardly somethin' you'd want to eat, never mind something for which you'd pay extra!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Those hawkers can pretend that it's an upper-crust good all they want, but we all know it's just a waste of dough.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Heheh, I did it again! Sorry, sorry, I'll get the train back on track. Heh...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Blendin' grains? Why jumble the flavors and textures? Just make two loaves of bread instead of one! Or several, if we're talkin' about more than two types of grain.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Say, that reminds me! Bread's probably the most versatile food. You can make it from just about any type of grain.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: But just because you can doesn't mean that you should. Who could stomach somethin' like 'Oatmeal-Bran Fusion Delight'? WHO WOULD EVEN MAKE BREAD OUT OF OATS?!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Just a waste of food, in my opinion. Sure, it may be the hottest new culinary sensation now, but it'll die out like any other idiotic fad in just days. I'm positive that nobody's eatin' it for the taste, that's for sure. Like 'Seven Colors of the Grainbow,' or 'Hearty Hemp-tastic,' or...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: ...and don't get me started on 'Pain au Cinfras'! But really, Oatmeal-Bran Fusion Delight is among the worst. Oh! That reminds me about a better use for oats.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: If you want to avoid bein' three sheets to the wind after a busy night of Jofash Rum, then eat a hearty bowl of oatmeal.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Sounds crazy, I know. But it actually works. Take it from me; I've tried it!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: While anythin' made of grain helps, oats are particularly good at this.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: And I'd bet my bread that you'd rather eat oatmeal than Oatmeal-Bran Fusion Delight, whatever that's supposed to be.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Though it seems like you just can't get a good loaf of bread nearby. Sure, there's sailin' biscuits, but that hardly qualifies!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I can't stomach the fancy stuff, so I just make my own. Not only is it cheaper, but it also tastes much better.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: It isn't too difficult. Besides the obvious, you'll just need some salt and yeast. Grab something to write with, y'hear? Take some notes!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Ready? Right, let's get started! The less ingredients you use, the closer you'll get to makin' a real loaf! Not the wannabe poundcakes eaten by wannabe spendthrifts.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: There's a common misconception that you need sugar for yeast to start risin'. Not true!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Give it some time, and bread without sugar will rise just as well. If you want somethin' good, you need to put in the time and effort for it!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Get it right, and you'll have the perfect taste and texture for nothin' more than a few hours of your time!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Let me make it clear: you don't want sugar in your bread. It'll do a number on its taste and your teeth.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I'll cover the taste first. The sugar fights with the raw, savory flavors of an otherwise respectable loaf of bread.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: It also fights with your teeth. Bread's quite sticky as it is, and the sugar doesn't do it any favors.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Why, I can still remember the time that I got a cavity. Cried my eyes out, I did.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Eventually, my pappy had enough, and he went for the ol' string-on-a-doorknob trick. He got me good there, though it took him a few tries.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Ah, it seems like I got distracted. Back to the topic at hand.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You aren't goin' to get quite as much of an effect on your digestion than coarse-ground whole-grain bread. It keeps most of the fiber intact, after all.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You know how fruit juice contains next to no fiber because none of it goes into the juice? It's the same deal with white bread.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Fruit juice was banned in my household. As my pappy liked to say, a real man only drinks hard spirits and the sweat runnin' down his face! Though I wasn't allowed to have the former, not yet at least! Heheh! So I drank milk instead.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Say, if you haven't done so already, try bread dipped in milk! Go on! There's nothin' quite like it. Don't accidentally drop the bread into the milk, of course.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You'll end up with a bloated mess with the consistency of a sponge. And you should know by now that consistency is everythin'!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: While we're on the subject of milk, do you know how some folks can't drink it? Oh, yes, they can try, but sooner or later their belly will protest.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: It's the same deal with bread! Stick with whole-grain, nothin' added. That way, you don't have to worry about surprise milk appearances and whatnot.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You got that? Let me know when you're ready for more. Say, you know what? I oughta talk a bit slower to help you digest what I'm sayin'. Oh! 'Digest'! I did it again! Heheh...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Right, then, somethin' that really peeves me is people who use bakin' powder. What's wrong with some good ol' yeast?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Too little of it, and it'll go plum flat in the oven. Just a little too much of it, and your bread's goin' to be as bitter as wormwood!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: The only way to get a size that's just right is the long way! Wait until the yeast works its magic, and bake it right as it reaches a good size.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: There's also nothin' quite like the smell of yeast as it causes the dough to rise! Works up quite the appetite, it does.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Some people put the cart before the horse and think that yeast works like bakin' powder. Try that, and you'll end up with some scorchin'-hot bricks in your oven.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: No, you have to do it right, and doin' it right means leavin' some of the work to the yeast.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Unless you like flat breads. I can't see why anyone would, though. Bread's supposed to be puffy and chewy, not some dough jerky!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Though that may not be the case for some other pastries. For one, I've never once heard of a pie with a chewy crust.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Really, the beauty in bread lies with its simplicity! No complicated steps, no chances for the dough to rebel. Certainly not as fickle as somethin' like a cream puff.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: If you treat the dough with respect, the bread will respect you in turn. It's simple stuff, really! No finnickin' around with stiff peaks, or needin' half a dozen bowls to mix in, or getting a flaky dough just right, or...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: ...and not to mention that just about everythin' needs butter in some shape or form! Really, what's with it? It's not like the stuff grows on trees!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Makin' the pastry shiny. Makin' it taste rich. Makin' the dough thick. There's no end to it! Bread's so much simpler to handle.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Though some people insist on putin' butter in the bread. Not just on it, but in it! There's more butter than bread at that point!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I don't have anythin' against butter itself, mind you. It's great on toast! Just I think that it oughta stay on the toast rather than in it.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Not to mention there's a time, place, and occasion for it. If you put butter on everythin, you're goin' to get sick of it real quickly. Eat it in moderation! Your tongue and your emerald pouch will thank you.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Of course, there's always margarine, but why settle for somethin' inferior? You shouldn't settle for anythin' less than the quality you'd expect from your bread!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Though, now that I look at it, bread does get a reputation for bein' a breakfast food. That's ridiculous! It's got a place in every meal of the day!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Sandwiches? They've got bread in 'em. Casseroles? Any respectable one has it as a shell. Bread sticks? It's in the name, for cryin' out loud!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Done right, and it's also great as a side. I already mentioned havin' a fresh-ground fresh-baked loaf of hole grain with a slab of flat-iron steak, but really, a well-sliced loaf and some dippin butter can transform a family dinner into a banquet!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: They're almost as versatile as potatoes! Actually, even more so, I'd say!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: As my pappy liked to say, a real man's got to earn his daily bread through his own toilin'. As you can see, I've taken his advice to heart!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: ...I feel that I'm missin' somethin' important that I wanted to discuss. Hang on for a bit, would you?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Ah, of course! I can't believe that I forgot! I wanted to cover some thoughts about bread consistency.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Namely, the two extremes: too chewy and not chewy enough. I already spoke on hardly chewy bread plenty, but there's such a thing as too much of a good thing.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: And in this case, bread chewiness is the good thing. You don't want your bread to be too chewy, got it?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Too chewy's a step right towards bread that's outright rubbery. Your teeth'll bounce right off it!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Sure, too much give in the dough's awkward and sets you up for bitin' your own tongue, but too firm of a loaf can lead to much of the same.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: They always say never to bite off more than you can chew, but you oughta be careful not to bite off any less than that, either!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: No, just right and chewy's what you want. Don't settle for anything more or less!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Hmm, come to think. You seem really interested in discussin' bread with me!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Lean in for a second, would you? I've got somethin' important to say.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Listening? Right! Ah, sorry, I didn't mean to shout in your ear.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You're just about the only person that I've been able to have an honest conversation about bread with.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Usually, bread gets brushed off as some kind of dull fodder. Dismissed as too borin' and plain, I tell you! That's what leads to unnecessary excess as people try to make it into something that it's not.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: But us? We're different, we're visionaries, and we know the truth about what really makes a good loaf!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Tell ‘em off, I say! They can't follow the thoughts of bread enthusiasts like you and I otherwise!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Ah! Right, I never did get to answerin' your question. About my favorite type of bread, that is...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Plain ol' coarse-ground wheat.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Sure, it may be simple, but if you were payin' any attention at all, you'd know for sure why that's everythin' that I'm lookin' for.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: And that just about sums up the basics! Let me know if you want to hear anythin' more.

lines.speaker: Bread Enthusiast
lines.line: Let's continue! Have you ever seen a baker wearin' a fancy hat? Have you ever wondered how that corresponds to how well they bake bread compared to somethin' else?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Aye!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Hah! That crazy coot, you're chattin' with that feller?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: He's wack-o, y'know... Singing his songs all day, somethin's not right upstairs.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: You do you, buddy, but I'd steer clear.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: A parrot? You know where you are, right?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I see plenty parrots everyday, I don't keep track.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I'll keep an eye or two out for one, though, sound peachy?

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Welcome, welcome! How can I be of service to you, o' traveler?

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: How can I be of service to you, o' traveler?

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Why, I am glad you asked, though I knew you would, of course!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: For you see... I am gifted with foresight, the futures memories come to me like no other!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: For the low, low price of [1 LE] , your future will be foretold!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: What do you say? Ha-ha, I ask out of courtesy, for I know what you will choose.

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Relend! Oh, the spirits have much to say of that man...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: More than most, he has seen... More than perhaps most should...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Do not be fooled, o' traveler! Many a map has been snatched from his gnarled grasp...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...perhaps your fortune shall reveal more! Worth a shot, hey?

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Aha... another one who follows the winged reaper...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Yes... o' traveler... I have seen the parrot many a time... yes, indeed...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Today, however, the wraith flies a unique way, one my eyes have not glimpsed.

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: The keeper of the Tavern by my southern stall-mate will know its whereabouts...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...be wary, o' traveler.

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: A wise choice, though expected, o' traveler!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Now... I must consult the spirits...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Aha! O' traveler! Your fortune is as clear to me as the sky on a very clear day!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: You...

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...will grow a little bit older, very soon!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...are being watched!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...are really nice!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...will feel disappointed!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...are going to lose [1 LE]!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...should've watched your step!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...were homeless!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...are now breathing manually!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...will find prosperity!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...enjoyed local cuisine!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...really like bread!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: ...are going to get... a refund? What!? Oh, come on!

lines.speaker: Jofash Clairvoyant
lines.line: Hello... hello! You have said... Hello!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Oh.. H-hello...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: C-Can I help you..?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Uh? O-oh, yes, sorry...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I'm doing j-just fine... Just.. I'm just fine...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I feel p-pretty good actually.

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Uh? I'm just... uh...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I'm n-not sure... uh, actually...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: ...w-what are you doing?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Uh? R-Relend..? Rel and w-who...?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Uh.. I-I'm sorry, I don't know who you m-mean...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I'm, uh, well I'm, uh...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: ...sorry, I d-don't know...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Ah... A-Alright...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Uh? O-oh a parrot?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: L-L-Like a b-bird?! I l-love birds!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I will look for it... Human...

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: Y-you can count o-on me... I will find the bird.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: Howdy, welcome to Jo's Tavern. What can I get for ya?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: What can I get for ya?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: Oh, me? I'm doing just fine, mate.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: This place is pretty popular among sailors, so we get a decent amount a' traffic for such a small place.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: 's the only thing keeping me here, quite honestly. Lots'a crazies in this little town, it's nice to meet some normal folk, ya know?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: One Nemract Whiskey, comin' up!

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: One Jofash Rum, comin' up!

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: One Llevigar Pinot, comin' up!

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: One Ahmsord Absinthe, comin' up!

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: ...you sure you like this stuff?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: ...Relend? That old guy out front?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: Typical resident here, if you ask me, totally nuts.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: 's a weird one for sure, always speakin' in his little rhymes. Somethin's really snapped up there.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: I've had loads a' folk come in here real angry 'bout the guy.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: 'pparently he takes 'em for joyrides 'round the sea and get's all sorts'a labour out of 'em, then just drops 'em back here.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: Ha! Guess he knows how to get some free work done, I'll give 'im that. Maybe he ain't so insane after all, eh?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: ...Oh, you're goin' out with Relend, hey? Even after all I said?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: Heh, have fun, mate. Lot'sa treasure out there, eh?

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: Well, whatever, mate. Yeah, the parrot's out on the patio, to the right of me, last I checked.

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: Have a nice trip, mate, if ya can catch it, that is. Heh...

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: No worries, let me know if you need anythin'

lines.speaker: Tavern Owner
lines.line: ...Didn't you hear me, mate? It's out on the tavern patio, to the right of me. The drinks not got t' ya already, has it?

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: H-H-HUMAN!!!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I-I-I SAW IT!!! THE B-BIRD!!!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: IT'S IN T-THE TREE, HERE! IT'S HERE!!!

lines.speaker: Jofash Resident
lines.line: I f-found it... The bird...

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: You have the map! Thank you for the assistance!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Now let us set sail, and cover some distance!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I'm sorry, new friend, to be of haste!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: However I sense power in you, and we have no time to waste!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: So off we go, to find an old friend, that would be ideal.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I'll captain the ship up at the steering wheel.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Welcome aboard, I suppose I can consider you my first mate. Although, it appears we now have a problem on our plate.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: You see those spikes all around my boat? Well, we're about to ram into them like a goat!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I'd steer around them, but it appears the wheel is all smashed. I need you to craft a new one before we both get splashed!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: There's a Crafting Table at the front near all the crates. Now hurry up, else the ocean floor awaits!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: There's a Crafting Table at the front near all the crates. Now hurry up, else the ocean floor awaits!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Ah, thank you for helping me in my time of need. Let's maneuver through these spikes at a steady speed!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Although, at the last minute, there is something I have to confess. I have never captained a ship with any success.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I think before we get into any real danger, we should turn around. Could you man the wheel and get us back to solid ground?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I think before we get into any real danger, we should turn around. Could you man the wheel and get us back to solid ground?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Now you're the captain, hope the sea's not making you nauseous. Steer this ship, but you'll have to be cautious!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Nice steering, although your maneuvers are a bit brash. Hey, watch out! I think we're about to-

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Trying to play captain, eh? Can't say I blame you. After all, who wouldn't want to sail the ocean blue?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: As you can see, my ship has become a shipwreck! Now please help me, I am trapped in the lower deck!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Amazing work, seems you got below deck rather quickly! You're going to have to get through this wreckage to free me!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Wow, so you managed to work your way through after all! Maybe to free me, you can use that cannonball?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Thank you for freeing me, now let's leave this mess! Although, I don't know how  to do that, I have not even a guess.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: When the ship crashed, it was buried beneath the sand! But the good news is that we're finally back on land!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: We should probably get out of this place, it feels rather small. Perhaps you can try to break through that weak spot in the wall?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: We should probably get out of this place, it feels rather small. Perhaps you can try to break through that weak spot in the wall?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: It looks like we're going to be stuck here for a while. Come and speak to me so we can find a way off of this isle!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Gateway Island... we've finally arri ved. I'm just thankful that we survived.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Well, all this adventuring has me hungry for stew. We'll need ingredients, whatever's on the island will have to do.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Meat is definitely something we need to reap, try and get [10 Raw Mutton] from those sheep.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: And perhaps you could get [5 Edible Mushrooms] from the western cave, just make sure not to get the kind that will send me to my grave.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I feel like something is missing from this medley. Oh, how about you get [1 Coconut] from atop that tree?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: And if you could fetch [7 Berries], that would just make me merry!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Check your quest book if you ever need a recap. And to make sure you don't get lost, take the map.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Take a look at your quest book if you forgot your project, this island has supplies we ought to collect!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: If you need to create something, there are utilities on the beach. I know that my old friend is someone we shall finally reach.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Well, this stew has a rather odd flavour. But any food we can get here I shall savour.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: What remains of my ship won't protect us very well. We'll need to find shelter, as you can clearly tell.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: To the east, I can just barely make out a tent. Go and look for my friend there, I'm simply hellbent!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: So the tent was all empty and run-down? All of this bad news is making me frown.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Allow me to borrow your map for a second. We'll have to find him somewhere else, I reckon.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I know we can come up with a solution using our wits. Perhaps we can craft an explosive to blow that big rock to bits!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Let's think of some materials we can get here. There isn't much on this island, I fear.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: First we're going to need [5 Gritty Sand]. Where to get it? Try the beach at the back of the island.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Next up is [Sawdust], you'll need three. I think the best place to search would be the largest tree.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Finally, [1 Black Powder], found in a place that is very unique. You'll have to brave your way to the volcano's peak.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: You'll need those items to craft the bomb, I just told you where to look. If you forget what you need to find, check your content book.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Incredible, the explosive blew right through the stone!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Let us progress into this mysterious zone.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: For adventurers like us, an incredible cave, perfect to explore.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Surely where my old friend ventured - just as I swore!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Long ago, a strong adventurer like yourself reached out to me for a wonderful sail. It truly is a gripping tale!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: We became the best of friends on our quest. But then he vanished, oh how he was the best.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: And we've finally made it to where he'd been. I can't wait to see him again, I don't know where to begin!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: A mystical portal! This must be where my old friend got lost!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: We must go through and find him, whatever the cost.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I can't believe it! I simply can't speak!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I always told the others I wasn't a freak. Old friend, I'll look for you until the bitter end!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: A foreign land filled with danger, to the brim...

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: It must be where he vanished to, regardless of how grim.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: My friend... Where do you think we are?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Wherever it is, I feel that we're being overseen from afar.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: With all this danger, I do hope my good friend is still okay.

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: My goodness! Keep your wits about, we may be in for a fray!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Aagh... new friend.. are you there?

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: Don't...give up... we must find him, I swear...

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: I promise I'll find him, I'll do it, without a single scar!

lines.speaker: Relend
lines.line: AAARRGHHHHH!
Oh?! Hold on, is anyone there..!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Why hello there! Whatcha doin' here? I'm Ava!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Want a quick job? How 'bout helpin' me out?! That was perfect timing!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Y'see, while the other Avos hate it, I just find electromagic so fascinating!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Look, I think I got a breakthrough invention. If it works... Oh man...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I just need to harness some nature magic, and there's an amazing source in the chief's hut. Ya comin'?

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Don't you worry about rewards! I got you! See ya' there!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Hey! You showed up! Listen up, here's the plan...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: There's a small museum inside the hut with all kinds of trophies.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Our chief is quite the talkative fella, and I can guarantee he'd love to tell you stories.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: That should keep him and his guards busy. And that's where I come in!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I'll take that chance to sneak behind the throne, where our sacred totem is. I'm not stealing it, don't worry!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I'm a little clumsy, but I'm sure I can count on ya'! No matter what, keep the chief busy!

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: Greetings, human. Welcome back.

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: So, what brings you here, hm?

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: Oh, you want to learn more about us... Of course, of course!

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: We have a room where I can show you some of our history.

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: You're in luck, I'm in a good mood. Follow me then.

lines.speaker: Avos Chief
lines.line: Ah, history first! Great, great!

lines.speaker: Avos Chief
lines.line: Gah! You startled me!

lines.speaker: Avos Chief
lines.line: Ah, our wisteria tree! Yes...

lines.speaker: Avos Chief
lines.line: Oh, this is quite the important tome.

lines.speaker: Avos Chief
lines.line: Right, the feathery crate!

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: What was that?! I'll check.

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: Someone broke in? But why? Anyone can use our totem...

lines.speaker: Avos Chieftain
lines.line: I don't get it. They could've just asked...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Oh, hey! Thanks for earlier. You were a big help.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Truth is, anyone can use that totem. They just don't like me very much.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Anyway, we got what we needed, and it's promising! Now onto the next part...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Y'see, I managed to bottle up some of our magic, but I still need Corkian stuff.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Fortunately for us, there's a shop outside the city. Though, things might get complicated...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: A bunch of Corkians aren't too fond of... Us. I just think you should come along with me, y'know?

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Here, I wrote the coords into that book of yours. It's a bit far, so come on out and I'll give you a lift!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Alright, if you want a lift, tell me, or you could just walk!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Not sure why you'd do that when I'm right here though!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Alright, buckle up, we're taking off!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Still holding on? We're almost there!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Here we are! Enjoyed the lift? I'm a great form of fast travel, right?!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Well, this was my first time using this magic magnet on people, but...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Or I guess you could just leave, that's cool too...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Ah, finally! I could've taken you there y'know!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Honestly, I just wanted to test something on you... Oh well!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: This is the shop! I think we can buy an Enhanced Potential Microchip here.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I need you to accompany me.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: If I'm with a human, surely they'll sell one, right?

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: You go first, I'll follow you.

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper
lines.line: Hmpf. What are you doing in here, Avo?!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: So-uh, I was, y'know, wonderin' if you had any-

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper
lines.line: Huh?!

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper
lines.line: There's NO WAY I'm selling anythin' to an Avo! Shoo! Get out!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: But...!

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper
lines.line: OUT!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I... can't believe this.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I am NOT giving up! To hell with all this!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Here, go in yourself and ask. I'll cover the cost later.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I'll stand back. CLEARLY this guy is too STUCK up to- Ugh, I'm getting angry! Just go in again.

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper
lines.line: Huh?! I made myself clear! You were with her!

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper
lines.line: I'm closing for today, I cannot stand this! OUT!!

lines.speaker: Shopkeeper
lines.line: Oh, and don't even think about even approaching MY shop!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Hang tight! He's gone crazy!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Urgh, this guy's nuts. Hmm...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I'm... surprised he kicked you out, too. Maybe he's a patriot?

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Well, anyway, we need a plan. I don't wanna wait this out.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Look, this guy has to have a control panel somewhere. Maybe we can neutralize the robots.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: That stuff hates water, y'know? So I'll go fetch some in the meantime.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I'd like to NOT get zapped by a forcefield, so I'll sneak inside once we're done with that.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Got it? Find the control panel. It should be somewhere around the house. Talk to me once you're ready.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Good luck, then! I'll be back once you find the control panel and get inside!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Here we are! Good job! Alright, let's see...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Wait... Why are there... Buttons... Everywhere??

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I feel like soaking everything would be quite the mistake.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: And none of them are labelled! What is that?!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Look, your choice. What should we neutralize first?

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Left, huh? Well, let's see how that goes.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Alright, let's soak this.
!safetyteleportationsequenceactivated!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: TELEPORTATION?!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Center... I guess the most important stuff could be here. In theory. I wouldn't count on it.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Huh! This wasn't that bad. And... I see something poking out, hold on...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Haha! I think that's what we're looking for!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Look, I still want to make it up to the guy. I really don't want to be the villain of his story.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I'll meet you back at the Workshop. You can go on ahead.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Right, right. Stand back, just in case.
[!] ERROR! Defense protocols shutdown...

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Oh wow. You got the right one, first try! How'd you know?

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Well, good job. I still want to make it up to the poor guy though.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Just meet me back at the Workshop, I'll be there!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Ouch!

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: Sorry about all the trouble I caused... I hope this makes it up to you.

lines.speaker: Ava
lines.line: I hope that human's alright... I managed to find the microchip right away, after all.

lines.speaker: Ava
