lines.line: Quiet. Dwarven whelp...we will not go quietly. AWAKEN.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: I can't believe this... That bone was part of the ritual?! Agh, how could we have been so STUPID! You're all lucky we prepared for this!!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: You need to get inside him. He's still chained! The amulet will protect you from the heat! Freeze him from the inside out!!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: EVERYONE, STOP THIS! RIGHT NOW!! IT'S OVER!!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Open your eyes for once in your lives!! You see that?! Behind me! THAT was going to be the end result!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Garaheth would have killed every one of us, damn it! Are you that short-sighted that you can't see this?!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Everyone here is to blame, except the human who helped stop this! The Doguns were already exiled, they wouldn't have hurt anyone!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: But we couldn't just let ANYTHING be! You always need more glory, more, more, MORE! Don't you, Draani? I'm ashamed to be your lineage!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: And you, Doguns! I...I pitied you. You were wronged, but you resort to this? You'd doom the world over to spite the Dwarves? Is that it?!

lines.speaker: Dogun Chieftain
lines.line: Whelp. You do not understand. To be persecuted...and see your people tortured...hunted.

lines.speaker: Dwarven Commander
lines.line: You all deserve it! You attacked our ancestors for sport! Eye for an eye, have you heard of it? It's only fair!

lines.speaker: Dogun Chieftain
lines.line: Imbeciles...your stories are not true. We... We lived through the war. You took everything...and suffered none.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: I've been trying to tell BOTH of you that the monarchy has been spreading lies for centuries! One bad king doesn't mean the whole species is a loss!

lines.speaker: Dogun Chieftain
lines.line: Shut your mouth. Even now...you trample on the bones of our god... You have taken everything from us...

lines.speaker: Dogun Chieftain
lines.line: This earth is stained by you. We...we shall burn you...and scatter your ash to the wind!

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: DON'T YOU DARE! STOP, RIGHT NOW!

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: Axelus!

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: You would... You would kill a savior...?

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: No, no! No no no, this can't be happening! H-Hang on, we'll save you, I...I'll do something, I...

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: Y-You DEMONS! MONSTERS! I'll avenge you, Axelus, j-just give me time-

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: AGH, SHUT UP! SHUT...ack... Q-Quiet. Listen to one damn word from my mouth, Draani... For once in your miserable life.

lines.speaker: Axelus
lines.line: Tell. The. TRUTH!! G-gaagh...you know that's th...the only way to stop this. Swallow your pride, you...old fool...

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: I...I... Axelus... He...he called me Draani...why did...?

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: Men, stand down. This... This war is over! I will not have one more life lost! Touch the Doguns and I'll personally behead you!

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: Chief, I...I ask of you but an hour of your time. If you are willing to negotiate...

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: Ah, you've arrived. I...actually remember you from earlier. So you and...

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: A-and...

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: ...you knew my son. Were helping him try to put an end to this, before everything was too far gone. Heh...apologies, for that.

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: Paku and I have had a long discussion about the wisdom of youth over the old. You all were right. I needed to swallow my pride.

lines.speaker: Dogun Chieftain
lines.line: We agreed upon a peace treaty... A new city... The Dwarves will aid us in building it.

lines.speaker: Dogun Chieftain
lines.line: All hostilities...will end. My people will...be free to roam the caverns. It has been...too long.

lines.speaker: King of Rodoroc
lines.line: And the entombed Doguns at Courag will be reconstituted, as well, supposing that is a possibility.

lines.speaker: The Secretary
lines.line: Hello, welcome to Ynnos’ facility.

lines.speaker: The Secretary
lines.line: Oh, you're here about the job vacancy? Well, you’re a little late.

lines.speaker: The Secretary
lines.line: There might still be time, just sneak in to the conference room behind me.

lines.speaker: The Secretary
lines.line: How's the mission going?

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: *Ahem* Welcome, everyone.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: I am Ynnos, one of the leading scientists in Gavel. You’re here because.. Well you read the help wanted sign.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: Allow me to explain the situation we’re in. It’s a series of unfortunate events. I study the amazing properties of crystals and other geodes.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: I was funded by a private organisation, however that seems to have stopped. So.. We had to make cuts in the budget.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: One of those, was using cheaper rope. While moving the crystal across Ahmsord, well, it snapped. The crystal fell.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: I can not stress the value of that crystal. It had many unique properties that are allowing me to understand why the sky islands float the way they do.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: They hold the very key to restoring this land to being whole once more... But it’s gone.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: Fortunately, I detected an impact. It’s hit something down in the void. We’re not sure what, however or how deep.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: Your mission will be to retrieve the crystal in a specially designed ship to withstand the void. We barely scraped it out of the budget, so try to bring it back in one piece.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: If you think you are not up for the challenge, leave now...

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: When you think you are ready, exit the room behind me and meet me at the dock as soon as possible.

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: Attention crew members.

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: This is the ship's mechanic. There appears to be a fault on the lower deck. I request urgent assistance.

lines.speaker: Arlene
lines.line: I wonder what the mechanic is doing?

lines.speaker: Arlene
lines.line: He has been screaming and crying for a while now. I hope everything is alright down there.

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: Ah finally! One of the air pipes has shattered, we need to patch it up ASAP!

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: Quick, head into the room behind me and line up the white glass with the blue blocks. I'll control things from here!

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: Oh wow, thanks for the help! You should head up to the resting room and take a nap before we arrive at the first island.

lines.speaker: Burne
lines.line: Did you just come up from the basement?! There were some pretty worrying sounds down there!

lines.speaker: Burne
lines.line: You should probably check with the mechanic if you haven't already.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: We have encountered out first island, 100m down. Crew members, climb up the ladder and search the island for the crystal.

lines.speaker: Manny
lines.line: Who would've thought that the crystal fell that far...

lines.speaker: Manny
lines.line: But after all, there's still a lot ahead of us!

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: We've arrived at the next void island.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: The void islands are really different from Gavel... Or are we still even in Gavel?

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Anyway, let's explore the island, look for the crystal, and return to Ahmsord!

lines.speaker: Rex
lines.line: Hmm. Strange, I didn't think plants could grow down here.

lines.speaker: Rex
lines.line: Apparently I was wrong. They look rather sickly, though.

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: This is just trash!

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: Do the people of Ahmsord just throw their garbage out the window or what?

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: Have you found the crystal? Because I haven't.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Have you looked around for the island for the crystal yet?

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: If you haven't found anything, jump back in the submarine and I'll take us down to the next one.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Oh my, what are these creatures!?

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: They are attacking the windshield in the front room, it looks like it's about to break any moment!

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Quick, you! Come to the cockpit and press on the window to scare them off!

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Get out of here and try again!

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: This is not good, the creatures destroyed part of the windshield.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: We can't continue much longer with a broken windshield, we'll have to repair it at another island.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Ynnos said the void has pockets of toxic gas... Go take a nap, I'll wake you up when we're there.

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: Pfft. I would've done a better job saving the windshield.

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: Too bad I was in another room.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Attention crew. We have arrived at the second island, 300m down. We cannot progress without making some emergency repairs.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Crew, please disembark and search resources to help repair the ship. We need glass and some kind of glue.

lines.speaker: Burne
lines.line: I'm bored, I want to go back home.

lines.speaker: Burne
lines.line: I just came because I wanted the reward, I'm not planning on helping.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: The void creatures did heavy damage to our craft, we need to repair the submarine.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: I'm not sure what we'll find here, but we'll need some glue and glass...

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: I doubt we'll find those exact things, so get resourceful!

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Bring me 5 Sand Substitutes and 10 Glue Substitutes, that should be enough.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: We'll need 5 Sand Substitutes and 10 Glue Substitutes to repair the ship.

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: Oh no, this isn't good. The windshield is destroyed...

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: I thought this trip was going to be easy.

lines.speaker: Manny
lines.line: Huh, sand?

lines.speaker: Manny
lines.line: This sand must've fallen from the sky islands, but why is it red?

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Ech! What is this stuff? Well, this should do the trick.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: The mechanic and I will start repairing. It'll take a while, so enter the submarine and rest up.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: We'll continue the trip when we've repaired the ship.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Go rest up; The mechanic and I can take care of this ourselves.

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: This is the mechanic, requesting urgent assistance in the basement!

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: Toxic gas has leaked in through the submarine's vents, someone will have to manually close them.

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: I'll control things from here, someone get down to the lowest level and close those vents!

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: What's that smell?

lines.speaker: Kantor
lines.line: It smells really...sterile? Does this mean I have to work...?

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Attention crew. We have arrived at the next island 700m down.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Disembark and start the search for the crystal.

lines.speaker: Captain Olof
lines.line: Let's hope it's here... I don't know how much more void my body can handle.

lines.speaker: Rex
lines.line: Look out! soldier, we'll build a bridge to the other island whilst you defend us from the mobs!

lines.speaker: Manny
lines.line: Don't die back there!

lines.speaker: Jesp
lines.line: Keep fighting! We're almost halfway to the other side!

lines.speaker: Arlene
lines.line: Almost done!

lines.speaker: Manny
lines.line: Hey, the bridge is ready!

lines.speaker: Rex
lines.line: We didn't find the crystal here either. Maybe it just fell in the void?

lines.speaker: Manny
lines.line: No, it must have hit an island. The scientist said he detected a collision.

lines.speaker: Rex
lines.line: Wait... What's that sound?

lines.speaker: Many
lines.line: The ropes are snapping! Quick! Abandon ship!

lines.speaker: Antrus
lines.line: The void does strange things toooo our bodies. Just look at us! We've lived down here for one thousand years without dying.

lines.speaker: Antrus
lines.line: It's like we haven't even aged.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: Whoooooooo are you!?

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: A...HUUUUUUMAN!? In the void?

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: Someone dropped a boooook about you people! Warriors! Workers!

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: Ah. Yoooou want to know about this place?

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: Well... We were once Villagers. I think we still are, a bit.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: For some reason, 1000 years agoooo. The sky islands ruptured.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: Some stayed. Others fell. We somehow survived the fall into the vooooid.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: How we have lived for so long, I doooo not know. But one thing we know for sure. The void provides.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: We are stuck here now. The void has forever changed our physiology.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: The crystal yoooou are looking for fell on this island. But...

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: We need it. It will aid us for years.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: We have very limited resources here. That’s why a power source like this is soooo valuable.

lines.speaker: Celuuse
lines.line: If you go to the east, you will find Rontaid, our chief scientist. He'll know what to doooo.

lines.speaker: Vonlus
lines.line: The crops didn't adapt like we did.

lines.speaker: Vonlus
lines.line: Let's hope the kitchen keeps throwing out all that food. The void always provides...

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: WHAT...WHO...Humans in the void!?

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: Well, looks like the book we found wasn't fiction after all!

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: This crystal is going toooo be our saviour. I was trying to create one of my own, you know.

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: I think I have the formula, but we don't have what we need to make it.

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: Instead of taking this crystal back, why don't I exchange it for the recipe?

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: That way, you can make however many crystals youuuu want, and we can keep this one.

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: Here's the recipe, give it to a scientist or someone a bit...smarter than yourself. No offense.

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: A platform was lowered from the surface a while ago at your crash site, as well. If youuuu wish to return, follow this path, I made a shortcut.

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: I hope you make use of our science.

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: We don't want another village to fall down here... I'm not sure we could provide for even more people.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: You survived! Where is everyone else?

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: I knew some must have died... But all of them?

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: Well... At least I don't have to pay them! Hah!

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: ...That was heartless of me, I'm sorry. The rope we used was too weak to hold you down there.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: My calculations didn't account for the void's physics, it seems.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: At least we got you back in one piece. You can tell us what happened.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: Well I'll be damned. I'll start sending post down there! We can work together.

lines.speaker: Scientist Ynnos
lines.line: Better to keep everything that happened here a secret. I don't want to lose what little funding I have. This recipe is genius! Here, take this, as well as your money.

lines.speaker: The Secretary
lines.line: Welcome back, I know what happened... Don't blame yourself, it's not your fault that your crewmates are gone.

lines.speaker: The Secretary
lines.line: Actually, Ynnos didn't think there would be any survivors...

lines.speaker: Secretary
lines.line: Hey! Get away from there!

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: Back again, I see. That Ynnos is a rather kind fellow.

lines.speaker: Rontaid
lines.line: He is trying to make arrangements to send proper shipments of supplies down here.

lines.speaker: The Secretary
lines.line: Welcome to Ynnos' research facility! Hello, how can I help you?

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Ah, bonjour! Welcome to my restaurant, allow me to lead you to your seat-

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Oh, do my eyes decieve me? Serait-ce possible?!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: It is you... the novice soldier turned hero of legends! Who would have thought?!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: I have heard tales of your exploits across the lands, mon ami! Je suis honoré! Someone like you sitting in my restaurant!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Je suis, bien sûr... Le Chef Hamsey! Famed across the lands for my flavours, as you are for your weapon!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: I boast, I boast. Je peux t'offrir un plat... but perhaps I have a different proposition for us both.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: You may have mastered the art of battle, my friend, but what of. .. L'Art de la Cuisine?!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Follow me into the kitchen behind me, and I will tell you more.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Follow me into the kitchen, mon ami.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Welcome to my kitchen! C'est beau, non?

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: It may be on fire, but... que serait la Cuisine sans une touche de danger, eh?!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: So, back to the challenge. What do you say to a bit of friendly competition, hehe?

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: You can work with one of my three best chefs on a dish and present it to me once you're done!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: I, of course, will judge your dish on the twenty-nine Principes de Cuisine - texture, presentation, originality...

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: ... aroma, magical ability.. oh, and flavour!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: S'il te plaît! Go introduce yourself to each of my chefs and return once you have decided who to work with!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer! You haven't talked to Brie, Kale, or Frank yet, make sure to talk to them before choosing who to work with.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Yo, dawg. Name's Frank. Pleasure to meet'cha.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Nothin' too sure on what we're gonna cook yet, figure I'll dream somethin' up before the time comes.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Thinkin' a pie, maybe? Not too much effort there, can't go too far wrong, right?

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Yo dude, appreciate the enthusiasm but y'all should check out the other chefs before deciding on me!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Good friend of Hamsey's, are you? I'll believe it when - no, if - you somehow win this competition.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: I don't need any ameteurs like yourself getting in my way when I'm cooking up a storm!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Are you still here? Just... go chitchat to someone else, please.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Please go and talk to the other chefs first before you decide to weigh me down with your ""assistance"".

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Heya! You must be the adventurer that Hamsey told me about. You know, he was almost ecstatic, but don't tell him I said that!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Oh, a cook-off? How exciting! I'll gladly help you out. Maybe this way I can prove myself a bit more to the others...?

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: If we work together, we can make a Seasoned Voidroot Stew, how does that sound?

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: You need to talk to the other chefs before deciding who to work with though!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: You should go tell Hamsey who you've chosen to work with!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Hey, again! I'd love to chat, but you should talk to the other chefs before making your decision!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: I still can't believe you chose to ""work"" with me. Make yourself useful and go and tell the Chef. I certainly won't.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Can't wait to work with you man, tell the big man we're working together and we can get started.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Ah, you have introduced yourself to tous mes cuisiniers? Who do you want to work with?!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Ah, Kale. One of my most talented chefs, though he can be stubborn at times!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Frank! Whilst he may seem rather... relaxed, at times, I assure you he is a most capable chef!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Ah, Brie! An excellent chef... and an even better cheese! I jest, I jest. You will work well together, I am certain.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Maintenant, mon ami, head over to your chef and start cooking!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: How is the cooking going?! If you have lost your recipe book, just ask your chef for another copy!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: It is time to cook, mon ami! Head over to your chef and ask them what to do.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: No sweat, man, I probably wouldn't choose me either. Good luck!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Not feeling a vibe with me? No worries! I'm sure you'll do great whoever you work with.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Ugh. Stay out of my way, and we'll get along just fine.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Make yourself useful and get me everything we need. I'm not in the mood for chit-chat.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: I don't want my reputation tarnished by the likes of you...

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Listen up, because I am *not* going to say this again. Take notes.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: The key ingredient in my amazing omelette  is obviously the [Blue-Ring Grook Egg], which of course you didn't know.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: First, we're gonna need some kinda flour. A lil' [Sunrise Flour] aughtta do.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Secondly, we need some [Snail Slime], which is at Snail Island, obviously. Any seasoned chef could tell you that.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Lastly, you need a [Talking Mushroom] which you could find on the swamp Sky Island, provided you have a functioning sense of sight.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: YOU FORGOT ALREADY?? I TOLD YOU TO TAKE NOTES!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Lucky for you, at least one of us here is competent. I wrote everything down in this recipe book. Right-click to open it. Now get me my ingredients and scram!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: I don't suppose you've made much progress. Check your recipe book if you've forgotten what I told you, since you obviously have.

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Hello aaand welcome to the Racetrack of the Century!

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: One winner, one loser. And Usnail Bolt eats losers for breakfast.

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Breakfast? Wait, did I have breakfast? A little breckkie could be good fo-

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Well, no matter. What do you say, adventurer? Enter the race against Usnail Bolt. The grand prize is some Snail Slime!

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Shame, could’ve been a great race. See you around, adventurer!

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Aaaaaand they’re off!

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Well well well... looks like Usnail Bolt has won this one. Again.

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Not your lucky day, human. Oh well, you know the price for losing. Guards!

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Wowee! In what turned out to be an amazing race, the human has managed to steal the lead right out from Usnail Bolt's nose!

lines.speaker: Snail Race Supervisor
lines.line: Here, human, take this slime as your prize.

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: ISN'T THIS JUST ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC. A HUMAN?! WHO WOULD HAVE GUESSED.

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: YOU'RE THE SEVENTH ONE PASSING ME TODAY AND YOU'RE NO DIFFERENT FROM THE OTHERS.

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: EVERY SINGLE ONE WITH THAT DOPEY SHEEPISH LOOK ON THEIR FACE, AS IF A TALKING MUSHROOM IS OUT OF THE BLUE.

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: GIVE ME A BREAK, I'VE HAD ENOUGH OF JERKS JUST PICKING ME UP AND DISRESPECTING ME LIKE THAT. PRIVATE SPACE, EVER HEARD OF IT?

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: WHY DO I EVEN TRY. JUST LOOK AT YOU! THE EPITOME OF CLUELESS. WHAT NOW, GONNA TAKE ME ON SOME LOONEY ADVENTURE ACROSS THE SKY ISLANDS?

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: I HOPE NOT, IF YOU WERE THINKING THAT. I'VE ALREADY LOST A STEM TODAY BECAUSE SOME DIMWIT TRIED TAKING A BITE OUT OF ME... LIVE!

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: DON'T TELL ME, YOU ARE TAKING ME ON SOME LOONEY ADVENTURE ACROSS THE SKY ISLANDS? HOW LOVELY.

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: A KITCHEN YOU SAY, WELL IF IT'LL PUT ME OUT OF MY MISERY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE, THEN WHY NOT.

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: WAIT, WHY ARE YOU STUFFING ME INTO YOUR BAG? HOW DO YOU EXPECT ME TO BREATHE IN HERE?!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Of course you've lost the book. Can't trust you with anything! Here's another one. Be careful this time.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: You got everything? Took you long enough.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Let's get started. Everyone else already finished. Stay back while I work my magic.

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Mwah! My masterdish is finished. Present this to the chef, I'm sure he'll love it!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: And be CAREFUL taking it over. That food could be worth HUNDREDS once I'm famous!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Have you shown Hamsey yet? Ugh, of course you haven't. Get to it!

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Good luck, dude.

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Ooooh, your dish smells great! Good luck!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Ah, you have finished your dish? Well, then, il est temps de goûter!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Let us retreat to my private dining room... this way!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Meet me in my dining room and we'll taste your dish!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: I cannot help but notice that your dish is ready!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Let me taste your dish and I will present you mine! Mon dieu, une omelette?

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Je suis déçu, ami. I would prefer biting into a mule derrière! This thing... a Gert wouldn't touch it!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: I see you haven't improved in the art of cuisine. Leave me be, and come back when you have learned what good food is!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Welcome back to my restaurant, adventurer!

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Good to see you again, dude!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Ah. You're back. Just stay out of my way, I'm trying to do actual cooking.

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Hey! Nice to see you again.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Welcome back, mon ami! Alas, running a restaurant is busy work, so I can't talk for long. Maybe take a seat in the restaurant?

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Thank grook you didn't choose me. Goodness knows I don't need another ameteur weighing me down.

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Heya again! So you decided to make the Seasoned Voidroot Stew with me? Hurray!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: It's not quite as easy as it might seem, but I think together we'll be able to handle it.

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Like I said before, about proving myself... I'm the newest chef here at the kitchen and some of the other chefs disapprove of my ideas. This could be my chance!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: I've been working on my recipe for Voidroot Stew for months now and I finally have a chance to show everyone what I'm worth!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: The first ingredient is some [Snail Slime], available on Snail Island! We'll only need one for this dish.

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Next up, we need some [Voidroot], a super rare root found deep in the Void. I've heard someone in the Sky Islands can take you down there.

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Lastly, we need some [Moonsalt], which is famously hard to obtain. Luckily, self-proclaimed 'Space Wizard' Astralaus should have some, so you can just pop over to his tower and ask for some!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: And that should do it! I'll give you a Recipe Book, just right-click to open it up and track your ingredients. Good luck!

lines.speaker: Astralus
lines.line: Welcome to Astralaus' Astral House! Can you get to the top by flipping gravity?

lines.speaker: Astralus
lines.line: Astronomical progress! But this is just the beginning!

lines.speaker: Astralus
lines.line: ...And why did you come to my tower?

lines.speaker: Astralus
lines.line: My Moonsalt? How absurd! I collected mine myself, you collect yours! It's only fair.

lines.speaker: Astralus
lines.line: Darn humans, you never listen! I said... Get. It. Yourself.

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: What takes you here, strangeling? What namings do you have? Hu-man? We claim Humyn! Bad choose, pick else, strangeling!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: Looking for helping? How many conveniences! Humyns requires assistancing! You observes, humyns failflies into large crater-rock!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: Burnmilk run out and one direction to retrieve it is moonsalt! We strike lucknugget and discover moonsalt on crater-rock!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: Refined moonsalt gives burnmilk for spacezoom! Inconveniencing, spacezoom destroyed. Humyns create miniscule spacezoom!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: Only singular humyn can fit in current spacezoom. If strangeling helps, humyns will let strangeling in spacezoom. Humyns can create new spacezoom given time!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: Humyns currently residing on crater-rock, meaning waiting is not result death!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: Moonsalt discovered in saltcave in north, strangeling follow path!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: Just [1 Unrefined Moonsalt] need for burnmilk, strangeling can grab any left over!

lines.speaker: Regular Humyn
lines.line: When strangeling has moonsalt, refine at device beside humyn and go zoom in spacezoom!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Have you got all the ingredients? Amazing!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Okay you step back and let me work on the cooking, just pass over the ingredients!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Aha! That should do it! Hopefully I've done everything correctly... but wow, would you look at the colour of that soup!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: You should bring it over to Hamsey to see what he thinks!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Have you shown Hamsey our dish yet? I'm sure he's gonna love it!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Hey! How's the ingredient gathering going? Remember to check your recipe book if you're stuck!

lines.speaker: Brie
lines.line: Need another recipe book? No problem! I keep plenty of spares, you never know what might happen!

lines.speaker: Kale
lines.line: Can't say your bake looks very good. No match for Kale's mighty omelette!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Welcome back, mon ami! I see you've returned with a dish in hand!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: A stew? Seems simple, but even the simplest things in life can be le meilleur!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer, are you sure you made this dish? It is so good I might as well close the restaurant!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: You never fail to surprise me, friend. Here, take this apron, an essential of any true chef.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Thrilled to be workin' with you, dude! We'll blow Hamsey's mind.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Hmmm, now what kinda pie should we be bakin', here?

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Well, I might be a lil' lazy, but when it comes to cookin', I've got the eye. And to me, dude? You look like a real Skyhigh Pie kind of guy! Heheh.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Welp, guess you know how to cook up a simple Skyhigh Pie, right? Off you go, I'll be waiting here when you have the ingredients.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Hehe, just messin' with you, man! Shoulda seen your face.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: First, we're gonna need some kinda flour. A lil' [Sunrise Flour] aughtta do.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: A good-sized [Blue-Ring Grook Egg] should give us a lil' kick. Not as much as those grooks'll give you a kick, if they see you pilfering their eggs, though!

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Finally, the secret ingredient - A [Skyhigh Raspberry]. Real good stuff, but it's a fair way out. Guess a lil' walking never hurt anyone, huh? Not that I've ever bothered.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Huh, you've got a bad memory? Yeah, me too, man. Here's a Recipe Book, just right-click to open it up and check where to grab the ingredients!

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Return here once you've got them all. Peace out, dude!

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Yo, how are the ingredients coming along? I wrote 'em down in your recipe book if you forgot.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: You lost my super-secret recipe? No sweat, I always keep a spare. But be careful with this one!

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: Hello there! I can see you knead some sunrise flour, don't you?

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: It's needed rye away? Well no worries, friend!

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: Well butter me up and call me toast, it seems I ran out of the stuff, there's none left.

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: I'm sorry if I seem to be just loafing around, but at yeast I know how to make some more.

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: Can you see that wheat field over there, next to the bakery? You can farm up some wheat and pop it on the mill.

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: Grab a scythe from the tool merchant next dough and get to work!

lines.speaker: Baker
lines.line: Make as much as you want, I've made all the bread I need for today already.

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: Howdy, pal! Looking for some Skyhigh Raspberries? They work great in a pie!

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: If you're interested, it's just a small fee of 10 Emeralds to get access to the island.

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: A man's gotta make a living somehow, so I've set up a system of cannons to take you right up to the island they grow on!

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: So, whaddya say? Small price for a little adventure, and as many raspberries as you can eat!

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: Alrighty, no worries. Feel free to come back if you're ever in the mood for some!

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: Alrighty! Just head over to that island beside me and jump in the cannon - it's perfectly safe, I promise!

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: Find your way up to the island and grab as many raspberries as you want! When you're done just jump in the big cannon to come back to shore!

lines.speaker: Raspberry Vendor
lines.line: You're all paid up for a trip to the island already, just jump in the cannon on the island right beside me!

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: 'ey there, 'uman! What brings ya to these parts?

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: Voidroot, eh? I'll be sure there's some o' that down 'ere in the void.

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: I can bring ya down there, for free! See, ain't getting much traffic here, am I? Gotta take all the action I can get.

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: Be careful down there; it's a full nuthouse! 'eard stories 'bout things disappearin' and appearin'.

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: Just be wary, will ya, 'uman?

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: Stroll over to me ol' crane, and I'll crank ya down!

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: Why 'ello there, friend. Back to go down to the void again?

lines.speaker: Crank
lines.line: 'elcome to Crank's Crank, the one an' only place to get you down to the void. Sorry if ye wanted to go down, but the crane is under maintenence.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: You got everything? Awesome stuff, dude.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: I'll just take a smallll bit of this raspberry - chef's commission, eh? And let's get started!

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: And we're all done. Hamsey's gonna love this.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Here you go, dawg. Pleasure working with you - show this to Hamsey and we'll see what he thinks. Make sure you don't ""lose"" any of it on the way over - you know what they say about your own supply!

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Hey, you're knocking off my mojo, man! Stay back while the master does his work.

lines.speaker: Frank
lines.line: Well, what did Hamsey think of the bake?

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: I see you've returned, and not empty handed. Please, show me what you've created!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: A pie? Why, you must have been helped by Frank. He always has a thing for making pie!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: I can see that your compétences culinaires are very well developed!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Though I will not truly call you a master chef quite yet, you are très bien! Have this reward as congratulations!

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Bonjour, adventurer! Welcome to my restaurant. Alas, it seems we are all booked up for now.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Perhaps you could make a reservation for when you are level 96?

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer! You haven't talked to Kale or Frank yet, make sure to talk to them before choosing who to work with.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer! You haven't talked to Brie or Kale yet, make sure to talk to them before choosing who to work with.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer! You haven't talked to Brie or Frank yet, make sure to talk to them before choosing who to work with.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer! You haven't talked to Frank yet, make sure to talk to them before choosing who to work with.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer! You haven't talked to Brie yet, make sure to talk to them before choosing who to work with.

lines.speaker: Chef Hamsey
lines.line: Adventurer! You haven't talked to Kale yet, make sure to talk to them before choosing who to work with.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Hey! This is a restricted area, please return to the perimeter!

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Help? You're not nearly experienced enough to help us out, get out of here!

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: ... Alright, let's see here... Private! Give me a report!

lines.speaker: Private Walder
lines.line: Sir, our readings are positive! Stability is at 96%, and shows no sign of dropping.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Excellent. Keep an eye on everything, and let me know if something comes up. Now, I need to go find... -

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Hmph. And who exactly are you? This site is off-limits to civilians.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Adventurer. Of course. Well, as it stands, we’re doing rather dangerous work here. I’ll have to ask you to-

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: ... The stabilizer? We're doing rather dangerous work here, keeping the thing beyond that cliff passive. So, I'll have to ask you to-

lines.speaker: Private Walder
lines.line: General! Stability is dropping, and fast!

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Urgh... Soldiers, follow protocol! Secure what you can, leave what you can't! And- you! I haven't forgotten about you. As soon as this all clears up, we'll-

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Gah! This damned Colossus! What I wouldn't give to...

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: ... It's over. Walder! Survey the damages to our equipment! Morec! Take count of injuries around the base, make sure everyone's safe!
General! We came as soon as we could- we were down in the library and the exit co- Oh. Wow.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Well, Rhay, you're here now, yes? What do you think, can you fix it? We'll need to get it working before-

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Can I- No, of course I can't fix it! Not on my own, especially since we don't have the proper equipment around here! Ugh, how long has it even been since last time?
It has been... three days... give or take. Rhay... you know we can't keep-

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: The stabilizer has been working so far, Ineos! It's some of the finest technology our province has to offer, and it has been working!.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Rhay, you know... as well as I do... that it is getting worse. The Protector is... growing resistant to... your machines. We need... a new plan.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Yes, well, as soon as you come up with one, I'll be glad to hear it! But so far, you've barely gotten anything-

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: ... Sorry. I'm sorry, I didn't mean that. General, to answer your question... The stabilizer itself is damaged, but you should have what’s needed to repair it here. -

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: The issue is the controls look like they’re fried! And we don’t have any replacement parts stored here. We’ll have to travel back to Corkus, and...

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: ... Right. You. You’re an adventurer, yes? And you appear to be well-equipped. Then you’ll be traveling to Corkus with Rhay, and assist with whatever is needed there.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Wait, General-... Right. Alright. In that case... I’ll give you time to prepare. We’ll take the Hot Air Balloon to travel to Corkus, so I’ll meet you there. We don’t have any time to waste.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: And I will... return to the library. I trust... you will succeed... But we must... prepare for the... worst.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Have you flown to Corkus with Rhay yet? Quick, get to the Hot Air Balloon in the south!

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Ah, you're here! Well, if you're ready, then we'd best be off. Just hop aboard this balloon, and the captain will take us where we need to go.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: I can tell you more while we travel, but we need to get going quick. There's no telling how much time we have before-

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Right, right. Don't mind me, I'm just a little on edge, for... well, for obvious reasons. Just hop aboard.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Well? What are you waiting for- come on, let's get going to Corkus!

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Well, there it is! The Canyon Colossus itself. The source of all of our problems here at Kandon-Beda.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: So! How much do you already know? I know we dragged you into this without telling you much, so... I can fill you in on the details.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Oh, he did? Right, that makes sense. Well, you're right in that it's the source of the earthquakes, but there's more to it than that.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: You've seen the Sky Islands, right? Heard of the Fracturing. From what we can tell, what happened to that region a thousand years ago is happening again, here and now.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Yes, exactly. It's been malfunctioning for a long time now, and it's starting to tear the canyon apart. That's where we come in.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Well... To start with, it's an ancient thing. It was built long before even the doguns can remember, and they've lived in this region for thousands of years.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: According to Ineos, the doguns used to be responsible for keeping it calm, but ever since the dwarves came in and started their war, that knowledge has been lost to time.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Which is... a problem! The Colossus has been malfunctioning for hundreds of years, and it's reaching its breaking point. If we don't stop it, it'll tear the canyon apart.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Oh? So you've traveled the canyon, then. Yeah, then you've seen how the canyon twists and changes.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: It destroys peoples' homes, it traps them deep within the maze-like valleys... And, more recently, it has been tearing a hole into the void.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: This thing is ancient, and we don't know how it works. The best we can do is try and keep it from reaching its breaking point, and prevent the canyon from meeting the same fate as the Sky Islands.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: So, Gavel's government contacted us in Corkus some time ago, requesting our help to deal with this threat.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Our council agreed, and we got to work designing a machine that could replicate the dogun magic that pacified the Colossus long ago.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: We've had Ineos' help on that front. He and I have been working here in Kandon-Beda to ensure things are running smoothly. Which... evidently, they are not.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: ... We'll be fine! We're going to meet up with my husband at Corkus, and he'll know what to do. He always does.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Our people working there will be able to get us the parts we need to repair the device. This... this isn't the first time it's exploded. I had hoped that this time we would have gotten it stable, but...

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: But, hey! We have it under control. We're always able to repair it quickly enough to keep it running while the Colossus is active.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Oh! Yeah. He's the one responsible for the design and production of this device. He's got a talent for designing these sorts of things, without him... well, we'd be in a much worse situation than we are now.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: I'll be glad to see him again. It's been a while since I last had to travel to Corkus, and... Well, I'm confident he'll know what to do here. He always does.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: ... Right! Hey, it looks like we're almost there. We'll be able to get this all sorted out, and we'll be back to Kandon-Beda in no time.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Alright, let's just head on in. My husband should be around here somewhere...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Rhay, love! You're back already? Our next routine maintenance isn't for another- Wait, soldier? What are you doing here?

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: I... You two know each other?

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Of course we do - they're the one who helped me with all the Factory stuff! How did you two meet?

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: They just showed up at Kandon-Beda and agreed to help us with... - Why didn't you bring this up earlier?

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: It must have...- right. Well, if anything that makes you even more qualified to help us out, I guess! I can't believe I didn't recognize you...?

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Okay, right, back to the question - what are you two doing here already? There's another few days or so until our next routine maintenance, isn't there?

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: I did send you an invite! I gave it to... you know, the one captain who ferries people around! But then you didn't show up to the wedding, so I guess it didn't reach you...

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Look, you're a hard person to reach! You've been all over the world at this point, including Kandon-Beda of all places- speaking of, why are you two here?

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Right! Right. Got a little distracted there... Uh, we've run into a problem back at Kandon-Beda. We experienced an unexpected seismic event, and the device was heavily damaged.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: We should be able to finish most of the repairs with what materials we have there, but we're missing a Magmaflux Capacitor for the control panel.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: ... Oh. That's going to be a problem. We haven't had an opportunity to make more parts yet - it hasn't been long enough since our last maintenance. So... I'm not sure what we-

lines.speaker: Nodise
lines.line: I overheard the conversation from over there- good to see you Rhay, by the way- But. We may not have any capacitors left up here, but I know where you can get one.

lines.speaker: Nodise
lines.line: We repurposed this factory for our needs, but it was built here to process resources from the mines below.

lines.speaker: Nodise
lines.line: Though it was discontinued, it's very likely that there are still miner mechs down there- and some of the more powerful models made use of very similar circuits to the capacitors we use today.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: ...You're right! If they're still down there, we should be able to scrap one of the bots and reuse its circuits. soldier, we can send you down into the mines to find what we need, while we prepare up here!

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Alright... Good luck down there! Find the bot, destroy it, and bring the capacitor back up! Just step on the platform in the middle of the factory when you're ready.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Okay. That's fine, just make it quick! You know we can't waste any time here.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Just step on the iron platform and we'll send you down!

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Door opening in 3...

lines.speaker: Mining Robots
lines.line: INTRUDER DETECTED. HOSTILE ENGAGEMENT AUTHORISED.

lines.speaker: Mining Robots
lines.line: DEPLOYING SECONDARY ANTI-INTRUDER MEASURES.

lines.speaker: Mining Robots
lines.line: DIVERTING ALL AVAILABLE UNITS TO HALT INTRUDER.

lines.speaker: The Mother Drill
lines.line: THIS IS A RESTRICTED AREA. REQUESTING AUTHORISATION FOR USE OF LETHAL FORCE AGAINST INTRUDER...

lines.speaker: The Mother Drill
lines.line: AUTHORISATION GRANTED.

lines.speaker: The Mother Drill
lines.line: DIVERTING MINER MECHS TO HALT INTRUDER.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: You got the part! Head back to the balloon and I'll meet you there.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Amazing work! I'll get us back to Kandon Beda with that capacitor as quick as possible.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Good to see you again, soldier. Good luck with the colossus. And Rhay... come home as soon as you can.

lines.speaker: Maxie
lines.line: Fly safe, both of you.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Well... that went better than expected, really. I still can't believe you didn't tell me you already knew Maxie.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Oh, wow. It looks like they've managed to fix up the machine pretty well, all things considered. Just this part left to get it running again...

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Hmph. Rhay, there you are. Seeing as you've returned, I gather everything went smoothly at Corkus?

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Smoothly enough, General! We have what we need to repair the control panel. We'll be able to get the stabilizer running again!

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Well?! What are you waiting for? Finish the repairs, we can't afford to lose any time with this damned Colossus looming over us.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Yes, sir! Alright. soldier, just slot the capacitor in right... there. I'll make sure it runs smoothly.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Well, what are you waiting for?! Put the part in the machine, quick!

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: There we are. Now, let's get this thing running again! Walder, keep an eye on stability! And... Rhay. You're confident this will work?

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: I-I'm sure. This is our last chance. We have to hold out hope that the stabilizer will hold.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Alright, alright... It's now or never... Hold, stabilizer, hold!

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: ... Oh. That's... that's it, then. It's over. We failed.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I... am sorry, Rhay. I had... hoped it would work. In truth... I do not have... a plan... either.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: The Elders... would have known... what to do... But they are... long gone. Nothing but... ruins remain.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: The Elders... They were... the greatest... of doguns. As old... as the oldest stones... and as wise... as the earth itself...

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: They were capable... of magic... beyond what any... of us could achieve. They alone... could calm our... Protector.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: They were... sealed away. Frozen in... the deepest... of ice. When the dwarves... slew Garaheth... the Elders... fell with him.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Such atrocities... The war... My people... But it is not... to dwell on, now. There are... more important... things at hand.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I... I did not... know of this. My people... are free? How long... has it been... since I have seen... my home?

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: You... Adventurer. We must... speak to my people. Our chieftain... will know... how we may free... the Elders.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: If there's a chance... We have to take it. Ineos, soldier, take the balloon. We'll do what we can here. Now, go! There's no time to waste!

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: It has been... many years... since I fled the Heights. I am... grateful to... the Corkians... for taking me in.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: But... The war... has ended. I can finally... go home...

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: ... The Colossus first... though. We still... have work to do...

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Have you flown to the Heights with Ineos yet? Quick, get to the Hot Air Balloon in the south!

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I... will meet you... by the airship. I am... eager... to see my home... again.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Well... That's it, then! I'll see you two off, and then... Then I'll figure out how to clean up here.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: I... I really did hope we could do it. I thought that our magic could save the day, that it could stop this thing!

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: ... Nothing to do about it now, of course! Good luck out there. We're counting on you two now. Go find those Elders!

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: Good luck in the heights, soldier. I'll... see if there's anything I can salvage from the machine, but it's not looking good. Ineos' Elders might be our only hope...

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I have never... seen the Heights... from above. I wonder... if their glow... holds the same strength... it does from below...

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I only hope... the Elders... are not gone... for good. We greatly need... their wisdom.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Ah... I believe us... to be landing...

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: soldier... Hello. What a... strange sight... to see you landing... at our village... in such a contraption...

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: And... is that... Ineos? We thought... the dwarves... had turned you to rubble...

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I escaped... It is a long... story, Korzim. We do not... have time. Where is... your father?

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: He is... below. They are... freeing the frozen... in New Taloka. Why do you... wish to speak... with him?

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: The Protector... is angered. We must find... the Elders. They will know... how to calm it.

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: The... Protector... I understand. I will... bring you two... to him. Sidio... Raetin... I leave you two... in charge.

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: Now, let us... travel. Through flame... and through stone...

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: We are... here. Taloka was... one of the first to fall... in the war. We have been... working with the dwarves... to restore it.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Are we all ready?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Very well. Begin on three. One... Two... Three!

lines.speaker: Dwarven Technician
lines.line: Beginning reheating cycle! Stand back from the subject.

lines.speaker: Unsealed Dogun
lines.line: ... Where... am... I? How long... has it... been...?

lines.speaker: Unsealed Dogun
lines.line: ...Dwarf... You... you froze me... I will... I will...!

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Calm yourself... Delg. Our war... has ended. We are... freed. You have been... freed.

lines.speaker: Dogun Delg
lines.line: ... Freedom? Hundreds... of years... of war... And we are... free?

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Yes. We are free... to roam our home... once more. Edac... Escort Delg... and help him re-adjust... to the heights.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Ah, soldier! It’s good to see you again. We haven’t seen you around here since... since the end of it.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Yes. We have been... hard at work... these past weeks. Taloka will soon... stand once more. And many... of our sealed brethren... have been returned to life.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Ah, but we can talk more about that later. Tell me, what brings you here today? Is there something you need from us?

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: The situation... is dire. The Great Protector... has been left alone... for far too long. We need... the wisdom... of our Elders. Do you know... where they are sealed?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: The Elders?! Yes, we know where they are sealed. However, retrieving them is no simple task. It would take us years to break past the defenses, and we have countless other doguns to release first.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Ineos... I want our Elders free... as much as you do. But our Protector... has stood firm... for hundreds of years. It can stand... for another-

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: No... Has it truly... fallen this far..?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ... That was your Protector? How powerful is it, if it can reach this far?

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: If the Protector... could shake even the Heights... It could destroy... half of this province.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Draani... the Elders must be freed. They alone... would know how to calm it.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Yes... I understand. Very well. soldier, I will take you to the Elders' vault. I hold the keys to open the way forward. Paku, gather your people. See if anyone has alternative solutions.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: We will... search for one. I cannot... promise that one exists.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: soldier, let us go. It sounds as if we have very little time to waste.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: I will make preparations, and meet you at the Vault of Ice.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ... Ahem. This is the entrance, then. One of our most closely guarded secrets... I was hoping not to have to confront this reminder for a while yet...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: But it seems we don’t have much choice now. I have the keys, let’s go inside.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Rather cold in here, isn’t it? A vault carved into a drake’s True Ice... I suppose my ancestors hoped to seal these doguns here forever. I’ll be glad to disappoint them.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Quickly, then, let us proceed to the primary door. I pray the Elders' will be responsive to our situation with the Colossus.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: In any case... Let me see if I can open this second gate. It should be as simple as...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Hm. That... didn’t work. This magic is old, and I never took the time to learn it properly... Alright. We have alternatives.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: If my memory serves correctly, there should be a manual override on the other end of this chasm.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: The issue is that treacherous pool of lava on the way... and I don't think my knees are up to the task of jumping over it all.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: I would never usually do this, but these are desperate times. Here, take my Trusty Grappling Hook. It should help you get over to the switch.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: It has limitations, though. It will only be able to latch onto those blue rocks on the walls - and I'll be taking it back once you're finished, thank you very much!

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: What are you waiting for? Use my hook to get to the override switch at the end of this cave!

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Looks like that unlocked it, soldier! Get yourself back over here and I'll open the door.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: There we are! Excellent work. You used that hook like a true expert! Ah, reminds me of the time-...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ...Ahem. Excellent work, indeed. With the override activated, I should be able to do the rest of the work to open the gate.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: First, though, I'll be having that grappling hook back! Think of what could happen if you had free reign of that all over.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: And so... I believe we have gone as far as we can.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: This is True Ice, soldier. It has scarred this part of the Heights for centuries, ever since it was created by an ice dragon in my ancestors’ conquest.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: It cannot be melted or burned through by any means. It is why this location was chosen for their tomb. I’m afraid there is nothing more we can do.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: At the end of the war, I imagine.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: As the final dogun settlements fell, and as Garaheth was slain for the first time, my ancestors must have sealed them deep in this ice.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: The... actions of the Dwarves after winning the war are well documented. I would not be surprised if our accounts describe this imprisonment as a great victory.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: The Dwarves, of course. Who else?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: I believe it was General Algard of the Dwarven army who ordered the Elders’ imprisonments

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: He was lauded as a hero, naturally. Now... now we must reap the consequences of such a decision.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: True Ice is a material which cannot be melted or burned through by any means. Not even dogun magic has been able to make a dent.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ... I imagine this is why this location was chosen to hold the elders. A prison from which they would never be able to escape.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: It is known for it to form naturally under extreme conditions... But the ice here is nowhere near natural.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: It was formed by an Ice Drake’s Breath partway through the war- and, well, as you can see, it has remained here ever since.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Just another remnant of our past mistakes, I suppose...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Breakfast... I had some eggs, I suppose. Though, I had no idea that breakfast would be my last, did I..?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Hm... Had I known, maybe I would have chosen differently. Maybe I would have-... nevermind.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Ahem. In any case- as I said, True Ice is impossible to break through, even with the most scorching flames.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: I... I suppose that a dragon’s breath might be able to melt it. That logic does make sense.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: We have little knowledge of what dragons were like, though. As they went extinct, that information became... useless. And so, it was lost.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: If anyone would know more about dragons, it would be the doguns.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: This ice is harder than obsidian itself. The crystals which form the material are bonded by ancient magic.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Shattering it with such tools isn't an option. Perhaps there is a weapon that could break through, somewhere deep in our armory- after all, this vault had to be carved somehow...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: However, given the circumstances, I don't think we have the time to search for it. Even if we started now, our armory is enormous. It would take weeks to find what we need.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: The lava of the Heights is nothing more than molten rock. Just a remnant of the shaping of these caverns.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: It's not nearly hot enough to melt True Ice. If it could, the Freezing Heights would have faded long ago.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: My... uhm... green is nice, I suppose? Though perhaps not very Dwarven...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Red, then. Or orange! ...Although my bedsheets are the most wonderful shade of navy blue...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: But none of that matters. All the dragons are gone, after all. We still have no options

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Why, they died out. As Gavellian civilizations grew in size, the ferocity and size of a dragon was simply too big a threat.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Some were hunted. Some died of starvation. Eggs were taken from nests and shattered over boulders for the birds to feed on.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Now all that are left are dragonlings - echoes of their once-great ancestors, with barely enough flame to singe your armor.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: You- what? Near Thanos?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: A living dragon... You’ve done quite a lot, haven’t you? Stopped a war, moved a dragon...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Well... if there is a living dragon at Thanos... Then we still have hope! soldier, we must ask for its help.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Let us return to the others. I asked them to wait outside of Rodoroc... perhaps they’ll be able to confirm that a dragon’s breath would do the job.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Indeed. The fire dragons sided with them during the war. I'm sure you've come across the skeleton just outside Freezing Heights?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Yes, well... the Dwarves needed a counter to the sheer power of a fire dragon in battle, and so they resorted to enslaving dragons and drakes of other elements.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Like the Ice Drake that created this vault, and encased the Elders in the truest of ice.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ... Well, there was this excellent novel of about one of those creatures from the Shiar, who had to travel to the Heights with this ring he had inherited-

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: But I confess, these questions seem almost irrelevant. We have a more pressing issue at hand, soldier.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ... so that is the situation we find ourselves in. Paku, what do you think? Would such a plan work?

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Hm... You may be correct... Draani. The magic in... a dragon’s breath... was very potent. And to think... mighty Ozoth had survived... all these years...

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: If Ozoth is alive... we must seek her help. If the doguns ask... for her aid, she will... give it.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Well, that’s as good a plan as any. soldier, you’ll travel to seek this dragon’s counsel, along with... Ineos, was it? Good luck.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: You should... take the Trading Tunnel... soldier. I will put the coordinates... in your Content Book.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: You should... take the Trading Tunnel... soldier. I have put the coordinates... in your Content Book.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Ah... it is... good to... see you. We must... proceed to Ozoth... with all haste.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Ozoth the Dragon... Endless Kindler... we have come... to ask for your aid.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: We are searching... for a way... to melt the truest... of ice. The fate... of Gavel... hangs in the balance.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Doguns... and Dragons... our fates have been entwined... for centuries. We call on you now... Endless Kindler... to save this province.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I... see. soldier... Ozoth tells me... that an Everflame... will free the Elders.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: ... well...

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: The Endless Kindler... is willing to part... with hers. You must... retrieve it... from her stomach.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: I would advise you... not to think... too much about this. When... you are ready... enter Ozoth's mouth and retrieve... the flame.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: soldier! Have you retrieved... the Everflame?

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Excellent. Endless Kindler... thank you... for your sacrifice. I will ensure... that your flame... is returned to you.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Ozoth apologises... if it was a bit hot... in there.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Now, soldier... I was never the best... at the ancient magic... but I hope I have enough skill... to take us the short route back...

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: You have returned! Is there news from Thanos? Did the dragon offer aid?

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: She did... Ozoth has made a great sacrifice... for this province... but we have an Everflame... to melt the ice.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Well done... both of you. I will ensure... that the doguns thank her... properly. The dwarves would do well... to do the same.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Yes, yes, but there's no time to worry about that now. Quick, let's get back to the-

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Be wary... of the Elders... Draani. It is unlikely they will react well... after their imprisonment. It is vital... you explain the situation... to them.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: I would join you... both... but the ice is inhospitable... to my kind. I wish the both of you... the best of luck.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ... right. Yes. Well, there's no getting around it. Come, soldier. We must unfreeze the Elders and get them to listen to us. Bring the flame, I will meet you at the Vault.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Come, soldier. We must unfreeze the Elders and get them to listen to us. Bring the flame, I will meet you at the Vault.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Well then, what are we waiting for! Let’s free these elders, shall we?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Just bring the Everflame to each of the cells, and melt through that True Ice.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: Excellent! We’ve done it! Now we just need to explain the situation-...

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: We are freed.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: ...Ah. I suppose I did not... think this through. Ehm. Elders, I must apo-

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: Dwarf... Hm. The crimes... of your ancestors... must be repaid.

lines.speaker: Elder Desint
lines.line: However. We have... heard you speak. We have... learned of... the Protector’s state.

lines.speaker: Elder Iscor
lines.line: We will... settle your debt... later. This situation... is a more pressing... concern. The Protector... must be calmed.

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: ...Yes. You. Human. That was... dragonfire... was it not?

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: Then allow me... to borrow it. Its strength... will allow us... to restore ours. Now... Who now holds... the title... of Chieftain?

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: A-ah! Paku is now the Dogun Chieftain. He would be at... At Taloka.

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: Very well... We shall travel... through flame... and through stone...

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: ...The Elders... after all this time... to see you, again... in the flesh...

lines.speaker: Elder Desint
lines.line: Greetings, Paku. We have much... to discuss. But first... we must travel... to the Protector.

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: Join us... Ineos and Paku. There is... very little time... to waste.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: Korzim... my son... join us. The Elders must see... to the Protector.

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: Iscor... Astal... Desint... it has been... too long. I will come.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: -have to trust that they'll return!

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: There's no time! I can feel the damned ground cracking beneath my feet, we have to turn to the final option. We've had demolition mages on standby the past few days, our only choice is to-

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Rhay. Elix. My Elders... have been freed. They are here... to help... the Protector.

lines.speaker: Elder Iscor
lines.line: Join us... brave ones. You will see... that your efforts to save this Province... have not been in vain.

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: Great Protector... It is furious.

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: Hmph. Foolish dwarves... This is what has come...of your needless war... You are fortunate...to have freed us now...

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: Desint... Iscor... I will prepare... the ritual. Defend me... as I do so.

lines.speaker: Elder Desint
lines.line: Human. We will pull the Protector... away from the brink. That is all we can do now. All the power... we can muster.

lines.speaker: Elder Iscor
lines.line: You must enter... these sacred grounds. Battle through to the end... Knock some sense... into it.

lines.speaker: Ineos
lines.line: Adventurer... We are counting...on you. We will try to...support you however we can.

lines.speaker: Rhay
lines.line: We'll do the best we can out here! I have some ideas already...

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Rhay, this isn't the time. Human. We have your back. You can do this.

lines.speaker: Korzim
lines.line: You have faced...worse odds before...have you not? You will face them...again.

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: It is done. Desint... Iscor... Take your positions. We must... hold it back.

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: We will... hold it from here... human. Now... go! We will not... be able to hold it... for long...

lines.speaker: Elder Astal
lines.line: This crystal...will let you harness...our flame. Use it...to break through...its defenses.

lines.speaker: Chieftain Paku
lines.line: soldier... Before you go. I will offer you... these powerful relics. Our people... have held them for... longer than I have lived. They may... help you on your quest.

lines.speaker: King Draani
lines.line: I cannot give you something as unique as what Paku has offered, but I can still lend you a sum from our treasury. Use it as you must, so long as you can calm that thing. Good luck.

lines.speaker: General Elix
lines.line: Well, the saviour of the province! I count my lucky stars that you walked through Kandon that day the machine broke, I don't know what we would've done without you.

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Back off! No'ne enters 'til the pirate queen is chosen. What's a landwalker like ye doin' here?

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Participate? Are ye crazy? Ain't no way a landlubber is wearing the crown.

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Off with ya now! Before I call the gals to gut you. And dun' go wandering round chatting to any skyraiders!

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Watcha be doin' here?

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Another contestant, eh? That outfit looks a bit funny on ye, but I'll let yer in. Hurry up!

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Aye, my queen!

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Hey! I told yer, ye not gettin' in if yer not a skyraider!

lines.speaker: Skyraider Guard
lines.line: Stop! The new Queen is being chosen here, and ye can only try out from level 98 onwards. Leave now! Ain't even a skyraider, bloody idiot!

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Yer wantin' to be pirate queen, ye? Don' worry, I can help ye.

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Y'see, the other pirates ain't fit for the role. They're dumb 'n weak. All they've got is looks.

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Yer got the lot! Looks and talent.

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Y'know, the guard, she's dumb too. A simple disguise will fool 'er. Issue is, ye dun' look like a skyraider at all!

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Yer in luck, though. A skyraider will sell anything for a price - just look around the town and see if ye can persuade anyone to part with their outfit.

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Don' waste your time 'round me! You've got trials to attend.

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Congratulations, my queen! May yer rule be the best one!

lines.speaker: Hrona
lines.line: Move along, landwalker!

lines.speaker: Egpla
lines.line: Aye? A landwalker, wanderin' around our base? Whatcha' want?

lines.speaker: Egpla
lines.line: My outfit?!

lines.speaker: Egpla
lines.line: ... aye, I suppose I could be tempted to pass it on to ye... for a price.

lines.speaker: Egpla
lines.line: Here, these are what I would trade it to ye for.

lines.speaker: Egpla
lines.line: If yer thinkin' emeralds... [30 Emerald Blocks] seems like a fair price, heh.

lines.speaker: Egpla
lines.line: Of course, if yer running low on funds, how about ye grab me [3 Dragonling Eggs] instead? Y'know, the ingredient. I'm 'oping to raise some 'o the lil critters!

lines.speaker: Egpla
