lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Have you ever been to the Legendary Island? Y'know, the island just southeast of Corkus?

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Did I ever tell you how I got this key? You see, one day I was attacked by a pirate ship!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: You ev'r notice how ev'ry identifier is hidin' a stash of potatoes?

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Ah, I almost forgot! Take this Reset Scroll! I doubt that I'll ever need one.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Y'hear? One o' my old wizardy kind-o-friends needed a ride down to mage islan', and o' course I'd help 'im. I'm a sea cap'n, if ya didn' notice!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Let me tell ya, ol' Zhight is a real lunatic, and it seems to have rubbed off onto his neighbors.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Have you heard tales about Captain Redbeard? Back when I was young, he terrorized the seas!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Do ya 'member that time I rescued ya on a random island?

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: They seemed to be praisin' soldiers by kidnappin' more of them. Odd tactic, but I ain't one to judge.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: I 'eard they're tryin' to train a chicken now. Fended off a huge beast or somethin'.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: My love of the sea goes way back to my childhood. I grew up by the shores o' Gavel.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: So, do you like me ship? I've had the ol' Seaskipper for years now!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Did ya know that Detlas and Selchar are sister cities?

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Say, did I ever tell you about the dock I set up near Skien's island?

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: So, there's this other ship at Selchar that takes ya to the island of Corkus. C.S.S. Wavebreaker, they call it.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: You ever heard of Regular Island? Well, that's what the people there are callin' it, anyways. Odd guys, those are.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Have you been to that big ol' gate just south of Corkus? It's a sight to behold, alright.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: I've been thinking, one day I'm gonna be too old for this job.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Did I ever tell ya about the one time I met a renowned, but retired theater director in Llevigar?

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: I've heard tale of people who travel the mountain paths to get from Wynn to Gavel instead of goin' by boat.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Say, you ever been to Rodoroc? It's a huge dwarven city off in Gavel.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: So, I noticed I've been getting less human customers recently. It's been worryin' me, I mean I'm not aware of any competitors.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Just on my last stop, I was chattin' with an acquaintance of mine on Mage Island. He told me about what a terrifyin' monster you were about to take on in the Jungle.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Ye know, I saw you sailin' on that Corkian vessel some time back.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Ya know, recently I've been noticin' some strange trend where once in about every, say, year or so I get a sudden spike in payin' customers. And I ain't got the faintest clue of where they've all suddenly come from!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Ya know, some of you soldier types can get mighty strange at times.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: I can see that gloomy isle off in the distance... There, ahead, that's where old Skien used to live.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Besides the occasional surge of robots and the bitter relations between the humans and the native folk, I've heard that Corkus was a nice place to live in.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Hey, look over there! D'you see that overgrown structure in the distance?

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Oh, I see you've brought a friend along with you today! It's always nice to share a voyage with someone!

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: HEY, OLD MAN!! SO I'VE BEEN WONDERING... WHAT'S THE DEAL WITH THIS, UH, BUSINESS YOU'VE GOT RUNNING HERE?

lines.speaker: Talking Mushroom
lines.line: JEEZ, CAN THIS GUY HURRY UP? THE SALT IN THE WIND IS MAKING ME ROT.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Woah! Hold onto yer helmet, these waves are rougher than usual!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Hey soldier, le' me tell ya a real good piece of advice.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Welcome to the V.S.S. Seaskipper, from Seasail Enterprises! There's nothin' better than Seasail if you're lookin' to travel!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Just hop on the boat and buy a pass so you can get goin' to almost anywhere on the ocean!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: You can even take your pals along with you for free if you're in a party!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper
lines.line: I'm afraid you cannot afford that boat.

lines.speaker: Seaskipper
lines.line: There you go. Come again!

lines.speaker: Seaskipper Captain
lines.line: Ohoh, that reminds me! I’ve got a letter for you - special delivery from a Corkian fellow. White hair, goggles, the lot.
You dare enter these sewers, human? These pipes once hid the civilians of Ragni during raids... Now it just holds corpses.
The forces of the Humans could not save me when I hid here, and they can’t save you either.

lines.speaker: Witherhead
lines.line: You persist through the sludge, now you will join me like the rest!
Yko dare kker these sk:;DJkkkAJEkkkkThkksad:ekghakkkkkreid:
... How foolkh of you... to come back here.:5tykkkfter what happenei:

lines.speaker: Corrupted Witherhead
lines.line: You... you've come HERE before. You shouldn't be alive....
This is a familiar face... hehe...

lines.speaker: Corrupted Arakadicus
lines.line: Don't mind our other guest back there. He had such a bitter taste. However, my babies think you look delicious... hehehe...

lines.speaker: Corrupted Arakadicus
lines.line: Ah, the main course has arrived. You look so good, I think I'll have a taste of you myself!
⒪⒣ ⒡⒪⒭ ⒣⒠⒜⒱⒠⒩⒮ ⒮⒜⒦⒠- You haven't understood a word I've said, have you? What an unrefined way of speech. Now, if you have intruded here, surely you must know who you are angering.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: I am Garoth, master of the temporal arts, the greatest mage to have ever lived! And, if you do not cease your disruption, you will learn firsthand why I have earned these titles.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: You. Do you understand the gravity of what you are doing? What you have done? If the sanctum falls apart, it will pull both of us into the infinite abyss beyond!

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: I have expended a great deal of my strength to keep this spell from shattering, and yet you continue to work directly against me! Do you have a death wish!?

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: ...So, this is your decision, then? Very well. Bring the sanctum down, destroy thousands of years of knowledge... there is no stopping it now.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: Should you survive the oncoming collapse, I will be waiting. There will be no escape for either of us, not now. You have certainly seen to that.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: Here we are, then! Perhaps I'll find one final bit of comfort in your demise before it all comes to an end.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: You- I will not stand for this. To think, someone like you could ever stand a chance against someone like me?!

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: ...How are you still standing? Nothing could have possibly withstood that attack... No matter. You will fall before my wrath!

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: Why... won't... you... die!?
Ahhh.. Good timing. I needed someone to test my defenses.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: I think you know who I am. The second human ever to be liberated by the portal. I now seek to purify this world.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: There is still a lot to be done it seems.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: I keep a lot of creatures here to conduct my experiments on, to test their vulnerabilities. I can't wait to find yours.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: Species are nothing to me. Thousands of creepers used to live here, I decimated them like it was nothing.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: Well, looks like I get to finally find out what humans are made of.
Great timing, human. Just in time to witness sorrow and destruction. History will burn before your eyes.

lines.speaker: Corrupted Garoth
lines.line: Welcome, qwerty. My name is Garoth, but you already know that, of course. Who doesn't?

lines.speaker: Corrupted Garoth
lines.line: Now, die!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Garoth
lines.line: Even now, you continue to terrorise my den. I truly cannft wait to meet with you face to dhry again.

lines.speaker: Corrupted Garoth
lines.line: No matter what you try, the fhwisbk4 stand no chance of surviving. I will track down every last one of fue: if it’s the last thing I do. Admit it, you’ve lost.

lines.speaker: Garoth
lines.line: Did you not learn to not put your hand in a fire for the second time? Fool, prepare yourself for Gaia's most powerful force - fire!
How foolish. You might think you are strong, adventurer, but you have no idea what you are about to face...

lines.speaker: Charon
lines.line: I have an entire undead army at my service. Do you really think you stand a chance?

lines.speaker: Charon
lines.line: I see you've brought some help with you, you aren't as foolish as I thought. However, how do you plan to defeat an army that cannot die?

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Aha, chap! Wonderful, the Ragni regiment's gotten its representative down 'ere. All rested up, I suppose, so let me give you an earful.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Those blighting zombies are all over the place. I tell ya, this skull's been giving the folk in Nemract the collywobbles. Just as I thought, they're all coming from here.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Now, I don't wish to alarm you old bean, but I believe we are in front of the literal gates to hell.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Not to worry chuck! Don’t look so glum, I've called for aid from the nearby towns. Once they get here we'll give them a good kicking, and you've already gotten out of there before, ain't ya?

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Now is finally our chance to take down his army... It will be a jolly difficult battle, knowing our opponent and what he's managed, even away from his lair.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Still, early days to say what he could be like in person! I'll take another route, but we'll meet in front of his door, right after crossing the river. Good luck, old bean!

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Simply marvellous work, chap! You've made it this far, so no time to fill your boots. Be prepared, we are about to fight Charon's undead army.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: We've lost a lot of good men on the way here, but I believe we can still throw a heavy punch.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: You've earned a lot of respect from the boys this fight, better than all of us I'd say. For this fight, I'll let you direct the army.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Don't take it as a promotion though, old bean. It's only for this fight, although you'll be getting a medal of valor if I can wangle it! Charon's army is remarkably strong, we need as much help as we can get.

lines.speaker: General Graken
lines.line: Aey- soldier careful now, the cretin must be lurking around here somewhere.

lines.speaker: Charon
lines.line: I see you've brought aid, you aren't as foolish as I thought.

lines.speaker: Charon
lines.line: Tell me, how do you plan to defeat an army that cannot die!?

lines.speaker: Charon
lines.line: Rise my minions! An undead army at my service, do you really think you stand a chance?

lines.speaker: Charon
lines.line: You will suffer the same fate as those before you, summon thee souls from beneath!
How foolish. Just because you have overcome something once does not mean it will happen again.
BLARGH! My minions shall not let you pass!
Aahrg, get the human! We can't let it pass by again!

lines.speaker: Corrupted Charon
lines.line: Do you really think I will fall for that one again? An army likes yours is childsplay afor me! However, how do you plan to defeat an army that is already dead?
Who is the fool that has opened this accursed cage?
You are not of the old empire... Not one of those who forced me in here.
Why do you take arms against me? I only tried to save my people from my father!

lines.speaker: Hashr
lines.line: If you insist on ending me, then I'll dispose of you like I did that wretched emperor!
The fool returns... The cage shall claim you too.
The glorious sands run red... I cannot understand it. I cannot understand you.
Yet... New power runs forth at my fingertips. I may yet save this wretched land...

lines.speaker: Hashr
lines.line: I will rule the red sands with this power under my control!

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: Soldier! I'm not sure it is wise to be here... An icy death awaits you if you proceed. A death that I will cause..

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: You must think you can save me? There is no cure for what I have.

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: I froze this land to allow it to heal.. People did not understand.. They came for me here, seeking revenge.

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: Even if you think you can cure me.. I can not allow you to try for if it were to fail my corrupted body would wreak havoc on the world!

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: I told you it would fail.

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: Your noble deeds have allowed the darkness to take over my mind.

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: It all seems clear to me now.. The struggle for life... It’s futile. There need only be peaceful darkness.

lines.speaker: Ghostly Voice
lines.line: I will not let you stop me!
I can sense your life force... it is very powerful. I shall take pleasure in draining it from your body!

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: Troms used to beckon to my every need and desire... Even sacrifice it's own children for my magical defense!

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: Now the city will truly get to witness what power they have discarded.. They will see they made the wrong call.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: Nothing and no one will stop me from sieging the city. Not even you!

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: You have made the sacrifices of many be in total vain!
More life...familiar life... It’s you again. Isn’t it?

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: Even in death... Wasn’t I right? Wasn’t I ALWAYS right? The corruption is here...

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: No saviours, no heroes. You being alive is nothing short of a miracle.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: Your life will sustain my sanity. You will be...just another meal for me.

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: AAAGH! Idiot! Fool! Damnable THING! Exposed! Exposed! DIE!!

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: I don’t want to die! I WON’T die! Go away! CEASE TO EXIST!

lines.speaker: Slykaar
lines.line: I... You... No...
ARE YOU INCAPABLE OF READING THE SIGN ON THE DOOR? THE FACTORY IS CLOSED. WE ARE NOT ACCEPTING VISITORS FOR TOURS RIGHT NOW.
FINE. I’M OPENING THE DOOR FOR YOU. TAKE A SHORT LOOK AROUND AND THEN LEAVE. THERE IS DANGEROUS EQUIPMENT HERE THAT ONLY OFFICIAL FACTORY ASSOCIATES SHOULD HANDLE.
OF COURSE, IF YOU ARE DEAD THEN THERE IS NO WAY FOR YOU TO TOUCH ANYTHING, AND MY ROBOTS ARE VERY GOOD CLEANERS, SO I THINK THIS NEW SOLUTION WILL WORK OUT FOR EVERYONE.

Unauthorized blockage in Factory Sector A2. Emergency maintenance will be performed in approximately 75 seconds. All regularly scheduled workers, please leave your posts until the blockage is cleared.
Blockage in Factory Sector A2 is now clear. All regularly scheduled workers, please return to your posts immediately.
WELL. DON'T YOU JUST FEEL SO PROUD OF YOURSELF. I DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU EXPECT TO ACCOMPLISH BY CRAWLING THROUGH THE VENTS. EXCEPT A FACE FULL OF HOT FUMES FROM THE FURNACE.
Activating Main Production Line.
SINCE YOU SEEM TO BE INSISTENT ON STAYING, PERHAPS YOU WOULD BE INTERESTED IN TAKING A LOOK AT SOME OF THE MACHINERY CLOSE UP
IF I WERE YOU, NOW WOULD BE A GOOD TIME TO RUN.
I'VE HAD ENOUGH OF YOU.
THAT WAS A LIE. I'M ACTUALLY STARTING TO ENJOY THIS.
YOU KNOW, THERE ISN'T A WAY FOR YOU TO GO FORWARD HERE. I COULD JUST KEEP THE DOOR LOCKED UNTIL YOU DROP FROM HUNGER.
WHOOPSIE-DOODLES. MY METAPHORICAL FINGER SLIPPED. AND BY THAT I MEAN I CLOSED THE DOOR MANUALLY.
Unexpected breach of locked door in Factory Sector 3A. Hastily-applied repairs due in approximately 30 seconds.
DO NOT TOUCH THAT BUTTON. YES, THE BIG SHINY ONE IN THE ROOM. IT WILL TURN ON THE POWER TO THE CLOCK TOWER MECHANISMS.
Activating Antikythera Clockwork Mechanism. All regularly scheduled workers, please evacuate the room immediately at risk of severe bodily harm and death.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: YOU KNOW, YOU COULD SPARE ME A LOT OF TROUBLE IF YOU JUST GAVE UP WHAT YOU'RE DOING FOREVER. IT WOULD MOST LIKELY SPARE A LOT OF PEOPLE A LOT OF TROUBLE, ACTUALLY.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: I SEE MY PERSUASIVE SKILLS HAVE NOT MOVED YOU. I THINK I'LL TRY AGAIN IN A LANGUAGE YOU SEEM TO KNOW INTIMATELY.

Unauthorized blockage in Factory Sector E1. Emergency maintenance will be performed in approximately 75 seconds. All regularly scheduled workers, please leave your posts until the blockage is cleared.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: WELL THEN. EVEN THOUGH YOU GOT THROUGH THERE, YOU'LL BE SURPRISED TO KNOW I STILL HAVE ONE LAST LINE OF DEFENSE. I DOUBT EVEN YOU CAN GET PAST IT.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: IF YOU ARE REALLY SO DESPERATE TO GET AT ME, THE KEY TO THE DOOR IS IN THIS PUPPY. EVEN SEEING YOUR ACTIONS THROUGHOUT THE REST OF MY FACTORY, I HAVE FAITH YOU WON'T KILL IT.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: WELL. WELL WELL WELL. WELL WELL WELL WELLY WELL WELL. I AM HONESTLY SHOCKED. REALLY, I AM. I TRULY STILL HAD SOME FAITH IN HUMANS. BEFORE YOU SHOWED UP.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: THAT TRICK WON'T WORK, YOU KNOW. THERE'S NO VITAL PART OR DUCT ABOVE THERE TO ENTER. WHAT DID YOU HOPE TO ACCOMPLISH?

lines.speaker: Antikythera Core A
lines.line: Oh, heya doc. Lemme tell ya, weirdest thing! Some bozo just ran up and shoved a bunch of scrap metal in my vent-

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: YOU'VE QUICKLY BECOME NO LONGER ENTERTAINING TO WATCH. YOU REALLY SHOULDN'T GO IN THERE.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Core B
lines.line: Unauthorized personnel detected in Antikythera Auxiliary Core Duct B. Leave immediately, or be faced with lethal force and negative marks on your career record.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: Primary ventilation duct A unblocked. Closing emergency maintenance hatch.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: THAT IS EXTREMELY ANNOYING, CONSTANTLY CLEANING UP AFTER YOU. THERE ARE FAR MORE EFFICIENT WAYS OF DISPOSING OF SCRAP METAL AND UNNEEDED WASTE.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: YOUR DESTRUCTIVE TENDENCIES KNOW NO BOUNDS. FIRST A DOOR. THEN A GRATE. THEN MY MONITOR. I'M SURPRISED YOU DIDN'T JUST THROW A MATCH AT THE FACTORY DOOR.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: Antikythera Firewall Pass A accepted. Access granted. Please present Antikythera Firewall Pass B at the next checkpoint.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Supercomputer
lines.line: Antikythera Firewall Pass B accepted. Access granted. Welcome, Cerid. You may now enter the Antikythera Main Core Chamber.

lines.speaker: Antikythera Main Core
lines.line: SO YOU FOUND ME. CONGRATULATIONS. NOW PLEASE KINDLY LAY DOWN IN A CIRCUIT AND PRETEND TO BE A CONDUCTOR UNTIL YOUR BODY'S VITAL PROCESSES PERMANENTLY SHUT DOWN.

lines.speaker: Vagrant Van
lines.line: Oh, a Ragni soldier. It's been awhile since I've seen one of you out here.

lines.speaker: Ragni Guard
lines.line: Welcome to Ragni, new recruit. How's Fruma these days? Ah right, directions.

lines.speaker: Ragni Guard
lines.line: Welcome back, I suppose you're a Wynn citizen now. I've heard quite a few things about your deeds throughout the province.
